<b>4 </b>¶ And Moses spake unto all the congregation of the children of Israel, saying, This <i>is</i> the thing which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded, saying,

<b>5 </b>Take ye from among you an offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: whosoever <i>is</i> of a willing heart, let him bring it, an offering of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; gold, and silver, and brass,

<b>6 </b>And blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats’ <i>hair,</i>

<b>7 </b>And rams’ skins dyed red, and badgers’ skins, and shittim wood,

<b>8 </b>And oil for the light, and spices for anointing oil, and for the sweet incense,

<b>9 </b>And onyx stones, and stones to be set for the ephod, and for the breastplate.

<b>10 </b>And every wise hearted among you shall come, and make all that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath commanded;

<b>11 </b>The tabernacle, his tent, and his covering, his taches, and his boards, his bars, his pillars, and his sockets,

<b>12 </b>The ark, and the staves thereof, <i>with</i> the mercy seat, and the veil of the covering,

<b>13 </b>The table, and his staves, and all his vessels, and the shewbread,

<b>14 </b>The candlestick also for the light, and his furniture, and his lamps, with the oil for the light,

<b>15 </b>And the incense altar, and his staves, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the hanging for the door at the entering in of the tabernacle,

<b>16 </b>The altar of burnt offering, with his brasen grate, his staves, and all his vessels, the laver and his foot,

<b>17 </b>The hangings of the court, his pillars, and their sockets, and the hanging for the door of the court,

<b>18 </b>The pins of the tabernacle, and the pins of the court, and their cords,

<b>19 </b>The cloths of service, to do service in the holy <i>place,</i> the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest’s office.

<b>20 </b>¶ And all the congregation of the children of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.

<b>21 </b>And they came, every one whose heart stirred him up, and every one whom his spirit made willing, <i>and</i> they brought the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s offering to the work of the tabernacle of the congregation, and for all his service, and for the holy garments.

<b>22 </b>And they came, both men and women, as many as were willing hearted, <i>and</i> brought bracelets, and earrings, and rings, and tablets, all jewels of gold: and every man that offered <i>offered</i> an offering of gold unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>23 </b>And every man, with whom was found blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats’ <i>hair,</i> and red skins of rams, and badgers’ skins, brought <i>them.</i>

<b>24 </b>Every one that did offer an offering of silver and brass brought the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s offering: and every man, with whom was found shittim wood for any work of the service, brought <i>it.</i>

<b>25 </b>And all the women that were wise hearted did spin with their hands, and brought that which they had spun, <i>both</i> of blue, and of purple, <i>and</i> of scarlet, and of fine linen.

<b>26 </b>And all the women whose heart stirred them up in wisdom spun goats’ <i>hair.</i>

<b>27 </b>And the rulers brought onyx stones, and stones to be set, for the ephod, and for the breastplate;

<b>28 </b>And spice, and oil for the light, and for the anointing oil, and for the sweet incense.

<b>29 </b>The children of Israel brought a willing offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, every man and woman, whose heart made them willing to bring for all manner of work, which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had commanded to be made by the hand of Moses.

<b>30 </b>¶ And Moses said unto the children of Israel, See, the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath called by name Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah;

<b>31 </b>And he hath filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship;

<b>32 </b>And to devise curious works, to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass,

<b>33 </b>And in the cutting of stones, to set <i>them,</i> and in carving of wood, to make any manner of cunning work.

<b>34 </b>And he hath put in his heart that he may teach, <i>both</i> he, and Aholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.

<b>35 </b>Them hath he filled with wisdom of heart, to work all manner of work, of the engraver, and of the cunning workman, and of the embroiderer, in blue, and in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen, and of the weaver, <i>even</i> of them that do any work, and of those that devise cunning work.


--------------------

CHAPTER 36

<b>1 </b>Then wrought Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise hearted man, in whom the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> put wisdom and understanding to know how to work all manner of work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had commanded.

<b>2 </b>And Moses called Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise hearted man, in whose heart the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had put wisdom, <i>even</i> every one whose heart stirred him up to come unto the work to do it:

<b>3 </b>And they received of Moses all the offering, which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, to make it <i>withal.</i> And they brought yet unto him free offerings every morning.

<b>4 </b>And all the wise men, that wrought all the work of the sanctuary, came every man from his work which they made;

<b>5 </b>¶ And they spake unto Moses, saying, The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work, which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded to make.

<b>6 </b>And Moses gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, Let neither man nor woman make any more work for the offering of the sanctuary. So the people were restrained from bringing.

<b>7 </b>For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.

<b>8 </b>¶ And every wise hearted man among them that wrought the work of the tabernacle made ten curtains <i>of</i> fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet: <i>with</i> cherubims of cunning work made he them.

<b>9 </b>The length of one curtain <i>was</i> twenty and eight cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: the curtains <i>were</i> all of one size.

<b>10 </b>And he coupled the five curtains one unto another: and <i>the other</i> five curtains he coupled one unto another.

<b>11 </b>And he made loops of blue on the edge of one curtain from the selvedge in the coupling: likewise he made in the uttermost side of <i>another</i> curtain, in the coupling of the second.

<b>12 </b>Fifty loops made he in one curtain, and fifty loops made he in the edge of the curtain which <i>was</i> in the coupling of the second: the loops held one <i>curtain</i> to another.

<b>13 </b>And he made fifty taches of gold, and coupled the curtains one unto another with the taches: so it became one tabernacle.

<b>14 </b>¶ And he made curtains <i>of</i> goats’ <i>hair</i> for the tent over the tabernacle: eleven curtains he made them.

<b>15 </b>The length of one curtain <i>was</i> thirty cubits, and four cubits <i>was</i> the breadth of one curtain: the eleven curtains <i>were</i> of one size.

<b>16 </b>And he coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.

<b>17 </b>And he made fifty loops upon the uttermost edge of the curtain in the coupling, and fifty loops made he upon the edge of the curtain which coupleth the second.

<b>18 </b>And he made fifty taches <i>of</i> brass to couple the tent together, that it might be one.

<b>19 </b>And he made a covering for the tent <i>of</i> rams’ skins dyed red, and a covering <i>of</i> badgers’ skins above <i>that.</i>

<b>20 </b>¶ And he made boards for the tabernacle <i>of</i> shittim wood, standing up.

<b>21 </b>The length of a board <i>was</i> ten cubits, and the breadth of a board one cubit and a half.

<b>22 </b>One board had two tenons, equally distant one from another: thus did he make for all the boards of the tabernacle.

<b>23 </b>And he made boards for the tabernacle; twenty boards for the south side southward:

<b>24 </b>And forty sockets of silver he made under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for his two tenons, and two sockets under another board for his two tenons.

<b>25 </b>And for the other side of the tabernacle, <i>which is</i> toward the north corner, he made twenty boards,

<b>26 </b>And their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.

<b>27 </b>And for the sides of the tabernacle westward he made six boards.

<b>28 </b>And two boards made he for the corners of the tabernacle in the two sides.

<b>29 </b>And they were coupled beneath, and coupled together at the head thereof, to one ring: thus he did to both of them in both the corners.

<b>30 </b>And there were eight boards; and their sockets <i>were</i> sixteen sockets of silver, under every board two sockets.

<b>31 </b>¶ And he made bars of shittim wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,

<b>32 </b>And five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the sides westward.

<b>33 </b>And he made the middle bar to shoot through the boards from the one end to the other.

<b>34 </b>And he overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings <i>of</i> gold <i>to be</i> places for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.

<b>35 </b>¶ And he made a veil <i>of</i> blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: <i>with</i> cherubims made he it of cunning work.

<b>36 </b>And he made thereunto four pillars <i>of</i> shittim <i>wood,</i> and overlaid them with gold: their hooks <i>were of</i> gold; and he cast for them four sockets of silver.

<b>37 </b>¶ And he made an hanging for the tabernacle door <i>of</i> blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, of needlework;

<b>38 </b>And the five pillars of it with their hooks: and he overlaid their chapiters and their fillets with gold: but their five sockets <i>were of</i> brass.


--------------------

CHAPTER 37

<b>1 </b>And Bezaleel made the ark <i>of</i> shittim wood: two cubits and a half <i>was</i> the length of it, and a cubit and a half the breadth of it, and a cubit and a half the height of it:

<b>2 </b>And he overlaid it with pure gold within and without, and made a crown of gold to it round about.

<b>3 </b>And he cast for it four rings of gold, <i>to be set</i> by the four corners of it; even two rings upon the one side of it, and two rings upon the other side of it.

<b>4 </b>And he made staves <i>of</i> shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold.

<b>5 </b>And he put the staves into the rings by the sides of the ark, to bear the ark.

<b>6 </b>¶ And he made the mercy seat <i>of</i> pure gold: two cubits and a half <i>was</i> the length thereof, and one cubit and a half the breadth thereof.

<b>7 </b>And he made two cherubims <i>of</i> gold, beaten out of one piece made he them, on the two ends of the mercy seat;

<b>8 </b>One cherub on the end on this side, and another cherub on the <i>other</i> end on that side: out of the mercy seat made he the cherubims on the two ends thereof.

<b>9 </b>And the cherubims spread out <i>their</i> wings on high, <i>and</i> covered with their wings over the mercy seat, with their faces one to another; <i>even</i> to the mercy seatward were the faces of the cherubims.

<b>10 </b>¶ And he made the table <i>of</i> shittim wood: two cubits <i>was</i> the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof:

<b>11 </b>And he overlaid it with pure gold, and made thereunto a crown of gold round about.

<b>12 </b>Also he made thereunto a border of an handbreadth round about; and made a crown of gold for the border thereof round about.

<b>13 </b>And he cast for it four rings of gold, and put the rings upon the four corners that <i>were</i> in the four feet thereof.

<b>14 </b>Over against the border were the rings, the places for the staves to bear the table.

<b>15 </b>And he made the staves <i>of</i> shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold, to bear the table.

<b>16 </b>And he made the vessels which <i>were</i> upon the table, his dishes, and his spoons, and his bowls, and his covers to cover withal, <i>of</i> pure gold.

<b>17 </b>¶ And he made the candlestick <i>of</i> pure gold: <i>of</i> beaten work made he the candlestick; his shaft, and his branch, his bowls, his knops, and his flowers, were of the same:

<b>18 </b>And six branches going out of the sides thereof; three branches of the candlestick out of the one side thereof, and three branches of the candlestick out of the other side thereof:

<b>19 </b>Three bowls made after the fashion of almonds in one branch, a knop and a flower; and three bowls made like almonds in another branch, a knop and a flower: so throughout the six branches going out of the candlestick.

<b>20 </b>And in the candlestick <i>were</i> four bowls made like almonds, his knops, and his flowers:

<b>21 </b>And a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, according to the six branches going out of it.

<b>22 </b>Their knops and their branches were of the same: all of it <i>was</i> one beaten work <i>of</i> pure gold.

<b>23 </b>And he made his seven lamps, and his snuffers, and his snuffdishes, <i>of</i> pure gold.

<b>24 </b><i>Of</i> a talent of pure gold made he it, and all the vessels thereof.

<b>25 </b>¶ And he made the incense altar <i>of</i> shittim wood: the length of it <i>was</i> a cubit, and the breadth of it a cubit; <i>it was</i> foursquare; and two cubits <i>was</i> the height of it; the horns thereof were of the same.

<b>26 </b>And he overlaid it with pure gold, <i>both</i> the top of it, and the sides thereof round about, and the horns of it: also he made unto it a crown of gold round about.

<b>27 </b>And he made two rings of gold for it under the crown thereof, by the two corners of it, upon the two sides thereof, to be places for the staves to bear it withal.

<b>28 </b>And he made the staves <i>of</i> shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold.

<b>29 </b>¶ And he made the holy anointing oil, and the pure incense of sweet spices, according to the work of the apothecary.


--------------------

CHAPTER 38

<b>1 </b>And he made the altar of burnt offering <i>of</i> shittim wood: five cubits <i>was</i> the length thereof, and five cubits the breadth thereof; <i>it was</i> foursquare; and three cubits the height thereof.

<b>2 </b>And he made the horns thereof on the four corners of it; the horns thereof were of the same: and he overlaid it with brass.

<b>3 </b>And he made all the vessels of the altar, the pots, and the shovels, and the basins, <i>and</i> the fleshhooks, and the firepans: all the vessels thereof made he <i>of</i> brass.

<b>4 </b>And he made for the altar a brasen grate of network under the compass thereof beneath unto the midst of it.

<b>5 </b>And he cast four rings for the four ends of the grate of brass, <i>to be</i> places for the staves.

<b>6 </b>And he made the staves <i>of</i> shittim wood, and overlaid them with brass.

<b>7 </b>And he put the staves into the rings on the sides of the altar, to bear it withal; he made the altar hollow with boards.

<b>8 </b>¶ And he made the laver <i>of</i> brass, and the foot of it <i>of</i> brass, of the lookingglasses of <i>the women</i> assembling, which assembled <i>at</i> the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

<b>9 </b>¶ And he made the court: on the south side southward the hangings of the court <i>were of</i> fine twined linen, an hundred cubits:

<b>10 </b>Their pillars <i>were</i> twenty, and their brasen sockets twenty; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets <i>were of</i> silver.

<b>11 </b>And for the north side <i>the hangings were</i> an hundred cubits, their pillars <i>were</i> twenty, and their sockets of brass twenty; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets <i>of</i> silver.

<b>12 </b>And for the west side <i>were</i> hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets <i>of</i> silver.

<b>13 </b>And for the east side eastward fifty cubits.

<b>14 </b>The hangings of the one side <i>of the gate were</i> fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.

<b>15 </b>And for the other side of the court gate, on this hand and that hand, <i>were</i> hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.

<b>16 </b>All the hangings of the court round about <i>were</i> of fine twined linen.

<b>17 </b>And the sockets for the pillars <i>were of</i> brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets <i>of</i> silver; and the overlaying of their chapiters <i>of</i> silver; and all the pillars of the court <i>were</i> filleted with silver.

<b>18 </b>And the hanging for the gate of the court <i>was</i> needlework, <i>of</i> blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: and twenty cubits <i>was</i> the length, and the height in the breadth <i>was</i> five cubits, answerable to the hangings of the court.

<b>19 </b>And their pillars <i>were</i> four, and their sockets <i>of</i> brass four; their hooks <i>of</i> silver, and the overlaying of their chapiters and their fillets <i>of</i> silver.

<b>20 </b>And all the pins of the tabernacle, and of the court round about, <i>were of</i> brass.

<b>21 </b>¶ This is the sum of the tabernacle, <i>even</i> of the tabernacle of testimony, as it was counted, according to the commandment of Moses, <i>for</i> the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, son to Aaron the priest.

<b>22 </b>And Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>23 </b>And with him <i>was</i> Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, and a cunning workman, and an embroiderer in blue, and in purple, and in scarlet, and fine linen.

<b>24 </b>All the gold that was occupied for the work in all the work of the holy <i>place,</i> even the gold of the offering, was twenty and nine talents, and seven hundred and thirty shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary.

<b>25 </b>And the silver of them that were numbered of the congregation <i>was</i> an hundred talents, and a thousand seven hundred and threescore and fifteen shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary:

<b>26 </b>A bekah for every man, <i>that is,</i> half a shekel, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for every one that went to be numbered, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred thousand and three thousand and five hundred and fifty <i>men.</i>

<b>27 </b>And of the hundred talents of silver were cast the sockets of the sanctuary, and the sockets of the veil; an hundred sockets of the hundred talents, a talent for a socket.

<b>28 </b>And of the thousand seven hundred seventy and five <i>shekels</i> he made hooks for the pillars, and overlaid their chapiters, and filleted them.

<b>29 </b>And the brass of the offering <i>was</i> seventy talents, and two thousand and four hundred shekels.

<b>30 </b>And therewith he made the sockets to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and the brasen altar, and the brasen grate for it, and all the vessels of the altar,

<b>31 </b>And the sockets of the court round about, and the sockets of the court gate, and all the pins of the tabernacle, and all the pins of the court round about.


--------------------

CHAPTER 39

<b>1 </b>And of the blue, and purple, and scarlet, they made cloths of service, to do service in the holy <i>place,</i> and made the holy garments for Aaron; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>2 </b>And he made the ephod <i>of</i> gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.

<b>3 </b>And they did beat the gold into thin plates, and cut <i>it into</i> wires, to work <i>it</i> in the blue, and in the purple, and in the scarlet, and in the fine linen, <i>with</i> cunning work.

<b>4 </b>They made shoulderpieces for it, to couple <i>it</i> together: by the two edges was it coupled together.

<b>5 </b>And the curious girdle of his ephod, that <i>was</i> upon it, <i>was</i> of the same, according to the work thereof; <i>of</i> gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>6 </b>¶ And they wrought onyx stones inclosed in ouches of gold, graven, as signets are graven, with the names of the children of Israel.

<b>7 </b>And he put them on the shoulders of the ephod, <i>that they should be</i> stones for a memorial to the children of Israel; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>8 </b>¶ And he made the breastplate <i>of</i> cunning work, like the work of the ephod; <i>of</i> gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.

<b>9 </b>It was foursquare; they made the breastplate double: a span <i>was</i> the length thereof, and a span the breadth thereof, <i>being</i> doubled.

<b>10 </b>And they set in it four rows of stones: <i>the first</i> row <i>was</i> a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle: this <i>was</i> the first row.

<b>11 </b>And the second row, an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.

<b>12 </b>And the third row, a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.

<b>13 </b>And the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper: <i>they were</i> inclosed in ouches of gold in their inclosings.

<b>14 </b>And the stones <i>were</i> according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names, <i>like</i> the engravings of a signet, every one with his name, according to the twelve tribes.

<b>15 </b>And they made upon the breastplate chains at the ends, <i>of</i> wreathen work <i>of</i> pure gold.

<b>16 </b>And they made two ouches <i>of</i> gold, and two gold rings; and put the two rings in the two ends of the breastplate.

<b>17 </b>And they put the two wreathen chains of gold in the two rings on the ends of the breastplate.

<b>18 </b>And the two ends of the two wreathen chains they fastened in the two ouches, and put them on the shoulderpieces of the ephod, before it.

<b>19 </b>And they made two rings of gold, and put <i>them</i> on the two ends of the breastplate, upon the border of it, which <i>was</i> on the side of the ephod inward.

<b>20 </b>And they made two <i>other</i> golden rings, and put them on the two sides of the ephod underneath, toward the forepart of it, over against the <i>other</i> coupling thereof, above the curious girdle of the ephod.

<b>21 </b>And they did bind the breastplate by his rings unto the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be above the curious girdle of the ephod, and that the breastplate might not be loosed from the ephod; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>22 </b>¶ And he made the robe of the ephod <i>of</i> woven work, all <i>of</i> blue.

<b>23 </b>And <i>there was</i> an hole in the midst of the robe, as the hole of an habergeon, <i>with</i> a band round about the hole, that it should not rend.

<b>24 </b>And they made upon the hems of the robe pomegranates <i>of</i> blue, and purple, and scarlet, <i>and</i> twined <i>linen.</i>

<b>25 </b>And they made bells <i>of</i> pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates upon the hem of the robe, round about between the pomegranates;

<b>26 </b>A bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, round about the hem of the robe to minister <i>in;</i> as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>27 </b>¶ And they made coats <i>of</i> fine linen <i>of</i> woven work for Aaron, and for his sons,

<b>28 </b>And a mitre <i>of</i> fine linen, and goodly bonnets <i>of</i> fine linen, and linen breeches <i>of</i> fine twined linen,

<b>29 </b>And a girdle <i>of</i> fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, <i>of</i> needlework; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>30 </b>¶ And they made the plate of the holy crown <i>of</i> pure gold, and wrote upon it a writing, <i>like to</i> the engravings of a signet, <span class="uppercase">Holiness to the Lord</span>.

<b>31 </b>And they tied unto it a lace of blue, to fasten <i>it</i> on high upon the mitre; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>32 </b>¶ Thus was all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation finished: and the children of Israel did according to all that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses, so did they.

<b>33 </b>¶ And they brought the tabernacle unto Moses, the tent, and all his furniture, his taches, his boards, his bars, and his pillars, and his sockets,

<b>34 </b>And the covering of rams’ skins dyed red, and the covering of badgers’ skins, and the veil of the covering,

<b>35 </b>The ark of the testimony, and the staves thereof, and the mercy seat,

<b>36 </b>The table, <i>and</i> all the vessels thereof, and the shewbread,

<b>37 </b>The pure candlestick, <i>with</i> the lamps thereof, <i>even with</i> the lamps to be set in order, and all the vessels thereof, and the oil for light,

<b>38 </b>And the golden altar, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the hanging for the tabernacle door,

<b>39 </b>The brasen altar, and his grate of brass, his staves, and all his vessels, the laver and his foot,

<b>40 </b>The hangings of the court, his pillars, and his sockets, and the hanging for the court gate, his cords, and his pins, and all the vessels of the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of the congregation,

<b>41 </b>The cloths of service to do service in the holy <i>place,</i> and the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and his sons’ garments, to minister in the priest’s office.

<b>42 </b>According to all that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses, so the children of Israel made all the work.

<b>43 </b>And Moses did look upon all the work, and, behold, they had done it as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had commanded, even so had they done it: and Moses blessed them.


--------------------

CHAPTER 40

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>2 </b>On the first day of the first month shalt thou set up the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation.

<b>3 </b>And thou shalt put therein the ark of the testimony, and cover the ark with the veil.

<b>4 </b>And thou shalt bring in the table, and set in order the things that are to be set in order upon it; and thou shalt bring in the candlestick, and light the lamps thereof.

<b>5 </b>And thou shalt set the altar of gold for the incense before the ark of the testimony, and put the hanging of the door to the tabernacle.

<b>6 </b>And thou shalt set the altar of the burnt offering before the door of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation.

<b>7 </b>And thou shalt set the laver between the tent of the congregation and the altar, and shalt put water therein.

<b>8 </b>And thou shalt set up the court round about, and hang up the hanging at the court gate.

<b>9 </b>And thou shalt take the anointing oil, and anoint the tabernacle, and all that <i>is</i> therein, and shalt hallow it, and all the vessels thereof: and it shall be holy.

<b>10 </b>And thou shalt anoint the altar of the burnt offering, and all his vessels, and sanctify the altar: and it shall be an altar most holy.

<b>11 </b>And thou shalt anoint the laver and his foot, and sanctify it.

<b>12 </b>And thou shalt bring Aaron and his sons unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and wash them with water.

<b>13 </b>And thou shalt put upon Aaron the holy garments, and anoint him, and sanctify him; that he may minister unto me in the priest’s office.

<b>14 </b>And thou shalt bring his sons, and clothe them with coats:

<b>15 </b>And thou shalt anoint them, as thou didst anoint their father, that they may minister unto me in the priest’s office: for their anointing shall surely be an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations.

<b>16 </b>Thus did Moses: according to all that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded him, so did he.

<b>17 </b>¶ And it came to pass in the first month in the second year, on the first <i>day</i> of the month, <i>that</i> the tabernacle was reared up.

<b>18 </b>And Moses reared up the tabernacle, and fastened his sockets, and set up the boards thereof, and put in the bars thereof, and reared up his pillars.

<b>19 </b>And he spread abroad the tent over the tabernacle, and put the covering of the tent above upon it; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>20 </b>¶ And he took and put the testimony into the ark, and set the staves on the ark, and put the mercy seat above upon the ark:

<b>21 </b>And he brought the ark into the tabernacle, and set up the veil of the covering, and covered the ark of the testimony; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>22 </b>¶ And he put the table in the tent of the congregation, upon the side of the tabernacle northward, without the veil.

<b>23 </b>And he set the bread in order upon it before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had commanded Moses.

<b>24 </b>¶ And he put the candlestick in the tent of the congregation, over against the table, on the side of the tabernacle southward.

<b>25 </b>And he lighted the lamps before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>26 </b>¶ And he put the golden altar in the tent of the congregation before the veil:

<b>27 </b>And he burnt sweet incense thereon; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>28 </b>¶ And he set up the hanging <i>at</i> the door of the tabernacle.

<b>29 </b>And he put the altar of burnt offering <i>by</i> the door of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation, and offered upon it the burnt offering and the meat offering; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>30 </b>¶ And he set the laver between the tent of the congregation and the altar, and put water there, to wash <i>withal.</i>

<b>31 </b>And Moses and Aaron and his sons washed their hands and their feet thereat:

<b>32 </b>When they went into the tent of the congregation, and when they came near unto the altar, they washed; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>33 </b>And he reared up the court round about the tabernacle and the altar, and set up the hanging of the court gate. So Moses finished the work.

<b>34 </b>¶ Then a cloud covered the tent of the congregation, and the glory of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> filled the tabernacle.

<b>35 </b>And Moses was not able to enter into the tent of the congregation, because the cloud abode thereon, and the glory of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> filled the tabernacle.

<b>36 </b>And when the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the children of Israel went onward in all their journeys:

<b>37 </b>But if the cloud were not taken up, then they journeyed not till the day that it was taken up.

<b>38 </b>For the cloud of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>was</i> upon the tabernacle by day, and fire was on it by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.


--------------------

<small>The Third Book of Moses </small><small>Called </small>Leviticus

CHAPTER 1

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> called unto Moses, and spake unto him out of the tabernacle of the congregation, saying,

<b>2 </b>Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, If any man of you bring an offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, ye shall bring your offering of the cattle, <i>even</i> of the herd, and of the flock.

<b>3 </b>If his offering <i>be</i> a burnt sacrifice of the herd, let him offer a male without blemish: he shall offer it of his own voluntary will at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>4 </b>And he shall put his hand upon the head of the burnt offering; and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.

<b>5 </b>And he shall kill the bullock before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: and the priests, Aaron’s sons, shall bring the blood, and sprinkle the blood round about upon the altar that <i>is by</i> the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

<b>6 </b>And he shall flay the burnt offering, and cut it into his pieces.

<b>7 </b>And the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar, and lay the wood in order upon the fire:

<b>8 </b>And the priests, Aaron’s sons, shall lay the parts, the head, and the fat, in order upon the wood that <i>is</i> on the fire which <i>is</i> upon the altar:

<b>9 </b>But his inwards and his legs shall he wash in water: and the priest shall burn all on the altar, <i>to be</i> a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>10 </b>¶ And if his offering <i>be</i> of the flocks, <i>namely,</i> of the sheep, or of the goats, for a burnt sacrifice; he shall bring it a male without blemish.

<b>11 </b>And he shall kill it on the side of the altar northward before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: and the priests, Aaron’s sons, shall sprinkle his blood round about upon the altar.

<b>12 </b>And he shall cut it into his pieces, with his head and his fat: and the priest shall lay them in order on the wood that <i>is</i> on the fire which <i>is</i> upon the altar:

<b>13 </b>But he shall wash the inwards and the legs with water: and the priest shall bring <i>it</i> all, and burn <i>it</i> upon the altar: it <i>is</i> a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>14 </b>¶ And if the burnt sacrifice for his offering to the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>be</i> of fowls, then he shall bring his offering of turtledoves, or of young pigeons.

<b>15 </b>And the priest shall bring it unto the altar, and wring off his head, and burn <i>it</i> on the altar; and the blood thereof shall be wrung out at the side of the altar:

<b>16 </b>And he shall pluck away his crop with his feathers, and cast it beside the altar on the east part, by the place of the ashes:

<b>17 </b>And he shall cleave it with the wings thereof, <i>but</i> shall not divide <i>it</i> asunder: and the priest shall burn it upon the altar, upon the wood that <i>is</i> upon the fire: it <i>is</i> a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.


--------------------

CHAPTER 2

<b>1 </b>And when any will offer a meat offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, his offering shall be <i>of</i> fine flour; and he shall pour oil upon it, and put frankincense thereon:

<b>2 </b>And he shall bring it to Aaron’s sons the priests: and he shall take thereout his handful of the flour thereof, and of the oil thereof, with all the frankincense thereof; and the priest shall burn the memorial of it upon the altar, <i>to be</i> an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>:

<b>3 </b>And the remnant of the meat offering <i>shall be</i> Aaron’s and his sons’: <i>it is</i> a thing most holy of the offerings of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> made by fire.

<b>4 </b>¶ And if thou bring an oblation of a meat offering baken in the oven, <i>it shall be</i> unleavened cakes of fine flour mingled with oil, or unleavened wafers anointed with oil.

<b>5 </b>¶ And if thy oblation <i>be</i> a meat offering <i>baken</i> in a pan, it shall be <i>of</i> fine flour unleavened, mingled with oil.

<b>6 </b>Thou shalt part it in pieces, and pour oil thereon: it <i>is</i> a meat offering.

<b>7 </b>¶ And if thy oblation <i>be</i> a meat offering <i>baken</i> in the fryingpan, it shall be made <i>of</i> fine flour with oil.

<b>8 </b>And thou shalt bring the meat offering that is made of these things unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: and when it is presented unto the priest, he shall bring it unto the altar.

<b>9 </b>And the priest shall take from the meat offering a memorial thereof, and shall burn <i>it</i> upon the altar: <i>it is</i> an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>10 </b>And that which is left of the meat offering <i>shall be</i> Aaron’s and his sons’: <i>it is</i> a thing most holy of the offerings of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> made by fire.

<b>11 </b>No meat offering, which ye shall bring unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, shall be made with leaven: for ye shall burn no leaven, nor any honey, in any offering of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> made by fire.

<b>12 </b>¶ As for the oblation of the firstfruits, ye shall offer them unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: but they shall not be burnt on the altar for a sweet savour.

<b>13 </b>And every oblation of thy meat offering shalt thou season with salt; neither shalt thou suffer the salt of the covenant of thy God to be lacking from thy meat offering: with all thine offerings thou shalt offer salt.

<b>14 </b>And if thou offer a meat offering of thy firstfruits unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, thou shalt offer for the meat offering of thy firstfruits green ears of corn dried by the fire, <i>even</i> corn beaten out of full ears.

<b>15 </b>And thou shalt put oil upon it, and lay frankincense thereon: it <i>is</i> a meat offering.

<b>16 </b>And the priest shall burn the memorial of it, <i>part</i> of the beaten corn thereof, and <i>part</i> of the oil thereof, with all the frankincense thereof: <i>it is</i> an offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.


--------------------

CHAPTER 3

<b>1 </b>And if his oblation <i>be</i> a sacrifice of peace offering, if he offer <i>it</i> of the herd; whether <i>it be</i> a male or female, he shall offer it without blemish before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>2 </b>And he shall lay his hand upon the head of his offering, and kill it <i>at</i> the door of the tabernacle of the congregation: and Aaron’s sons the priests shall sprinkle the blood upon the altar round about.

<b>3 </b>And he shall offer of the sacrifice of the peace offering an offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that <i>is</i> upon the inwards,

<b>4 </b>And the two kidneys, and the fat that <i>is</i> on them, which <i>is</i> by the flanks, and the caul above the liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away.

<b>5 </b>And Aaron’s sons shall burn it on the altar upon the burnt sacrifice, which <i>is</i> upon the wood that <i>is</i> on the fire: <i>it is</i> an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>6 </b>¶ And if his offering for a sacrifice of peace offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>be</i> of the flock; male or female, he shall offer it without blemish.

<b>7 </b>If he offer a lamb for his offering, then shall he offer it before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>8 </b>And he shall lay his hand upon the head of his offering, and kill it before the tabernacle of the congregation: and Aaron’s sons shall sprinkle the blood thereof round about upon the altar.

<b>9 </b>And he shall offer of the sacrifice of the peace offering an offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; the fat thereof, <i>and</i> the whole rump, it shall he take off hard by the backbone; and the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that <i>is</i> upon the inwards,

<b>10 </b>And the two kidneys, and the fat that <i>is</i> upon them, which <i>is</i> by the flanks, and the caul above the liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away.

<b>11 </b>And the priest shall burn it upon the altar: <i>it is</i> the food of the offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>12 </b>¶ And if his offering <i>be</i> a goat, then he shall offer it before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>13 </b>And he shall lay his hand upon the head of it, and kill it before the tabernacle of the congregation: and the sons of Aaron shall sprinkle the blood thereof upon the altar round about.

<b>14 </b>And he shall offer thereof his offering, <i>even</i> an offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that <i>is</i> upon the inwards,

<b>15 </b>And the two kidneys, and the fat that <i>is</i> upon them, which <i>is</i> by the flanks, and the caul above the liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away.

<b>16 </b>And the priest shall burn them upon the altar: <i>it is</i> the food of the offering made by fire for a sweet savour: all the fat <i>is</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s.

<b>17 </b><i>It shall be</i> a perpetual statute for your generations throughout all your dwellings, that ye eat neither fat nor blood.


--------------------

CHAPTER 4

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>2 </b>Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, If a soul shall sin through ignorance against any of the commandments of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>concerning things</i> which ought not to be done, and shall do against any of them:

<b>3 </b>If the priest that is anointed do sin according to the sin of the people; then let him bring for his sin, which he hath sinned, a young bullock without blemish unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> for a sin offering.

<b>4 </b>And he shall bring the bullock unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; and shall lay his hand upon the bullock’s head, and kill the bullock before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>5 </b>And the priest that is anointed shall take of the bullock’s blood, and bring it to the tabernacle of the congregation:

<b>6 </b>And the priest shall dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle of the blood seven times before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, before the veil of the sanctuary.

<b>7 </b>And the priest shall put <i>some</i> of the blood upon the horns of the altar of sweet incense before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, which <i>is</i> in the tabernacle of the congregation; and shall pour all the blood of the bullock at the bottom of the altar of the burnt offering, which <i>is at</i> the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

<b>8 </b>And he shall take off from it all the fat of the bullock for the sin offering; the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that <i>is</i> upon the inwards,

<b>9 </b>And the two kidneys, and the fat that <i>is</i> upon them, which <i>is</i> by the flanks, and the caul above the liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away,

<b>10 </b>As it was taken off from the bullock of the sacrifice of peace offerings: and the priest shall burn them upon the altar of the burnt offering.

<b>11 </b>And the skin of the bullock, and all his flesh, with his head, and with his legs, and his inwards, and his dung,

<b>12 </b>Even the whole bullock shall he carry forth without the camp unto a clean place, where the ashes are poured out, and burn him on the wood with fire: where the ashes are poured out shall he be burnt.

<b>13 </b>¶ And if the whole congregation of Israel sin through ignorance, and the thing be hid from the eyes of the assembly, and they have done <i>somewhat against</i> any of the commandments of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>concerning things</i> which should not be done, and are guilty;

<b>14 </b>When the sin, which they have sinned against it, is known, then the congregation shall offer a young bullock for the sin, and bring him before the tabernacle of the congregation.

<b>15 </b>And the elders of the congregation shall lay their hands upon the head of the bullock before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: and the bullock shall be killed before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>16 </b>And the priest that is anointed shall bring of the bullock’s blood to the tabernacle of the congregation:

<b>17 </b>And the priest shall dip his finger <i>in some</i> of the blood, and sprinkle <i>it</i> seven times before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, <i>even</i> before the veil.

<b>18 </b>And he shall put <i>some</i> of the blood upon the horns of the altar which <i>is</i> before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, that <i>is</i> in the tabernacle of the congregation, and shall pour out all the blood at the bottom of the altar of the burnt offering, which <i>is at</i> the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

<b>19 </b>And he shall take all his fat from him, and burn <i>it</i> upon the altar.

<b>20 </b>And he shall do with the bullock as he did with the bullock for a sin offering, so shall he do with this: and the priest shall make an atonement for them, and it shall be forgiven them.

<b>21 </b>And he shall carry forth the bullock without the camp, and burn him as he burned the first bullock: it <i>is</i> a sin offering for the congregation.

<b>22 </b>¶ When a ruler hath sinned, and done <i>somewhat</i> through ignorance <i>against</i> any of the commandments of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> his God <i>concerning things</i> which should not be done, and is guilty;

<b>23 </b>Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:

<b>24 </b>And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the goat, and kill it in the place where they kill the burnt offering before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: it <i>is</i> a sin offering.

<b>25 </b>And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering with his finger, and put <i>it</i> upon the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and shall pour out his blood at the bottom of the altar of burnt offering.

<b>26 </b>And he shall burn all his fat upon the altar, as the fat of the sacrifice of peace offerings: and the priest shall make an atonement for him as concerning his sin, and it shall be forgiven him.

<b>27 </b>¶ And if any one of the common people sin through ignorance, while he doeth <i>somewhat against</i> any of the commandments of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>concerning things</i> which ought not to be done, and be guilty;

<b>28 </b>Or if his sin, which he hath sinned, come to his knowledge: then he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a female without blemish, for his sin which he hath sinned.

<b>29 </b>And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin offering, and slay the sin offering in the place of the burnt offering.

<b>30 </b>And the priest shall take of the blood thereof with his finger, and put <i>it</i> upon the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and shall pour out all the blood thereof at the bottom of the altar.

<b>31 </b>And he shall take away all the fat thereof, as the fat is taken away from off the sacrifice of peace offerings; and the priest shall burn <i>it</i> upon the altar for a sweet savour unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; and the priest shall make an atonement for him, and it shall be forgiven him.

<b>32 </b>And if he bring a lamb for a sin offering, he shall bring it a female without blemish.

<b>33 </b>And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin offering, and slay it for a sin offering in the place where they kill the burnt offering.

<b>34 </b>And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering with his finger, and put <i>it</i> upon the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and shall pour out all the blood thereof at the bottom of the altar:

<b>35 </b>And he shall take away all the fat thereof, as the fat of the lamb is taken away from the sacrifice of the peace offerings; and the priest shall burn them upon the altar, according to the offerings made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: and the priest shall make an atonement for his sin that he hath committed, and it shall be forgiven him.


--------------------

CHAPTER 5

<b>1 </b>And if a soul sin, and hear the voice of swearing, and <i>is</i> a witness, whether he hath seen or known <i>of it;</i> if he do not utter <i>it,</i> then he shall bear his iniquity.

<b>2 </b>Or if a soul touch any unclean thing, whether <i>it be</i> a carcase of an unclean beast, or a carcase of unclean cattle, or the carcase of unclean creeping things, and <i>if</i> it be hidden from him; he also shall be unclean, and guilty.

<b>3 </b>Or if he touch the uncleanness of man, whatsoever uncleanness <i>it be</i> that a man shall be defiled withal, and it be hid from him; when he knoweth <i>of it,</i> then he shall be guilty.

<b>4 </b>Or if a soul swear, pronouncing with <i>his</i> lips to do evil, or to do good, whatsoever <i>it be</i> that a man shall pronounce with an oath, and it be hid from him; when he knoweth <i>of it,</i> then he shall be guilty in one of these.

<b>5 </b>And it shall be, when he shall be guilty in one of these <i>things,</i> that he shall confess that he hath sinned in that <i>thing:</i>

<b>6 </b>And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> for his sin which he hath sinned, a female from the flock, a lamb or a kid of the goats, for a sin offering; and the priest shall make an atonement for him concerning his sin.

<b>7 </b>And if he be not able to bring a lamb, then he shall bring for his trespass, which he hath committed, two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering.

<b>8 </b>And he shall bring them unto the priest, who shall offer <i>that</i> which <i>is</i> for the sin offering first, and wring off his head from his neck, but shall not divide <i>it</i> asunder:

<b>9 </b>And he shall sprinkle of the blood of the sin offering upon the side of the altar; and the rest of the blood shall be wrung out at the bottom of the altar: it <i>is</i> a sin offering.

<b>10 </b>And he shall offer the second <i>for</i> a burnt offering, according to the manner: and the priest shall make an atonement for him for his sin which he hath sinned, and it shall be forgiven him.

<b>11 </b>¶ But if he be not able to bring two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, then he that sinned shall bring for his offering the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a sin offering; he shall put no oil upon it, neither shall he put <i>any</i> frankincense thereon: for it <i>is</i> a sin offering.

<b>12 </b>Then shall he bring it to the priest, and the priest shall take his handful of it, <i>even</i> a memorial thereof, and burn <i>it</i> on the altar, according to the offerings made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: it <i>is</i> a sin offering.

<b>13 </b>And the priest shall make an atonement for him as touching his sin that he hath sinned in one of these, and it shall be forgiven him: and <i>the remnant</i> shall be the priest’s, as a meat offering.

<b>14 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>15 </b>If a soul commit a trespass, and sin through ignorance, in the holy things of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; then he shall bring for his trespass unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> a ram without blemish out of the flocks, with thy estimation by shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for a trespass offering:

<b>16 </b>And he shall make amends for the harm that he hath done in the holy thing, and shall add the fifth part thereto, and give it unto the priest: and the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering, and it shall be forgiven him.

<b>17 </b>¶ And if a soul sin, and commit any of these things which are forbidden to be done by the commandments of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; though he wist <i>it</i> not, yet is he guilty, and shall bear his iniquity.

<b>18 </b>And he shall bring a ram without blemish out of the flock, with thy estimation, for a trespass offering, unto the priest: and the priest shall make an atonement for him concerning his ignorance wherein he erred and wist <i>it</i> not, and it shall be forgiven him.

<b>19 </b>It <i>is</i> a trespass offering: he hath certainly trespassed against the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.


--------------------

CHAPTER 6

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>2 </b>If a soul sin, and commit a trespass against the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and lie unto his neighbour in that which was delivered him to keep, or in fellowship, or in a thing taken away by violence, or hath deceived his neighbour;

<b>3 </b>Or have found that which was lost, and lieth concerning it, and sweareth falsely; in any of all these that a man doeth, sinning therein:

<b>4 </b>Then it shall be, because he hath sinned, and is guilty, that he shall restore that which he took violently away, or the thing which he hath deceitfully gotten, or that which was delivered him to keep, or the lost thing which he found,

<b>5 </b>Or all that about which he hath sworn falsely; he shall even restore it in the principal, and shall add the fifth part more thereto, <i>and</i> give it unto him to whom it appertaineth, in the day of his trespass offering.

<b>6 </b>And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, a ram without blemish out of the flock, with thy estimation, for a trespass offering, unto the priest:

<b>7 </b>And the priest shall make an atonement for him before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: and it shall be forgiven him for any thing of all that he hath done in trespassing therein.

<b>8 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>9 </b>Command Aaron and his sons, saying, This <i>is</i> the law of the burnt offering: It <i>is</i> the burnt offering, because of the burning upon the altar all night unto the morning, and the fire of the altar shall be burning in it.

<b>10 </b>And the priest shall put on his linen garment, and his linen breeches shall he put upon his flesh, and take up the ashes which the fire hath consumed with the burnt offering on the altar, and he shall put them beside the altar.

<b>11 </b>And he shall put off his garments, and put on other garments, and carry forth the ashes without the camp unto a clean place.

<b>12 </b>And the fire upon the altar shall be burning in it; it shall not be put out: and the priest shall burn wood on it every morning, and lay the burnt offering in order upon it; and he shall burn thereon the fat of the peace offerings.

<b>13 </b>The fire shall ever be burning upon the altar; it shall never go out.

<b>14 </b>¶ And this <i>is</i> the law of the meat offering: the sons of Aaron shall offer it before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, before the altar.

<b>15 </b>And he shall take of it his handful, of the flour of the meat offering, and of the oil thereof, and all the frankincense which <i>is</i> upon the meat offering, and shall burn <i>it</i> upon the altar <i>for</i> a sweet savour, <i>even</i> the memorial of it, unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>16 </b>And the remainder thereof shall Aaron and his sons eat: with unleavened bread shall it be eaten in the holy place; in the court of the tabernacle of the congregation they shall eat it.

<b>17 </b>It shall not be baken with leaven. I have given it <i>unto them for</i> their portion of my offerings made by fire; it <i>is</i> most holy, as <i>is</i> the sin offering, and as the trespass offering.

<b>18 </b>All the males among the children of Aaron shall eat of it. <i>It shall be</i> a statute for ever in your generations concerning the offerings of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> made by fire: every one that toucheth them shall be holy.

<b>19 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>20 </b>This <i>is</i> the offering of Aaron and of his sons, which they shall offer unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in the day when he is anointed; the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a meat offering perpetual, half of it in the morning, and half thereof at night.

<b>21 </b>In a pan it shall be made with oil; <i>and when it is</i> baken, thou shalt bring it in: <i>and</i> the baken pieces of the meat offering shalt thou offer <i>for</i> a sweet savour unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>22 </b>And the priest of his sons that is anointed in his stead shall offer it: <i>it is</i> a statute for ever unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; it shall be wholly burnt.

<b>23 </b>For every meat offering for the priest shall be wholly burnt: it shall not be eaten.

<b>24 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>25 </b>Speak unto Aaron and to his sons, saying, This <i>is</i> the law of the sin offering: In the place where the burnt offering is killed shall the sin offering be killed before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: it <i>is</i> most holy.

<b>26 </b>The priest that offereth it for sin shall eat it: in the holy place shall it be eaten, in the court of the tabernacle of the congregation.

<b>27 </b>Whatsoever shall touch the flesh thereof shall be holy: and when there is sprinkled of the blood thereof upon any garment, thou shalt wash that whereon it was sprinkled in the holy place.

<b>28 </b>But the earthen vessel wherein it is sodden shall be broken: and if it be sodden in a brasen pot, it shall be both scoured, and rinsed in water.

<b>29 </b>All the males among the priests shall eat thereof: it <i>is</i> most holy.

<b>30 </b>And no sin offering, whereof <i>any</i> of the blood is brought into the tabernacle of the congregation to reconcile <i>withal</i> in the holy <i>place,</i> shall be eaten: it shall be burnt in the fire.


--------------------

CHAPTER 7

<b>1 </b>Likewise this <i>is</i> the law of the trespass offering: it <i>is</i> most holy.

<b>2 </b>In the place where they kill the burnt offering shall they kill the trespass offering: and the blood thereof shall he sprinkle round about upon the altar.

<b>3 </b>And he shall offer of it all the fat thereof; the rump, and the fat that covereth the inwards,

<b>4 </b>And the two kidneys, and the fat that <i>is</i> on them, which <i>is</i> by the flanks, and the caul <i>that is</i> above the liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away:

<b>5 </b>And the priest shall burn them upon the altar <i>for</i> an offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: it <i>is</i> a trespass offering.

<b>6 </b>Every male among the priests shall eat thereof: it shall be eaten in the holy place: it <i>is</i> most holy.

<b>7 </b>As the sin offering <i>is,</i> so <i>is</i> the trespass offering: <i>there is</i> one law for them: the priest that maketh atonement therewith shall have <i>it.</i>

<b>8 </b>And the priest that offereth any man’s burnt offering, <i>even</i> the priest shall have to himself the skin of the burnt offering which he hath offered.

<b>9 </b>And all the meat offering that is baken in the oven, and all that is dressed in the fryingpan, and in the pan, shall be the priest’s that offereth it.

<b>10 </b>And every meat offering, mingled with oil, and dry, shall all the sons of Aaron have, one <i>as much</i> as another.

<b>11 </b>And this <i>is</i> the law of the sacrifice of peace offerings, which he shall offer unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>12 </b>If he offer it for a thanksgiving, then he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes mingled with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and cakes mingled with oil, of fine flour, fried.

<b>13 </b>Besides the cakes, he shall offer <i>for</i> his offering leavened bread with the sacrifice of thanksgiving of his peace offerings.

<b>14 </b>And of it he shall offer one out of the whole oblation <i>for</i> an heave offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, <i>and</i> it shall be the priest’s that sprinkleth the blood of the peace offerings.

<b>15 </b>And the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings for thanksgiving shall be eaten the same day that it is offered; he shall not leave any of it until the morning.

<b>16 </b>But if the sacrifice of his offering <i>be</i> a vow, or a voluntary offering, it shall be eaten the same day that he offereth his sacrifice: and on the morrow also the remainder of it shall be eaten:

<b>17 </b>But the remainder of the flesh of the sacrifice on the third day shall be burnt with fire.

<b>18 </b>And if <i>any</i> of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings be eaten at all on the third day, it shall not be accepted, neither shall it be imputed unto him that offereth it: it shall be an abomination, and the soul that eateth of it shall bear his iniquity.

<b>19 </b>And the flesh that toucheth any unclean <i>thing</i> shall not be eaten; it shall be burnt with fire: and as for the flesh, all that be clean shall eat thereof.

<b>20 </b>But the soul that eateth <i>of</i> the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, that <i>pertain</i> unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, having his uncleanness upon him, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.

<b>21 </b>Moreover the soul that shall touch any unclean <i>thing, as</i> the uncleanness of man, or <i>any</i> unclean beast, or any abominable unclean <i>thing,</i> and eat of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, which <i>pertain</i> unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.

<b>22 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>23 </b>Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, Ye shall eat no manner of fat, of ox, or of sheep, or of goat.

<b>24 </b>And the fat of the beast that dieth of itself, and the fat of that which is torn with beasts, may be used in any other use: but ye shall in no wise eat of it.

<b>25 </b>For whosoever eateth the fat of the beast, of which men offer an offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, even the soul that eateth <i>it</i> shall be cut off from his people.

<b>26 </b>Moreover ye shall eat no manner of blood, <i>whether it be</i> of fowl or of beast, in any of your dwellings.

<b>27 </b>Whatsoever soul <i>it be</i> that eateth any manner of blood, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.

<b>28 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>29 </b>Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, He that offereth the sacrifice of his peace offerings unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall bring his oblation unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> of the sacrifice of his peace offerings.

<b>30 </b>His own hands shall bring the offerings of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> made by fire, the fat with the breast, it shall he bring, that the breast may be waved <i>for</i> a wave offering before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>31 </b>And the priest shall burn the fat upon the altar: but the breast shall be Aaron’s and his sons’.

<b>32 </b>And the right shoulder shall ye give unto the priest <i>for</i> an heave offering of the sacrifices of your peace offerings.

<b>33 </b>He among the sons of Aaron, that offereth the blood of the peace offerings, and the fat, shall have the right shoulder for <i>his</i> part.

<b>34 </b>For the wave breast and the heave shoulder have I taken of the children of Israel from off the sacrifices of their peace offerings, and have given them unto Aaron the priest and unto his sons by a statute for ever from among the children of Israel.

<b>35 </b>¶ This <i>is the portion</i> of the anointing of Aaron, and of the anointing of his sons, out of the offerings of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> made by fire, in the day <i>when</i> he presented them to minister unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in the priest’s office;

<b>36 </b>Which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded to be given them of the children of Israel, in the day that he anointed them, <i>by</i> a statute for ever throughout their generations.

<b>37 </b>This <i>is</i> the law of the burnt offering, of the meat offering, and of the sin offering, and of the trespass offering, and of the consecrations, and of the sacrifice of the peace offerings;

<b>38 </b>Which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses in mount Sinai, in the day that he commanded the children of Israel to offer their oblations unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, in the wilderness of Sinai.


--------------------

CHAPTER 8

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>2 </b>Take Aaron and his sons with him, and the garments, and the anointing oil, and a bullock for the sin offering, and two rams, and a basket of unleavened bread;

<b>3 </b>And gather thou all the congregation together unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

<b>4 </b>And Moses did as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded him; and the assembly was gathered together unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

<b>5 </b>And Moses said unto the congregation, This <i>is</i> the thing which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded to be done.

<b>6 </b>And Moses brought Aaron and his sons, and washed them with water.

<b>7 </b>And he put upon him the coat, and girded him with the girdle, and clothed him with the robe, and put the ephod upon him, and he girded him with the curious girdle of the ephod, and bound <i>it</i> unto him therewith.

<b>8 </b>And he put the breastplate upon him: also he put in the breastplate the Urim and the Thummim.

<b>9 </b>And he put the mitre upon his head; also upon the mitre, <i>even</i> upon his forefront, did he put the golden plate, the holy crown; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>10 </b>And Moses took the anointing oil, and anointed the tabernacle and all that <i>was</i> therein, and sanctified them.

<b>11 </b>And he sprinkled thereof upon the altar seven times, and anointed the altar and all his vessels, both the laver and his foot, to sanctify them.

<b>12 </b>And he poured of the anointing oil upon Aaron’s head, and anointed him, to sanctify him.

<b>13 </b>And Moses brought Aaron’s sons, and put coats upon them, and girded them with girdles, and put bonnets upon them; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>14 </b>And he brought the bullock for the sin offering: and Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the bullock for the sin offering.

<b>15 </b>And he slew <i>it;</i> and Moses took the blood, and put <i>it</i> upon the horns of the altar round about with his finger, and purified the altar, and poured the blood at the bottom of the altar, and sanctified it, to make reconciliation upon it.

<b>16 </b>And he took all the fat that <i>was</i> upon the inwards, and the caul <i>above</i> the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat, and Moses burned <i>it</i> upon the altar.

<b>17 </b>But the bullock, and his hide, his flesh, and his dung, he burnt with fire without the camp; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>18 </b>¶ And he brought the ram for the burnt offering: and Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the ram.

<b>19 </b>And he killed <i>it;</i> and Moses sprinkled the blood upon the altar round about.

<b>20 </b>And he cut the ram into pieces; and Moses burnt the head, and the pieces, and the fat.

<b>21 </b>And he washed the inwards and the legs in water; and Moses burnt the whole ram upon the altar: it <i>was</i> a burnt sacrifice for a sweet savour, <i>and</i> an offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>22 </b>¶ And he brought the other ram, the ram of consecration: and Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the ram.

<b>23 </b>And he slew <i>it;</i> and Moses took of the blood of it, and put <i>it</i> upon the tip of Aaron’s right ear, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot.

<b>24 </b>And he brought Aaron’s sons, and Moses put of the blood upon the tip of their right ear, and upon the thumbs of their right hands, and upon the great toes of their right feet: and Moses sprinkled the blood upon the altar round about.

<b>25 </b>And he took the fat, and the rump, and all the fat that <i>was</i> upon the inwards, and the caul <i>above</i> the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat, and the right shoulder:

<b>26 </b>And out of the basket of unleavened bread, that <i>was</i> before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, he took one unleavened cake, and a cake of oiled bread, and one wafer, and put <i>them</i> on the fat, and upon the right shoulder:

<b>27 </b>And he put all upon Aaron’s hands, and upon his sons’ hands, and waved them <i>for</i> a wave offering before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>28 </b>And Moses took them from off their hands, and burnt <i>them</i> on the altar upon the burnt offering: they <i>were</i> consecrations for a sweet savour: it <i>is</i> an offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>29 </b>And Moses took the breast, and waved it <i>for</i> a wave offering before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: <i>for</i> of the ram of consecration it was Moses’ part; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>30 </b>And Moses took of the anointing oil, and of the blood which <i>was</i> upon the altar, and sprinkled <i>it</i> upon Aaron, <i>and</i> upon his garments, and upon his sons, and upon his sons’ garments with him; and sanctified Aaron, <i>and</i> his garments, and his sons, and his sons’ garments with him.

<b>31 </b>¶ And Moses said unto Aaron and to his sons, Boil the flesh <i>at</i> the door of the tabernacle of the congregation: and there eat it with the bread that <i>is</i> in the basket of consecrations, as I commanded, saying, Aaron and his sons shall eat it.

<b>32 </b>And that which remaineth of the flesh and of the bread shall ye burn with fire.

<b>33 </b>And ye shall not go out of the door of the tabernacle of the congregation <i>in</i> seven days, until the days of your consecration be at an end: for seven days shall he consecrate you.

<b>34 </b>As he hath done this day, <i>so</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath commanded to do, to make an atonement for you.

<b>35 </b>Therefore shall ye abide <i>at</i> the door of the tabernacle of the congregation day and night seven days, and keep the charge of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, that ye die not: for so I am commanded.

<b>36 </b>So Aaron and his sons did all things which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded by the hand of Moses.


--------------------

CHAPTER 9

<b>1 </b>And it came to pass on the eighth day, <i>that</i> Moses called Aaron and his sons, and the elders of Israel;

<b>2 </b>And he said unto Aaron, Take thee a young calf for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering, without blemish, and offer <i>them</i> before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>3 </b>And unto the children of Israel thou shalt speak, saying, Take ye a kid of the goats for a sin offering; and a calf and a lamb, <i>both</i> of the first year, without blemish, for a burnt offering;

<b>4 </b>Also a bullock and a ram for peace offerings, to sacrifice before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; and a meat offering mingled with oil: for to day the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> will appear unto you.

<b>5 </b>¶ And they brought <i>that</i> which Moses commanded before the tabernacle of the congregation: and all the congregation drew near and stood before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>6 </b>And Moses said, This <i>is</i> the thing which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded that ye should do: and the glory of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall appear unto you.

<b>7 </b>And Moses said unto Aaron, Go unto the altar, and offer thy sin offering, and thy burnt offering, and make an atonement for thyself, and for the people: and offer the offering of the people, and make an atonement for them; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded.

<b>8 </b>¶ Aaron therefore went unto the altar, and slew the calf of the sin offering, which <i>was</i> for himself.

<b>9 </b>And the sons of Aaron brought the blood unto him: and he dipped his finger in the blood, and put <i>it</i> upon the horns of the altar, and poured out the blood at the bottom of the altar:

<b>10 </b>But the fat, and the kidneys, and the caul above the liver of the sin offering, he burnt upon the altar; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>11 </b>And the flesh and the hide he burnt with fire without the camp.

<b>12 </b>And he slew the burnt offering; and Aaron’s sons presented unto him the blood, which he sprinkled round about upon the altar.

<b>13 </b>And they presented the burnt offering unto him, with the pieces thereof, and the head: and he burnt <i>them</i> upon the altar.

<b>14 </b>And he did wash the inwards and the legs, and burnt <i>them</i> upon the burnt offering on the altar.

<b>15 </b>¶ And he brought the people’s offering, and took the goat, which <i>was</i> the sin offering for the people, and slew it, and offered it for sin, as the first.

<b>16 </b>And he brought the burnt offering, and offered it according to the manner.

<b>17 </b>And he brought the meat offering, and took an handful thereof, and burnt <i>it</i> upon the altar, beside the burnt sacrifice of the morning.

<b>18 </b>He slew also the bullock and the ram <i>for</i> a sacrifice of peace offerings, which <i>was</i> for the people: and Aaron’s sons presented unto him the blood, which he sprinkled upon the altar round about,

<b>19 </b>And the fat of the bullock and of the ram, the rump, and that which covereth <i>the inwards,</i> and the kidneys, and the caul <i>above</i> the liver:

<b>20 </b>And they put the fat upon the breasts, and he burnt the fat upon the altar:

<b>21 </b>And the breasts and the right shoulder Aaron waved <i>for</i> a wave offering before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; as Moses commanded.

<b>22 </b>And Aaron lifted up his hand toward the people, and blessed them, and came down from offering of the sin offering, and the burnt offering, and peace offerings.

<b>23 </b>And Moses and Aaron went into the tabernacle of the congregation, and came out, and blessed the people: and the glory of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> appeared unto all the people.

<b>24 </b>And there came a fire out from before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and consumed upon the altar the burnt offering and the fat: <i>which</i> when all the people saw, they shouted, and fell on their faces.


--------------------

CHAPTER 10

<b>1 </b>And Nadab and Abihu, the sons of Aaron, took either of them his censer, and put fire therein, and put incense thereon, and offered strange fire before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, which he commanded them not.

<b>2 </b>And there went out fire from the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and devoured them, and they died before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>3 </b>Then Moses said unto Aaron, This <i>is it</i> that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake, saying, I will be sanctified in them that come nigh me, and before all the people I will be glorified. And Aaron held his peace.

<b>4 </b>And Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uzziel the uncle of Aaron, and said unto them, Come near, carry your brethren from before the sanctuary out of the camp.

<b>5 </b>So they went near, and carried them in their coats out of the camp; as Moses had said.

<b>6 </b>And Moses said unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar, his sons, Uncover not your heads, neither rend your clothes; lest ye die, and lest wrath come upon all the people: but let your brethren, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath kindled.

<b>7 </b>And ye shall not go out from the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, lest ye die: for the anointing oil of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>is</i> upon you. And they did according to the word of Moses.

<b>8 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Aaron, saying,

<b>9 </b>Do not drink wine nor strong drink, thou, nor thy sons with thee, when ye go into the tabernacle of the congregation, lest ye die: <i>it shall be</i> a statute for ever throughout your generations:

<b>10 </b>And that ye may put difference between holy and unholy, and between unclean and clean;

<b>11 </b>And that ye may teach the children of Israel all the statutes which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath spoken unto them by the hand of Moses.

<b>12 </b>¶ And Moses spake unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar, his sons that were left, Take the meat offering that remaineth of the offerings of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> made by fire, and eat it without leaven beside the altar: for it <i>is</i> most holy:

<b>13 </b>And ye shall eat it in the holy place, because it <i>is</i> thy due, and thy sons’ due, of the sacrifices of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> made by fire: for so I am commanded.

<b>14 </b>And the wave breast and heave shoulder shall ye eat in a clean place; thou, and thy sons, and thy daughters with thee: for <i>they be</i> thy due, and thy sons’ due, <i>which</i> are given out of the sacrifices of peace offerings of the children of Israel.

<b>15 </b>The heave shoulder and the wave breast shall they bring with the offerings made by fire of the fat, to wave <i>it for</i> a wave offering before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; and it shall be thine, and thy sons’ with thee, by a statute for ever; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath commanded.

<b>16 </b>¶ And Moses diligently sought the goat of the sin offering, and, behold, it was burnt: and he was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron <i>which were</i> left <i>alive,</i> saying,

<b>17 </b>Wherefore have ye not eaten the sin offering in the holy place, seeing it <i>is</i> most holy, and <i>God</i> hath given it you to bear the iniquity of the congregation, to make atonement for them before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>?

<b>18 </b>Behold, the blood of it was not brought in within the holy <i>place:</i> ye should indeed have eaten it in the holy <i>place,</i> as I commanded.
