<b>19 </b>And Aaron said unto Moses, Behold, this day have they offered their sin offering and their burnt offering before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; and such things have befallen me: and <i>if</i> I had eaten the sin offering to day, should it have been accepted in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>?

<b>20 </b>And when Moses heard <i>that,</i> he was content.


--------------------

CHAPTER 11

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses and to Aaron, saying unto them,

<b>2 </b>Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, These <i>are</i> the beasts which ye shall eat among all the beasts that <i>are</i> on the earth.

<b>3 </b>Whatsoever parteth the hoof, and is clovenfooted, <i>and</i> cheweth the cud, among the beasts, that shall ye eat.

<b>4 </b>Nevertheless these shall ye not eat of them that chew the cud, or of them that divide the hoof: <i>as</i> the camel, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hoof; he <i>is</i> unclean unto you.

<b>5 </b>And the coney, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hoof; he <i>is</i> unclean unto you.

<b>6 </b>And the hare, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hoof; he <i>is</i> unclean unto you.

<b>7 </b>And the swine, though he divide the hoof, and be clovenfooted, yet he cheweth not the cud; he <i>is</i> unclean to you.

<b>8 </b>Of their flesh shall ye not eat, and their carcase shall ye not touch; they <i>are</i> unclean to you.

<b>9 </b>¶ These shall ye eat of all that <i>are</i> in the waters: whatsoever hath fins and scales in the waters, in the seas, and in the rivers, them shall ye eat.

<b>10 </b>And all that have not fins and scales in the seas, and in the rivers, of all that move in the waters, and of any living thing which <i>is</i> in the waters, they <i>shall be</i> an abomination unto you:

<b>11 </b>They shall be even an abomination unto you; ye shall not eat of their flesh, but ye shall have their carcases in abomination.

<b>12 </b>Whatsoever hath no fins nor scales in the waters, that <i>shall be</i> an abomination unto you.

<b>13 </b>¶ And these <i>are they which</i> ye shall have in abomination among the fowls; they shall not be eaten, they <i>are</i> an abomination: the eagle, and the ossifrage, and the ospray,

<b>14 </b>And the vulture, and the kite after his kind;

<b>15 </b>Every raven after his kind;

<b>16 </b>And the owl, and the night hawk, and the cuckow, and the hawk after his kind,

<b>17 </b>And the little owl, and the cormorant, and the great owl,

<b>18 </b>And the swan, and the pelican, and the gier eagle,

<b>19 </b>And the stork, the heron after her kind, and the lapwing, and the bat.

<b>20 </b>All fowls that creep, going upon <i>all</i> four, <i>shall be</i> an abomination unto you.

<b>21 </b>Yet these may ye eat of every flying creeping thing that goeth upon <i>all</i> four, which have legs above their feet, to leap withal upon the earth;

<b>22 </b><i>Even</i> these of them ye may eat; the locust after his kind, and the bald locust after his kind, and the beetle after his kind, and the grasshopper after his kind.

<b>23 </b>But all <i>other</i> flying creeping things, which have four feet, <i>shall be</i> an abomination unto you.

<b>24 </b>And for these ye shall be unclean: whosoever toucheth the carcase of them shall be unclean until the even.

<b>25 </b>And whosoever beareth <i>ought</i> of the carcase of them shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even.

<b>26 </b><i>The carcases</i> of every beast which divideth the hoof, and <i>is</i> not clovenfooted, nor cheweth the cud, <i>are</i> unclean unto you: every one that toucheth them shall be unclean.

<b>27 </b>And whatsoever goeth upon his paws, among all manner of beasts that go on <i>all</i> four, those <i>are</i> unclean unto you: whoso toucheth their carcase shall be unclean until the even.

<b>28 </b>And he that beareth the carcase of them shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even: they <i>are</i> unclean unto you.

<b>29 </b>¶ These also <i>shall be</i> unclean unto you among the creeping things that creep upon the earth; the weasel, and the mouse, and the tortoise after his kind,

<b>30 </b>And the ferret, and the chameleon, and the lizard, and the snail, and the mole.

<b>31 </b>These <i>are</i> unclean to you among all that creep: whosoever doth touch them, when they be dead, shall be unclean until the even.

<b>32 </b>And upon whatsoever <i>any</i> of them, when they are dead, doth fall, it shall be unclean; whether <i>it be</i> any vessel of wood, or raiment, or skin, or sack, whatsoever vessel <i>it be,</i> wherein <i>any</i> work is done, it must be put into water, and it shall be unclean until the even; so it shall be cleansed.

<b>33 </b>And every earthen vessel, whereinto <i>any</i> of them falleth, whatsoever <i>is</i> in it shall be unclean; and ye shall break it.

<b>34 </b>Of all meat which may be eaten, <i>that</i> on which <i>such</i> water cometh shall be unclean: and all drink that may be drunk in every <i>such</i> vessel shall be unclean.

<b>35 </b>And every <i>thing</i> whereupon <i>any part</i> of their carcase falleth shall be unclean; <i>whether it be</i> oven, or ranges for pots, they shall be broken down: <i>for</i> they <i>are</i> unclean, and shall be unclean unto you.

<b>36 </b>Nevertheless a fountain or pit, <i>wherein there is</i> plenty of water, shall be clean: but that which toucheth their carcase shall be unclean.

<b>37 </b>And if <i>any part</i> of their carcase fall upon any sowing seed which is to be sown, it <i>shall be</i> clean.

<b>38 </b>But if <i>any</i> water be put upon the seed, and <i>any part</i> of their carcase fall thereon, it <i>shall be</i> unclean unto you.

<b>39 </b>And if any beast, of which ye may eat, die; he that toucheth the carcase thereof shall be unclean until the even.

<b>40 </b>And he that eateth of the carcase of it shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even: he also that beareth the carcase of it shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even.

<b>41 </b>And every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth <i>shall be</i> an abomination; it shall not be eaten.

<b>42 </b>Whatsoever goeth upon the belly, and whatsoever goeth upon <i>all</i> four, or whatsoever hath more feet among all creeping things that creep upon the earth, them ye shall not eat; for they <i>are</i> an abomination.

<b>43 </b>Ye shall not make yourselves abominable with any creeping thing that creepeth, neither shall ye make yourselves unclean with them, that ye should be defiled thereby.

<b>44 </b>For I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God: ye shall therefore sanctify yourselves, and ye shall be holy; for I <i>am</i> holy: neither shall ye defile yourselves with any manner of creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.

<b>45 </b>For I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> that bringeth you up out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: ye shall therefore be holy, for I <i>am</i> holy.

<b>46 </b>This <i>is</i> the law of the beasts, and of the fowl, and of every living creature that moveth in the waters, and of every creature that creepeth upon the earth:

<b>47 </b>To make a difference between the unclean and the clean, and between the beast that may be eaten and the beast that may not be eaten.


--------------------

CHAPTER 12

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>2 </b>Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, If a woman have conceived seed, and born a man child: then she shall be unclean seven days; according to the days of the separation for her infirmity shall she be unclean.

<b>3 </b>And in the eighth day the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised.

<b>4 </b>And she shall then continue in the blood of her purifying three and thirty days; she shall touch no hallowed thing, nor come into the sanctuary, until the days of her purifying be fulfilled.

<b>5 </b>But if she bear a maid child, then she shall be unclean two weeks, as in her separation: and she shall continue in the blood of her purifying threescore and six days.

<b>6 </b>And when the days of her purifying are fulfilled, for a son, or for a daughter, she shall bring a lamb of the first year for a burnt offering, and a young pigeon, or a turtledove, for a sin offering, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, unto the priest:

<b>7 </b>Who shall offer it before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and make an atonement for her; and she shall be cleansed from the issue of her blood. This <i>is</i> the law for her that hath born a male or a female.

<b>8 </b>And if she be not able to bring a lamb, then she shall bring two turtles, or two young pigeons; the one for the burnt offering, and the other for a sin offering: and the priest shall make an atonement for her, and she shall be clean.


--------------------

CHAPTER 13

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses and Aaron, saying,

<b>2 </b>When a man shall have in the skin of his flesh a rising, a scab, or bright spot, and it be in the skin of his flesh <i>like</i> the plague of leprosy; then he shall be brought unto Aaron the priest, or unto one of his sons the priests:

<b>3 </b>And the priest shall look on the plague in the skin of the flesh: and <i>when</i> the hair in the plague is turned white, and the plague in sight <i>be</i> deeper than the skin of his flesh, it <i>is</i> a plague of leprosy: and the priest shall look on him, and pronounce him unclean.

<b>4 </b>If the bright spot <i>be</i> white in the skin of his flesh, and in sight <i>be</i> not deeper than the skin, and the hair thereof be not turned white; then the priest shall shut up <i>him that hath</i> the plague seven days:

<b>5 </b>And the priest shall look on him the seventh day: and, behold, <i>if</i> the plague in his sight be at a stay, <i>and</i> the plague spread not in the skin; then the priest shall shut him up seven days more:

<b>6 </b>And the priest shall look on him again the seventh day: and, behold, <i>if</i> the plague <i>be</i> somewhat dark, <i>and</i> the plague spread not in the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean: it <i>is but</i> a scab: and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.

<b>7 </b>But if the scab spread much abroad in the skin, after that he hath been seen of the priest for his cleansing, he shall be seen of the priest again:

<b>8 </b>And <i>if</i> the priest see that, behold, the scab spreadeth in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it <i>is</i> a leprosy.

<b>9 </b>¶ When the plague of leprosy is in a man, then he shall be brought unto the priest;

<b>10 </b>And the priest shall see <i>him:</i> and, behold, <i>if</i> the rising <i>be</i> white in the skin, and it have turned the hair white, and <i>there be</i> quick raw flesh in the rising;

<b>11 </b>It <i>is</i> an old leprosy in the skin of his flesh, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean, and shall not shut him up: for he <i>is</i> unclean.

<b>12 </b>And if a leprosy break out abroad in the skin, and the leprosy cover all the skin of <i>him that hath</i> the plague from his head even to his foot, wheresoever the priest looketh;

<b>13 </b>Then the priest shall consider: and, behold, <i>if</i> the leprosy have covered all his flesh, he shall pronounce <i>him</i> clean <i>that hath</i> the plague: it is all turned white: he <i>is</i> clean.

<b>14 </b>But when raw flesh appeareth in him, he shall be unclean.

<b>15 </b>And the priest shall see the raw flesh, and pronounce him to be unclean: <i>for</i> the raw flesh <i>is</i> unclean: it <i>is</i> a leprosy.

<b>16 </b>Or if the raw flesh turn again, and be changed unto white, he shall come unto the priest;

<b>17 </b>And the priest shall see him: and, behold, <i>if</i> the plague be turned into white; then the priest shall pronounce <i>him</i> clean <i>that hath</i> the plague: he <i>is</i> clean.

<b>18 </b>¶ The flesh also, in which, <i>even</i> in the skin thereof, was a boil, and is healed,

<b>19 </b>And in the place of the boil there be a white rising, or a bright spot, white, and somewhat reddish, and it be shewed to the priest;

<b>20 </b>And if, when the priest seeth it, behold, it <i>be</i> in sight lower than the skin, and the hair thereof be turned white; the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it <i>is</i> a plague of leprosy broken out of the boil.

<b>21 </b>But if the priest look on it, and, behold, <i>there be</i> no white hairs therein, and <i>if</i> it <i>be</i> not lower than the skin, but <i>be</i> somewhat dark; then the priest shall shut him up seven days:

<b>22 </b>And if it spread much abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it <i>is</i> a plague.

<b>23 </b>But if the bright spot stay in his place, <i>and</i> spread not, it <i>is</i> a burning boil; and the priest shall pronounce him clean.

<b>24 </b>¶ Or if there be <i>any</i> flesh, in the skin whereof <i>there is</i> a hot burning, and the quick <i>flesh</i> that burneth have a white bright spot, somewhat reddish, or white;

<b>25 </b>Then the priest shall look upon it: and, behold, <i>if</i> the hair in the bright spot be turned white, and it <i>be in</i> sight deeper than the skin; it <i>is</i> a leprosy broken out of the burning: wherefore the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it <i>is</i> the plague of leprosy.

<b>26 </b>But if the priest look on it, and, behold, <i>there be</i> no white hair in the bright spot, and it <i>be</i> no lower than the <i>other</i> skin, but <i>be</i> somewhat dark; then the priest shall shut him up seven days:

<b>27 </b>And the priest shall look upon him the seventh day: <i>and</i> if it be spread much abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it <i>is</i> the plague of leprosy.

<b>28 </b>And if the bright spot stay in his place, <i>and</i> spread not in the skin, but it <i>be</i> somewhat dark; it <i>is</i> a rising of the burning, and the priest shall pronounce him clean: for it <i>is</i> an inflammation of the burning.

<b>29 </b>¶ If a man or woman have a plague upon the head or the beard;

<b>30 </b>Then the priest shall see the plague: and, behold, if it <i>be</i> in sight deeper than the skin; <i>and there be</i> in it a yellow thin hair; then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it <i>is</i> a dry scall, <i>even</i> a leprosy upon the head or beard.

<b>31 </b>And if the priest look on the plague of the scall, and, behold, it <i>be</i> not in sight deeper than the skin, and <i>that there is</i> no black hair in it; then the priest shall shut up <i>him that hath</i> the plague of the scall seven days:

<b>32 </b>And in the seventh day the priest shall look on the plague: and, behold, <i>if</i> the scall spread not, and there be in it no yellow hair, and the scall <i>be</i> not in sight deeper than the skin;

<b>33 </b>He shall be shaven, but the scall shall he not shave; and the priest shall shut up <i>him that hath</i> the scall seven days more:

<b>34 </b>And in the seventh day the priest shall look on the scall: and, behold, <i>if</i> the scall be not spread in the skin, nor <i>be</i> in sight deeper than the skin; then the priest shall pronounce him clean: and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.

<b>35 </b>But if the scall spread much in the skin after his cleansing;

<b>36 </b>Then the priest shall look on him: and, behold, if the scall be spread in the skin, the priest shall not seek for yellow hair; he <i>is</i> unclean.

<b>37 </b>But if the scall be in his sight at a stay, and <i>that</i> there is black hair grown up therein; the scall is healed, he <i>is</i> clean: and the priest shall pronounce him clean.

<b>38 </b>¶ If a man also or a woman have in the skin of their flesh bright spots, <i>even</i> white bright spots;

<b>39 </b>Then the priest shall look: and, behold, <i>if</i> the bright spots in the skin of their flesh <i>be</i> darkish white; it <i>is</i> a freckled spot <i>that</i> groweth in the skin; he <i>is</i> clean.

<b>40 </b>And the man whose hair is fallen off his head, he <i>is</i> bald; <i>yet is</i> he clean.

<b>41 </b>And he that hath his hair fallen off from the part of his head toward his face, he <i>is</i> forehead bald: <i>yet is</i> he clean.

<b>42 </b>And if there be in the bald head, or bald forehead, a white reddish sore; it <i>is</i> a leprosy sprung up in his bald head, or his bald forehead.

<b>43 </b>Then the priest shall look upon it: and, behold, <i>if</i> the rising of the sore <i>be</i> white reddish in his bald head, or in his bald forehead, as the leprosy appeareth in the skin of the flesh;

<b>44 </b>He is a leprous man, he <i>is</i> unclean: the priest shall pronounce him utterly unclean; his plague <i>is</i> in his head.

<b>45 </b>And the leper in whom the plague <i>is,</i> his clothes shall be rent, and his head bare, and he shall put a covering upon his upper lip, and shall cry, Unclean, unclean.

<b>46 </b>All the days wherein the plague <i>shall be</i> in him he shall be defiled; he <i>is</i> unclean: he shall dwell alone; without the camp <i>shall</i> his habitation <i>be.</i>

<b>47 </b>¶ The garment also that the plague of leprosy is in, <i>whether it be</i> a woollen garment, or a linen garment;

<b>48 </b>Whether <i>it be</i> in the warp, or woof; of linen, or of woollen; whether in a skin, or in any thing made of skin;

<b>49 </b>And if the plague be greenish or reddish in the garment, or in the skin, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin; it <i>is</i> a plague of leprosy, and shall be shewed unto the priest:

<b>50 </b>And the priest shall look upon the plague, and shut up <i>it that hath</i> the plague seven days:

<b>51 </b>And he shall look on the plague on the seventh day: if the plague be spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in a skin, <i>or</i> in any work that is made of skin; the plague <i>is</i> a fretting leprosy; it <i>is</i> unclean.

<b>52 </b>He shall therefore burn that garment, whether warp or woof, in woollen or in linen, or any thing of skin, wherein the plague is: for it <i>is</i> a fretting leprosy; it shall be burnt in the fire.

<b>53 </b>And if the priest shall look, and, behold, the plague be not spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin;

<b>54 </b>Then the priest shall command that they wash <i>the thing</i> wherein the plague <i>is,</i> and he shall shut it up seven days more:

<b>55 </b>And the priest shall look on the plague, after that it is washed: and, behold, <i>if</i> the plague have not changed his colour, and the plague be not spread; it <i>is</i> unclean; thou shalt burn it in the fire; it <i>is</i> fret inward, <i>whether</i> it <i>be</i> bare within or without.

<b>56 </b>And if the priest look, and, behold, the plague <i>be</i> somewhat dark after the washing of it; then he shall rend it out of the garment, or out of the skin, or out of the warp, or out of the woof:

<b>57 </b>And if it appear still in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin; it <i>is</i> a spreading <i>plague:</i> thou shalt burn that wherein the plague <i>is</i> with fire.

<b>58 </b>And the garment, either warp, or woof, or whatsoever thing of skin <i>it be,</i> which thou shalt wash, if the plague be departed from them, then it shall be washed the second time, and shall be clean.

<b>59 </b>This <i>is</i> the law of the plague of leprosy in a garment of woollen or linen, either in the warp, or woof, or any thing of skins, to pronounce it clean, or to pronounce it unclean.


--------------------

CHAPTER 14

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>2 </b>This shall be the law of the leper in the day of his cleansing: He shall be brought unto the priest:

<b>3 </b>And the priest shall go forth out of the camp; and the priest shall look, and, behold, <i>if</i> the plague of leprosy be healed in the leper;

<b>4 </b>Then shall the priest command to take for him that is to be cleansed two birds alive <i>and</i> clean, and cedar wood, and scarlet, and hyssop:

<b>5 </b>And the priest shall command that one of the birds be killed in an earthen vessel over running water:

<b>6 </b>As for the living bird, he shall take it, and the cedar wood, and the scarlet, and the hyssop, and shall dip them and the living bird in the blood of the bird <i>that was</i> killed over the running water:

<b>7 </b>And he shall sprinkle upon him that is to be cleansed from the leprosy seven times, and shall pronounce him clean, and shall let the living bird loose into the open field.

<b>8 </b>And he that is to be cleansed shall wash his clothes, and shave off all his hair, and wash himself in water, that he may be clean: and after that he shall come into the camp, and shall tarry abroad out of his tent seven days.

<b>9 </b>But it shall be on the seventh day, that he shall shave all his hair off his head and his beard and his eyebrows, even all his hair he shall shave off: and he shall wash his clothes, also he shall wash his flesh in water, and he shall be clean.

<b>10 </b>And on the eighth day he shall take two he lambs without blemish, and one ewe lamb of the first year without blemish, and three tenth deals of fine flour <i>for</i> a meat offering, mingled with oil, and one log of oil.

<b>11 </b>And the priest that maketh <i>him</i> clean shall present the man that is to be made clean, and those things, before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, <i>at</i> the door of the tabernacle of the congregation:

<b>12 </b>And the priest shall take one he lamb, and offer him for a trespass offering, and the log of oil, and wave them <i>for</i> a wave offering before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>:

<b>13 </b>And he shall slay the lamb in the place where he shall kill the sin offering and the burnt offering, in the holy place: for as the sin offering <i>is</i> the priest’s, <i>so is</i> the trespass offering: it <i>is</i> most holy:

<b>14 </b>And the priest shall take <i>some</i> of the blood of the trespass offering, and the priest shall put <i>it</i> upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot:

<b>15 </b>And the priest shall take <i>some</i> of the log of oil, and pour <i>it</i> into the palm of his own left hand:

<b>16 </b>And the priest shall dip his right finger in the oil that <i>is</i> in his left hand, and shall sprinkle of the oil with his finger seven times before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>:

<b>17 </b>And of the rest of the oil that <i>is</i> in his hand shall the priest put upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot, upon the blood of the trespass offering:

<b>18 </b>And the remnant of the oil that <i>is</i> in the priest’s hand he shall pour upon the head of him that is to be cleansed: and the priest shall make an atonement for him before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>19 </b>And the priest shall offer the sin offering, and make an atonement for him that is to be cleansed from his uncleanness; and afterward he shall kill the burnt offering:

<b>20 </b>And the priest shall offer the burnt offering and the meat offering upon the altar: and the priest shall make an atonement for him, and he shall be clean.

<b>21 </b>And if he <i>be</i> poor, and cannot get so much; then he shall take one lamb <i>for</i> a trespass offering to be waved, to make an atonement for him, and one tenth deal of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat offering, and a log of oil;

<b>22 </b>And two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, such as he is able to get; and the one shall be a sin offering, and the other a burnt offering.

<b>23 </b>And he shall bring them on the eighth day for his cleansing unto the priest, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>24 </b>And the priest shall take the lamb of the trespass offering, and the log of oil, and the priest shall wave them <i>for</i> a wave offering before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>:

<b>25 </b>And he shall kill the lamb of the trespass offering, and the priest shall take <i>some</i> of the blood of the trespass offering, and put <i>it</i> upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot:

<b>26 </b>And the priest shall pour of the oil into the palm of his own left hand:

<b>27 </b>And the priest shall sprinkle with his right finger <i>some</i> of the oil that <i>is</i> in his left hand seven times before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>:

<b>28 </b>And the priest shall put of the oil that <i>is</i> in his hand upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot, upon the place of the blood of the trespass offering:

<b>29 </b>And the rest of the oil that <i>is</i> in the priest’s hand he shall put upon the head of him that is to be cleansed, to make an atonement for him before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>30 </b>And he shall offer the one of the turtledoves, or of the young pigeons, such as he can get;

<b>31 </b><i>Even</i> such as he is able to get, the one <i>for</i> a sin offering, and the other <i>for</i> a burnt offering, with the meat offering: and the priest shall make an atonement for him that is to be cleansed before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>32 </b>This <i>is</i> the law <i>of him</i> in whom <i>is</i> the plague of leprosy, whose hand is not able to get <i>that which pertaineth</i> to his cleansing.

<b>33 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,

<b>34 </b>When ye be come into the land of Canaan, which I give to you for a possession, and I put the plague of leprosy in a house of the land of your possession;

<b>35 </b>And he that owneth the house shall come and tell the priest, saying, It seemeth to me <i>there is</i> as it were a plague in the house:

<b>36 </b>Then the priest shall command that they empty the house, before the priest go <i>into it</i> to see the plague, that all that <i>is</i> in the house be not made unclean: and afterward the priest shall go in to see the house:

<b>37 </b>And he shall look on the plague, and, behold, <i>if</i> the plague <i>be</i> in the walls of the house with hollow strakes, greenish or reddish, which in sight <i>are</i> lower than the wall;

<b>38 </b>Then the priest shall go out of the house to the door of the house, and shut up the house seven days:

<b>39 </b>And the priest shall come again the seventh day, and shall look: and, behold, <i>if</i> the plague be spread in the walls of the house;

<b>40 </b>Then the priest shall command that they take away the stones in which the plague <i>is,</i> and they shall cast them into an unclean place without the city:

<b>41 </b>And he shall cause the house to be scraped within round about, and they shall pour out the dust that they scrape off without the city into an unclean place:

<b>42 </b>And they shall take other stones, and put <i>them</i> in the place of those stones; and he shall take other mortar, and shall plaster the house.

<b>43 </b>And if the plague come again, and break out in the house, after that he hath taken away the stones, and after he hath scraped the house, and after it is plastered;

<b>44 </b>Then the priest shall come and look, and, behold, <i>if</i> the plague be spread in the house, it <i>is</i> a fretting leprosy in the house: it <i>is</i> unclean.

<b>45 </b>And he shall break down the house, the stones of it, and the timber thereof, and all the mortar of the house; and he shall carry <i>them</i> forth out of the city into an unclean place.

<b>46 </b>Moreover he that goeth into the house all the while that it is shut up shall be unclean until the even.

<b>47 </b>And he that lieth in the house shall wash his clothes; and he that eateth in the house shall wash his clothes.

<b>48 </b>And if the priest shall come in, and look <i>upon it,</i> and, behold, the plague hath not spread in the house, after the house was plastered: then the priest shall pronounce the house clean, because the plague is healed.

<b>49 </b>And he shall take to cleanse the house two birds, and cedar wood, and scarlet, and hyssop:

<b>50 </b>And he shall kill the one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water:

<b>51 </b>And he shall take the cedar wood, and the hyssop, and the scarlet, and the living bird, and dip them in the blood of the slain bird, and in the running water, and sprinkle the house seven times:

<b>52 </b>And he shall cleanse the house with the blood of the bird, and with the running water, and with the living bird, and with the cedar wood, and with the hyssop, and with the scarlet:

<b>53 </b>But he shall let go the living bird out of the city into the open fields, and make an atonement for the house: and it shall be clean.

<b>54 </b>This <i>is</i> the law for all manner of plague of leprosy, and scall,

<b>55 </b>And for the leprosy of a garment, and of a house,

<b>56 </b>And for a rising, and for a scab, and for a bright spot:

<b>57 </b>To teach when <i>it is</i> unclean, and when <i>it is</i> clean: this <i>is</i> the law of leprosy.


--------------------

CHAPTER 15

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses and to Aaron, saying,

<b>2 </b>Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When any man hath a running issue out of his flesh, <i>because of</i> his issue he <i>is</i> unclean.

<b>3 </b>And this shall be his uncleanness in his issue: whether his flesh run with his issue, or his flesh be stopped from his issue, it <i>is</i> his uncleanness.

<b>4 </b>Every bed, whereon he lieth that hath the issue, is unclean: and every thing, whereon he sitteth, shall be unclean.

<b>5 </b>And whosoever toucheth his bed shall wash his clothes, and bathe <i>himself</i> in water, and be unclean until the even.

<b>6 </b>And he that sitteth on <i>any</i> thing whereon he sat that hath the issue shall wash his clothes, and bathe <i>himself</i> in water, and be unclean until the even.

<b>7 </b>And he that toucheth the flesh of him that hath the issue shall wash his clothes, and bathe <i>himself</i> in water, and be unclean until the even.

<b>8 </b>And if he that hath the issue spit upon him that is clean; then he shall wash his clothes, and bathe <i>himself</i> in water, and be unclean until the even.

<b>9 </b>And what saddle soever he rideth upon that hath the issue shall be unclean.

<b>10 </b>And whosoever toucheth any thing that was under him shall be unclean until the even: and he that beareth <i>any of</i> those things shall wash his clothes, and bathe <i>himself</i> in water, and be unclean until the even.

<b>11 </b>And whomsoever he toucheth that hath the issue, and hath not rinsed his hands in water, he shall wash his clothes, and bathe <i>himself</i> in water, and be unclean until the even.

<b>12 </b>And the vessel of earth, that he toucheth which hath the issue, shall be broken: and every vessel of wood shall be rinsed in water.

<b>13 </b>And when he that hath an issue is cleansed of his issue; then he shall number to himself seven days for his cleansing, and wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in running water, and shall be clean.

<b>14 </b>And on the eighth day he shall take to him two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, and come before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and give them unto the priest:

<b>15 </b>And the priest shall offer them, the one <i>for</i> a sin offering, and the other <i>for</i> a burnt offering; and the priest shall make an atonement for him before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> for his issue.

<b>16 </b>And if any man’s seed of copulation go out from him, then he shall wash all his flesh in water, and be unclean until the even.

<b>17 </b>And every garment, and every skin, whereon is the seed of copulation, shall be washed with water, and be unclean until the even.

<b>18 </b>The woman also with whom man shall lie <i>with</i> seed of copulation, they shall <i>both</i> bathe <i>themselves</i> in water, and be unclean until the even.

<b>19 </b>¶ And if a woman have an issue, <i>and</i> her issue in her flesh be blood, she shall be put apart seven days: and whosoever toucheth her shall be unclean until the even.

<b>20 </b>And every thing that she lieth upon in her separation shall be unclean: every thing also that she sitteth upon shall be unclean.

<b>21 </b>And whosoever toucheth her bed shall wash his clothes, and bathe <i>himself</i> in water, and be unclean until the even.

<b>22 </b>And whosoever toucheth any thing that she sat upon shall wash his clothes, and bathe <i>himself</i> in water, and be unclean until the even.

<b>23 </b>And if it <i>be</i> on <i>her</i> bed, or on any thing whereon she sitteth, when he toucheth it, he shall be unclean until the even.

<b>24 </b>And if any man lie with her at all, and her flowers be upon him, he shall be unclean seven days; and all the bed whereon he lieth shall be unclean.

<b>25 </b>And if a woman have an issue of her blood many days out of the time of her separation, or if it run beyond the time of her separation; all the days of the issue of her uncleanness shall be as the days of her separation: she <i>shall be</i> unclean.

<b>26 </b>Every bed whereon she lieth all the days of her issue shall be unto her as the bed of her separation: and whatsoever she sitteth upon shall be unclean, as the uncleanness of her separation.

<b>27 </b>And whosoever toucheth those things shall be unclean, and shall wash his clothes, and bathe <i>himself</i> in water, and be unclean until the even.

<b>28 </b>But if she be cleansed of her issue, then she shall number to herself seven days, and after that she shall be clean.

<b>29 </b>And on the eighth day she shall take unto her two turtles, or two young pigeons, and bring them unto the priest, to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

<b>30 </b>And the priest shall offer the one <i>for</i> a sin offering, and the other <i>for</i> a burnt offering; and the priest shall make an atonement for her before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> for the issue of her uncleanness.

<b>31 </b>Thus shall ye separate the children of Israel from their uncleanness; that they die not in their uncleanness, when they defile my tabernacle that <i>is</i> among them.

<b>32 </b>This <i>is</i> the law of him that hath an issue, and <i>of him</i> whose seed goeth from him, and is defiled therewith;

<b>33 </b>And of her that is sick of her flowers, and of him that hath an issue, of the man, and of the woman, and of him that lieth with her that is unclean.


--------------------

CHAPTER 16

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses after the death of the two sons of Aaron, when they offered before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and died;

<b>2 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Moses, Speak unto Aaron thy brother, that he come not at all times into the holy <i>place</i> within the veil before the mercy seat, which <i>is</i> upon the ark; that he die not: for I will appear in the cloud upon the mercy seat.

<b>3 </b>Thus shall Aaron come into the holy <i>place:</i> with a young bullock for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering.

<b>4 </b>He shall put on the holy linen coat, and he shall have the linen breeches upon his flesh, and shall be girded with a linen girdle, and with the linen mitre shall he be attired: these <i>are</i> holy garments; therefore shall he wash his flesh in water, and <i>so</i> put them on.

<b>5 </b>And he shall take of the congregation of the children of Israel two kids of the goats for a sin offering, and one ram for a burnt offering.

<b>6 </b>And Aaron shall offer his bullock of the sin offering, which <i>is</i> for himself, and make an atonement for himself, and for his house.

<b>7 </b>And he shall take the two goats, and present them before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>at</i> the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

<b>8 </b>And Aaron shall cast lots upon the two goats; one lot for the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and the other lot for the scapegoat.

<b>9 </b>And Aaron shall bring the goat upon which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s lot fell, and offer him <i>for</i> a sin offering.

<b>10 </b>But the goat, on which the lot fell to be the scapegoat, shall be presented alive before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, to make an atonement with him, <i>and</i> to let him go for a scapegoat into the wilderness.

<b>11 </b>And Aaron shall bring the bullock of the sin offering, which <i>is</i> for himself, and shall make an atonement for himself, and for his house, and shall kill the bullock of the sin offering which <i>is</i> for himself:

<b>12 </b>And he shall take a censer full of burning coals of fire from off the altar before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and his hands full of sweet incense beaten small, and bring <i>it</i> within the veil:

<b>13 </b>And he shall put the incense upon the fire before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, that the cloud of the incense may cover the mercy seat that <i>is</i> upon the testimony, that he die not:

<b>14 </b>And he shall take of the blood of the bullock, and sprinkle <i>it</i> with his finger upon the mercy seat eastward; and before the mercy seat shall he sprinkle of the blood with his finger seven times.

<b>15 </b>¶ Then shall he kill the goat of the sin offering, that <i>is</i> for the people, and bring his blood within the veil, and do with that blood as he did with the blood of the bullock, and sprinkle it upon the mercy seat, and before the mercy seat:

<b>16 </b>And he shall make an atonement for the holy <i>place,</i> because of the uncleanness of the children of Israel, and because of their transgressions in all their sins: and so shall he do for the tabernacle of the congregation, that remaineth among them in the midst of their uncleanness.

<b>17 </b>And there shall be no man in the tabernacle of the congregation when he goeth in to make an atonement in the holy <i>place,</i> until he come out, and have made an atonement for himself, and for his household, and for all the congregation of Israel.

<b>18 </b>And he shall go out unto the altar that <i>is</i> before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and make an atonement for it; and shall take of the blood of the bullock, and of the blood of the goat, and put <i>it</i> upon the horns of the altar round about.

<b>19 </b>And he shall sprinkle of the blood upon it with his finger seven times, and cleanse it, and hallow it from the uncleanness of the children of Israel.

<b>20 </b>¶ And when he hath made an end of reconciling the holy <i>place,</i> and the tabernacle of the congregation, and the altar, he shall bring the live goat:

<b>21 </b>And Aaron shall lay both his hands upon the head of the live goat, and confess over him all the iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their transgressions in all their sins, putting them upon the head of the goat, and shall send <i>him</i> away by the hand of a fit man into the wilderness:

<b>22 </b>And the goat shall bear upon him all their iniquities unto a land not inhabited: and he shall let go the goat in the wilderness.

<b>23 </b>And Aaron shall come into the tabernacle of the congregation, and shall put off the linen garments, which he put on when he went into the holy <i>place,</i> and shall leave them there:

<b>24 </b>And he shall wash his flesh with water in the holy place, and put on his garments, and come forth, and offer his burnt offering, and the burnt offering of the people, and make an atonement for himself, and for the people.

<b>25 </b>And the fat of the sin offering shall he burn upon the altar.

<b>26 </b>And he that let go the goat for the scapegoat shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward come into the camp.

<b>27 </b>And the bullock <i>for</i> the sin offering, and the goat <i>for</i> the sin offering, whose blood was brought in to make atonement in the holy <i>place,</i> shall <i>one</i> carry forth without the camp; and they shall burn in the fire their skins, and their flesh, and their dung.

<b>28 </b>And he that burneth them shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp.

<b>29 </b>¶ And <i>this</i> shall be a statute for ever unto you: <i>that</i> in the seventh month, on the tenth <i>day</i> of the month, ye shall afflict your souls, and do no work at all, <i>whether it be</i> one of your own country, or a stranger that sojourneth among you:

<b>30 </b>For on that day shall <i>the priest</i> make an atonement for you, to cleanse you, <i>that</i> ye may be clean from all your sins before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>31 </b>It <i>shall be</i> a sabbath of rest unto you, and ye shall afflict your souls, by a statute for ever.

<b>32 </b>And the priest, whom he shall anoint, and whom he shall consecrate to minister in the priest’s office in his father’s stead, shall make the atonement, and shall put on the linen clothes, <i>even</i> the holy garments:

<b>33 </b>And he shall make an atonement for the holy sanctuary, and he shall make an atonement for the tabernacle of the congregation, and for the altar, and he shall make an atonement for the priests, and for all the people of the congregation.

<b>34 </b>And this shall be an everlasting statute unto you, to make an atonement for the children of Israel for all their sins once a year. And he did as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.


--------------------

CHAPTER 17

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>2 </b>Speak unto Aaron, and unto his sons, and unto all the children of Israel, and say unto them; This <i>is</i> the thing which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath commanded, saying,

<b>3 </b>What man soever <i>there be</i> of the house of Israel, that killeth an ox, or lamb, or goat, in the camp, or that killeth <i>it</i> out of the camp,

<b>4 </b>And bringeth it not unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, to offer an offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> before the tabernacle of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; blood shall be imputed unto that man; he hath shed blood; and that man shall be cut off from among his people:

<b>5 </b>To the end that the children of Israel may bring their sacrifices, which they offer in the open field, even that they may bring them unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, unto the priest, and offer them <i>for</i> peace offerings unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>6 </b>And the priest shall sprinkle the blood upon the altar of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>at</i> the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and burn the fat for a sweet savour unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>7 </b>And they shall no more offer their sacrifices unto devils, after whom they have gone a whoring. This shall be a statute for ever unto them throughout their generations.

<b>8 </b>¶ And thou shalt say unto them, Whatsoever man <i>there be</i> of the house of Israel, or of the strangers which sojourn among you, that offereth a burnt offering or sacrifice,

<b>9 </b>And bringeth it not unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, to offer it unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; even that man shall be cut off from among his people.

<b>10 </b>¶ And whatsoever man <i>there be</i> of the house of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among you, that eateth any manner of blood; I will even set my face against that soul that eateth blood, and will cut him off from among his people.

<b>11 </b>For the life of the flesh <i>is</i> in the blood: and I have given it to you upon the altar to make an atonement for your souls: for it <i>is</i> the blood <i>that</i> maketh an atonement for the soul.

<b>12 </b>Therefore I said unto the children of Israel, No soul of you shall eat blood, neither shall any stranger that sojourneth among you eat blood.

<b>13 </b>And whatsoever man <i>there be</i> of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among you, which hunteth and catcheth any beast or fowl that may be eaten; he shall even pour out the blood thereof, and cover it with dust.

<b>14 </b>For <i>it is</i> the life of all flesh; the blood of it <i>is</i> for the life thereof: therefore I said unto the children of Israel, Ye shall eat the blood of no manner of flesh: for the life of all flesh <i>is</i> the blood thereof: whosoever eateth it shall be cut off.

<b>15 </b>And every soul that eateth that which died <i>of itself,</i> or that which was torn <i>with beasts, whether it be</i> one of your own country, or a stranger, he shall both wash his clothes, and bathe <i>himself</i> in water, and be unclean until the even: then shall he be clean.

<b>16 </b>But if he wash <i>them</i> not, nor bathe his flesh; then he shall bear his iniquity.


--------------------

CHAPTER 18

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>2 </b>Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, I am the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God.

<b>3 </b>After the doings of the land of Egypt, wherein ye dwelt, shall ye not do: and after the doings of the land of Canaan, whither I bring you, shall ye not do: neither shall ye walk in their ordinances.

<b>4 </b>Ye shall do my judgments, and keep mine ordinances, to walk therein: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God.

<b>5 </b>Ye shall therefore keep my statutes, and my judgments: which if a man do, he shall live in them: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>6 </b>¶ None of you shall approach to any that is near of kin to him, to uncover <i>their</i> nakedness: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>7 </b>The nakedness of thy father, or the nakedness of thy mother, shalt thou not uncover: she <i>is</i> thy mother; thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.

<b>8 </b>The nakedness of thy father’s wife shalt thou not uncover: it <i>is</i> thy father’s nakedness.

<b>9 </b>The nakedness of thy sister, the daughter of thy father, or daughter of thy mother, <i>whether she be</i> born at home, or born abroad, <i>even</i> their nakedness thou shalt not uncover.

<b>10 </b>The nakedness of thy son’s daughter, or of thy daughter’s daughter, <i>even</i> their nakedness thou shalt not uncover: for theirs <i>is</i> thine own nakedness.

<b>11 </b>The nakedness of thy father’s wife’s daughter, begotten of thy father, she <i>is</i> thy sister, thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.

<b>12 </b>Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy father’s sister: she <i>is</i> thy father’s near kinswoman.

<b>13 </b>Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy mother’s sister: for she <i>is</i> thy mother’s near kinswoman.

<b>14 </b>Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy father’s brother, thou shalt not approach to his wife: she <i>is</i> thine aunt.

<b>15 </b>Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy daughter in law: she <i>is</i> thy son’s wife; thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.

<b>16 </b>Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy brother’s wife: it <i>is</i> thy brother’s nakedness.

<b>17 </b>Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter, neither shalt thou take her son’s daughter, or her daughter’s daughter, to uncover her nakedness; <i>for</i> they <i>are</i> her near kinswomen: it <i>is</i> wickedness.

<b>18 </b>Neither shalt thou take a wife to her sister, to vex <i>her,</i> to uncover her nakedness, beside the other in her life <i>time.</i>

<b>19 </b>Also thou shalt not approach unto a woman to uncover her nakedness, as long as she is put apart for her uncleanness.

<b>20 </b>Moreover thou shalt not lie carnally with thy neighbour’s wife, to defile thyself with her.

<b>21 </b>And thou shalt not let any of thy seed pass through <i>the fire</i> to Molech, neither shalt thou profane the name of thy God: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>22 </b>Thou shalt not lie with mankind, as with womankind: it <i>is</i> abomination.

<b>23 </b>Neither shalt thou lie with any beast to defile thyself therewith: neither shall any woman stand before a beast to lie down thereto: it <i>is</i> confusion.

<b>24 </b>Defile not ye yourselves in any of these things: for in all these the nations are defiled which I cast out before you:

<b>25 </b>And the land is defiled: therefore I do visit the iniquity thereof upon it, and the land itself vomiteth out her inhabitants.

<b>26 </b>Ye shall therefore keep my statutes and my judgments, and shall not commit <i>any</i> of these abominations; <i>neither</i> any of your own nation, nor any stranger that sojourneth among you:

<b>27 </b>(For all these abominations have the men of the land done, which <i>were</i> before you, and the land is defiled;)

<b>28 </b>That the land spue not you out also, when ye defile it, as it spued out the nations that <i>were</i> before you.

<b>29 </b>For whosoever shall commit any of these abominations, even the souls that commit <i>them</i> shall be cut off from among their people.

<b>30 </b>Therefore shall ye keep mine ordinance, that <i>ye</i> commit not <i>any one</i> of these abominable customs, which were committed before you, and that ye defile not yourselves therein: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God.


--------------------

CHAPTER 19

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>2 </b>Speak unto all the congregation of the children of Israel, and say unto them, Ye shall be holy: for I the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God <i>am</i> holy.

<b>3 </b>¶ Ye shall fear every man his mother, and his father, and keep my sabbaths: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God.

<b>4 </b>¶ Turn ye not unto idols, nor make to yourselves molten gods: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God.

<b>5 </b>¶ And if ye offer a sacrifice of peace offerings unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, ye shall offer it at your own will.

<b>6 </b>It shall be eaten the same day ye offer it, and on the morrow: and if ought remain until the third day, it shall be burnt in the fire.

<b>7 </b>And if it be eaten at all on the third day, it <i>is</i> abominable; it shall not be accepted.

<b>8 </b>Therefore <i>every one</i> that eateth it shall bear his iniquity, because he hath profaned the hallowed thing of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: and that soul shall be cut off from among his people.

<b>9 </b>¶ And when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not wholly reap the corners of thy field, neither shalt thou gather the gleanings of thy harvest.

<b>10 </b>And thou shalt not glean thy vineyard, neither shalt thou gather <i>every</i> grape of thy vineyard; thou shalt leave them for the poor and stranger: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God.

<b>11 </b>¶ Ye shall not steal, neither deal falsely, neither lie one to another.

<b>12 </b>¶ And ye shall not swear by my name falsely, neither shalt thou profane the name of thy God: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>13 </b>¶ Thou shalt not defraud thy neighbour, neither rob <i>him:</i> the wages of him that is hired shall not abide with thee all night until the morning.

<b>14 </b>¶ Thou shalt not curse the deaf, nor put a stumblingblock before the blind, but shalt fear thy God: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>15 </b>¶ Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment: thou shalt not respect the person of the poor, nor honour the person of the mighty: <i>but</i> in righteousness shalt thou judge thy neighbour.

<b>16 </b>¶ Thou shalt not go up and down <i>as</i> a talebearer among thy people: neither shalt thou stand against the blood of thy neighbour: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>17 </b>¶ Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thine heart: thou shalt in any wise rebuke thy neighbour, and not suffer sin upon him.

<b>18 </b>¶ Thou shalt not avenge, nor bear any grudge against the children of thy people, but thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>19 </b>¶ Ye shall keep my statutes. Thou shalt not let thy cattle gender with a diverse kind: thou shalt not sow thy field with mingled seed: neither shall a garment mingled of linen and woollen come upon thee.

<b>20 </b>¶ And whosoever lieth carnally with a woman, that <i>is</i> a bondmaid, betrothed to an husband, and not at all redeemed, nor freedom given her; she shall be scourged; they shall not be put to death, because she was not free.

<b>21 </b>And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, <i>even</i> a ram for a trespass offering.

<b>22 </b>And the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> for his sin which he hath done: and the sin which he hath done shall be forgiven him.

<b>23 </b>¶ And when ye shall come into the land, and shall have planted all manner of trees for food, then ye shall count the fruit thereof as uncircumcised: three years shall it be as uncircumcised unto you: it shall not be eaten of.

<b>24 </b>But in the fourth year all the fruit thereof shall be holy to praise the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>withal.</i>

<b>25 </b>And in the fifth year shall ye eat of the fruit thereof, that it may yield unto you the increase thereof: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God.

<b>26 </b>¶ Ye shall not eat <i>any thing</i> with the blood: neither shall ye use enchantment, nor observe times.

<b>27 </b>Ye shall not round the corners of your heads, neither shalt thou mar the corners of thy beard.

<b>28 </b>Ye shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor print any marks upon you: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>29 </b>¶ Do not prostitute thy daughter, to cause her to be a whore; lest the land fall to whoredom, and the land become full of wickedness.

<b>30 </b>¶ Ye shall keep my sabbaths, and reverence my sanctuary: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>31 </b>¶ Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God.

<b>32 </b>¶ Thou shalt rise up before the hoary head, and honour the face of the old man, and fear thy God: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>33 </b>¶ And if a stranger sojourn with thee in your land, ye shall not vex him.

<b>34 </b><i>But</i> the stranger that dwelleth with you shall be unto you as one born among you, and thou shalt love him as thyself; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God.

<b>35 </b>¶ Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment, in meteyard, in weight, or in measure.

<b>36 </b>Just balances, just weights, a just ephah, and a just hin, shall ye have: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt.

<b>37 </b>Therefore shall ye observe all my statutes, and all my judgments, and do them: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.


--------------------

CHAPTER 20

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>2 </b>Again, thou shalt say to the children of Israel, Whosoever <i>he be</i> of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn in Israel, that giveth <i>any</i> of his seed unto Molech; he shall surely be put to death: the people of the land shall stone him with stones.

<b>3 </b>And I will set my face against that man, and will cut him off from among his people; because he hath given of his seed unto Molech, to defile my sanctuary, and to profane my holy name.

<b>4 </b>And if the people of the land do any ways hide their eyes from the man, when he giveth of his seed unto Molech, and kill him not:

<b>5 </b>Then I will set my face against that man, and against his family, and will cut him off, and all that go a whoring after him, to commit whoredom with Molech, from among their people.

<b>6 </b>¶ And the soul that turneth after such as have familiar spirits, and after wizards, to go a whoring after them, I will even set my face against that soul, and will cut him off from among his people.

<b>7 </b>¶ Sanctify yourselves therefore, and be ye holy: for I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God.

<b>8 </b>And ye shall keep my statutes, and do them: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> which sanctify you.

<b>9 </b>¶ For every one that curseth his father or his mother shall be surely put to death: he hath cursed his father or his mother; his blood <i>shall be</i> upon him.

<b>10 </b>¶ And the man that committeth adultery with <i>another</i> man’s wife, <i>even he</i> that committeth adultery with his neighbour’s wife, the adulterer and the adulteress shall surely be put to death.

<b>11 </b>And the man that lieth with his father’s wife hath uncovered his father’s nakedness: both of them shall surely be put to death; their blood <i>shall be</i> upon them.

<b>12 </b>And if a man lie with his daughter in law, both of them shall surely be put to death: they have wrought confusion; their blood <i>shall be</i> upon them.

<b>13 </b>If a man also lie with mankind, as he lieth with a woman, both of them have committed an abomination: they shall surely be put to death; their blood <i>shall be</i> upon them.

<b>14 </b>And if a man take a wife and her mother, it <i>is</i> wickedness: they shall be burnt with fire, both he and they; that there be no wickedness among you.

<b>15 </b>And if a man lie with a beast, he shall surely be put to death: and ye shall slay the beast.

<b>16 </b>And if a woman approach unto any beast, and lie down thereto, thou shalt kill the woman, and the beast: they shall surely be put to death; their blood <i>shall be</i> upon them.

<b>17 </b>And if a man shall take his sister, his father’s daughter, or his mother’s daughter, and see her nakedness, and she see his nakedness; it <i>is</i> a wicked thing; and they shall be cut off in the sight of their people: he hath uncovered his sister’s nakedness; he shall bear his iniquity.

<b>18 </b>And if a man shall lie with a woman having her sickness, and shall uncover her nakedness; he hath discovered her fountain, and she hath uncovered the fountain of her blood: and both of them shall be cut off from among their people.

<b>19 </b>And thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy mother’s sister, nor of thy father’s sister: for he uncovereth his near kin: they shall bear their iniquity.

<b>20 </b>And if a man shall lie with his uncle’s wife, he hath uncovered his uncle’s nakedness: they shall bear their sin; they shall die childless.

<b>21 </b>And if a man shall take his brother’s wife, it <i>is</i> an unclean thing: he hath uncovered his brother’s nakedness; they shall be childless.

<b>22 </b>¶ Ye shall therefore keep all my statutes, and all my judgments, and do them: that the land, whither I bring you to dwell therein, spue you not out.

<b>23 </b>And ye shall not walk in the manners of the nation, which I cast out before you: for they committed all these things, and therefore I abhorred them.

<b>24 </b>But I have said unto you, Ye shall inherit their land, and I will give it unto you to possess it, a land that floweth with milk and honey: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God, which have separated you from <i>other</i> people.

<b>25 </b>Ye shall therefore put difference between clean beasts and unclean, and between unclean fowls and clean: and ye shall not make your souls abominable by beast, or by fowl, or by any manner of living thing that creepeth on the ground, which I have separated from you as unclean.

<b>26 </b>And ye shall be holy unto me: for I the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>am</i> holy, and have severed you from <i>other</i> people, that ye should be mine.

<b>27 </b>¶ A man also or woman that hath a familiar spirit, or that is a wizard, shall surely be put to death: they shall stone them with stones: their blood <i>shall be</i> upon them.


--------------------

CHAPTER 21

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Moses, Speak unto the priests the sons of Aaron, and say unto them, There shall none be defiled for the dead among his people:

<b>2 </b>But for his kin, that is near unto him, <i>that is,</i> for his mother, and for his father, and for his son, and for his daughter, and for his brother,

<b>3 </b>And for his sister a virgin, that is nigh unto him, which hath had no husband; for her may he be defiled.

<b>4 </b><i>But</i> he shall not defile himself, <i>being</i> a chief man among his people, to profane himself.

<b>5 </b>They shall not make baldness upon their head, neither shall they shave off the corner of their beard, nor make any cuttings in their flesh.

<b>6 </b>They shall be holy unto their God, and not profane the name of their God: for the offerings of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> made by fire, <i>and</i> the bread of their God, they do offer: therefore they shall be holy.

<b>7 </b>They shall not take a wife <i>that is</i> a whore, or profane; neither shall they take a woman put away from her husband: for he <i>is</i> holy unto his God.

<b>8 </b>Thou shalt sanctify him therefore; for he offereth the bread of thy God: he shall be holy unto thee: for I the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, which sanctify you, <i>am</i> holy.

<b>9 </b>¶ And the daughter of any priest, if she profane herself by playing the whore, she profaneth her father: she shall be burnt with fire.

<b>10 </b>And <i>he that is</i> the high priest among his brethren, upon whose head the anointing oil was poured, and that is consecrated to put on the garments, shall not uncover his head, nor rend his clothes;

<b>11 </b>Neither shall he go in to any dead body, nor defile himself for his father, or for his mother;

<b>12 </b>Neither shall he go out of the sanctuary, nor profane the sanctuary of his God; for the crown of the anointing oil of his God <i>is</i> upon him: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>13 </b>And he shall take a wife in her virginity.

<b>14 </b>A widow, or a divorced woman, or profane, <i>or</i> an harlot, these shall he not take: but he shall take a virgin of his own people to wife.

<b>15 </b>Neither shall he profane his seed among his people: for I the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> do sanctify him.

<b>16 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>17 </b>Speak unto Aaron, saying, Whosoever <i>he be</i> of thy seed in their generations that hath <i>any</i> blemish, let him not approach to offer the bread of his God.

<b>18 </b>For whatsoever man <i>he be</i> that hath a blemish, he shall not approach: a blind man, or a lame, or he that hath a flat nose, or any thing superfluous,

<b>19 </b>Or a man that is brokenfooted, or brokenhanded,

<b>20 </b>Or crookbackt, or a dwarf, or that hath a blemish in his eye, or be scurvy, or scabbed, or hath his stones broken;

<b>21 </b>No man that hath a blemish of the seed of Aaron the priest shall come nigh to offer the offerings of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> made by fire: he hath a blemish; he shall not come nigh to offer the bread of his God.

<b>22 </b>He shall eat the bread of his God, <i>both</i> of the most holy, and of the holy.

<b>23 </b>Only he shall not go in unto the veil, nor come nigh unto the altar, because he hath a blemish; that he profane not my sanctuaries: for I the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> do sanctify them.

<b>24 </b>And Moses told <i>it</i> unto Aaron, and to his sons, and unto all the children of Israel.


--------------------

CHAPTER 22

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>2 </b>Speak unto Aaron and to his sons, that they separate themselves from the holy things of the children of Israel, and that they profane not my holy name <i>in those things</i> which they hallow unto me: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>3 </b>Say unto them, Whosoever <i>he be</i> of all your seed among your generations, that goeth unto the holy things, which the children of Israel hallow unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, having his uncleanness upon him, that soul shall be cut off from my presence: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>4 </b>What man soever of the seed of Aaron <i>is</i> a leper, or hath a running issue; he shall not eat of the holy things, until he be clean. And whoso toucheth any thing <i>that is</i> unclean <i>by</i> the dead, or a man whose seed goeth from him;

<b>5 </b>Or whosoever toucheth any creeping thing, whereby he may be made unclean, or a man of whom he may take uncleanness, whatsoever uncleanness he hath;

<b>6 </b>The soul which hath touched any such shall be unclean until even, and shall not eat of the holy things, unless he wash his flesh with water.

<b>7 </b>And when the sun is down, he shall be clean, and shall afterward eat of the holy things; because it <i>is</i> his food.

<b>8 </b>That which dieth of itself, or is torn <i>with beasts,</i> he shall not eat to defile himself therewith: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>9 </b>They shall therefore keep mine ordinance, lest they bear sin for it, and die therefore, if they profane it: I the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> do sanctify them.

<b>10 </b>There shall no stranger eat <i>of</i> the holy thing: a sojourner of the priest, or an hired servant, shall not eat <i>of</i> the holy thing.

<b>11 </b>But if the priest buy <i>any</i> soul with his money, he shall eat of it, and he that is born in his house: they shall eat of his meat.

<b>12 </b>If the priest’s daughter also be <i>married</i> unto a stranger, she may not eat of an offering of the holy things.

<b>13 </b>But if the priest’s daughter be a widow, or divorced, and have no child, and is returned unto her father’s house, as in her youth, she shall eat of her father’s meat: but there shall no stranger eat thereof.

<b>14 </b>¶ And if a man eat <i>of</i> the holy thing unwittingly, then he shall put the fifth <i>part</i> thereof unto it, and shall give <i>it</i> unto the priest with the holy thing.

<b>15 </b>And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, which they offer unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>;

<b>16 </b>Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> do sanctify them.

<b>17 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>18 </b>Speak unto Aaron, and to his sons, and unto all the children of Israel, and say unto them, Whatsoever <i>he be</i> of the house of Israel, or of the strangers in Israel, that will offer his oblation for all his vows, and for all his freewill offerings, which they will offer unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> for a burnt offering;

<b>19 </b><i>Ye shall offer</i> at your own will a male without blemish, of the beeves, of the sheep, or of the goats.

<b>20 </b><i>But</i> whatsoever hath a blemish, <i>that</i> shall ye not offer: for it shall not be acceptable for you.

<b>21 </b>And whosoever offereth a sacrifice of peace offerings unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> to accomplish <i>his</i> vow, or a freewill offering in beeves or sheep, it shall be perfect to be accepted; there shall be no blemish therein.

<b>22 </b>Blind, or broken, or maimed, or having a wen, or scurvy, or scabbed, ye shall not offer these unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, nor make an offering by fire of them upon the altar unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>23 </b>Either a bullock or a lamb that hath any thing superfluous or lacking in his parts, that mayest thou offer <i>for</i> a freewill offering; but for a vow it shall not be accepted.

<b>24 </b>Ye shall not offer unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> that which is bruised, or crushed, or broken, or cut; neither shall ye make <i>any offering thereof</i> in your land.

<b>25 </b>Neither from a stranger’s hand shall ye offer the bread of your God of any of these; because their corruption <i>is</i> in them, <i>and</i> blemishes <i>be</i> in them: they shall not be accepted for you.

<b>26 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>27 </b>When a bullock, or a sheep, or a goat, is brought forth, then it shall be seven days under the dam; and from the eighth day and thenceforth it shall be accepted for an offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>28 </b>And <i>whether it be</i> cow or ewe, ye shall not kill it and her young both in one day.

<b>29 </b>And when ye will offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, offer <i>it</i> at your own will.

<b>30 </b>On the same day it shall be eaten up; ye shall leave none of it until the morrow: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>31 </b>Therefore shall ye keep my commandments, and do them: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>32 </b>Neither shall ye profane my holy name; but I will be hallowed among the children of Israel: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> which hallow you,

<b>33 </b>That brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.


--------------------

CHAPTER 23

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>2 </b>Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, <i>Concerning</i> the feasts of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, which ye shall proclaim <i>to be</i> holy convocations, <i>even</i> these <i>are</i> my feasts.

<b>3 </b>Six days shall work be done: but the seventh day <i>is</i> the sabbath of rest, an holy convocation; ye shall do no work <i>therein:</i> it <i>is</i> the sabbath of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in all your dwellings.

<b>4 </b>¶ These <i>are</i> the feasts of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, <i>even</i> holy convocations, which ye shall proclaim in their seasons.

<b>5 </b>In the fourteenth <i>day</i> of the first month at even <i>is</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s passover.

<b>6 </b>And on the fifteenth day of the same month <i>is</i> the feast of unleavened bread unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: seven days ye must eat unleavened bread.

<b>7 </b>In the first day ye shall have an holy convocation: ye shall do no servile work therein.

<b>8 </b>But ye shall offer an offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> seven days: in the seventh day <i>is</i> an holy convocation: ye shall do no servile work <i>therein.</i>

<b>9 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>10 </b>Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye be come into the land which I give unto you, and shall reap the harvest thereof, then ye shall bring a sheaf of the firstfruits of your harvest unto the priest:

<b>11 </b>And he shall wave the sheaf before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, to be accepted for you: on the morrow after the sabbath the priest shall wave it.

<b>12 </b>And ye shall offer that day when ye wave the sheaf an he lamb without blemish of the first year for a burnt offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>13 </b>And the meat offering thereof <i>shall be</i> two tenth deals of fine flour mingled with oil, an offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>for</i> a sweet savour: and the drink offering thereof <i>shall be</i> of wine, the fourth <i>part</i> of an hin.

<b>14 </b>And ye shall eat neither bread, nor parched corn, nor green ears, until the selfsame day that ye have brought an offering unto your God: <i>it shall be</i> a statute for ever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

<b>15 </b>¶ And ye shall count unto you from the morrow after the sabbath, from the day that ye brought the sheaf of the wave offering; seven sabbaths shall be complete:

<b>16 </b>Even unto the morrow after the seventh sabbath shall ye number fifty days; and ye shall offer a new meat offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>17 </b>Ye shall bring out of your habitations two wave loaves of two tenth deals: they shall be of fine flour; they shall be baken with leaven; <i>they are</i> the firstfruits unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>18 </b>And ye shall offer with the bread seven lambs without blemish of the first year, and one young bullock, and two rams: they shall be <i>for</i> a burnt offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, with their meat offering, and their drink offerings, <i>even</i> an offering made by fire, of sweet savour unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>19 </b>Then ye shall sacrifice one kid of the goats for a sin offering, and two lambs of the first year for a sacrifice of peace offerings.

<b>20 </b>And the priest shall wave them with the bread of the firstfruits <i>for</i> a wave offering before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, with the two lambs: they shall be holy to the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> for the priest.

<b>21 </b>And ye shall proclaim on the selfsame day, <i>that</i> it may be an holy convocation unto you: ye shall do no servile work <i>therein: it shall be</i> a statute for ever in all your dwellings throughout your generations.

<b>22 </b>¶ And when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not make clean riddance of the corners of thy field when thou reapest, neither shalt thou gather any gleaning of thy harvest: thou shalt leave them unto the poor, and to the stranger: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God.

<b>23 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>24 </b>Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, In the seventh month, in the first <i>day</i> of the month, shall ye have a sabbath, a memorial of blowing of trumpets, an holy convocation.

<b>25 </b>Ye shall do no servile work <i>therein:</i> but ye shall offer an offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>26 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>27 </b>Also on the tenth <i>day</i> of this seventh month <i>there shall be</i> a day of atonement: it shall be an holy convocation unto you; and ye shall afflict your souls, and offer an offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>28 </b>And ye shall do no work in that same day: for it <i>is</i> a day of atonement, to make an atonement for you before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God.

<b>29 </b>For whatsoever soul <i>it be</i> that shall not be afflicted in that same day, he shall be cut off from among his people.

<b>30 </b>And whatsoever soul <i>it be</i> that doeth any work in that same day, the same soul will I destroy from among his people.

<b>31 </b>Ye shall do no manner of work: <i>it shall be</i> a statute for ever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

<b>32 </b>It <i>shall be</i> unto you a sabbath of rest, and ye shall afflict your souls: in the ninth <i>day</i> of the month at even, from even unto even, shall ye celebrate your sabbath.

<b>33 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>34 </b>Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, The fifteenth day of this seventh month <i>shall be</i> the feast of tabernacles <i>for</i> seven days unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>35 </b>On the first day <i>shall be</i> an holy convocation: ye shall do no servile work <i>therein.</i>

<b>36 </b>Seven days ye shall offer an offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: on the eighth day shall be an holy convocation unto you; and ye shall offer an offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: it <i>is</i> a solemn assembly; <i>and</i> ye shall do no servile work <i>therein.</i>

<b>37 </b>These <i>are</i> the feasts of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, which ye shall proclaim <i>to be</i> holy convocations, to offer an offering made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, a burnt offering, and a meat offering, a sacrifice, and drink offerings, every thing upon his day:

<b>38 </b>Beside the sabbaths of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and beside your gifts, and beside all your vows, and beside all your freewill offerings, which ye give unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>39 </b>Also in the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when ye have gathered in the fruit of the land, ye shall keep a feast unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> seven days: on the first day <i>shall be</i> a sabbath, and on the eighth day <i>shall be</i> a sabbath.

<b>40 </b>And ye shall take you on the first day the boughs of goodly trees, branches of palm trees, and the boughs of thick trees, and willows of the brook; and ye shall rejoice before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God seven days.

<b>41 </b>And ye shall keep it a feast unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> seven days in the year. <i>It shall be</i> a statute for ever in your generations: ye shall celebrate it in the seventh month.

<b>42 </b>Ye shall dwell in booths seven days; all that are Israelites born shall dwell in booths:

<b>43 </b>That your generations may know that I made the children of Israel to dwell in booths, when I brought them out of the land of Egypt: I <i>am</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God.

<b>44 </b>And Moses declared unto the children of Israel the feasts of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.


--------------------

CHAPTER 24

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>2 </b>Command the children of Israel, that they bring unto thee pure oil olive beaten for the light, to cause the lamps to burn continually.

<b>3 </b>Without the veil of the testimony, in the tabernacle of the congregation, shall Aaron order it from the evening unto the morning before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> continually: <i>it shall be</i> a statute for ever in your generations.

<b>4 </b>He shall order the lamps upon the pure candlestick before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> continually.

<b>5 </b>¶ And thou shalt take fine flour, and bake twelve cakes thereof: two tenth deals shall be in one cake.
