<b>26 </b>And the angel of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> went further, and stood in a narrow place, where <i>was</i> no way to turn either to the right hand or to the left.

<b>27 </b>And when the ass saw the angel of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, she fell down under Balaam: and Balaam’s anger was kindled, and he smote the ass with a staff.

<b>28 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> opened the mouth of the ass, and she said unto Balaam, What have I done unto thee, that thou hast smitten me these three times?

<b>29 </b>And Balaam said unto the ass, Because thou hast mocked me: I would there were a sword in mine hand, for now would I kill thee.

<b>30 </b>And the ass said unto Balaam, <i>Am</i> not I thine ass, upon which thou hast ridden ever since <i>I was</i> thine unto this day? was I ever wont to do so unto thee? And he said, Nay.

<b>31 </b>Then the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> opened the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the angel of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> standing in the way, and his sword drawn in his hand: and he bowed down his head, and fell flat on his face.

<b>32 </b>And the angel of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto him, Wherefore hast thou smitten thine ass these three times? behold, I went out to withstand thee, because <i>thy</i> way is perverse before me:

<b>33 </b>And the ass saw me, and turned from me these three times: unless she had turned from me, surely now also I had slain thee, and saved her alive.

<b>34 </b>And Balaam said unto the angel of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, I have sinned; for I knew not that thou stoodest in the way against me: now therefore, if it displease thee, I will get me back again.

<b>35 </b>And the angel of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Balaam, Go with the men: but only the word that I shall speak unto thee, that thou shalt speak. So Balaam went with the princes of Balak.

<b>36 </b>¶ And when Balak heard that Balaam was come, he went out to meet him unto a city of Moab, which <i>is</i> in the border of Arnon, which <i>is</i> in the utmost coast.

<b>37 </b>And Balak said unto Balaam, Did I not earnestly send unto thee to call thee? wherefore camest thou not unto me? am I not able indeed to promote thee to honour?

<b>38 </b>And Balaam said unto Balak, Lo, I am come unto thee: have I now any power at all to say any thing? the word that God putteth in my mouth, that shall I speak.

<b>39 </b>And Balaam went with Balak, and they came unto Kirjath-huzoth.

<b>40 </b>And Balak offered oxen and sheep, and sent to Balaam, and to the princes that <i>were</i> with him.

<b>41 </b>And it came to pass on the morrow, that Balak took Balaam, and brought him up into the high places of Baal, that thence he might see the utmost <i>part</i> of the people.


--------------------

CHAPTER 23

<b>1 </b>And Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven oxen and seven rams.

<b>2 </b>And Balak did as Balaam had spoken; and Balak and Balaam offered on <i>every</i> altar a bullock and a ram.

<b>3 </b>And Balaam said unto Balak, Stand by thy burnt offering, and I will go: peradventure the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> will come to meet me: and whatsoever he sheweth me I will tell thee. And he went to an high place.

<b>4 </b>And God met Balaam: and he said unto him, I have prepared seven altars, and I have offered upon <i>every</i> altar a bullock and a ram.

<b>5 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> put a word in Balaam’s mouth, and said, Return unto Balak, and thus thou shalt speak.

<b>6 </b>And he returned unto him, and, lo, he stood by his burnt sacrifice, he, and all the princes of Moab.

<b>7 </b>And he took up his parable, and said, Balak the king of Moab hath brought me from Aram, out of the mountains of the east, <i>saying,</i> Come, curse me Jacob, and come, defy Israel.

<b>8 </b>How shall I curse, whom God hath not cursed? or how shall I defy, <i>whom</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath not defied?

<b>9 </b>For from the top of the rocks I see him, and from the hills I behold him: lo, the people shall dwell alone, and shall not be reckoned among the nations.

<b>10 </b>Who can count the dust of Jacob, and the number of the fourth <i>part</i> of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous, and let my last end be like his!

<b>11 </b>And Balak said unto Balaam, What hast thou done unto me? I took thee to curse mine enemies, and, behold, thou hast blessed <i>them</i> altogether.

<b>12 </b>And he answered and said, Must I not take heed to speak that which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath put in my mouth?

<b>13 </b>And Balak said unto him, Come, I pray thee, with me unto another place, from whence thou mayest see them: thou shalt see but the utmost part of them, and shalt not see them all: and curse me them from thence.

<b>14 </b>¶ And he brought him into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered a bullock and a ram on <i>every</i> altar.

<b>15 </b>And he said unto Balak, Stand here by thy burnt offering, while I meet <i>the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span></i> yonder.

<b>16 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> met Balaam, and put a word in his mouth, and said, Go again unto Balak, and say thus.

<b>17 </b>And when he came to him, behold, he stood by his burnt offering, and the princes of Moab with him. And Balak said unto him, What hath the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spoken?

<b>18 </b>And he took up his parable, and said, Rise up, Balak, and hear; hearken unto me, thou son of Zippor:

<b>19 </b>God <i>is</i> not a man, that he should lie; neither the son of man, that he should repent: hath he said, and shall he not do <i>it?</i> or hath he spoken, and shall he not make it good?

<b>20 </b>Behold, I have received <i>commandment</i> to bless: and he hath blessed; and I cannot reverse it.

<b>21 </b>He hath not beheld iniquity in Jacob, neither hath he seen perverseness in Israel: the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> his God <i>is</i> with him, and the shout of a king <i>is</i> among them.

<b>22 </b>God brought them out of Egypt; he hath as it were the strength of an unicorn.

<b>23 </b>Surely <i>there is</i> no enchantment against Jacob, neither <i>is there</i> any divination against Israel: according to this time it shall be said of Jacob and of Israel, What hath God wrought!

<b>24 </b>Behold, the people shall rise up as a great lion, and lift up himself as a young lion: he shall not lie down until he eat <i>of</i> the prey, and drink the blood of the slain.

<b>25 </b>¶ And Balak said unto Balaam, Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all.

<b>26 </b>But Balaam answered and said unto Balak, Told not I thee, saying, All that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> speaketh, that I must do?

<b>27 </b>¶ And Balak said unto Balaam, Come, I pray thee, I will bring thee unto another place; peradventure it will please God that thou mayest curse me them from thence.

<b>28 </b>And Balak brought Balaam unto the top of Peor, that looketh toward Jeshimon.

<b>29 </b>And Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven bullocks and seven rams.

<b>30 </b>And Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered a bullock and a ram on <i>every</i> altar.


--------------------

CHAPTER 24

<b>1 </b>And when Balaam saw that it pleased the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> to bless Israel, he went not, as at other times, to seek for enchantments, but he set his face toward the wilderness.

<b>2 </b>And Balaam lifted up his eyes, and he saw Israel abiding <i>in his tents</i> according to their tribes; and the spirit of God came upon him.

<b>3 </b>And he took up his parable, and said, Balaam the son of Beor hath said, and the man whose eyes are open hath said:

<b>4 </b>He hath said, which heard the words of God, which saw the vision of the Almighty, falling <i>into a trance,</i> but having his eyes open:

<b>5 </b>How goodly are thy tents, O Jacob, <i>and</i> thy tabernacles, O Israel!

<b>6 </b>As the valleys are they spread forth, as gardens by the river’s side, as the trees of lign aloes which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath planted, <i>and</i> as cedar trees beside the waters.

<b>7 </b>He shall pour the water out of his buckets, and his seed <i>shall be</i> in many waters, and his king shall be higher than Agag, and his kingdom shall be exalted.

<b>8 </b>God brought him forth out of Egypt; he hath as it were the strength of an unicorn: he shall eat up the nations his enemies, and shall break their bones, and pierce <i>them</i> through with his arrows.

<b>9 </b>He couched, he lay down as a lion, and as a great lion: who shall stir him up? Blessed <i>is</i> he that blesseth thee, and cursed <i>is</i> he that curseth thee.

<b>10 </b>¶ And Balak’s anger was kindled against Balaam, and he smote his hands together: and Balak said unto Balaam, I called thee to curse mine enemies, and, behold, thou hast altogether blessed <i>them</i> these three times.

<b>11 </b>Therefore now flee thou to thy place: I thought to promote thee unto great honour; but, lo, the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath kept thee back from honour.

<b>12 </b>And Balaam said unto Balak, Spake I not also to thy messengers which thou sentest unto me, saying,

<b>13 </b>If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the commandment of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, to do <i>either</i> good or bad of mine own mind; <i>but</i> what the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> saith, that will I speak?

<b>14 </b>And now, behold, I go unto my people: come <i>therefore, and</i> I will advertise thee what this people shall do to thy people in the latter days.

<b>15 </b>¶ And he took up his parable, and said, Balaam the son of Beor hath said, and the man whose eyes are open hath said:

<b>16 </b>He hath said, which heard the words of God, and knew the knowledge of the most High, <i>which</i> saw the vision of the Almighty, falling <i>into a trance,</i> but having his eyes open:

<b>17 </b>I shall see him, but not now: I shall behold him, but not nigh: there shall come a Star out of Jacob, and a Sceptre shall rise out of Israel, and shall smite the corners of Moab, and destroy all the children of Sheth.

<b>18 </b>And Edom shall be a possession, Seir also shall be a possession for his enemies; and Israel shall do valiantly.

<b>19 </b>Out of Jacob shall come he that shall have dominion, and shall destroy him that remaineth of the city.

<b>20 </b>¶ And when he looked on Amalek, he took up his parable, and said, Amalek <i>was</i> the first of the nations; but his latter end <i>shall be</i> that he perish for ever.

<b>21 </b>And he looked on the Kenites, and took up his parable, and said, Strong is thy dwellingplace, and thou puttest thy nest in a rock.

<b>22 </b>Nevertheless the Kenite shall be wasted, until Asshur shall carry thee away captive.

<b>23 </b>And he took up his parable, and said, Alas, who shall live when God doeth this!

<b>24 </b>And ships <i>shall come</i> from the coast of Chittim, and shall afflict Asshur, and shall afflict Eber, and he also shall perish for ever.

<b>25 </b>And Balaam rose up, and went and returned to his place: and Balak also went his way.


--------------------

CHAPTER 25

<b>1 </b>And Israel abode in Shittim, and the people began to commit whoredom with the daughters of Moab.

<b>2 </b>And they called the people unto the sacrifices of their gods: and the people did eat, and bowed down to their gods.

<b>3 </b>And Israel joined himself unto Baal-peor: and the anger of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> was kindled against Israel.

<b>4 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Moses, Take all the heads of the people, and hang them up before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> against the sun, that the fierce anger of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> may be turned away from Israel.

<b>5 </b>And Moses said unto the judges of Israel, Slay ye every one his men that were joined unto Baal-peor.

<b>6 </b>¶ And, behold, one of the children of Israel came and brought unto his brethren a Midianitish woman in the sight of Moses, and in the sight of all the congregation of the children of Israel, who <i>were</i> weeping <i>before</i> the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

<b>7 </b>And when Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw <i>it,</i> he rose up from among the congregation, and took a javelin in his hand;

<b>8 </b>And he went after the man of Israel into the tent, and thrust both of them through, the man of Israel, and the woman through her belly. So the plague was stayed from the children of Israel.

<b>9 </b>And those that died in the plague were twenty and four thousand.

<b>10 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>11 </b>Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, hath turned my wrath away from the children of Israel, while he was zealous for my sake among them, that I consumed not the children of Israel in my jealousy.

<b>12 </b>Wherefore say, Behold, I give unto him my covenant of peace:

<b>13 </b>And he shall have it, and his seed after him, <i>even</i> the covenant of an everlasting priesthood; because he was zealous for his God, and made an atonement for the children of Israel.

<b>14 </b>Now the name of the Israelite that was slain, <i>even</i> that was slain with the Midianitish woman, <i>was</i> Zimri, the son of Salu, a prince of a chief house among the Simeonites.

<b>15 </b>And the name of the Midianitish woman that was slain <i>was</i> Cozbi, the daughter of Zur; he <i>was</i> head over a people, <i>and</i> of a chief house in Midian.

<b>16 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>17 </b>Vex the Midianites, and smite them:

<b>18 </b>For they vex you with their wiles, wherewith they have beguiled you in the matter of Peor, and in the matter of Cozbi, the daughter of a prince of Midian, their sister, which was slain in the day of the plague for Peor’s sake.


--------------------

CHAPTER 26

<b>1 </b>And it came to pass after the plague, that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses and unto Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, saying,

<b>2 </b>Take the sum of all the congregation of the children of Israel, from twenty years old and upward, throughout their fathers’ house, all that are able to go to war in Israel.

<b>3 </b>And Moses and Eleazar the priest spake with them in the plains of Moab by Jordan <i>near</i> Jericho, saying,

<b>4 </b><i>Take the sum of the people,</i> from twenty years old and upward; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses and the children of Israel, which went forth out of the land of Egypt.

<b>5 </b>¶ Reuben, the eldest son of Israel: the children of Reuben; Hanoch, <i>of whom cometh</i> the family of the Hanochites: of Pallu, the family of the Palluites:

<b>6 </b>Of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites: of Carmi, the family of the Carmites.

<b>7 </b>These <i>are</i> the families of the Reubenites: and they that were numbered of them were forty and three thousand and seven hundred and thirty.

<b>8 </b>And the sons of Pallu; Eliab.

<b>9 </b>And the sons of Eliab; Nemuel, and Dathan, and Abiram. This <i>is that</i> Dathan and Abiram, <i>which were</i> famous in the congregation, who strove against Moses and against Aaron in the company of Korah, when they strove against the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>:

<b>10 </b>And the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed them up together with Korah, when that company died, what time the fire devoured two hundred and fifty men: and they became a sign.

<b>11 </b>Notwithstanding the children of Korah died not.

<b>12 </b>¶ The sons of Simeon after their families: of Nemuel, the family of the Nemuelites: of Jamin, the family of the Jaminites: of Jachin, the family of the Jachinites:

<b>13 </b>Of Zerah, the family of the Zarhites: of Shaul, the family of the Shaulites.

<b>14 </b>These <i>are</i> the families of the Simeonites, twenty and two thousand and two hundred.

<b>15 </b>¶ The children of Gad after their families: of Zephon, the family of the Zephonites: of Haggi, the family of the Haggites: of Shuni, the family of the Shunites:

<b>16 </b>Of Ozni, the family of the Oznites: of Eri, the family of the Erites:

<b>17 </b>Of Arod, the family of the Arodites: of Areli, the family of the Arelites.

<b>18 </b>These <i>are</i> the families of the children of Gad according to those that were numbered of them, forty thousand and five hundred.

<b>19 </b>¶ The sons of Judah <i>were</i> Er and Onan: and Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.

<b>20 </b>And the sons of Judah after their families were; of Shelah, the family of the Shelanites: of Pharez, the family of the Pharzites: of Zerah, the family of the Zarhites.

<b>21 </b>And the sons of Pharez were; of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites: of Hamul, the family of the Hamulites.

<b>22 </b>These <i>are</i> the families of Judah according to those that were numbered of them, threescore and sixteen thousand and five hundred.

<b>23 </b>¶ <i>Of</i> the sons of Issachar after their families: <i>of</i> Tola, the family of the Tolaites: of Pua, the family of the Punites:

<b>24 </b>Of Jashub, the family of the Jashubites: of Shimron, the family of the Shimronites.

<b>25 </b>These <i>are</i> the families of Issachar according to those that were numbered of them, threescore and four thousand and three hundred.

<b>26 </b>¶ <i>Of</i> the sons of Zebulun after their families: of Sered, the family of the Sardites: of Elon, the family of the Elonites: of Jahleel, the family of the Jahleelites.

<b>27 </b>These <i>are</i> the families of the Zebulunites according to those that were numbered of them, threescore thousand and five hundred.

<b>28 </b>¶ The sons of Joseph after their families <i>were</i> Manasseh and Ephraim.

<b>29 </b>Of the sons of Manasseh: of Machir, the family of the Machirites: and Machir begat Gilead: of Gilead <i>come</i> the family of the Gileadites.

<b>30 </b>These <i>are</i> the sons of Gilead: <i>of</i> Jeezer, the family of the Jeezerites: of Helek, the family of the Helekites:

<b>31 </b>And <i>of</i> Asriel, the family of the Asrielites: and <i>of</i> Shechem, the family of the Shechemites:

<b>32 </b>And <i>of</i> Shemida, the family of the Shemidaites: and <i>of</i> Hepher, the family of the Hepherites.

<b>33 </b>¶ And Zelophehad the son of Hepher had no sons, but daughters: and the names of the daughters of Zelophehad <i>were</i> Mahlah, and Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

<b>34 </b>These <i>are</i> the families of Manasseh, and those that were numbered of them, fifty and two thousand and seven hundred.

<b>35 </b>¶ These <i>are</i> the sons of Ephraim after their families: of Shuthelah, the family of the Shuthalhites: of Becher, the family of the Bachrites: of Tahan, the family of the Tahanites.

<b>36 </b>And these <i>are</i> the sons of Shuthelah: of Eran, the family of the Eranites.

<b>37 </b>These <i>are</i> the families of the sons of Ephraim according to those that were numbered of them, thirty and two thousand and five hundred. These <i>are</i> the sons of Joseph after their families.

<b>38 </b>¶ The sons of Benjamin after their families: of Bela, the family of the Belaites: of Ashbel, the family of the Ashbelites: of Ahiram, the family of the Ahiramites:

<b>39 </b>Of Shupham, the family of the Shuphamites: of Hupham, the family of the Huphamites.

<b>40 </b>And the sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: <i>of Ard,</i> the family of the Ardites: <i>and</i> of Naaman, the family of the Naamites.

<b>41 </b>These <i>are</i> the sons of Benjamin after their families: and they that were numbered of them <i>were</i> forty and five thousand and six hundred.

<b>42 </b>¶ These <i>are</i> the sons of Dan after their families: of Shuham, the family of the Shuhamites. These <i>are</i> the families of Dan after their families.

<b>43 </b>All the families of the Shuhamites, according to those that were numbered of them, <i>were</i> threescore and four thousand and four hundred.

<b>44 </b>¶ <i>Of</i> the children of Asher after their families: of Jimna, the family of the Jimnites: of Jesui, the family of the Jesuites: of Beriah, the family of the Beriites.

<b>45 </b>Of the sons of Beriah: of Heber, the family of the Heberites: of Malchiel, the family of the Malchielites.

<b>46 </b>And the name of the daughter of Asher <i>was</i> Sarah.

<b>47 </b>These <i>are</i> the families of the sons of Asher according to those that were numbered of them; <i>who were</i> fifty and three thousand and four hundred.

<b>48 </b>¶ <i>Of</i> the sons of Naphtali after their families: of Jahzeel, the family of the Jahzeelites: of Guni, the family of the Gunites:

<b>49 </b>Of Jezer, the family of the Jezerites: of Shillem, the family of the Shillemites.

<b>50 </b>These <i>are</i> the families of Naphtali according to their families: and they that were numbered of them <i>were</i> forty and five thousand and four hundred.

<b>51 </b>These <i>were</i> the numbered of the children of Israel, six hundred thousand and a thousand seven hundred and thirty.

<b>52 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>53 </b>Unto these the land shall be divided for an inheritance according to the number of names.

<b>54 </b>To many thou shalt give the more inheritance, and to few thou shalt give the less inheritance: to every one shall his inheritance be given according to those that were numbered of him.

<b>55 </b>Notwithstanding the land shall be divided by lot: according to the names of the tribes of their fathers they shall inherit.

<b>56 </b>According to the lot shall the possession thereof be divided between many and few.

<b>57 </b>¶ And these <i>are</i> they that were numbered of the Levites after their families: of Gershon, the family of the Gershonites: of Kohath, the family of the Kohathites: of Merari, the family of the Merarites.

<b>58 </b>These <i>are</i> the families of the Levites: the family of the Libnites, the family of the Hebronites, the family of the Mahlites, the family of the Mushites, the family of the Korathites. And Kohath begat Amram.

<b>59 </b>And the name of Amram’s wife <i>was</i> Jochebed, the daughter of Levi, whom <i>her mother</i> bare to Levi in Egypt: and she bare unto Amram Aaron and Moses, and Miriam their sister.

<b>60 </b>And unto Aaron was born Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

<b>61 </b>And Nadab and Abihu died, when they offered strange fire before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>62 </b>And those that were numbered of them were twenty and three thousand, all males from a month old and upward: for they were not numbered among the children of Israel, because there was no inheritance given them among the children of Israel.

<b>63 </b>¶ These <i>are</i> they that were numbered by Moses and Eleazar the priest, who numbered the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by Jordan <i>near</i> Jericho.

<b>64 </b>But among these there was not a man of them whom Moses and Aaron the priest numbered, when they numbered the children of Israel in the wilderness of Sinai.

<b>65 </b>For the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had said of them, They shall surely die in the wilderness. And there was not left a man of them, save Caleb the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua the son of Nun.


--------------------

CHAPTER 27

<b>1 </b>Then came the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of Manasseh the son of Joseph: and these <i>are</i> the names of his daughters; Mahlah, Noah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Tirzah.

<b>2 </b>And they stood before Moses, and before Eleazar the priest, and before the princes and all the congregation, <i>by</i> the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, saying,

<b>3 </b>Our father died in the wilderness, and he was not in the company of them that gathered themselves together against the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in the company of Korah; but died in his own sin, and had no sons.

<b>4 </b>Why should the name of our father be done away from among his family, because he hath no son? Give unto us <i>therefore</i> a possession among the brethren of our father.

<b>5 </b>And Moses brought their cause before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>6 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>7 </b>The daughters of Zelophehad speak right: thou shalt surely give them a possession of an inheritance among their father’s brethren; and thou shalt cause the inheritance of their father to pass unto them.

<b>8 </b>And thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, If a man die, and have no son, then ye shall cause his inheritance to pass unto his daughter.

<b>9 </b>And if he have no daughter, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his brethren.

<b>10 </b>And if he have no brethren, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his father’s brethren.

<b>11 </b>And if his father have no brethren, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his kinsman that is next to him of his family, and he shall possess it: and it shall be unto the children of Israel a statute of judgment, as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>12 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Moses, Get thee up into this mount Abarim, and see the land which I have given unto the children of Israel.

<b>13 </b>And when thou hast seen it, thou also shalt be gathered unto thy people, as Aaron thy brother was gathered.

<b>14 </b>For ye rebelled against my commandment in the desert of Zin, in the strife of the congregation, to sanctify me at the water before their eyes: that <i>is</i> the water of Meribah in Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.

<b>15 </b>¶ And Moses spake unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, saying,

<b>16 </b>Let the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, the God of the spirits of all flesh, set a man over the congregation,

<b>17 </b>Which may go out before them, and which may go in before them, and which may lead them out, and which may bring them in; that the congregation of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> be not as sheep which have no shepherd.

<b>18 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Moses, Take thee Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom <i>is</i> the spirit, and lay thine hand upon him;

<b>19 </b>And set him before Eleazar the priest, and before all the congregation; and give him a charge in their sight.

<b>20 </b>And thou shalt put <i>some</i> of thine honour upon him, that all the congregation of the children of Israel may be obedient.

<b>21 </b>And he shall stand before Eleazar the priest, who shall ask <i>counsel</i> for him after the judgment of Urim before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: at his word shall they go out, and at his word they shall come in, <i>both</i> he, and all the children of Israel with him, even all the congregation.

<b>22 </b>And Moses did as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded him: and he took Joshua, and set him before Eleazar the priest, and before all the congregation:

<b>23 </b>And he laid his hands upon him, and gave him a charge, as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded by the hand of Moses.


--------------------

CHAPTER 28

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>2 </b>Command the children of Israel, and say unto them, My offering, <i>and</i> my bread for my sacrifices made by fire, <i>for</i> a sweet savour unto me, shall ye observe to offer unto me in their due season.

<b>3 </b>And thou shalt say unto them, This <i>is</i> the offering made by fire which ye shall offer unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; two lambs of the first year without spot day by day, <i>for</i> a continual burnt offering.

<b>4 </b>The one lamb shalt thou offer in the morning, and the other lamb shalt thou offer at even;

<b>5 </b>And a tenth <i>part</i> of an ephah of flour for a meat offering, mingled with the fourth <i>part</i> of an hin of beaten oil.

<b>6 </b><i>It is</i> a continual burnt offering, which was ordained in mount Sinai for a sweet savour, a sacrifice made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>7 </b>And the drink offering thereof <i>shall be</i> the fourth <i>part</i> of an hin for the one lamb: in the holy <i>place</i> shalt thou cause the strong wine to be poured unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>for</i> a drink offering.

<b>8 </b>And the other lamb shalt thou offer at even: as the meat offering of the morning, and as the drink offering thereof, thou shalt offer <i>it,</i> a sacrifice made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>9 </b>¶ And on the sabbath day two lambs of the first year without spot, and two tenth deals of flour <i>for</i> a meat offering, mingled with oil, and the drink offering thereof:

<b>10 </b><i>This is</i> the burnt offering of every sabbath, beside the continual burnt offering, and his drink offering.

<b>11 </b>¶ And in the beginnings of your months ye shall offer a burnt offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; two young bullocks, and one ram, seven lambs of the first year without spot;

<b>12 </b>And three tenth deals of flour <i>for</i> a meat offering, mingled with oil, for one bullock; and two tenth deals of flour <i>for</i> a meat offering, mingled with oil, for one ram;

<b>13 </b>And a several tenth deal of flour mingled with oil <i>for</i> a meat offering unto one lamb; <i>for</i> a burnt offering of a sweet savour, a sacrifice made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>14 </b>And their drink offerings shall be half an hin of wine unto a bullock, and the third <i>part</i> of an hin unto a ram, and a fourth <i>part</i> of an hin unto a lamb: this <i>is</i> the burnt offering of every month throughout the months of the year.

<b>15 </b>And one kid of the goats for a sin offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall be offered, beside the continual burnt offering, and his drink offering.

<b>16 </b>And in the fourteenth day of the first month <i>is</i> the passover of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>17 </b>And in the fifteenth day of this month <i>is</i> the feast: seven days shall unleavened bread be eaten.

<b>18 </b>In the first day <i>shall be</i> an holy convocation; ye shall do no manner of servile work <i>therein:</i>

<b>19 </b>But ye shall offer a sacrifice made by fire <i>for</i> a burnt offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; two young bullocks, and one ram, and seven lambs of the first year: they shall be unto you without blemish:

<b>20 </b>And their meat offering <i>shall be of</i> flour mingled with oil: three tenth deals shall ye offer for a bullock, and two tenth deals for a ram;

<b>21 </b>A several tenth deal shalt thou offer for every lamb, throughout the seven lambs:

<b>22 </b>And one goat <i>for</i> a sin offering, to make an atonement for you.

<b>23 </b>Ye shall offer these beside the burnt offering in the morning, which <i>is</i> for a continual burnt offering.

<b>24 </b>After this manner ye shall offer daily, throughout the seven days, the meat of the sacrifice made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: it shall be offered beside the continual burnt offering, and his drink offering.

<b>25 </b>And on the seventh day ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work.

<b>26 </b>¶ Also in the day of the firstfruits, when ye bring a new meat offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, after your weeks <i>be out,</i> ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work:

<b>27 </b>But ye shall offer the burnt offering for a sweet savour unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; two young bullocks, one ram, seven lambs of the first year;

<b>28 </b>And their meat offering of flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals unto one bullock, two tenth deals unto one ram,

<b>29 </b>A several tenth deal unto one lamb, throughout the seven lambs;

<b>30 </b><i>And</i> one kid of the goats, to make an atonement for you.

<b>31 </b>Ye shall offer <i>them</i> beside the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering, (they shall be unto you without blemish) and their drink offerings.


--------------------

CHAPTER 29

<b>1 </b>And in the seventh month, on the first <i>day</i> of the month, ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work: it is a day of blowing the trumpets unto you.

<b>2 </b>And ye shall offer a burnt offering for a sweet savour unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; one young bullock, one ram, <i>and</i> seven lambs of the first year without blemish:

<b>3 </b>And their meat offering <i>shall be of</i> flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals for a bullock, <i>and</i> two tenth deals for a ram,

<b>4 </b>And one tenth deal for one lamb, throughout the seven lambs:

<b>5 </b>And one kid of the goats <i>for</i> a sin offering, to make an atonement for you:

<b>6 </b>Beside the burnt offering of the month, and his meat offering, and the daily burnt offering, and his meat offering, and their drink offerings, according unto their manner, for a sweet savour, a sacrifice made by fire unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>7 </b>¶ And ye shall have on the tenth <i>day</i> of this seventh month an holy convocation; and ye shall afflict your souls: ye shall not do any work <i>therein:</i>

<b>8 </b>But ye shall offer a burnt offering unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>for</i> a sweet savour; one young bullock, one ram, <i>and</i> seven lambs of the first year; they shall be unto you without blemish:

<b>9 </b>And their meat offering <i>shall be of</i> flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals to a bullock, <i>and</i> two tenth deals to one ram,

<b>10 </b>A several tenth deal for one lamb, throughout the seven lambs:

<b>11 </b>One kid of the goats <i>for</i> a sin offering; beside the sin offering of atonement, and the continual burnt offering, and the meat offering of it, and their drink offerings.

<b>12 </b>¶ And on the fifteenth day of the seventh month ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work, and ye shall keep a feast unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> seven days:

<b>13 </b>And ye shall offer a burnt offering, a sacrifice made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; thirteen young bullocks, two rams, <i>and</i> fourteen lambs of the first year; they shall be without blemish:

<b>14 </b>And their meat offering <i>shall be of</i> flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals unto every bullock of the thirteen bullocks, two tenth deals to each ram of the two rams,

<b>15 </b>And a several tenth deal to each lamb of the fourteen lambs:

<b>16 </b>And one kid of the goats <i>for</i> a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, his meat offering, and his drink offering.

<b>17 </b>¶ And on the second day <i>ye shall offer</i> twelve young bullocks, two rams, fourteen lambs of the first year without spot:

<b>18 </b>And their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, <i>shall be</i> according to their number, after the manner:

<b>19 </b>And one kid of the goats <i>for</i> a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, and the meat offering thereof, and their drink offerings.

<b>20 </b>¶ And on the third day eleven bullocks, two rams, fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish;

<b>21 </b>And their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, <i>shall be</i> according to their number, after the manner:

<b>22 </b>And one goat <i>for</i> a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering, and his drink offering.

<b>23 </b>¶ And on the fourth day ten bullocks, two rams, <i>and</i> fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish:

<b>24 </b>Their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, <i>shall be</i> according to their number, after the manner:

<b>25 </b>And one kid of the goats <i>for</i> a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, his meat offering, and his drink offering.

<b>26 </b>¶ And on the fifth day nine bullocks, two rams, <i>and</i> fourteen lambs of the first year without spot:

<b>27 </b>And their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, <i>shall be</i> according to their number, after the manner:

<b>28 </b>And one goat <i>for</i> a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering, and his drink offering.

<b>29 </b>¶ And on the sixth day eight bullocks, two rams, <i>and</i> fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish:

<b>30 </b>And their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, <i>shall be</i> according to their number, after the manner:

<b>31 </b>And one goat <i>for</i> a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, his meat offering, and his drink offering.

<b>32 </b>¶ And on the seventh day seven bullocks, two rams, <i>and</i> fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish:

<b>33 </b>And their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, <i>shall be</i> according to their number, after the manner:

<b>34 </b>And one goat <i>for</i> a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, his meat offering, and his drink offering.

<b>35 </b>¶ On the eighth day ye shall have a solemn assembly: ye shall do no servile work <i>therein:</i>

<b>36 </b>But ye shall offer a burnt offering, a sacrifice made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: one bullock, one ram, seven lambs of the first year without blemish:

<b>37 </b>Their meat offering and their drink offerings for the bullock, for the ram, and for the lambs, <i>shall be</i> according to their number, after the manner:

<b>38 </b>And one goat <i>for</i> a sin offering; beside the continual burnt offering, and his meat offering, and his drink offering.

<b>39 </b>These <i>things</i> ye shall do unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in your set feasts, beside your vows, and your freewill offerings, for your burnt offerings, and for your meat offerings, and for your drink offerings, and for your peace offerings.

<b>40 </b>And Moses told the children of Israel according to all that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.


--------------------

CHAPTER 30

<b>1 </b>And Moses spake unto the heads of the tribes concerning the children of Israel, saying, This <i>is</i> the thing which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath commanded.

<b>2 </b>If a man vow a vow unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, or swear an oath to bind his soul with a bond; he shall not break his word, he shall do according to all that proceedeth out of his mouth.

<b>3 </b>If a woman also vow a vow unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and bind <i>herself</i> by a bond, <i>being</i> in her father’s house in her youth;

<b>4 </b>And her father hear her vow, and her bond wherewith she hath bound her soul, and her father shall hold his peace at her: then all her vows shall stand, and every bond wherewith she hath bound her soul shall stand.

<b>5 </b>But if her father disallow her in the day that he heareth; not any of her vows, or of her bonds wherewith she hath bound her soul, shall stand: and the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall forgive her, because her father disallowed her.

<b>6 </b>And if she had at all an husband, when she vowed, or uttered ought out of her lips, wherewith she bound her soul;

<b>7 </b>And her husband heard <i>it,</i> and held his peace at her in the day that he heard <i>it:</i> then her vows shall stand, and her bonds wherewith she bound her soul shall stand.

<b>8 </b>But if her husband disallowed her on the day that he heard <i>it;</i> then he shall make her vow which she vowed, and that which she uttered with her lips, wherewith she bound her soul, of none effect: and the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall forgive her.

<b>9 </b>But every vow of a widow, and of her that is divorced, wherewith they have bound their souls, shall stand against her.

<b>10 </b>And if she vowed in her husband’s house, or bound her soul by a bond with an oath;

<b>11 </b>And her husband heard <i>it,</i> and held his peace at her, <i>and</i> disallowed her not: then all her vows shall stand, and every bond wherewith she bound her soul shall stand.

<b>12 </b>But if her husband hath utterly made them void on the day he heard <i>them; then</i> whatsoever proceeded out of her lips concerning her vows, or concerning the bond of her soul, shall not stand: her husband hath made them void; and the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall forgive her.

<b>13 </b>Every vow, and every binding oath to afflict the soul, her husband may establish it, or her husband may make it void.

<b>14 </b>But if her husband altogether hold his peace at her from day to day; then he establisheth all her vows, or all her bonds, which <i>are</i> upon her: he confirmeth them, because he held his peace at her in the day that he heard <i>them.</i>

<b>15 </b>But if he shall any ways make them void after that he hath heard <i>them;</i> then he shall bear her iniquity.

<b>16 </b>These <i>are</i> the statutes, which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses, between a man and his wife, between the father and his daughter, <i>being yet</i> in her youth in her father’s house.


--------------------

CHAPTER 31

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>2 </b>Avenge the children of Israel of the Midianites: afterward shalt thou be gathered unto thy people.

<b>3 </b>And Moses spake unto the people, saying, Arm some of yourselves unto the war, and let them go against the Midianites, and avenge the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> of Midian.

<b>4 </b>Of every tribe a thousand, throughout all the tribes of Israel, shall ye send to the war.

<b>5 </b>So there were delivered out of the thousands of Israel, a thousand of <i>every</i> tribe, twelve thousand armed for war.

<b>6 </b>And Moses sent them to the war, a thousand of <i>every</i> tribe, them and Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, to the war, with the holy instruments, and the trumpets to blow in his hand.

<b>7 </b>And they warred against the Midianites, as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses; and they slew all the males.

<b>8 </b>And they slew the kings of Midian, beside the rest of them that were slain; <i>namely,</i> Evi, and Rekem, and Zur, and Hur, and Reba, five kings of Midian: Balaam also the son of Beor they slew with the sword.

<b>9 </b>And the children of Israel took <i>all</i> the women of Midian captives, and their little ones, and took the spoil of all their cattle, and all their flocks, and all their goods.

<b>10 </b>And they burnt all their cities wherein they dwelt, and all their goodly castles, with fire.

<b>11 </b>And they took all the spoil, and all the prey, <i>both</i> of men and of beasts.

<b>12 </b>And they brought the captives, and the prey, and the spoil, unto Moses, and Eleazar the priest, and unto the congregation of the children of Israel, unto the camp at the plains of Moab, which <i>are</i> by Jordan <i>near</i> Jericho.

<b>13 </b>¶ And Moses, and Eleazar the priest, and all the princes of the congregation, went forth to meet them without the camp.

<b>14 </b>And Moses was wroth with the officers of the host, <i>with</i> the captains over thousands, and captains over hundreds, which came from the battle.

<b>15 </b>And Moses said unto them, Have ye saved all the women alive?

<b>16 </b>Behold, these caused the children of Israel, through the counsel of Balaam, to commit trespass against the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in the matter of Peor, and there was a plague among the congregation of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>17 </b>Now therefore kill every male among the little ones, and kill every woman that hath known man by lying with him.

<b>18 </b>But all the women children, that have not known a man by lying with him, keep alive for yourselves.

<b>19 </b>And do ye abide without the camp seven days: whosoever hath killed any person, and whosoever hath touched any slain, purify <i>both</i> yourselves and your captives on the third day, and on the seventh day.

<b>20 </b>And purify all <i>your</i> raiment, and all that is made of skins, and all work of goats’ <i>hair,</i> and all things made of wood.

<b>21 </b>¶ And Eleazar the priest said unto the men of war which went to the battle, This <i>is</i> the ordinance of the law which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses;

<b>22 </b>Only the gold, and the silver, the brass, the iron, the tin, and the lead,

<b>23 </b>Every thing that may abide the fire, ye shall make <i>it</i> go through the fire, and it shall be clean: nevertheless it shall be purified with the water of separation: and all that abideth not the fire ye shall make go through the water.

<b>24 </b>And ye shall wash your clothes on the seventh day, and ye shall be clean, and afterward ye shall come into the camp.

<b>25 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>26 </b>Take the sum of the prey that was taken, <i>both</i> of man and of beast, thou, and Eleazar the priest, and the chief fathers of the congregation:

<b>27 </b>And divide the prey into two parts; between them that took the war upon them, who went out to battle, and between all the congregation:

<b>28 </b>And levy a tribute unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> of the men of war which went out to battle: one soul of five hundred, <i>both</i> of the persons, and of the beeves, and of the asses, and of the sheep:

<b>29 </b>Take <i>it</i> of their half, and give <i>it</i> unto Eleazar the priest, <i>for</i> an heave offering of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>30 </b>And of the children of Israel’s half, thou shalt take one portion of fifty, of the persons, of the beeves, of the asses, and of the flocks, of all manner of beasts, and give them unto the Levites, which keep the charge of the tabernacle of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>31 </b>And Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>32 </b>And the booty, <i>being</i> the rest of the prey which the men of war had caught, was six hundred thousand and seventy thousand and five thousand sheep,

<b>33 </b>And threescore and twelve thousand beeves,

<b>34 </b>And threescore and one thousand asses,

<b>35 </b>And thirty and two thousand persons in all, of women that had not known man by lying with him.

<b>36 </b>And the half, <i>which was</i> the portion of them that went out to war, was in number three hundred thousand and seven and thirty thousand and five hundred sheep:

<b>37 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s tribute of the sheep was six hundred and threescore and fifteen.

<b>38 </b>And the beeves <i>were</i> thirty and six thousand; of which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s tribute <i>was</i> threescore and twelve.

<b>39 </b>And the asses <i>were</i> thirty thousand and five hundred; of which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s tribute <i>was</i> threescore and one.

<b>40 </b>And the persons <i>were</i> sixteen thousand; of which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s tribute <i>was</i> thirty and two persons.

<b>41 </b>And Moses gave the tribute, <i>which was</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s heave offering, unto Eleazar the priest, as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>42 </b>And of the children of Israel’s half, which Moses divided from the men that warred,

<b>43 </b>(Now the half <i>that pertained unto</i> the congregation was three hundred thousand and thirty thousand <i>and</i> seven thousand and five hundred sheep,

<b>44 </b>And thirty and six thousand beeves,

<b>45 </b>And thirty thousand asses and five hundred,

<b>46 </b>And sixteen thousand persons;)

<b>47 </b>Even of the children of Israel’s half, Moses took one portion of fifty, <i>both</i> of man and of beast, and gave them unto the Levites, which kept the charge of the tabernacle of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>48 </b>¶ And the officers which <i>were</i> over thousands of the host, the captains of thousands, and captains of hundreds, came near unto Moses:

<b>49 </b>And they said unto Moses, Thy servants have taken the sum of the men of war which <i>are</i> under our charge, and there lacketh not one man of us.

<b>50 </b>We have therefore brought an oblation for the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, what every man hath gotten, of jewels of gold, chains, and bracelets, rings, earrings, and tablets, to make an atonement for our souls before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>51 </b>And Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold of them, <i>even</i> all wrought jewels.

<b>52 </b>And all the gold of the offering that they offered up to the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, of the captains of thousands, and of the captains of hundreds, was sixteen thousand seven hundred and fifty shekels.

<b>53 </b>(<i>For</i> the men of war had taken spoil, every man for himself.)

<b>54 </b>And Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold of the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and brought it into the tabernacle of the congregation, <i>for</i> a memorial for the children of Israel before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.


--------------------

CHAPTER 32

<b>1 </b>Now the children of Reuben and the children of Gad had a very great multitude of cattle: and when they saw the land of Jazer, and the land of Gilead, that, behold, the place <i>was</i> a place for cattle;

<b>2 </b>The children of Gad and the children of Reuben came and spake unto Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and unto the princes of the congregation, saying,

<b>3 </b>Ataroth, and Dibon, and Jazer, and Nimrah, and Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Shebam, and Nebo, and Beon,

<b>4 </b><i>Even</i> the country which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> smote before the congregation of Israel, <i>is</i> a land for cattle, and thy servants have cattle:

<b>5 </b>Wherefore, said they, if we have found grace in thy sight, let this land be given unto thy servants for a possession, <i>and</i> bring us not over Jordan.

<b>6 </b>¶ And Moses said unto the children of Gad and to the children of Reuben, Shall your brethren go to war, and shall ye sit here?

<b>7 </b>And wherefore discourage ye the heart of the children of Israel from going over into the land which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath given them?

<b>8 </b>Thus did your fathers, when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to see the land.

<b>9 </b>For when they went up unto the valley of Eshcol, and saw the land, they discouraged the heart of the children of Israel, that they should not go into the land which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had given them.

<b>10 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s anger was kindled the same time, and he sware, saying,

<b>11 </b>Surely none of the men that came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and upward, shall see the land which I sware unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob; because they have not wholly followed me:

<b>12 </b>Save Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenezite, and Joshua the son of Nun: for they have wholly followed the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>13 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s anger was kindled against Israel, and he made them wander in the wilderness forty years, until all the generation, that had done evil in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, was consumed.

<b>14 </b>And, behold, ye are risen up in your fathers’ stead, an increase of sinful men, to augment yet the fierce anger of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> toward Israel.

<b>15 </b>For if ye turn away from after him, he will yet again leave them in the wilderness; and ye shall destroy all this people.

<b>16 </b>¶ And they came near unto him, and said, We will build sheepfolds here for our cattle, and cities for our little ones:

<b>17 </b>But we ourselves will go ready armed before the children of Israel, until we have brought them unto their place: and our little ones shall dwell in the fenced cities because of the inhabitants of the land.

<b>18 </b>We will not return unto our houses, until the children of Israel have inherited every man his inheritance.

<b>19 </b>For we will not inherit with them on yonder side Jordan, or forward; because our inheritance is fallen to us on this side Jordan eastward.

<b>20 </b>¶ And Moses said unto them, If ye will do this thing, if ye will go armed before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> to war,

<b>21 </b>And will go all of you armed over Jordan before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, until he hath driven out his enemies from before him,

<b>22 </b>And the land be subdued before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: then afterward ye shall return, and be guiltless before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and before Israel; and this land shall be your possession before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>23 </b>But if ye will not do so, behold, ye have sinned against the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: and be sure your sin will find you out.

<b>24 </b>Build you cities for your little ones, and folds for your sheep; and do that which hath proceeded out of your mouth.

<b>25 </b>And the children of Gad and the children of Reuben spake unto Moses, saying, Thy servants will do as my lord commandeth.

<b>26 </b>Our little ones, our wives, our flocks, and all our cattle, shall be there in the cities of Gilead:

<b>27 </b>But thy servants will pass over, every man armed for war, before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> to battle, as my lord saith.

<b>28 </b>So concerning them Moses commanded Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun, and the chief fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel:

<b>29 </b>And Moses said unto them, If the children of Gad and the children of Reuben will pass with you over Jordan, every man armed to battle, before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and the land shall be subdued before you; then ye shall give them the land of Gilead for a possession:

<b>30 </b>But if they will not pass over with you armed, they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.

<b>31 </b>And the children of Gad and the children of Reuben answered, saying, As the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath said unto thy servants, so will we do.

<b>32 </b>We will pass over armed before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> into the land of Canaan, that the possession of our inheritance on this side Jordan <i>may be</i> ours.

<b>33 </b>And Moses gave unto them, <i>even</i> to the children of Gad, and to the children of Reuben, and unto half the tribe of Manasseh the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, the land, with the cities thereof in the coasts, <i>even</i> the cities of the country round about.

<b>34 </b>¶ And the children of Gad built Dibon, and Ataroth, and Aroer,

<b>35 </b>And Atroth, Shophan, and Jaazer, and Jogbehah,

<b>36 </b>And Beth-nimrah, and Beth-haran, fenced cities: and folds for sheep.

<b>37 </b>And the children of Reuben built Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Kirjathaim,

<b>38 </b>And Nebo, and Baal-meon, (their names being changed,) and Shibmah: and gave other names unto the cities which they builded.

<b>39 </b>And the children of Machir the son of Manasseh went to Gilead, and took it, and dispossessed the Amorite which <i>was</i> in it.

<b>40 </b>And Moses gave Gilead unto Machir the son of Manasseh; and he dwelt therein.

<b>41 </b>And Jair the son of Manasseh went and took the small towns thereof, and called them Havoth-jair.

<b>42 </b>And Nobah went and took Kenath, and the villages thereof, and called it Nobah, after his own name.


--------------------

CHAPTER 33

<b>1 </b>These <i>are</i> the journeys of the children of Israel, which went forth out of the land of Egypt with their armies under the hand of Moses and Aaron.

<b>2 </b>And Moses wrote their goings out according to their journeys by the commandment of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: and these <i>are</i> their journeys according to their goings out.

<b>3 </b>And they departed from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month; on the morrow after the passover the children of Israel went out with an high hand in the sight of all the Egyptians.

<b>4 </b>For the Egyptians buried all <i>their</i> firstborn, which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had smitten among them: upon their gods also the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> executed judgments.

<b>5 </b>And the children of Israel removed from Rameses, and pitched in Succoth.

<b>6 </b>And they departed from Succoth, and pitched in Etham, which <i>is</i> in the edge of the wilderness.

<b>7 </b>And they removed from Etham, and turned again unto Pi-hahiroth, which <i>is</i> before Baal-zephon: and they pitched before Migdol.

<b>8 </b>And they departed from before Pi-hahiroth, and passed through the midst of the sea into the wilderness, and went three days’ journey in the wilderness of Etham, and pitched in Marah.

<b>9 </b>And they removed from Marah, and came unto Elim: and in Elim <i>were</i> twelve fountains of water, and threescore and ten palm trees; and they pitched there.

<b>10 </b>And they removed from Elim, and encamped by the Red sea.

<b>11 </b>And they removed from the Red sea, and encamped in the wilderness of Sin.

<b>12 </b>And they took their journey out of the wilderness of Sin, and encamped in Dophkah.

<b>13 </b>And they departed from Dophkah, and encamped in Alush.

<b>14 </b>And they removed from Alush, and encamped at Rephidim, where was no water for the people to drink.

<b>15 </b>And they departed from Rephidim, and pitched in the wilderness of Sinai.

<b>16 </b>And they removed from the desert of Sinai, and pitched at Kibroth-hattaavah.

<b>17 </b>And they departed from Kibroth-hattaavah, and encamped at Hazeroth.

<b>18 </b>And they departed from Hazeroth, and pitched in Rithmah.

<b>19 </b>And they departed from Rithmah, and pitched at Rimmon-parez.

<b>20 </b>And they departed from Rimmon-parez, and pitched in Libnah.

<b>21 </b>And they removed from Libnah, and pitched at Rissah.

<b>22 </b>And they journeyed from Rissah, and pitched in Kehelathah.

<b>23 </b>And they went from Kehelathah, and pitched in mount Shapher.

<b>24 </b>And they removed from mount Shapher, and encamped in Haradah.

<b>25 </b>And they removed from Haradah, and pitched in Makheloth.

<b>26 </b>And they removed from Makheloth, and encamped at Tahath.

<b>27 </b>And they departed from Tahath, and pitched at Tarah.

<b>28 </b>And they removed from Tarah, and pitched in Mithcah.

<b>29 </b>And they went from Mithcah, and pitched in Hashmonah.

<b>30 </b>And they departed from Hashmonah, and encamped at Moseroth.

<b>31 </b>And they departed from Moseroth, and pitched in Bene-jaakan.

<b>32 </b>And they removed from Bene-jaakan, and encamped at Hor-hagidgad.

<b>33 </b>And they went from Hor-hagidgad, and pitched in Jotbathah.

<b>34 </b>And they removed from Jotbathah, and encamped at Ebronah.

<b>35 </b>And they departed from Ebronah, and encamped at Ezion-gaber.

<b>36 </b>And they removed from Ezion-gaber, and pitched in the wilderness of Zin, which <i>is</i> Kadesh.

<b>37 </b>And they removed from Kadesh, and pitched in mount Hor, in the edge of the land of Edom.

<b>38 </b>And Aaron the priest went up into mount Hor at the commandment of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and died there, in the fortieth year after the children of Israel were come out of the land of Egypt, in the first <i>day</i> of the fifth month.

<b>39 </b>And Aaron <i>was</i> an hundred and twenty and three years old when he died in mount Hor.

<b>40 </b>And king Arad the Canaanite, which dwelt in the south in the land of Canaan, heard of the coming of the children of Israel.

<b>41 </b>And they departed from mount Hor, and pitched in Zalmonah.

<b>42 </b>And they departed from Zalmonah, and pitched in Punon.

<b>43 </b>And they departed from Punon, and pitched in Oboth.

<b>44 </b>And they departed from Oboth, and pitched in Ije-abarim, in the border of Moab.

<b>45 </b>And they departed from Iim, and pitched in Dibon-gad.

<b>46 </b>And they removed from Dibon-gad, and encamped in Almon-diblathaim.

<b>47 </b>And they removed from Almon-diblathaim, and pitched in the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.

<b>48 </b>And they departed from the mountains of Abarim, and pitched in the plains of Moab by Jordan <i>near</i> Jericho.

<b>49 </b>And they pitched by Jordan, from Beth-jesimoth <i>even</i> unto Abel-shittim in the plains of Moab.

<b>50 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses in the plains of Moab by Jordan <i>near</i> Jericho, saying,

<b>51 </b>Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye are passed over Jordan into the land of Canaan;

<b>52 </b>Then ye shall drive out all the inhabitants of the land from before you, and destroy all their pictures, and destroy all their molten images, and quite pluck down all their high places:

<b>53 </b>And ye shall dispossess <i>the inhabitants of</i> the land, and dwell therein: for I have given you the land to possess it.

<b>54 </b>And ye shall divide the land by lot for an inheritance among your families: <i>and</i> to the more ye shall give the more inheritance, and to the fewer ye shall give the less inheritance: every man’s <i>inheritance</i> shall be in the place where his lot falleth; according to the tribes of your fathers ye shall inherit.

<b>55 </b>But if ye will not drive out the inhabitants of the land from before you; then it shall come to pass, that those which ye let remain of them <i>shall be</i> pricks in your eyes, and thorns in your sides, and shall vex you in the land wherein ye dwell.

<b>56 </b>Moreover it shall come to pass, <i>that</i> I shall do unto you, as I thought to do unto them.


--------------------

CHAPTER 34

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>2 </b>Command the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye come into the land of Canaan; (this <i>is</i> the land that shall fall unto you for an inheritance, <i>even</i> the land of Canaan with the coasts thereof:)

<b>3 </b>Then your south quarter shall be from the wilderness of Zin along by the coast of Edom, and your south border shall be the outmost coast of the salt sea eastward:

<b>4 </b>And your border shall turn from the south to the ascent of Akrabbim, and pass on to Zin: and the going forth thereof shall be from the south to Kadesh-barnea, and shall go on to Hazar-addar, and pass on to Azmon:

<b>5 </b>And the border shall fetch a compass from Azmon unto the river of Egypt, and the goings out of it shall be at the sea.

<b>6 </b>And <i>as for</i> the western border, ye shall even have the great sea for a border: this shall be your west border.

<b>7 </b>And this shall be your north border: from the great sea ye shall point out for you mount Hor:

<b>8 </b>From mount Hor ye shall point out <i>your border</i> unto the entrance of Hamath; and the goings forth of the border shall be to Zedad:

<b>9 </b>¶ And the border shall go on to Ziphron, and the goings out of it shall be at Hazar-enan: this shall be your north border.

<b>10 </b>And ye shall point out your east border from Hazar-enan to Shepham:

<b>11 </b>And the coast shall go down from Shepham to Riblah, on the east side of Ain; and the border shall descend, and shall reach unto the side of the sea of Chinnereth eastward:

<b>12 </b>And the border shall go down to Jordan, and the goings out of it shall be at the salt sea: this shall be your land with the coasts thereof round about.

<b>13 </b>And Moses commanded the children of Israel, saying, This <i>is</i> the land which ye shall inherit by lot, which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded to give unto the nine tribes, and to the half tribe:

<b>14 </b>For the tribe of the children of Reuben according to the house of their fathers, and the tribe of the children of Gad according to the house of their fathers, have received <i>their inheritance;</i> and half the tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance:

<b>15 </b>The two tribes and the half tribe have received their inheritance on this side Jordan <i>near</i> Jericho eastward, toward the sunrising.

<b>16 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>17 </b>These <i>are</i> the names of the men which shall divide the land unto you: Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun.

<b>18 </b>And ye shall take one prince of every tribe, to divide the land by inheritance.

<b>19 </b>And the names of the men <i>are</i> these: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh.

<b>20 </b>And of the tribe of the children of Simeon, Shemuel the son of Ammihud.

<b>21 </b>Of the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad the son of Chislon.

<b>22 </b>And the prince of the tribe of the children of Dan, Bukki the son of Jogli.

<b>23 </b>The prince of the children of Joseph, for the tribe of the children of Manasseh, Hanniel the son of Ephod.

<b>24 </b>And the prince of the tribe of the children of Ephraim, Kemuel the son of Shiphtan.

<b>25 </b>And the prince of the tribe of the children of Zebulun, Elizaphan the son of Parnach.

<b>26 </b>And the prince of the tribe of the children of Issachar, Paltiel the son of Azzan.

<b>27 </b>And the prince of the tribe of the children of Asher, Ahihud the son of Shelomi.

<b>28 </b>And the prince of the tribe of the children of Naphtali, Pedahel the son of Ammihud.

<b>29 </b>These <i>are they</i> whom the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded to divide the inheritance unto the children of Israel in the land of Canaan.


--------------------

CHAPTER 35

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses in the plains of Moab by Jordan <i>near</i> Jericho, saying,

<b>2 </b>Command the children of Israel, that they give unto the Levites of the inheritance of their possession cities to dwell in; and ye shall give <i>also</i> unto the Levites suburbs for the cities round about them.

<b>3 </b>And the cities shall they have to dwell in; and the suburbs of them shall be for their cattle, and for their goods, and for all their beasts.

<b>4 </b>And the suburbs of the cities, which ye shall give unto the Levites, <i>shall reach</i> from the wall of the city and outward a thousand cubits round about.

<b>5 </b>And ye shall measure from without the city on the east side two thousand cubits, and on the south side two thousand cubits, and on the west side two thousand cubits, and on the north side two thousand cubits; and the city <i>shall be</i> in the midst: this shall be to them the suburbs of the cities.

<b>6 </b>And among the cities which ye shall give unto the Levites <i>there shall be</i> six cities for refuge, which ye shall appoint for the manslayer, that he may flee thither: and to them ye shall add forty and two cities.

<b>7 </b><i>So</i> all the cities which ye shall give to the Levites <i>shall be</i> forty and eight cities: them <i>shall ye give</i> with their suburbs.

<b>8 </b>And the cities which ye shall give <i>shall be</i> of the possession of the children of Israel: from <i>them that have</i> many ye shall give many; but from <i>them that have</i> few ye shall give few: every one shall give of his cities unto the Levites according to his inheritance which he inheriteth.

<b>9 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses, saying,

<b>10 </b>Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye be come over Jordan into the land of Canaan;

<b>11 </b>Then ye shall appoint you cities to be cities of refuge for you; that the slayer may flee thither, which killeth any person at unawares.

<b>12 </b>And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

<b>13 </b>And of these cities which ye shall give six cities shall ye have for refuge.

<b>14 </b>Ye shall give three cities on this side Jordan, and three cities shall ye give in the land of Canaan, <i>which</i> shall be cities of refuge.

<b>15 </b>These six cities shall be a refuge, <i>both</i> for the children of Israel, and for the stranger, and for the sojourner among them: that every one that killeth any person unawares may flee thither.

<b>16 </b>And if he smite him with an instrument of iron, so that he die, he <i>is</i> a murderer: the murderer shall surely be put to death.

<b>17 </b>And if he smite him with throwing a stone, wherewith he may die, and he die, he <i>is</i> a murderer: the murderer shall surely be put to death.

<b>18 </b>Or <i>if</i> he smite him with an hand weapon of wood, wherewith he may die, and he die, he <i>is</i> a murderer: the murderer shall surely be put to death.

<b>19 </b>The revenger of blood himself shall slay the murderer: when he meeteth him, he shall slay him.

<b>20 </b>But if he thrust him of hatred, or hurl at him by laying of wait, that he die;

<b>21 </b>Or in enmity smite him with his hand, that he die: he that smote <i>him</i> shall surely be put to death; <i>for</i> he <i>is</i> a murderer: the revenger of blood shall slay the murderer, when he meeteth him.

<b>22 </b>But if he thrust him suddenly without enmity, or have cast upon him any thing without laying of wait,

<b>23 </b>Or with any stone, wherewith a man may die, seeing <i>him</i> not, and cast <i>it</i> upon him, that he die, and <i>was</i> not his enemy, neither sought his harm:

<b>24 </b>Then the congregation shall judge between the slayer and the revenger of blood according to these judgments:

<b>25 </b>And the congregation shall deliver the slayer out of the hand of the revenger of blood, and the congregation shall restore him to the city of his refuge, whither he was fled: and he shall abide in it unto the death of the high priest, which was anointed with the holy oil.

<b>26 </b>But if the slayer shall at any time come without the border of the city of his refuge, whither he was fled;

<b>27 </b>And the revenger of blood find him without the borders of the city of his refuge, and the revenger of blood kill the slayer; he shall not be guilty of blood:

<b>28 </b>Because he should have remained in the city of his refuge until the death of the high priest: but after the death of the high priest the slayer shall return into the land of his possession.

<b>29 </b>So these <i>things</i> shall be for a statute of judgment unto you throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

<b>30 </b>Whoso killeth any person, the murderer shall be put to death by the mouth of witnesses: but one witness shall not testify against any person <i>to cause him</i> to die.

<b>31 </b>Moreover ye shall take no satisfaction for the life of a murderer, which <i>is</i> guilty of death: but he shall be surely put to death.

<b>32 </b>And ye shall take no satisfaction for him that is fled to the city of his refuge, that he should come again to dwell in the land, until the death of the priest.

<b>33 </b>So ye shall not pollute the land wherein ye <i>are:</i> for blood it defileth the land: and the land cannot be cleansed of the blood that is shed therein, but by the blood of him that shed it.

<b>34 </b>Defile not therefore the land which ye shall inhabit, wherein I dwell: for I the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> dwell among the children of Israel.


--------------------

CHAPTER 36

<b>1 </b>And the chief fathers of the families of the children of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came near, and spake before Moses, and before the princes, the chief fathers of the children of Israel:

<b>2 </b>And they said, The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded my lord to give the land for an inheritance by lot to the children of Israel: and my lord was commanded by the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother unto his daughters.

<b>3 </b>And if they be married to any of the sons of the <i>other</i> tribes of the children of Israel, then shall their inheritance be taken from the inheritance of our fathers, and shall be put to the inheritance of the tribe whereunto they are received: so shall it be taken from the lot of our inheritance.

<b>4 </b>And when the jubilee of the children of Israel shall be, then shall their inheritance be put unto the inheritance of the tribe whereunto they are received: so shall their inheritance be taken away from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers.

<b>5 </b>And Moses commanded the children of Israel according to the word of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, saying, The tribe of the sons of Joseph hath said well.

<b>6 </b>This <i>is</i> the thing which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> doth command concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, saying, Let them marry to whom they think best; only to the family of the tribe of their father shall they marry.

<b>7 </b>So shall not the inheritance of the children of Israel remove from tribe to tribe: for every one of the children of Israel shall keep himself to the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.

<b>8 </b>And every daughter, that possesseth an inheritance in any tribe of the children of Israel, shall be wife unto one of the family of the tribe of her father, that the children of Israel may enjoy every man the inheritance of his fathers.

<b>9 </b>Neither shall the inheritance remove from <i>one</i> tribe to another tribe; but every one of the tribes of the children of Israel shall keep himself to his own inheritance.

<b>10 </b>Even as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses, so did the daughters of Zelophehad:

<b>11 </b>For Mahlah, Tirzah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, were married unto their father’s brothers’ sons:

<b>12 </b><i>And</i> they were married into the families of the sons of Manasseh the son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in the tribe of the family of their father.

<b>13 </b>These <i>are</i> the commandments and the judgments, which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded by the hand of Moses unto the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by Jordan <i>near</i> Jericho.


--------------------

<small>The Fifth Book of Moses </small><small>Called </small>Deuteronomy

CHAPTER 1

<b>1 </b>These <i>be</i> the words which Moses spake unto all Israel on this side Jordan in the wilderness, in the plain over against the Red <i>sea</i><i>,</i> between Paran, and Tophel, and Laban, and Hazeroth, and Dizahab.

<b>2 </b>(<i>There are</i> eleven days’ <i>journey</i> from Horeb by the way of mount Seir unto Kadesh-barnea.)

<b>3 </b>And it came to pass in the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, on the first <i>day</i> of the month, <i>that</i> Moses spake unto the children of Israel, according unto all that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had given him in commandment unto them;

<b>4 </b>After he had slain Sihon the king of the Amorites, which dwelt in Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, which dwelt at Astaroth in Edrei:

<b>5 </b>On this side Jordan, in the land of Moab, began Moses to declare this law, saying,

<b>6 </b>The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> our God spake unto us in Horeb, saying, Ye have dwelt long enough in this mount:

<b>7 </b>Turn you, and take your journey, and go to the mount of the Amorites, and unto all <i>the places</i> nigh thereunto, in the plain, in the hills, and in the vale, and in the south, and by the sea side, to the land of the Canaanites, and unto Lebanon, unto the great river, the river Euphrates.

<b>8 </b>Behold, I have set the land before you: go in and possess the land which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> sware unto your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give unto them and to their seed after them.

<b>9 </b>¶ And I spake unto you at that time, saying, I am not able to bear you myself alone:

<b>10 </b>The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God hath multiplied you, and, behold, ye <i>are</i> this day as the stars of heaven for multitude.

<b>11 </b>(The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of your fathers make you a thousand times so many more as ye <i>are,</i> and bless you, as he hath promised you!)

<b>12 </b>How can I myself alone bear your cumbrance, and your burden, and your strife?

<b>13 </b>Take you wise men, and understanding, and known among your tribes, and I will make them rulers over you.

<b>14 </b>And ye answered me, and said, The thing which thou hast spoken <i>is</i> good <i>for us</i> to do.

<b>15 </b>So I took the chief of your tribes, wise men, and known, and made them heads over you, captains over thousands, and captains over hundreds, and captains over fifties, and captains over tens, and officers among your tribes.

<b>16 </b>And I charged your judges at that time, saying, Hear <i>the causes</i> between your brethren, and judge righteously between <i>every</i> man and his brother, and the stranger <i>that is</i> with him.

<b>17 </b>Ye shall not respect persons in judgment; <i>but</i> ye shall hear the small as well as the great; ye shall not be afraid of the face of man; for the judgment <i>is</i> God’s: and the cause that is too hard for you, bring <i>it</i> unto me, and I will hear it.

<b>18 </b>And I commanded you at that time all the things which ye should do.

<b>19 </b>¶ And when we departed from Horeb, we went through all that great and terrible wilderness, which ye saw by the way of the mountain of the Amorites, as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> our God commanded us; and we came to Kadesh-barnea.

<b>20 </b>And I said unto you, Ye are come unto the mountain of the Amorites, which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> our God doth give unto us.

<b>21 </b>Behold, the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> thy God hath set the land before thee: go up <i>and</i> possess <i>it,</i> as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of thy fathers hath said unto thee; fear not, neither be discouraged.

<b>22 </b>¶ And ye came near unto me every one of you, and said, We will send men before us, and they shall search us out the land, and bring us word again by what way we must go up, and into what cities we shall come.

<b>23 </b>And the saying pleased me well: and I took twelve men of you, one of a tribe:

<b>24 </b>And they turned and went up into the mountain, and came unto the valley of Eshcol, and searched it out.
