<b>21 </b>And it shall come to pass, when many evils and troubles are befallen them, that this song shall testify against them as a witness; for it shall not be forgotten out of the mouths of their seed: for I know their imagination which they go about, even now, before I have brought them into the land which I sware.

<b>22 </b>¶ Moses therefore wrote this song the same day, and taught it the children of Israel.

<b>23 </b>And he gave Joshua the son of Nun a charge, and said, Be strong and of a good courage: for thou shalt bring the children of Israel into the land which I sware unto them: and I will be with thee.

<b>24 </b>¶ And it came to pass, when Moses had made an end of writing the words of this law in a book, until they were finished,

<b>25 </b>That Moses commanded the Levites, which bare the ark of the covenant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, saying,

<b>26 </b>Take this book of the law, and put it in the side of the ark of the covenant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God, that it may be there for a witness against thee.

<b>27 </b>For I know thy rebellion, and thy stiff neck: behold, while I am yet alive with you this day, ye have been rebellious against the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; and how much more after my death?

<b>28 </b>¶ Gather unto me all the elders of your tribes, and your officers, that I may speak these words in their ears, and call heaven and earth to record against them.

<b>29 </b>For I know that after my death ye will utterly corrupt <i>yourselves,</i> and turn aside from the way which I have commanded you; and evil will befall you in the latter days; because ye will do evil in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, to provoke him to anger through the work of your hands.

<b>30 </b>And Moses spake in the ears of all the congregation of Israel the words of this song, until they were ended.


--------------------

CHAPTER 32

<b>1 </b>Give ear, O ye heavens, and I will speak; and hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.

<b>2 </b>My doctrine shall drop as the rain, my speech shall distil as the dew, as the small rain upon the tender herb, and as the showers upon the grass:

<b>3 </b>Because I will publish the name of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: ascribe ye greatness unto our God.

<b>4 </b><i>He is</i> the Rock, his work <i>is</i> perfect: for all his ways <i>are</i> judgment: a God of truth and without iniquity, just and right <i>is</i> he.

<b>5 </b>They have corrupted themselves, their spot <i>is</i> not <i>the spot</i> of his children: <i>they are</i> a perverse and crooked generation.

<b>6 </b>Do ye thus requite the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, O foolish people and unwise? <i>is</i> not he thy father <i>that</i> hath bought thee? hath he not made thee, and established thee?

<b>7 </b>¶ Remember the days of old, consider the years of many generations: ask thy father, and he will shew thee; thy elders, and they will tell thee.

<b>8 </b>When the most High divided to the nations their inheritance, when he separated the sons of Adam, he set the bounds of the people according to the number of the children of Israel.

<b>9 </b>For the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s portion <i>is</i> his people; Jacob <i>is</i> the lot of his inheritance.

<b>10 </b>He found him in a desert land, and in the waste howling wilderness; he led him about, he instructed him, he kept him as the apple of his eye.

<b>11 </b>As an eagle stirreth up her nest, fluttereth over her young, spreadeth abroad her wings, taketh them, beareth them on her wings:

<b>12 </b><i>So</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> alone did lead him, and <i>there was</i> no strange god with him.

<b>13 </b>He made him ride on the high places of the earth, that he might eat the increase of the fields; and he made him to suck honey out of the rock, and oil out of the flinty rock;

<b>14 </b>Butter of kine, and milk of sheep, with fat of lambs, and rams of the breed of Bashan, and goats, with the fat of kidneys of wheat; and thou didst drink the pure blood of the grape.

<b>15 </b>¶ But Jeshurun waxed fat, and kicked: thou art waxen fat, thou art grown thick, thou art covered <i>with fatness;</i> then he forsook God <i>which</i> made him, and lightly esteemed the Rock of his salvation.

<b>16 </b>They provoked him to jealousy with strange <i>gods,</i> with abominations provoked they him to anger.

<b>17 </b>They sacrificed unto devils, not to God; to gods whom they knew not, to new <i>gods that</i> came newly up, whom your fathers feared not.

<b>18 </b>Of the Rock <i>that</i> begat thee thou art unmindful, and hast forgotten God that formed thee.

<b>19 </b>And when the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> saw <i>it,</i> he abhorred <i>them,</i> because of the provoking of his sons, and of his daughters.

<b>20 </b>And he said, I will hide my face from them, I will see what their end <i>shall be:</i> for they <i>are</i> a very froward generation, children in whom <i>is</i> no faith.

<b>21 </b>They have moved me to jealousy with <i>that which is</i> not God; they have provoked me to anger with their vanities: and I will move them to jealousy with <i>those which are</i> not a people; I will provoke them to anger with a foolish nation.

<b>22 </b>For a fire is kindled in mine anger, and shall burn unto the lowest hell, and shall consume the earth with her increase, and set on fire the foundations of the mountains.

<b>23 </b>I will heap mischiefs upon them; I will spend mine arrows upon them.

<b>24 </b><i>They shall be</i> burnt with hunger, and devoured with burning heat, and with bitter destruction: I will also send the teeth of beasts upon them, with the poison of serpents of the dust.

<b>25 </b>The sword without, and terror within, shall destroy both the young man and the virgin, the suckling <i>also</i> with the man of gray hairs.

<b>26 </b>I said, I would scatter them into corners, I would make the remembrance of them to cease from among men:

<b>27 </b>Were it not that I feared the wrath of the enemy, lest their adversaries should behave themselves strangely, <i>and</i> lest they should say, Our hand <i>is</i> high, and the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath not done all this.

<b>28 </b>For they <i>are</i> a nation void of counsel, neither <i>is there any</i> understanding in them.

<b>29 </b>O that they were wise, <i>that</i> they understood this, <i>that</i> they would consider their latter end!

<b>30 </b>How should one chase a thousand, and two put ten thousand to flight, except their Rock had sold them, and the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had shut them up?

<b>31 </b>For their rock <i>is</i> not as our Rock, even our enemies themselves <i>being</i> judges.

<b>32 </b>For their vine <i>is</i> of the vine of Sodom, and of the fields of Gomorrah: their grapes <i>are</i> grapes of gall, their clusters <i>are</i> bitter:

<b>33 </b>Their wine <i>is</i> the poison of dragons, and the cruel venom of asps.

<b>34 </b><i>Is</i> not this laid up in store with me, <i>and</i> sealed up among my treasures?

<b>35 </b>To me <i>belongeth</i> vengeance, and recompence; their foot shall slide in <i>due</i> time: for the day of their calamity <i>is</i> at hand, and the things that shall come upon them make haste.

<b>36 </b>For the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall judge his people, and repent himself for his servants, when he seeth that <i>their</i> power is gone, and <i>there is</i> none shut up, or left.

<b>37 </b>And he shall say, Where <i>are</i> their gods, <i>their</i> rock in whom they trusted,

<b>38 </b>Which did eat the fat of their sacrifices, <i>and</i> drank the wine of their drink offerings? let them rise up and help you, <i>and</i> be your protection.

<b>39 </b>See now that I, <i>even</i> I, <i>am</i> he, and <i>there is</i> no god with me: I kill, and I make alive; I wound, and I heal: neither <i>is there any</i> that can deliver out of my hand.

<b>40 </b>For I lift up my hand to heaven, and say, I live for ever.

<b>41 </b>If I whet my glittering sword, and mine hand take hold on judgment; I will render vengeance to mine enemies, and will reward them that hate me.

<b>42 </b>I will make mine arrows drunk with blood, and my sword shall devour flesh; <i>and that</i> with the blood of the slain and of the captives, from the beginning of revenges upon the enemy.

<b>43 </b>Rejoice, O ye nations, <i>with</i> his people: for he will avenge the blood of his servants, and will render vengeance to his adversaries, and will be merciful unto his land, <i>and</i> to his people.

<b>44 </b>¶ And Moses came and spake all the words of this song in the ears of the people, he, and Hoshea the son of Nun.

<b>45 </b>And Moses made an end of speaking all these words to all Israel:

<b>46 </b>And he said unto them, Set your hearts unto all the words which I testify among you this day, which ye shall command your children to observe to do, all the words of this law.

<b>47 </b>For it <i>is</i> not a vain thing for you; because it <i>is</i> your life: and through this thing ye shall prolong <i>your</i> days in the land, whither ye go over Jordan to possess it.

<b>48 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Moses that selfsame day, saying,

<b>49 </b>Get thee up into this mountain Abarim, <i>unto</i> mount Nebo, which <i>is</i> in the land of Moab, that <i>is</i> over against Jericho; and behold the land of Canaan, which I give unto the children of Israel for a possession:

<b>50 </b>And die in the mount whither thou goest up, and be gathered unto thy people; as Aaron thy brother died in mount Hor, and was gathered unto his people:

<b>51 </b>Because ye trespassed against me among the children of Israel at the waters of Meribah-Kadesh, in the wilderness of Zin; because ye sanctified me not in the midst of the children of Israel.

<b>52 </b>Yet thou shalt see the land before <i>thee;</i> but thou shalt not go thither unto the land which I give the children of Israel.


--------------------

CHAPTER 33

<b>1 </b>And this <i>is</i> the blessing, wherewith Moses the man of God blessed the children of Israel before his death.

<b>2 </b>And he said, The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> came from Sinai, and rose up from Seir unto them; he shined forth from mount Paran, and he came with ten thousands of saints: from his right hand <i>went</i> a fiery law for them.

<b>3 </b>Yea, he loved the people; all his saints <i>are</i> in thy hand: and they sat down at thy feet; <i>every one</i> shall receive of thy words.

<b>4 </b>Moses commanded us a law, <i>even</i> the inheritance of the congregation of Jacob.

<b>5 </b>And he was king in Jeshurun, when the heads of the people <i>and</i> the tribes of Israel were gathered together.

<b>6 </b>¶ Let Reuben live, and not die; and let <i>not</i> his men be few.

<b>7 </b>¶ And this <i>is the blessing</i> of Judah: and he said, Hear, <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, the voice of Judah, and bring him unto his people: let his hands be sufficient for him; and be thou an help <i>to him</i> from his enemies.

<b>8 </b>¶ And of Levi he said, <i>Let</i> thy Thummim and thy Urim <i>be</i> with thy holy one, whom thou didst prove at Massah, <i>and with</i> whom thou didst strive at the waters of Meribah;

<b>9 </b>Who said unto his father and to his mother, I have not seen him; neither did he acknowledge his brethren, nor knew his own children: for they have observed thy word, and kept thy covenant.

<b>10 </b>They shall teach Jacob thy judgments, and Israel thy law: they shall put incense before thee, and whole burnt sacrifice upon thine altar.

<b>11 </b>Bless, <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, his substance, and accept the work of his hands: smite through the loins of them that rise against him, and of them that hate him, that they rise not again.

<b>12 </b>¶ <i>And</i> of Benjamin he said, The beloved of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall dwell in safety by him; <i>and the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span></i> shall cover him all the day long, and he shall dwell between his shoulders.

<b>13 </b>¶ And of Joseph he said, Blessed of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>be</i> his land, for the precious things of heaven, for the dew, and for the deep that coucheth beneath,

<b>14 </b>And for the precious fruits <i>brought forth</i> by the sun, and for the precious things put forth by the moon,

<b>15 </b>And for the chief things of the ancient mountains, and for the precious things of the lasting hills,

<b>16 </b>And for the precious things of the earth and fulness thereof, and <i>for</i> the good will of him that dwelt in the bush: let <i>the blessing</i> come upon the head of Joseph, and upon the top of the head of him <i>that was</i> separated from his brethren.

<b>17 </b>His glory <i>is like</i> the firstling of his bullock, and his horns <i>are like</i> the horns of unicorns: with them he shall push the people together to the ends of the earth: and they <i>are</i> the ten thousands of Ephraim, and they <i>are</i> the thousands of Manasseh.

<b>18 </b>¶ And of Zebulun he said, Rejoice, Zebulun, in thy going out; and, Issachar, in thy tents.

<b>19 </b>They shall call the people unto the mountain; there they shall offer sacrifices of righteousness: for they shall suck <i>of</i> the abundance of the seas, and <i>of</i> treasures hid in the sand.

<b>20 </b>¶ And of Gad he said, Blessed <i>be</i> he that enlargeth Gad: he dwelleth as a lion, and teareth the arm with the crown of the head.

<b>21 </b>And he provided the first part for himself, because there, <i>in</i> a portion of the lawgiver, <i>was he</i> seated; and he came with the heads of the people, he executed the justice of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and his judgments with Israel.

<b>22 </b>¶ And of Dan he said, Dan <i>is</i> a lion’s whelp: he shall leap from Bashan.

<b>23 </b>¶ And of Naphtali he said, O Naphtali, satisfied with favour, and full with the blessing of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: possess thou the west and the south.

<b>24 </b>¶ And of Asher he said, <i>Let</i> Asher <i>be</i> blessed with children; let him be acceptable to his brethren, and let him dip his foot in oil.

<b>25 </b>Thy shoes <i>shall be</i> iron and brass; and as thy days, <i>so shall</i> thy strength <i>be.</i>

<b>26 </b>¶ <i>There is</i> none like unto the God of Jeshurun, <i>who</i> rideth upon the heaven in thy help, and in his excellency on the sky.

<b>27 </b>The eternal God <i>is thy</i> refuge, and underneath <i>are</i> the everlasting arms: and he shall thrust out the enemy from before thee; and shall say, Destroy <i>them.</i>

<b>28 </b>Israel then shall dwell in safety alone: the fountain of Jacob <i>shall be</i> upon a land of corn and wine; also his heavens shall drop down dew.

<b>29 </b>Happy <i>art</i> thou, O Israel: who <i>is</i> like unto thee, O people saved by the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, the shield of thy help, and who <i>is</i> the sword of thy excellency! and thine enemies shall be found liars unto thee; and thou shalt tread upon their high places.


--------------------

CHAPTER 34

<b>1 </b>And Moses went up from the plains of Moab unto the mountain of Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, that <i>is</i> over against Jericho. And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shewed him all the land of Gilead, unto Dan,

<b>2 </b>And all Naphtali, and the land of Ephraim, and Manasseh, and all the land of Judah, unto the utmost sea,

<b>3 </b>And the south, and the plain of the valley of Jericho, the city of palm trees, unto Zoar.

<b>4 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto him, This <i>is</i> the land which I sware unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob, saying, I will give it unto thy seed: I have caused thee to see <i>it</i> with thine eyes, but thou shalt not go over thither.

<b>5 </b>¶ So Moses the servant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> died there in the land of Moab, according to the word of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>6 </b>And he buried him in a valley in the land of Moab, over against Beth-peor: but no man knoweth of his sepulchre unto this day.

<b>7 </b>¶ And Moses <i>was</i> an hundred and twenty years old when he died: his eye was not dim, nor his natural force abated.

<b>8 </b>¶ And the children of Israel wept for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days: so the days of weeping <i>and</i> mourning for Moses were ended.

<b>9 </b>¶ And Joshua the son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom; for Moses had laid his hands upon him: and the children of Israel hearkened unto him, and did as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>10 </b>¶ And there arose not a prophet since in Israel like unto Moses, whom the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> knew face to face,

<b>11 </b>In all the signs and the wonders, which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> sent him to do in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh, and to all his servants, and to all his land,

<b>12 </b>And in all that mighty hand, and in all the great terror which Moses shewed in the sight of all Israel.


--------------------

<small>The Book of </small>Joshua

CHAPTER 1

<b>1 </b>Now after the death of Moses the servant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> it came to pass, that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Joshua the son of Nun, Moses’ minister, saying,

<b>2 </b>Moses my servant is dead; now therefore arise, go over this Jordan, thou, and all this people, unto the land which I do give to them, <i>even</i> to the children of Israel.

<b>3 </b>Every place that the sole of your foot shall tread upon, that have I given unto you, as I said unto Moses.

<b>4 </b>From the wilderness and this Lebanon even unto the great river, the river Euphrates, all the land of the Hittites, and unto the great sea toward the going down of the sun, shall be your coast.

<b>5 </b>There shall not any man be able to stand before thee all the days of thy life: as I was with Moses, <i>so</i> I will be with thee: I will not fail thee, nor forsake thee.

<b>6 </b>Be strong and of a good courage: for unto this people shalt thou divide for an inheritance the land, which I sware unto their fathers to give them.

<b>7 </b>Only be thou strong and very courageous, that thou mayest observe to do according to all the law, which Moses my servant commanded thee: turn not from it <i>to</i> the right hand or <i>to</i> the left, that thou mayest prosper whithersoever thou goest.

<b>8 </b>This book of the law shall not depart out of thy mouth; but thou shalt meditate therein day and night, that thou mayest observe to do according to all that is written therein: for then thou shalt make thy way prosperous, and then thou shalt have good success.

<b>9 </b>Have not I commanded thee? Be strong and of a good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> thy God <i>is</i> with thee whithersoever thou goest.

<b>10 </b>¶ Then Joshua commanded the officers of the people, saying,

<b>11 </b>Pass through the host, and command the people, saying, Prepare you victuals; for within three days ye shall pass over this Jordan, to go in to possess the land, which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God giveth you to possess it.

<b>12 </b>¶ And to the Reubenites, and to the Gadites, and to half the tribe of Manasseh, spake Joshua, saying,

<b>13 </b>Remember the word which Moses the servant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded you, saying, The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God hath given you rest, and hath given you this land.

<b>14 </b>Your wives, your little ones, and your cattle, shall remain in the land which Moses gave you on this side Jordan; but ye shall pass before your brethren armed, all the mighty men of valour, and help them;

<b>15 </b>Until the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> have given your brethren rest, as <i>he hath given</i> you, and they also have possessed the land which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God giveth them: then ye shall return unto the land of your possession, and enjoy it, which Moses the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s servant gave you on this side Jordan toward the sunrising.

<b>16 </b>¶ And they answered Joshua, saying, All that thou commandest us we will do, and whithersoever thou sendest us, we will go.

<b>17 </b>According as we hearkened unto Moses in all things, so will we hearken unto thee: only the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> thy God be with thee, as he was with Moses.

<b>18 </b>Whosoever <i>he be</i> that doth rebel against thy commandment, and will not hearken unto thy words in all that thou commandest him, he shall be put to death: only be strong and of a good courage.


--------------------

CHAPTER 2

<b>1 </b>And Joshua the son of Nun sent out of Shittim two men to spy secretly, saying, Go view the land, even Jericho. And they went, and came into an harlot’s house, named Rahab, and lodged there.

<b>2 </b>And it was told the king of Jericho, saying, Behold, there came men in hither to night of the children of Israel to search out the country.

<b>3 </b>And the king of Jericho sent unto Rahab, saying, Bring forth the men that are come to thee, which are entered into thine house: for they be come to search out all the country.

<b>4 </b>And the woman took the two men, and hid them, and said thus, There came men unto me, but I wist not whence they <i>were:</i>

<b>5 </b>And it came to pass <i>about the time</i> of shutting of the gate, when it was dark, that the men went out: whither the men went I wot not: pursue after them quickly; for ye shall overtake them.

<b>6 </b>But she had brought them up to the roof of the house, and hid them with the stalks of flax, which she had laid in order upon the roof.

<b>7 </b>And the men pursued after them the way to Jordan unto the fords: and as soon as they which pursued after them were gone out, they shut the gate.

<b>8 </b>¶ And before they were laid down, she came up unto them upon the roof;

<b>9 </b>And she said unto the men, I know that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath given you the land, and that your terror is fallen upon us, and that all the inhabitants of the land faint because of you.

<b>10 </b>For we have heard how the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> dried up the water of the Red sea for you, when ye came out of Egypt; and what ye did unto the two kings of the Amorites, that <i>were</i> on the other side Jordan, Sihon and Og, whom ye utterly destroyed.

<b>11 </b>And as soon as we had heard <i>these things,</i> our hearts did melt, neither did there remain any more courage in any man, because of you: for the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God, he <i>is</i> God in heaven above, and in earth beneath.

<b>12 </b>Now therefore, I pray you, swear unto me by the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, since I have shewed you kindness, that ye will also shew kindness unto my father’s house, and give me a true token:

<b>13 </b>And <i>that</i> ye will save alive my father, and my mother, and my brethren, and my sisters, and all that they have, and deliver our lives from death.

<b>14 </b>And the men answered her, Our life for yours, if ye utter not this our business. And it shall be, when the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath given us the land, that we will deal kindly and truly with thee.

<b>15 </b>Then she let them down by a cord through the window: for her house <i>was</i> upon the town wall, and she dwelt upon the wall.

<b>16 </b>And she said unto them, Get you to the mountain, lest the pursuers meet you; and hide yourselves there three days, until the pursuers be returned: and afterward may ye go your way.

<b>17 </b>And the men said unto her, We <i>will be</i> blameless of this thine oath which thou hast made us swear.

<b>18 </b>Behold, <i>when</i> we come into the land, thou shalt bind this line of scarlet thread in the window which thou didst let us down by: and thou shalt bring thy father, and thy mother, and thy brethren, and all thy father’s household, home unto thee.

<b>19 </b>And it shall be, <i>that</i> whosoever shall go out of the doors of thy house into the street, his blood <i>shall be</i> upon his head, and we <i>will be</i> guiltless: and whosoever shall be with thee in the house, his blood <i>shall be</i> on our head, if <i>any</i> hand be upon him.

<b>20 </b>And if thou utter this our business, then we will be quit of thine oath which thou hast made us to swear.

<b>21 </b>And she said, According unto your words, so <i>be</i> it. And she sent them away, and they departed: and she bound the scarlet line in the window.

<b>22 </b>And they went, and came unto the mountain, and abode there three days, until the pursuers were returned: and the pursuers sought <i>them</i> throughout all the way, but found <i>them</i> not.

<b>23 </b>¶ So the two men returned, and descended from the mountain, and passed over, and came to Joshua the son of Nun, and told him all <i>things</i> that befell them:

<b>24 </b>And they said unto Joshua, Truly the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath delivered into our hands all the land; for even all the inhabitants of the country do faint because of us.


--------------------

CHAPTER 3

<b>1 </b>And Joshua rose early in the morning; and they removed from Shittim, and came to Jordan, he and all the children of Israel, and lodged there before they passed over.

<b>2 </b>And it came to pass after three days, that the officers went through the host;

<b>3 </b>And they commanded the people, saying, When ye see the ark of the covenant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God, and the priests the Levites bearing it, then ye shall remove from your place, and go after it.

<b>4 </b>Yet there shall be a space between you and it, about two thousand cubits by measure: come not near unto it, that ye may know the way by which ye must go: for ye have not passed <i>this</i> way heretofore.

<b>5 </b>And Joshua said unto the people, Sanctify yourselves: for to morrow the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> will do wonders among you.

<b>6 </b>And Joshua spake unto the priests, saying, Take up the ark of the covenant, and pass over before the people. And they took up the ark of the covenant, and went before the people.

<b>7 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Joshua, This day will I begin to magnify thee in the sight of all Israel, that they may know that, as I was with Moses, <i>so</i> I will be with thee.

<b>8 </b>And thou shalt command the priests that bear the ark of the covenant, saying, When ye are come to the brink of the water of Jordan, ye shall stand still in Jordan.

<b>9 </b>¶ And Joshua said unto the children of Israel, Come hither, and hear the words of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God.

<b>10 </b>And Joshua said, Hereby ye shall know that the living God <i>is</i> among you, and <i>that</i> he will without fail drive out from before you the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Hivites, and the Perizzites, and the Girgashites, and the Amorites, and the Jebusites.

<b>11 </b>Behold, the ark of the covenant of the Lord of all the earth passeth over before you into Jordan.

<b>12 </b>Now therefore take you twelve men out of the tribes of Israel, out of every tribe a man.

<b>13 </b>And it shall come to pass, as soon as the soles of the feet of the priests that bear the ark of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, the Lord of all the earth, shall rest in the waters of Jordan, <i>that</i> the waters of Jordan shall be cut off <i>from</i> the waters that come down from above; and they shall stand upon an heap.

<b>14 </b>¶ And it came to pass, when the people removed from their tents, to pass over Jordan, and the priests bearing the ark of the covenant before the people;

<b>15 </b>And as they that bare the ark were come unto Jordan, and the feet of the priests that bare the ark were dipped in the brim of the water, (for Jordan overfloweth all his banks all the time of harvest,)

<b>16 </b>That the waters which came down from above stood <i>and</i> rose up upon an heap very far from the city Adam, that <i>is</i> beside Zaretan: and those that came down toward the sea of the plain, <i>even</i> the salt sea, failed, <i>and</i> were cut off: and the people passed over right against Jericho.

<b>17 </b>And the priests that bare the ark of the covenant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> stood firm on dry ground in the midst of Jordan, and all the Israelites passed over on dry ground, until all the people were passed clean over Jordan.


--------------------

CHAPTER 4

<b>1 </b>And it came to pass, when all the people were clean passed over Jordan, that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Joshua, saying,

<b>2 </b>Take you twelve men out of the people, out of every tribe a man,

<b>3 </b>And command ye them, saying, Take you hence out of the midst of Jordan, out of the place where the priests’ feet stood firm, twelve stones, and ye shall carry them over with you, and leave them in the lodging place, where ye shall lodge this night.

<b>4 </b>Then Joshua called the twelve men, whom he had prepared of the children of Israel, out of every tribe a man:

<b>5 </b>And Joshua said unto them, Pass over before the ark of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God into the midst of Jordan, and take ye up every man of you a stone upon his shoulder, according unto the number of the tribes of the children of Israel:

<b>6 </b>That this may be a sign among you, <i>that</i> when your children ask <i>their fathers</i> in time to come, saying, What <i>mean</i> ye by these stones?

<b>7 </b>Then ye shall answer them, That the waters of Jordan were cut off before the ark of the covenant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; when it passed over Jordan, the waters of Jordan were cut off: and these stones shall be for a memorial unto the children of Israel for ever.

<b>8 </b>And the children of Israel did so as Joshua commanded, and took up twelve stones out of the midst of Jordan, as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Joshua, according to the number of the tribes of the children of Israel, and carried them over with them unto the place where they lodged, and laid them down there.

<b>9 </b>And Joshua set up twelve stones in the midst of Jordan, in the place where the feet of the priests which bare the ark of the covenant stood: and they are there unto this day.

<b>10 </b>¶ For the priests which bare the ark stood in the midst of Jordan, until every thing was finished that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Joshua to speak unto the people, according to all that Moses commanded Joshua: and the people hasted and passed over.

<b>11 </b>And it came to pass, when all the people were clean passed over, that the ark of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> passed over, and the priests, in the presence of the people.

<b>12 </b>And the children of Reuben, and the children of Gad, and half the tribe of Manasseh, passed over armed before the children of Israel, as Moses spake unto them:

<b>13 </b>About forty thousand prepared for war passed over before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> unto battle, to the plains of Jericho.

<b>14 </b>¶ On that day the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> magnified Joshua in the sight of all Israel; and they feared him, as they feared Moses, all the days of his life.

<b>15 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake unto Joshua, saying,

<b>16 </b>Command the priests that bear the ark of the testimony, that they come up out of Jordan.

<b>17 </b>Joshua therefore commanded the priests, saying, Come ye up out of Jordan.

<b>18 </b>And it came to pass, when the priests that bare the ark of the covenant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> were come up out of the midst of Jordan, <i>and</i> the soles of the priests’ feet were lifted up unto the dry land, that the waters of Jordan returned unto their place, and flowed over all his banks, as <i>they did</i> before.

<b>19 </b>¶ And the people came up out of Jordan on the tenth <i>day</i> of the first month, and encamped in Gilgal, in the east border of Jericho.

<b>20 </b>And those twelve stones, which they took out of Jordan, did Joshua pitch in Gilgal.

<b>21 </b>And he spake unto the children of Israel, saying, When your children shall ask their fathers in time to come, saying, What <i>mean</i> these stones?

<b>22 </b>Then ye shall let your children know, saying, Israel came over this Jordan on dry land.

<b>23 </b>For the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God dried up the waters of Jordan from before you, until ye were passed over, as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God did to the Red sea, which he dried up from before us, until we were gone over:

<b>24 </b>That all the people of the earth might know the hand of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, that it <i>is</i> mighty: that ye might fear the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God for ever.


--------------------

CHAPTER 5

<b>1 </b>And it came to pass, when all the kings of the Amorites, which <i>were</i> on the side of Jordan westward, and all the kings of the Canaanites, which <i>were</i> by the sea, heard that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had dried up the waters of Jordan from before the children of Israel, until we were passed over, that their heart melted, neither was there spirit in them any more, because of the children of Israel.

<b>2 </b>¶ At that time the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Joshua, Make thee sharp knives, and circumcise again the children of Israel the second time.

<b>3 </b>And Joshua made him sharp knives, and circumcised the children of Israel at the hill of the foreskins.

<b>4 </b>And this <i>is</i> the cause why Joshua did circumcise: All the people that came out of Egypt, <i>that were</i> males, <i>even</i> all the men of war, died in the wilderness by the way, after they came out of Egypt.

<b>5 </b>Now all the people that came out were circumcised: but all the people <i>that were</i> born in the wilderness by the way as they came forth out of Egypt, <i>them</i> they had not circumcised.

<b>6 </b>For the children of Israel walked forty years in the wilderness, till all the people <i>that were</i> men of war, which came out of Egypt, were consumed, because they obeyed not the voice of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: unto whom the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> sware that he would not shew them the land, which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> sware unto their fathers that he would give us, a land that floweth with milk and honey.

<b>7 </b>And their children, <i>whom</i> he raised up in their stead, them Joshua circumcised: for they were uncircumcised, because they had not circumcised them by the way.

<b>8 </b>And it came to pass, when they had done circumcising all the people, that they abode in their places in the camp, till they were whole.

<b>9 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Joshua, This day have I rolled away the reproach of Egypt from off you. Wherefore the name of the place is called Gilgal unto this day.

<b>10 </b>¶ And the children of Israel encamped in Gilgal, and kept the passover on the fourteenth day of the month at even in the plains of Jericho.

<b>11 </b>And they did eat of the old corn of the land on the morrow after the passover, unleavened cakes, and parched <i>corn</i> in the selfsame day.

<b>12 </b>¶ And the manna ceased on the morrow after they had eaten of the old corn of the land; neither had the children of Israel manna any more; but they did eat of the fruit of the land of Canaan that year.

<b>13 </b>¶ And it came to pass, when Joshua was by Jericho, that he lifted up his eyes and looked, and, behold, there stood a man over against him with his sword drawn in his hand: and Joshua went unto him, and said unto him, <i>Art</i> thou for us, or for our adversaries?

<b>14 </b>And he said, Nay; but <i>as</i> captain of the host of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> am I now come. And Joshua fell on his face to the earth, and did worship, and said unto him, What saith my lord unto his servant?

<b>15 </b>And the captain of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s host said unto Joshua, Loose thy shoe from off thy foot; for the place whereon thou standest <i>is</i> holy. And Joshua did so.


--------------------

CHAPTER 6

<b>1 </b>Now Jericho was straitly shut up because of the children of Israel: none went out, and none came in.

<b>2 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Joshua, See, I have given into thine hand Jericho, and the king thereof, <i>and</i> the mighty men of valour.

<b>3 </b>And ye shall compass the city, all <i>ye</i> men of war, <i>and</i> go round about the city once. Thus shalt thou do six days.

<b>4 </b>And seven priests shall bear before the ark seven trumpets of rams’ horns: and the seventh day ye shall compass the city seven times, and the priests shall blow with the trumpets.

<b>5 </b>And it shall come to pass, that when they make a long <i>blast</i> with the ram’s horn, <i>and</i> when ye hear the sound of the trumpet, all the people shall shout with a great shout; and the wall of the city shall fall down flat, and the people shall ascend up every man straight before him.

<b>6 </b>¶ And Joshua the son of Nun called the priests, and said unto them, Take up the ark of the covenant, and let seven priests bear seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>7 </b>And he said unto the people, Pass on, and compass the city, and let him that is armed pass on before the ark of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>8 </b>¶ And it came to pass, when Joshua had spoken unto the people, that the seven priests bearing the seven trumpets of rams’ horns passed on before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and blew with the trumpets: and the ark of the covenant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> followed them.

<b>9 </b>¶ And the armed men went before the priests that blew with the trumpets, and the rearward came after the ark, <i>the priests</i> going on, and blowing with the trumpets.

<b>10 </b>And Joshua had commanded the people, saying, Ye shall not shout, nor make any noise with your voice, neither shall <i>any</i> word proceed out of your mouth, until the day I bid you shout; then shall ye shout.

<b>11 </b>So the ark of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> compassed the city, going about <i>it</i> once: and they came into the camp, and lodged in the camp.

<b>12 </b>¶ And Joshua rose early in the morning, and the priests took up the ark of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>13 </b>And seven priests bearing seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> went on continually, and blew with the trumpets: and the armed men went before them; but the rearward came after the ark of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, <i>the priests</i> going on, and blowing with the trumpets.

<b>14 </b>And the second day they compassed the city once, and returned into the camp: so they did six days.

<b>15 </b>And it came to pass on the seventh day, that they rose early about the dawning of the day, and compassed the city after the same manner seven times: only on that day they compassed the city seven times.

<b>16 </b>And it came to pass at the seventh time, when the priests blew with the trumpets, Joshua said unto the people, Shout; for the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath given you the city.

<b>17 </b>¶ And the city shall be accursed, <i>even</i> it, and all that <i>are</i> therein, to the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: only Rahab the harlot shall live, she and all that <i>are</i> with her in the house, because she hid the messengers that we sent.

<b>18 </b>And ye, in any wise keep <i>yourselves</i> from the accursed thing, lest ye make <i>yourselves</i> accursed, when ye take of the accursed thing, and make the camp of Israel a curse, and trouble it.

<b>19 </b>But all the silver, and gold, and vessels of brass and iron, <i>are</i> consecrated unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: they shall come into the treasury of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>20 </b>So the people shouted when <i>the priests</i> blew with the trumpets: and it came to pass, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, and the people shouted with a great shout, that the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they took the city.

<b>21 </b>And they utterly destroyed all that <i>was</i> in the city, both man and woman, young and old, and ox, and sheep, and ass, with the edge of the sword.

<b>22 </b>But Joshua had said unto the two men that had spied out the country, Go into the harlot’s house, and bring out thence the woman, and all that she hath, as ye sware unto her.

<b>23 </b>And the young men that were spies went in, and brought out Rahab, and her father, and her mother, and her brethren, and all that she had; and they brought out all her kindred, and left them without the camp of Israel.

<b>24 </b>And they burnt the city with fire, and all that <i>was</i> therein: only the silver, and the gold, and the vessels of brass and of iron, they put into the treasury of the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>25 </b>And Joshua saved Rahab the harlot alive, and her father’s household, and all that she had; and she dwelleth in Israel <i>even</i> unto this day; because she hid the messengers, which Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.

<b>26 </b>¶ And Joshua adjured <i>them</i> at that time, saying, Cursed <i>be</i> the man before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, that riseth up and buildeth this city Jericho: he shall lay the foundation thereof in his firstborn, and in his youngest <i>son</i> shall he set up the gates of it.

<b>27 </b>So the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> was with Joshua; and his fame was <i>noised</i> throughout all the country.


--------------------

CHAPTER 7

<b>1 </b>But the children of Israel committed a trespass in the accursed thing: for Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took of the accursed thing: and the anger of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> was kindled against the children of Israel.

<b>2 </b>And Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which <i>is</i> beside Beth-aven, on the east side of Beth-el, and spake unto them, saying, Go up and view the country. And the men went up and viewed Ai.

<b>3 </b>And they returned to Joshua, and said unto him, Let not all the people go up; but let about two or three thousand men go up and smite Ai; <i>and</i> make not all the people to labour thither; for they <i>are but</i> few.

<b>4 </b>So there went up thither of the people about three thousand men: and they fled before the men of Ai.

<b>5 </b>And the men of Ai smote of them about thirty and six men: for they chased them <i>from</i> before the gate <i>even</i> unto Shebarim, and smote them in the going down: wherefore the hearts of the people melted, and became as water.

<b>6 </b>¶ And Joshua rent his clothes, and fell to the earth upon his face before the ark of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> until the eventide, he and the elders of Israel, and put dust upon their heads.

<b>7 </b>And Joshua said, Alas, O Lord <span class="small-caps">God</span>, wherefore hast thou at all brought this people over Jordan, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, to destroy us? would to God we had been content, and dwelt on the other side Jordan!

<b>8 </b>O Lord, what shall I say, when Israel turneth their backs before their enemies!

<b>9 </b>For the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land shall hear <i>of it,</i> and shall environ us round, and cut off our name from the earth: and what wilt thou do unto thy great name?

<b>10 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Joshua, Get thee up; wherefore liest thou thus upon thy face?

<b>11 </b>Israel hath sinned, and they have also transgressed my covenant which I commanded them: for they have even taken of the accursed thing, and have also stolen, and dissembled also, and they have put <i>it</i> even among their own stuff.

<b>12 </b>Therefore the children of Israel could not stand before their enemies, <i>but</i> turned <i>their</i> backs before their enemies, because they were accursed: neither will I be with you any more, except ye destroy the accursed from among you.

<b>13 </b>Up, sanctify the people, and say, Sanctify yourselves against to morrow: for thus saith the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel, <i>There is</i> an accursed thing in the midst of thee, O Israel: thou canst not stand before thine enemies, until ye take away the accursed thing from among you.

<b>14 </b>In the morning therefore ye shall be brought according to your tribes: and it shall be, <i>that</i> the tribe which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> taketh shall come according to the families <i>thereof;</i> and the family which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall take shall come by households; and the household which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall take shall come man by man.

<b>15 </b>And it shall be, <i>that</i> he that is taken with the accursed thing shall be burnt with fire, he and all that he hath: because he hath transgressed the covenant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and because he hath wrought folly in Israel.

<b>16 </b>¶ So Joshua rose up early in the morning, and brought Israel by their tribes; and the tribe of Judah was taken:

<b>17 </b>And he brought the family of Judah; and he took the family of the Zarhites: and he brought the family of the Zarhites man by man; and Zabdi was taken:

<b>18 </b>And he brought his household man by man; and Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was taken.

<b>19 </b>And Joshua said unto Achan, My son, give, I pray thee, glory to the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel, and make confession unto him; and tell me now what thou hast done; hide <i>it</i> not from me.

<b>20 </b>And Achan answered Joshua, and said, Indeed I have sinned against the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel, and thus and thus have I done:

<b>21 </b>When I saw among the spoils a goodly Babylonish garment, and two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of gold of fifty shekels weight, then I coveted them, and took them; and, behold, they <i>are</i> hid in the earth in the midst of my tent, and the silver under it.

<b>22 </b>¶ So Joshua sent messengers, and they ran unto the tent; and, behold, <i>it was</i> hid in his tent, and the silver under it.

<b>23 </b>And they took them out of the midst of the tent, and brought them unto Joshua, and unto all the children of Israel, and laid them out before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>24 </b>And Joshua, and all Israel with him, took Achan the son of Zerah, and the silver, and the garment, and the wedge of gold, and his sons, and his daughters, and his oxen, and his asses, and his sheep, and his tent, and all that he had: and they brought them unto the valley of Achor.

<b>25 </b>And Joshua said, Why hast thou troubled us? the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall trouble thee this day. And all Israel stoned him with stones, and burned them with fire, after they had stoned them with stones.

<b>26 </b>And they raised over him a great heap of stones unto this day. So the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> turned from the fierceness of his anger. Wherefore the name of that place was called, The valley of Achor, unto this day.


--------------------

CHAPTER 8

<b>1 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Joshua, Fear not, neither be thou dismayed: take all the people of war with thee, and arise, go up to Ai: see, I have given into thy hand the king of Ai, and his people, and his city, and his land:

<b>2 </b>And thou shalt do to Ai and her king as thou didst unto Jericho and her king: only the spoil thereof, and the cattle thereof, shall ye take for a prey unto yourselves: lay thee an ambush for the city behind it.

<b>3 </b>¶ So Joshua arose, and all the people of war, to go up against Ai: and Joshua chose out thirty thousand mighty men of valour, and sent them away by night.

<b>4 </b>And he commanded them, saying, Behold, ye shall lie in wait against the city, <i>even</i> behind the city: go not very far from the city, but be ye all ready:

<b>5 </b>And I, and all the people that <i>are</i> with me, will approach unto the city: and it shall come to pass, when they come out against us, as at the first, that we will flee before them,

<b>6 </b>(For they will come out after us) till we have drawn them from the city; for they will say, They flee before us, as at the first: therefore we will flee before them.

<b>7 </b>Then ye shall rise up from the ambush, and seize upon the city: for the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God will deliver it into your hand.

<b>8 </b>And it shall be, when ye have taken the city, <i>that</i> ye shall set the city on fire: according to the commandment of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall ye do. See, I have commanded you.

<b>9 </b>¶ Joshua therefore sent them forth: and they went to lie in ambush, and abode between Beth-el and Ai, on the west side of Ai: but Joshua lodged that night among the people.

<b>10 </b>And Joshua rose up early in the morning, and numbered the people, and went up, he and the elders of Israel, before the people to Ai.

<b>11 </b>And all the people, <i>even the people</i> of war that <i>were</i> with him, went up, and drew nigh, and came before the city, and pitched on the north side of Ai: now <i>there was</i> a valley between them and Ai.

<b>12 </b>And he took about five thousand men, and set them to lie in ambush between Beth-el and Ai, on the west side of the city.

<b>13 </b>And when they had set the people, <i>even</i> all the host that <i>was</i> on the north of the city, and their liers in wait on the west of the city, Joshua went that night into the midst of the valley.

<b>14 </b>¶ And it came to pass, when the king of Ai saw <i>it,</i> that they hasted and rose up early, and the men of the city went out against Israel to battle, he and all his people, at a time appointed, before the plain; but he wist not that <i>there were</i> liers in ambush against him behind the city.

<b>15 </b>And Joshua and all Israel made as if they were beaten before them, and fled by the way of the wilderness.

<b>16 </b>And all the people that <i>were</i> in Ai were called together to pursue after them: and they pursued after Joshua, and were drawn away from the city.

<b>17 </b>And there was not a man left in Ai or Beth-el, that went not out after Israel: and they left the city open, and pursued after Israel.

<b>18 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Joshua, Stretch out the spear that <i>is</i> in thy hand toward Ai; for I will give it into thine hand. And Joshua stretched out the spear that <i>he had</i> in his hand toward the city.

<b>19 </b>And the ambush arose quickly out of their place, and they ran as soon as he had stretched out his hand: and they entered into the city, and took it, and hasted and set the city on fire.

<b>20 </b>And when the men of Ai looked behind them, they saw, and, behold, the smoke of the city ascended up to heaven, and they had no power to flee this way or that way: and the people that fled to the wilderness turned back upon the pursuers.

<b>21 </b>And when Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had taken the city, and that the smoke of the city ascended, then they turned again, and slew the men of Ai.

<b>22 </b>And the other issued out of the city against them; so they were in the midst of Israel, some on this side, and some on that side: and they smote them, so that they let none of them remain or escape.

<b>23 </b>And the king of Ai they took alive, and brought him to Joshua.

<b>24 </b>And it came to pass, when Israel had made an end of slaying all the inhabitants of Ai in the field, in the wilderness wherein they chased them, and when they were all fallen on the edge of the sword, until they were consumed, that all the Israelites returned unto Ai, and smote it with the edge of the sword.

<b>25 </b>And <i>so</i> it was, <i>that</i> all that fell that day, both of men and women, <i>were</i> twelve thousand, <i>even</i> all the men of Ai.

<b>26 </b>For Joshua drew not his hand back, wherewith he stretched out the spear, until he had utterly destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.

<b>27 </b>Only the cattle and the spoil of that city Israel took for a prey unto themselves, according unto the word of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> which he commanded Joshua.

<b>28 </b>And Joshua burnt Ai, and made it an heap for ever, <i>even</i> a desolation unto this day.

<b>29 </b>And the king of Ai he hanged on a tree until eventide: and as soon as the sun was down, Joshua commanded that they should take his carcase down from the tree, and cast it at the entering of the gate of the city, and raise thereon a great heap of stones, <i>that remaineth</i> unto this day.

<b>30 </b>¶ Then Joshua built an altar unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel in mount Ebal,

<b>31 </b>As Moses the servant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded the children of Israel, as it is written in the book of the law of Moses, an altar of whole stones, over which no man hath lift up <i>any</i> iron: and they offered thereon burnt offerings unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and sacrificed peace offerings.

<b>32 </b>¶ And he wrote there upon the stones a copy of the law of Moses, which he wrote in the presence of the children of Israel.

<b>33 </b>And all Israel, and their elders, and officers, and their judges, stood on this side the ark and on that side before the priests the Levites, which bare the ark of the covenant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, as well the stranger, as he that was born among them; half of them over against mount Gerizim, and half of them over against mount Ebal; as Moses the servant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had commanded before, that they should bless the people of Israel.

<b>34 </b>And afterward he read all the words of the law, the blessings and cursings, according to all that is written in the book of the law.

<b>35 </b>There was not a word of all that Moses commanded, which Joshua read not before all the congregation of Israel, with the women, and the little ones, and the strangers that were conversant among them.


--------------------

CHAPTER 9

<b>1 </b>And it came to pass, when all the kings which <i>were</i> on this side Jordan, in the hills, and in the valleys, and in all the coasts of the great sea over against Lebanon, the Hittite, and the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite, heard <i>thereof;</i>

<b>2 </b>That they gathered themselves together, to fight with Joshua and with Israel, with one accord.

<b>3 </b>¶ And when the inhabitants of Gibeon heard what Joshua had done unto Jericho and to Ai,

<b>4 </b>They did work wilily, and went and made as if they had been ambassadors, and took old sacks upon their asses, and wine bottles, old, and rent, and bound up;

<b>5 </b>And old shoes and clouted upon their feet, and old garments upon them; and all the bread of their provision was dry <i>and</i> mouldy.

<b>6 </b>And they went to Joshua unto the camp at Gilgal, and said unto him, and to the men of Israel, We be come from a far country: now therefore make ye a league with us.

<b>7 </b>And the men of Israel said unto the Hivites, Peradventure ye dwell among us; and how shall we make a league with you?

<b>8 </b>And they said unto Joshua, We <i>are</i> thy servants. And Joshua said unto them, Who <i>are</i> ye? and from whence come ye?

<b>9 </b>And they said unto him, From a very far country thy servants are come because of the name of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> thy God: for we have heard the fame of him, and all that he did in Egypt,

<b>10 </b>And all that he did to the two kings of the Amorites, that <i>were</i> beyond Jordan, to Sihon king of Heshbon, and to Og king of Bashan, which <i>was</i> at Ashtaroth.

<b>11 </b>Wherefore our elders and all the inhabitants of our country spake to us, saying, Take victuals with you for the journey, and go to meet them, and say unto them, We <i>are</i> your servants: therefore now make ye a league with us.

<b>12 </b>This our bread we took hot <i>for</i> our provision out of our houses on the day we came forth to go unto you; but now, behold, it is dry, and it is mouldy:

<b>13 </b>And these bottles of wine, which we filled, <i>were</i> new; and, behold, they be rent: and these our garments and our shoes are become old by reason of the very long journey.

<b>14 </b>And the men took of their victuals, and asked not <i>counsel</i> at the mouth of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>15 </b>And Joshua made peace with them, and made a league with them, to let them live: and the princes of the congregation sware unto them.

<b>16 </b>¶ And it came to pass at the end of three days after they had made a league with them, that they heard that they <i>were</i> their neighbours, and <i>that</i> they dwelt among them.

<b>17 </b>And the children of Israel journeyed, and came unto their cities on the third day. Now their cities <i>were</i> Gibeon, and Chephirah, and Beeroth, and Kirjath-jearim.

<b>18 </b>And the children of Israel smote them not, because the princes of the congregation had sworn unto them by the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel. And all the congregation murmured against the princes.

<b>19 </b>But all the princes said unto all the congregation, We have sworn unto them by the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel: now therefore we may not touch them.

<b>20 </b>This we will do to them; we will even let them live, lest wrath be upon us, because of the oath which we sware unto them.

<b>21 </b>And the princes said unto them, Let them live; but let them be hewers of wood and drawers of water unto all the congregation; as the princes had promised them.

<b>22 </b>¶ And Joshua called for them, and he spake unto them, saying, Wherefore have ye beguiled us, saying, We <i>are</i> very far from you; when ye dwell among us?

<b>23 </b>Now therefore ye <i>are</i> cursed, and there shall none of you be freed from being bondmen, and hewers of wood and drawers of water for the house of my God.

<b>24 </b>And they answered Joshua, and said, Because it was certainly told thy servants, how that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> thy God commanded his servant Moses to give you all the land, and to destroy all the inhabitants of the land from before you, therefore we were sore afraid of our lives because of you, and have done this thing.

<b>25 </b>And now, behold, we <i>are</i> in thine hand: as it seemeth good and right unto thee to do unto us, do.

<b>26 </b>And so did he unto them, and delivered them out of the hand of the children of Israel, that they slew them not.

<b>27 </b>And Joshua made them that day hewers of wood and drawers of water for the congregation, and for the altar of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, even unto this day, in the place which he should choose.


--------------------

CHAPTER 10

<b>1 </b>Now it came to pass, when Adoni-zedek king of Jerusalem had heard how Joshua had taken Ai, and had utterly destroyed it; as he had done to Jericho and her king, so he had done to Ai and her king; and how the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel, and were among them;

<b>2 </b>That they feared greatly, because Gibeon <i>was</i> a great city, as one of the royal cities, and because it <i>was</i> greater than Ai, and all the men thereof <i>were</i> mighty.

<b>3 </b>Wherefore Adoni-zedek king of Jerusalem sent unto Hoham king of Hebron, and unto Piram king of Jarmuth, and unto Japhia king of Lachish, and unto Debir king of Eglon, saying,

<b>4 </b>Come up unto me, and help me, that we may smite Gibeon: for it hath made peace with Joshua and with the children of Israel.

<b>5 </b>Therefore the five kings of the Amorites, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, the king of Eglon, gathered themselves together, and went up, they and all their hosts, and encamped before Gibeon, and made war against it.

<b>6 </b>¶ And the men of Gibeon sent unto Joshua to the camp to Gilgal, saying, Slack not thy hand from thy servants; come up to us quickly, and save us, and help us: for all the kings of the Amorites that dwell in the mountains are gathered together against us.

<b>7 </b>So Joshua ascended from Gilgal, he, and all the people of war with him, and all the mighty men of valour.

<b>8 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Joshua, Fear them not: for I have delivered them into thine hand; there shall not a man of them stand before thee.

<b>9 </b>Joshua therefore came unto them suddenly, <i>and</i> went up from Gilgal all night.

<b>10 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> discomfited them before Israel, and slew them with a great slaughter at Gibeon, and chased them along the way that goeth up to Beth-horon, and smote them to Azekah, and unto Makkedah.

<b>11 </b>And it came to pass, as they fled from before Israel, <i>and</i> were in the going down to Beth-horon, that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> cast down great stones from heaven upon them unto Azekah, and they died: <i>they were</i> more which died with hailstones than <i>they</i> whom the children of Israel slew with the sword.

<b>12 </b>¶ Then spake Joshua to the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in the day when the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> delivered up the Amorites before the children of Israel, and he said in the sight of Israel, Sun, stand thou still upon Gibeon; and thou, Moon, in the valley of Ajalon.

<b>13 </b>And the sun stood still, and the moon stayed, until the people had avenged themselves upon their enemies. <i>Is</i> not this written in the book of Jasher? So the sun stood still in the midst of heaven, and hasted not to go down about a whole day.

<b>14 </b>And there was no day like that before it or after it, that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hearkened unto the voice of a man: for the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> fought for Israel.

<b>15 </b>¶ And Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, unto the camp to Gilgal.

<b>16 </b>But these five kings fled, and hid themselves in a cave at Makkedah.

<b>17 </b>And it was told Joshua, saying, The five kings are found hid in a cave at Makkedah.

<b>18 </b>And Joshua said, Roll great stones upon the mouth of the cave, and set men by it for to keep them:

<b>19 </b>And stay ye not, <i>but</i> pursue after your enemies, and smite the hindmost of them; suffer them not to enter into their cities: for the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God hath delivered them into your hand.

<b>20 </b>And it came to pass, when Joshua and the children of Israel had made an end of slaying them with a very great slaughter, till they were consumed, that the rest <i>which</i> remained of them entered into fenced cities.

<b>21 </b>And all the people returned to the camp to Joshua at Makkedah in peace: none moved his tongue against any of the children of Israel.

<b>22 </b>Then said Joshua, Open the mouth of the cave, and bring out those five kings unto me out of the cave.

<b>23 </b>And they did so, and brought forth those five kings unto him out of the cave, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, <i>and</i> the king of Eglon.

<b>24 </b>And it came to pass, when they brought out those kings unto Joshua, that Joshua called for all the men of Israel, and said unto the captains of the men of war which went with him, Come near, put your feet upon the necks of these kings. And they came near, and put their feet upon the necks of them.

<b>25 </b>And Joshua said unto them, Fear not, nor be dismayed, be strong and of good courage: for thus shall the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> do to all your enemies against whom ye fight.

<b>26 </b>And afterward Joshua smote them, and slew them, and hanged them on five trees: and they were hanging upon the trees until the evening.

<b>27 </b>And it came to pass at the time of the going down of the sun, <i>that</i> Joshua commanded, and they took them down off the trees, and cast them into the cave wherein they had been hid, and laid great stones in the cave’s mouth, <i>which remain</i> until this very day.

<b>28 </b>¶ And that day Joshua took Makkedah, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and the king thereof he utterly destroyed, them, and all the souls that <i>were</i> therein; he let none remain: and he did to the king of Makkedah as he did unto the king of Jericho.

<b>29 </b>Then Joshua passed from Makkedah, and all Israel with him, unto Libnah, and fought against Libnah:

<b>30 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> delivered it also, and the king thereof, into the hand of Israel; and he smote it with the edge of the sword, and all the souls that <i>were</i> therein; he let none remain in it; but did unto the king thereof as he did unto the king of Jericho.

<b>31 </b>¶ And Joshua passed from Libnah, and all Israel with him, unto Lachish, and encamped against it, and fought against it:

<b>32 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> delivered Lachish into the hand of Israel, which took it on the second day, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and all the souls that <i>were</i> therein, according to all that he had done to Libnah.

<b>33 </b>¶ Then Horam king of Gezer came up to help Lachish; and Joshua smote him and his people, until he had left him none remaining.

<b>34 </b>¶ And from Lachish Joshua passed unto Eglon, and all Israel with him; and they encamped against it, and fought against it:

<b>35 </b>And they took it on that day, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and all the souls that <i>were</i> therein he utterly destroyed that day, according to all that he had done to Lachish.

<b>36 </b>And Joshua went up from Eglon, and all Israel with him, unto Hebron; and they fought against it:

<b>37 </b>And they took it, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and the king thereof, and all the cities thereof, and all the souls that <i>were</i> therein; he left none remaining, according to all that he had done to Eglon; but destroyed it utterly, and all the souls that <i>were</i> therein.

<b>38 </b>¶ And Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, to Debir; and fought against it:

<b>39 </b>And he took it, and the king thereof, and all the cities thereof; and they smote them with the edge of the sword, and utterly destroyed all the souls that <i>were</i> therein; he left none remaining: as he had done to Hebron, so he did to Debir, and to the king thereof; as he had done also to Libnah, and to her king.

<b>40 </b>¶ So Joshua smote all the country of the hills, and of the south, and of the vale, and of the springs, and all their kings: he left none remaining, but utterly destroyed all that breathed, as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel commanded.

<b>41 </b>And Joshua smote them from Kadesh-barnea even unto Gaza, and all the country of Goshen, even unto Gibeon.

<b>42 </b>And all these kings and their land did Joshua take at one time, because the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel fought for Israel.

<b>43 </b>And Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, unto the camp to Gilgal.


--------------------

CHAPTER 11

<b>1 </b>And it came to pass, when Jabin king of Hazor had heard <i>those things,</i> that he sent to Jobab king of Madon, and to the king of Shimron, and to the king of Achshaph,

<b>2 </b>And to the kings that <i>were</i> on the north of the mountains, and of the plains south of Chinneroth, and in the valley, and in the borders of Dor on the west,

<b>3 </b><i>And to</i> the Canaanite on the east and on the west, and <i>to</i> the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Jebusite in the mountains, and <i>to</i> the Hivite under Hermon in the land of Mizpeh.

<b>4 </b>And they went out, they and all their hosts with them, much people, even as the sand that <i>is</i> upon the sea shore in multitude, with horses and chariots very many.

<b>5 </b>And when all these kings were met together, they came and pitched together at the waters of Merom, to fight against Israel.

<b>6 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Joshua, Be not afraid because of them: for to morrow about this time will I deliver them up all slain before Israel: thou shalt hough their horses, and burn their chariots with fire.

<b>7 </b>So Joshua came, and all the people of war with him, against them by the waters of Merom suddenly; and they fell upon them.

<b>8 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> delivered them into the hand of Israel, who smote them, and chased them unto great Zidon, and unto Misrephoth-maim, and unto the valley of Mizpeh eastward; and they smote them, until they left them none remaining.

<b>9 </b>And Joshua did unto them as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> bade him: he houghed their horses, and burnt their chariots with fire.

<b>10 </b>¶ And Joshua at that time turned back, and took Hazor, and smote the king thereof with the sword: for Hazor beforetime was the head of all those kingdoms.

<b>11 </b>And they smote all the souls that <i>were</i> therein with the edge of the sword, utterly destroying <i>them:</i> there was not any left to breathe: and he burnt Hazor with fire.

<b>12 </b>And all the cities of those kings, and all the kings of them, did Joshua take, and smote them with the edge of the sword, <i>and</i> he utterly destroyed them, as Moses the servant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded.

<b>13 </b>But <i>as for</i> the cities that stood still in their strength, Israel burned none of them, save Hazor only; <i>that</i> did Joshua burn.

<b>14 </b>And all the spoil of these cities, and the cattle, the children of Israel took for a prey unto themselves; but every man they smote with the edge of the sword, until they had destroyed them, neither left they any to breathe.

<b>15 </b>¶ As the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses his servant, so did Moses command Joshua, and so did Joshua; he left nothing undone of all that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>16 </b>So Joshua took all that land, the hills, and all the south country, and all the land of Goshen, and the valley, and the plain, and the mountain of Israel, and the valley of the same;

<b>17 </b><i>Even</i> from the mount Halak, that goeth up to Seir, even unto Baal-gad in the valley of Lebanon under mount Hermon: and all their kings he took, and smote them, and slew them.

<b>18 </b>Joshua made war a long time with all those kings.

<b>19 </b>There was not a city that made peace with the children of Israel, save the Hivites the inhabitants of Gibeon: all <i>other</i> they took in battle.

<b>20 </b>For it was of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> to harden their hearts, that they should come against Israel in battle, that he might destroy them utterly, <i>and</i> that they might have no favour, but that he might destroy them, as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses.

<b>21 </b>¶ And at that time came Joshua, and cut off the Anakims from the mountains, from Hebron, from Debir, from Anab, and from all the mountains of Judah, and from all the mountains of Israel: Joshua destroyed them utterly with their cities.

<b>22 </b>There was none of the Anakims left in the land of the children of Israel: only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod, there remained.

<b>23 </b>So Joshua took the whole land, according to all that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Moses; and Joshua gave it for an inheritance unto Israel according to their divisions by their tribes. And the land rested from war.


--------------------

CHAPTER 12

<b>1 </b>Now these <i>are</i> the kings of the land, which the children of Israel smote, and possessed their land on the other side Jordan toward the rising of the sun, from the river Arnon unto mount Hermon, and all the plain on the east:

<b>2 </b>Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon, <i>and</i> ruled from Aroer, which <i>is</i> upon the bank of the river Arnon, and from the middle of the river, and from half Gilead, even unto the river Jabbok, <i>which is</i> the border of the children of Ammon;

<b>3 </b>And from the plain to the sea of Chinneroth on the east, and unto the sea of the plain, <i>even</i> the salt sea on the east, the way to Beth-jeshimoth; and from the south, under Ashdoth-pisgah:

<b>4 </b>¶ And the coast of Og king of Bashan, <i>which was</i> of the remnant of the giants, that dwelt at Ashtaroth and at Edrei,

<b>5 </b>And reigned in mount Hermon, and in Salcah, and in all Bashan, unto the border of the Geshurites and the Maachathites, and half Gilead, the border of Sihon king of Heshbon.

<b>6 </b>Them did Moses the servant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> and the children of Israel smite: and Moses the servant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> gave it <i>for</i> a possession unto the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh.

<b>7 </b>¶ And these <i>are</i> the kings of the country which Joshua and the children of Israel smote on this side Jordan on the west, from Baal-gad in the valley of Lebanon even unto the mount Halak, that goeth up to Seir; which Joshua gave unto the tribes of Israel <i>for</i> a possession according to their divisions;

<b>8 </b>In the mountains, and in the valleys, and in the plains, and in the springs, and in the wilderness, and in the south country; the Hittites, the Amorites, and the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites:

<b>9 </b>¶ The king of Jericho, one; the king of Ai, which <i>is</i> beside Beth-el, one;

<b>10 </b>The king of Jerusalem, one; the king of Hebron, one;

<b>11 </b>The king of Jarmuth, one; the king of Lachish, one;

<b>12 </b>The king of Eglon, one; the king of Gezer, one;

<b>13 </b>The king of Debir, one; the king of Geder, one;

<b>14 </b>The king of Hormah, one; the king of Arad, one;

<b>15 </b>The king of Libnah, one; the king of Adullam, one;

<b>16 </b>The king of Makkedah, one; the king of Beth-el, one;

<b>17 </b>The king of Tappuah, one; the king of Hepher, one;

<b>18 </b>The king of Aphek, one; the king of Lasharon, one;

<b>19 </b>The king of Madon, one; the king of Hazor, one;

<b>20 </b>The king of Shimron-meron, one; the king of Achshaph, one;

<b>21 </b>The king of Taanach, one; the king of Megiddo, one;

<b>22 </b>The king of Kedesh, one; the king of Jokneam of Carmel, one;

<b>23 </b>The king of Dor in the coast of Dor, one; the king of the nations of Gilgal, one;

<b>24 </b>The king of Tirzah, one: all the kings thirty and one.


--------------------

CHAPTER 13

<b>1 </b>Now Joshua was old <i>and</i> stricken in years; and the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto him, Thou art old <i>and</i> stricken in years, and there remaineth yet very much land to be possessed.

<b>2 </b>This <i>is</i> the land that yet remaineth: all the borders of the Philistines, and all Geshuri,

<b>3 </b>From Sihor, which <i>is</i> before Egypt, even unto the borders of Ekron northward, <i>which</i> is counted to the Canaanite: five lords of the Philistines; the Gazathites, and the Ashdothites, the Eshkalonites, the Gittites, and the Ekronites; also the Avites:

<b>4 </b>From the south, all the land of the Canaanites, and Mearah that <i>is</i> beside the Sidonians, unto Aphek, to the borders of the Amorites:

<b>5 </b>And the land of the Giblites, and all Lebanon, toward the sunrising, from Baal-gad under mount Hermon unto the entering into Hamath.

<b>6 </b>All the inhabitants of the hill country from Lebanon unto Misrephoth-maim, <i>and</i> all the Sidonians, them will I drive out from before the children of Israel: only divide thou it by lot unto the Israelites for an inheritance, as I have commanded thee.

<b>7 </b>Now therefore divide this land for an inheritance unto the nine tribes, and the half tribe of Manasseh,

<b>8 </b>With whom the Reubenites and the Gadites have received their inheritance, which Moses gave them, beyond Jordan eastward, <i>even</i> as Moses the servant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> gave them;

<b>9 </b>From Aroer, that <i>is</i> upon the bank of the river Arnon, and the city that <i>is</i> in the midst of the river, and all the plain of Medeba unto Dibon;

<b>10 </b>And all the cities of Sihon king of the Amorites, which reigned in Heshbon, unto the border of the children of Ammon;

<b>11 </b>And Gilead, and the border of the Geshurites and Maachathites, and all mount Hermon, and all Bashan unto Salcah;

<b>12 </b>All the kingdom of Og in Bashan, which reigned in Ashtaroth and in Edrei, who remained of the remnant of the giants: for these did Moses smite, and cast them out.

<b>13 </b>Nevertheless the children of Israel expelled not the Geshurites, nor the Maachathites: but the Geshurites and the Maachathites dwell among the Israelites until this day.

<b>14 </b>Only unto the tribe of Levi he gave none inheritance; the sacrifices of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel made by fire <i>are</i> their inheritance, as he said unto them.

<b>15 </b>¶ And Moses gave unto the tribe of the children of Reuben <i>inheritance</i> according to their families.

<b>16 </b>And their coast was from Aroer, that <i>is</i> on the bank of the river Arnon, and the city that <i>is</i> in the midst of the river, and all the plain by Medeba;

<b>17 </b>Heshbon, and all her cities that <i>are</i> in the plain; Dibon, and Bamoth-baal, and Beth-baal-meon,

<b>18 </b>And Jahazah, and Kedemoth, and Mephaath,

<b>19 </b>And Kirjathaim, and Sibmah, and Zareth-shahar in the mount of the valley,

<b>20 </b>And Beth-peor, and Ashdoth-pisgah, and Beth-jeshimoth,

<b>21 </b>And all the cities of the plain, and all the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, which reigned in Heshbon, whom Moses smote with the princes of Midian, Evi, and Rekem, and Zur, and Hur, and Reba, <i>which were</i> dukes of Sihon, dwelling in the country.

<b>22 </b>¶ Balaam also the son of Beor, the soothsayer, did the children of Israel slay with the sword among them that were slain by them.

<b>23 </b>And the border of the children of Reuben was Jordan, and the border <i>thereof.</i> This <i>was</i> the inheritance of the children of Reuben after their families, the cities and the villages thereof.

<b>24 </b>And Moses gave <i>inheritance</i> unto the tribe of Gad, <i>even</i> unto the children of Gad according to their families.

<b>25 </b>And their coast was Jazer, and all the cities of Gilead, and half the land of the children of Ammon, unto Aroer that <i>is</i> before Rabbah;

<b>26 </b>And from Heshbon unto Ramath-mizpeh, and Betonim; and from Mahanaim unto the border of Debir;
