<b>27 </b>And in the valley, Beth-aram, and Beth-nimrah, and Succoth, and Zaphon, the rest of the kingdom of Sihon king of Heshbon, Jordan and <i>his</i> border, <i>even</i> unto the edge of the sea of Chinnereth on the other side Jordan eastward.

<b>28 </b>This <i>is</i> the inheritance of the children of Gad after their families, the cities, and their villages.

<b>29 </b>¶ And Moses gave <i>inheritance</i> unto the half tribe of Manasseh: and <i>this</i> was <i>the possession</i> of the half tribe of the children of Manasseh by their families.

<b>30 </b>And their coast was from Mahanaim, all Bashan, all the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, and all the towns of Jair, which <i>are</i> in Bashan, threescore cities:

<b>31 </b>And half Gilead, and Ashtaroth, and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan, <i>were pertaining</i> unto the children of Machir the son of Manasseh, <i>even</i> to the one half of the children of Machir by their families.

<b>32 </b>These <i>are the countries</i> which Moses did distribute for inheritance in the plains of Moab, on the other side Jordan, by Jericho, eastward.

<b>33 </b>But unto the tribe of Levi Moses gave not <i>any</i> inheritance: the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel <i>was</i> their inheritance, as he said unto them.


--------------------

CHAPTER 14

<b>1 </b>And these <i>are the countries</i> which the children of Israel inherited in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel, distributed for inheritance to them.

<b>2 </b>By lot <i>was</i> their inheritance, as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded by the hand of Moses, for the nine tribes, and <i>for</i> the half tribe.

<b>3 </b>For Moses had given the inheritance of two tribes and an half tribe on the other side Jordan: but unto the Levites he gave none inheritance among them.

<b>4 </b>For the children of Joseph were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim: therefore they gave no part unto the Levites in the land, save cities to dwell <i>in,</i> with their suburbs for their cattle and for their substance.

<b>5 </b>As the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did, and they divided the land.

<b>6 </b>¶ Then the children of Judah came unto Joshua in Gilgal: and Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenezite said unto him, Thou knowest the thing that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto Moses the man of God concerning me and thee in Kadesh-barnea.

<b>7 </b>Forty years old <i>was</i> I when Moses the servant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> sent me from Kadesh-barnea to espy out the land; and I brought him word again as <i>it was</i> in mine heart.

<b>8 </b>Nevertheless my brethren that went up with me made the heart of the people melt: but I wholly followed the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> my God.

<b>9 </b>And Moses sware on that day, saying, Surely the land whereon thy feet have trodden shall be thine inheritance, and thy children’s for ever, because thou hast wholly followed the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> my God.

<b>10 </b>And now, behold, the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath kept me alive, as he said, these forty and five years, even since the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake this word unto Moses, while <i>the children of</i> Israel wandered in the wilderness: and now, lo, I <i>am</i> this day fourscore and five years old.

<b>11 </b>As yet I <i>am as</i> strong this day as <i>I was</i> in the day that Moses sent me: as my strength <i>was</i> then, even so <i>is</i> my strength now, for war, both to go out, and to come in.

<b>12 </b>Now therefore give me this mountain, whereof the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake in that day; for thou heardest in that day how the Anakims <i>were</i> there, and <i>that</i> the cities <i>were</i> great <i>and</i> fenced: if so be the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>will be</i> with me, then I shall be able to drive them out, as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said.

<b>13 </b>And Joshua blessed him, and gave unto Caleb the son of Jephunneh Hebron for an inheritance.

<b>14 </b>Hebron therefore became the inheritance of Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenezite unto this day, because that he wholly followed the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel.

<b>15 </b>And the name of Hebron before <i>was</i> Kirjath-arba; <i>which Arba was</i> a great man among the Anakims. And the land had rest from war.


--------------------

CHAPTER 15

<b>1 </b><i>This</i> then was the lot of the tribe of the children of Judah by their families; <i>even</i> to the border of Edom the wilderness of Zin southward <i>was</i> the uttermost part of the south coast.

<b>2 </b>And their south border was from the shore of the salt sea, from the bay that looketh southward:

<b>3 </b>And it went out to the south side to Maaleh-acrabbim, and passed along to Zin, and ascended up on the south side unto Kadesh-barnea, and passed along to Hezron, and went up to Adar, and fetched a compass to Karkaa:

<b>4 </b><i>From thence</i> it passed toward Azmon, and went out unto the river of Egypt; and the goings out of that coast were at the sea: this shall be your south coast.

<b>5 </b>And the east border <i>was</i> the salt sea, <i>even</i> unto the end of Jordan. And <i>their</i> border in the north quarter <i>was</i> from the bay of the sea at the uttermost part of Jordan:

<b>6 </b>And the border went up to Beth-hogla, and passed along by the north of Beth-arabah; and the border went up to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben:

<b>7 </b>And the border went up toward Debir from the valley of Achor, and so northward, looking toward Gilgal, that <i>is</i> before the going up to Adummim, which <i>is</i> on the south side of the river: and the border passed toward the waters of En-shemesh, and the goings out thereof were at En-rogel:

<b>8 </b>And the border went up by the valley of the son of Hinnom unto the south side of the Jebusite; the same <i>is</i> Jerusalem: and the border went up to the top of the mountain that <i>lieth</i> before the valley of Hinnom westward, which <i>is</i> at the end of the valley of the giants northward:

<b>9 </b>And the border was drawn from the top of the hill unto the fountain of the water of Nephtoah, and went out to the cities of mount Ephron; and the border was drawn to Baalah, which <i>is</i> Kirjath-jearim:

<b>10 </b>And the border compassed from Baalah westward unto mount Seir, and passed along unto the side of mount Jearim, which <i>is</i> Chesalon, on the north side, and went down to Beth-shemesh, and passed on to Timnah:

<b>11 </b>And the border went out unto the side of Ekron northward: and the border was drawn to Shicron, and passed along to mount Baalah, and went out unto Jabneel; and the goings out of the border were at the sea.

<b>12 </b>And the west border <i>was</i> to the great sea, and the coast <i>thereof.</i> This <i>is</i> the coast of the children of Judah round about according to their families.

<b>13 </b>¶ And unto Caleb the son of Jephunneh he gave a part among the children of Judah, according to the commandment of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> to Joshua, <i>even</i> the city of Arba the father of Anak, which <i>city is</i> Hebron.

<b>14 </b>And Caleb drove thence the three sons of Anak, Sheshai, and Ahiman, and Talmai, the children of Anak.

<b>15 </b>And he went up thence to the inhabitants of Debir: and the name of Debir before <i>was</i> Kirjath-sepher.

<b>16 </b>¶ And Caleb said, He that smiteth Kirjath-sepher, and taketh it, to him will I give Achsah my daughter to wife.

<b>17 </b>And Othniel the son of Kenaz, the brother of Caleb, took it: and he gave him Achsah his daughter to wife.

<b>18 </b>And it came to pass, as she came <i>unto him,</i> that she moved him to ask of her father a field: and she lighted off <i>her</i> ass; and Caleb said unto her, What wouldest thou?

<b>19 </b>Who answered, Give me a blessing; for thou hast given me a south land; give me also springs of water. And he gave her the upper springs, and the nether springs.

<b>20 </b>This <i>is</i> the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Judah according to their families.

<b>21 </b>And the uttermost cities of the tribe of the children of Judah toward the coast of Edom southward were Kabzeel, and Eder, and Jagur,

<b>22 </b>And Kinah, and Dimonah, and Adadah,

<b>23 </b>And Kedesh, and Hazor, and Ithnan,

<b>24 </b>Ziph, and Telem, and Bealoth,

<b>25 </b>And Hazor, Hadattah, and Kerioth, <i>and</i> Hezron, which <i>is</i> Hazor,

<b>26 </b>Amam, and Shema, and Moladah,

<b>27 </b>And Hazar-gaddah, and Heshmon, and Beth-palet,

<b>28 </b>And Hazar-shual, and Beer-sheba, and Bizjothjah,

<b>29 </b>Baalah, and Iim, and Azem,

<b>30 </b>And Eltolad, and Chesil, and Hormah,

<b>31 </b>And Ziklag, and Madmannah, and Sansannah,

<b>32 </b>And Lebaoth, and Shilhim, and Ain, and Rimmon: all the cities <i>are</i> twenty and nine, with their villages:

<b>33 </b><i>And</i> in the valley, Eshtaol, and Zoreah, and Ashnah,

<b>34 </b>And Zanoah, and En-gannim, Tappuah, and Enam,

<b>35 </b>Jarmuth, and Adullam, Socoh, and Azekah,

<b>36 </b>And Sharaim, and Adithaim, and Gederah, and Gederothaim; fourteen cities with their villages:

<b>37 </b>Zenan, and Hadashah, and Migdal-gad,

<b>38 </b>And Dilean, and Mizpeh, and Joktheel,

<b>39 </b>Lachish, and Bozkath, and Eglon,

<b>40 </b>And Cabbon, and Lahmam, and Kithlish,

<b>41 </b>And Gederoth, Beth-dagon, and Naamah, and Makkedah; sixteen cities with their villages:

<b>42 </b>Libnah, and Ether, and Ashan,

<b>43 </b>And Jiphtah, and Ashnah, and Nezib,

<b>44 </b>And Keilah, and Achzib, and Mareshah; nine cities with their villages:

<b>45 </b>Ekron, with her towns and her villages:

<b>46 </b>From Ekron even unto the sea, all that <i>lay</i> near Ashdod, with their villages:

<b>47 </b>Ashdod with her towns and her villages, Gaza with her towns and her villages, unto the river of Egypt, and the great sea, and the border <i>thereof:</i>

<b>48 </b>¶ And in the mountains, Shamir, and Jattir, and Socoh,

<b>49 </b>And Dannah, and Kirjath-sannah, which <i>is</i> Debir,

<b>50 </b>And Anab, and Eshtemoh, and Anim,

<b>51 </b>And Goshen, and Holon, and Giloh; eleven cities with their villages:

<b>52 </b>Arab, and Dumah, and Eshean,

<b>53 </b>And Janum, and Beth-tappuah, and Aphekah,

<b>54 </b>And Humtah, and Kirjath-arba, which <i>is</i> Hebron, and Zior; nine cities with their villages:

<b>55 </b>Maon, Carmel, and Ziph, and Juttah,

<b>56 </b>And Jezreel, and Jokdeam, and Zanoah,

<b>57 </b>Cain, Gibeah, and Timnah; ten cities with their villages:

<b>58 </b>Halhul, Beth-zur, and Gedor,

<b>59 </b>And Maarath, and Beth-anoth, and Eltekon; six cities with their villages:

<b>60 </b>Kirjath-baal, which <i>is</i> Kirjath-jearim, and Rabbah; two cities with their villages:

<b>61 </b>In the wilderness, Beth-arabah, Middin, and Secacah,

<b>62 </b>And Nibshan, and the city of Salt, and En-gedi; six cities with their villages.

<b>63 </b>¶ As for the Jebusites the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the children of Judah could not drive them out: but the Jebusites dwell with the children of Judah at Jerusalem unto this day.


--------------------

CHAPTER 16

<b>1 </b>And the lot of the children of Joseph fell from Jordan by Jericho, unto the water of Jericho on the east, to the wilderness that goeth up from Jericho throughout mount Beth-el,

<b>2 </b>And goeth out from Beth-el to Luz, and passeth along unto the borders of Archi to Ataroth,

<b>3 </b>And goeth down westward to the coast of Japhleti, unto the coast of Beth-horon the nether, and to Gezer: and the goings out thereof are at the sea.

<b>4 </b>So the children of Joseph, Manasseh and Ephraim, took their inheritance.

<b>5 </b>¶ And the border of the children of Ephraim according to their families was <i>thus:</i> even the border of their inheritance on the east side was Ataroth-addar, unto Beth-horon the upper;

<b>6 </b>And the border went out toward the sea to Michmethah on the north side; and the border went about eastward unto Taanath-shiloh, and passed by it on the east to Janohah;

<b>7 </b>And it went down from Janohah to Ataroth, and to Naarath, and came to Jericho, and went out at Jordan.

<b>8 </b>The border went out from Tappuah westward unto the river Kanah; and the goings out thereof were at the sea. This <i>is</i> the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Ephraim by their families.

<b>9 </b>And the separate cities for the children of Ephraim <i>were</i> among the inheritance of the children of Manasseh, all the cities with their villages.

<b>10 </b>And they drave not out the Canaanites that dwelt in Gezer: but the Canaanites dwell among the Ephraimites unto this day, and serve under tribute.


--------------------

CHAPTER 17

<b>1 </b>There was also a lot for the tribe of Manasseh; for he <i>was</i> the firstborn of Joseph; <i>to wit,</i> for Machir the firstborn of Manasseh, the father of Gilead: because he was a man of war, therefore he had Gilead and Bashan.

<b>2 </b>There was also <i>a lot</i> for the rest of the children of Manasseh by their families; for the children of Abiezer, and for the children of Helek, and for the children of Asriel, and for the children of Shechem, and for the children of Hepher, and for the children of Shemida: these <i>were</i> the male children of Manasseh the son of Joseph by their families.

<b>3 </b>¶ But Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, had no sons, but daughters: and these <i>are</i> the names of his daughters, Mahlah, and Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

<b>4 </b>And they came near before Eleazar the priest, and before Joshua the son of Nun, and before the princes, saying, The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded Moses to give us an inheritance among our brethren. Therefore according to the commandment of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> he gave them an inheritance among the brethren of their father.

<b>5 </b>And there fell ten portions to Manasseh, beside the land of Gilead and Bashan, which <i>were</i> on the other side Jordan;

<b>6 </b>Because the daughters of Manasseh had an inheritance among his sons: and the rest of Manasseh’s sons had the land of Gilead.

<b>7 </b>¶ And the coast of Manasseh was from Asher to Michmethah, that <i>lieth</i> before Shechem; and the border went along on the right hand unto the inhabitants of En-tappuah.

<b>8 </b><i>Now</i> Manasseh had the land of Tappuah: but Tappuah on the border of Manasseh <i>belonged</i> to the children of Ephraim;

<b>9 </b>And the coast descended unto the river Kanah, southward of the river: these cities of Ephraim <i>are</i> among the cities of Manasseh: the coast of Manasseh also <i>was</i> on the north side of the river, and the outgoings of it were at the sea:

<b>10 </b>Southward <i>it was</i> Ephraim’s, and northward <i>it was</i> Manasseh’s, and the sea is his border; and they met together in Asher on the north, and in Issachar on the east.

<b>11 </b>And Manasseh had in Issachar and in Asher Beth-shean and her towns, and Ibleam and her towns, and the inhabitants of Dor and her towns, and the inhabitants of En-dor and her towns, and the inhabitants of Taanach and her towns, and the inhabitants of Megiddo and her towns, <i>even</i> three countries.

<b>12 </b>Yet the children of Manasseh could not drive out <i>the inhabitants of</i> those cities; but the Canaanites would dwell in that land.

<b>13 </b>Yet it came to pass, when the children of Israel were waxen strong, that they put the Canaanites to tribute; but did not utterly drive them out.

<b>14 </b>And the children of Joseph spake unto Joshua, saying, Why hast thou given me <i>but</i> one lot and one portion to inherit, seeing I <i>am</i> a great people, forasmuch as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath blessed me hitherto?

<b>15 </b>And Joshua answered them, If thou <i>be</i> a great people, <i>then</i> get thee up to the wood <i>country,</i> and cut down for thyself there in the land of the Perizzites and of the giants, if mount Ephraim be too narrow for thee.

<b>16 </b>And the children of Joseph said, The hill is not enough for us: and all the Canaanites that dwell in the land of the valley have chariots of iron, <i>both they</i> who <i>are</i> of Beth-shean and her towns, and <i>they</i> who <i>are</i> of the valley of Jezreel.

<b>17 </b>And Joshua spake unto the house of Joseph, <i>even</i> to Ephraim and to Manasseh, saying, Thou <i>art</i> a great people, and hast great power: thou shalt not have one lot <i>only:</i>

<b>18 </b>But the mountain shall be thine; for it <i>is</i> a wood, and thou shalt cut it down: and the outgoings of it shall be thine: for thou shalt drive out the Canaanites, though they have iron chariots, <i>and</i> though they <i>be</i> strong.


--------------------

CHAPTER 18

<b>1 </b>And the whole congregation of the children of Israel assembled together at Shiloh, and set up the tabernacle of the congregation there. And the land was subdued before them.

<b>2 </b>And there remained among the children of Israel seven tribes, which had not yet received their inheritance.

<b>3 </b>And Joshua said unto the children of Israel, How long <i>are</i> ye slack to go to possess the land, which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of your fathers hath given you?

<b>4 </b>Give out from among you three men for <i>each</i> tribe: and I will send them, and they shall rise, and go through the land, and describe it according to the inheritance of them; and they shall come <i>again</i> to me.

<b>5 </b>And they shall divide it into seven parts: Judah shall abide in their coast on the south, and the house of Joseph shall abide in their coasts on the north.

<b>6 </b>Ye shall therefore describe the land <i>into</i> seven parts, and bring <i>the description</i> hither to me, that I may cast lots for you here before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> our God.

<b>7 </b>But the Levites have no part among you; for the priesthood of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>is</i> their inheritance: and Gad, and Reuben, and half the tribe of Manasseh, have received their inheritance beyond Jordan on the east, which Moses the servant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> gave them.

<b>8 </b>¶ And the men arose, and went away: and Joshua charged them that went to describe the land, saying, Go and walk through the land, and describe it, and come again to me, that I may here cast lots for you before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in Shiloh.

<b>9 </b>And the men went and passed through the land, and described it by cities into seven parts in a book, and came <i>again</i> to Joshua to the host at Shiloh.

<b>10 </b>¶ And Joshua cast lots for them in Shiloh before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: and there Joshua divided the land unto the children of Israel according to their divisions.

<b>11 </b>¶ And the lot of the tribe of the children of Benjamin came up according to their families: and the coast of their lot came forth between the children of Judah and the children of Joseph.

<b>12 </b>And their border on the north side was from Jordan; and the border went up to the side of Jericho on the north side, and went up through the mountains westward; and the goings out thereof were at the wilderness of Beth-aven.

<b>13 </b>And the border went over from thence toward Luz, to the side of Luz, which <i>is</i> Beth-el, southward; and the border descended to Ataroth-adar, near the hill that <i>lieth</i> on the south side of the nether Beth-horon.

<b>14 </b>And the border was drawn <i>thence,</i> and compassed the corner of the sea southward, from the hill that <i>lieth</i> before Beth-horon southward; and the goings out thereof were at Kirjath-baal, which <i>is</i> Kirjath-jearim, a city of the children of Judah: this <i>was</i> the west quarter.

<b>15 </b>And the south quarter <i>was</i> from the end of Kirjath-jearim, and the border went out on the west, and went out to the well of waters of Nephtoah:

<b>16 </b>And the border came down to the end of the mountain that <i>lieth</i> before the valley of the son of Hinnom, <i>and</i> which <i>is</i> in the valley of the giants on the north, and descended to the valley of Hinnom, to the side of Jebusi on the south, and descended to En-rogel,

<b>17 </b>And was drawn from the north, and went forth to En-shemesh, and went forth toward Geliloth, which <i>is</i> over against the going up of Adummim, and descended to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben,

<b>18 </b>And passed along toward the side over against Arabah northward, and went down unto Arabah:

<b>19 </b>And the border passed along to the side of Beth-hoglah northward: and the outgoings of the border were at the north bay of the salt sea at the south end of Jordan: this <i>was</i> the south coast.

<b>20 </b>And Jordan was the border of it on the east side. This <i>was</i> the inheritance of the children of Benjamin, by the coasts thereof round about, according to their families.

<b>21 </b>Now the cities of the tribe of the children of Benjamin according to their families were Jericho, and Beth-hoglah, and the valley of Keziz,

<b>22 </b>And Beth-arabah, and Zemaraim, and Beth-el,

<b>23 </b>And Avim, and Parah, and Ophrah,

<b>24 </b>And Chephar-haammonai, and Ophni, and Gaba; twelve cities with their villages:

<b>25 </b>Gibeon, and Ramah, and Beeroth,

<b>26 </b>And Mizpeh, and Chephirah, and Mozah,

<b>27 </b>And Rekem, and Irpeel, and Taralah,

<b>28 </b>And Zelah, Eleph, and Jebusi, which <i>is</i> Jerusalem, Gibeath, <i>and</i> Kirjath; fourteen cities with their villages. This <i>is</i> the inheritance of the children of Benjamin according to their families.


--------------------

CHAPTER 19

<b>1 </b>And the second lot came forth to Simeon, <i>even</i> for the tribe of the children of Simeon according to their families: and their inheritance was within the inheritance of the children of Judah.

<b>2 </b>And they had in their inheritance Beer-sheba, or Sheba, and Moladah,

<b>3 </b>And Hazar-shual, and Balah, and Azem,

<b>4 </b>And Eltolad, and Bethul, and Hormah,

<b>5 </b>And Ziklag, and Beth-marcaboth, and Hazar-susah,

<b>6 </b>And Beth-lebaoth, and Sharuhen; thirteen cities and their villages:

<b>7 </b>Ain, Remmon, and Ether, and Ashan; four cities and their villages:

<b>8 </b>And all the villages that <i>were</i> round about these cities to Baalath-beer, Ramath of the south. This <i>is</i> the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Simeon according to their families.

<b>9 </b>Out of the portion of the children of Judah <i>was</i> the inheritance of the children of Simeon: for the part of the children of Judah was too much for them: therefore the children of Simeon had their inheritance within the inheritance of them.

<b>10 </b>¶ And the third lot came up for the children of Zebulun according to their families: and the border of their inheritance was unto Sarid:

<b>11 </b>And their border went up toward the sea, and Maralah, and reached to Dabbasheth, and reached to the river that <i>is</i> before Jokneam;

<b>12 </b>And turned from Sarid eastward toward the sunrising unto the border of Chisloth-tabor, and then goeth out to Daberath, and goeth up to Japhia,

<b>13 </b>And from thence passeth on along on the east to Gittah-hepher, to Ittah-kazin, and goeth out to Remmon-methoar to Neah;

<b>14 </b>And the border compasseth it on the north side to Hannathon: and the outgoings thereof are in the valley of Jiphthah-el:

<b>15 </b>And Kattath, and Nahallal, and Shimron, and Idalah, and Beth-lehem: twelve cities with their villages.

<b>16 </b>This <i>is</i> the inheritance of the children of Zebulun according to their families, these cities with their villages.

<b>17 </b>¶ <i>And</i> the fourth lot came out to Issachar, for the children of Issachar according to their families.

<b>18 </b>And their border was toward Jezreel, and Chesulloth, and Shunem,

<b>19 </b>And Hapharaim, and Shion, and Anaharath,

<b>20 </b>And Rabbith, and Kishion, and Abez,

<b>21 </b>And Remeth, and En-gannim, and En-haddah, and Beth-pazzez;

<b>22 </b>And the coast reacheth to Tabor, and Shahazimah, and Beth-shemesh; and the outgoings of their border were at Jordan: sixteen cities with their villages.

<b>23 </b>This <i>is</i> the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Issachar according to their families, the cities and their villages.

<b>24 </b>¶ And the fifth lot came out for the tribe of the children of Asher according to their families.

<b>25 </b>And their border was Helkath, and Hali, and Beten, and Achshaph,

<b>26 </b>And Alammelech, and Amad, and Misheal; and reacheth to Carmel westward, and to Shihor-libnath;

<b>27 </b>And turneth toward the sunrising to Beth-dagon, and reacheth to Zebulun, and to the valley of Jiphthah-el toward the north side of Beth-emek, and Neiel, and goeth out to Cabul on the left hand,

<b>28 </b>And Hebron, and Rehob, and Hammon, and Kanah, <i>even</i> unto great Zidon;

<b>29 </b>And <i>then</i> the coast turneth to Ramah, and to the strong city Tyre; and the coast turneth to Hosah; and the outgoings thereof are at the sea from the coast to Achzib:

<b>30 </b>Ummah also, and Aphek, and Rehob: twenty and two cities with their villages.

<b>31 </b>This <i>is</i> the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Asher according to their families, these cities with their villages.

<b>32 </b>¶ The sixth lot came out to the children of Naphtali, <i>even</i> for the children of Naphtali according to their families.

<b>33 </b>And their coast was from Heleph, from Allon to Zaanannim, and Adami, Nekeb, and Jabneel, unto Lakum; and the outgoings thereof were at Jordan:

<b>34 </b>And <i>then</i> the coast turneth westward to Aznoth-tabor, and goeth out from thence to Hukkok, and reacheth to Zebulun on the south side, and reacheth to Asher on the west side, and to Judah upon Jordan toward the sunrising.

<b>35 </b>And the fenced cities <i>are</i> Ziddim, Zer, and Hammath, Rakkath, and Chinnereth,

<b>36 </b>And Adamah, and Ramah, and Hazor,

<b>37 </b>And Kedesh, and Edrei, and En-hazor,

<b>38 </b>And Iron, and Migdal-el, Horem, and Beth-anath, and Beth-shemesh; nineteen cities with their villages.

<b>39 </b>This <i>is</i> the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Naphtali according to their families, the cities and their villages.

<b>40 </b>¶ <i>And</i> the seventh lot came out for the tribe of the children of Dan according to their families.

<b>41 </b>And the coast of their inheritance was Zorah, and Eshtaol, and Ir-shemesh,

<b>42 </b>And Shaalabbin, and Ajalon, and Jethlah,

<b>43 </b>And Elon, and Thimnathah, and Ekron,

<b>44 </b>And Eltekeh, and Gibbethon, and Baalath,

<b>45 </b>And Jehud, and Bene-berak, and Gath-rimmon,

<b>46 </b>And Me-jarkon, and Rakkon, with the border before Japho.

<b>47 </b>And the coast of the children of Dan went out <i>too little</i> for them: therefore the children of Dan went up to fight against Leshem, and took it, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and possessed it, and dwelt therein, and called Leshem, Dan, after the name of Dan their father.

<b>48 </b>This <i>is</i> the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Dan according to their families, these cities with their villages.

<b>49 </b>¶ When they had made an end of dividing the land for inheritance by their coasts, the children of Israel gave an inheritance to Joshua the son of Nun among them:

<b>50 </b>According to the word of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> they gave him the city which he asked, <i>even</i> Timnath-serah in mount Ephraim: and he built the city, and dwelt therein.

<b>51 </b>These <i>are</i> the inheritances, which Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel, divided for an inheritance by lot in Shiloh before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation. So they made an end of dividing the country.


--------------------

CHAPTER 20

<b>1 </b>The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> also spake unto Joshua, saying,

<b>2 </b>Speak to the children of Israel, saying, Appoint out for you cities of refuge, whereof I spake unto you by the hand of Moses:

<b>3 </b>That the slayer that killeth <i>any</i> person unawares <i>and</i> unwittingly may flee thither: and they shall be your refuge from the avenger of blood.

<b>4 </b>And when he that doth flee unto one of those cities shall stand at the entering of the gate of the city, and shall declare his cause in the ears of the elders of that city, they shall take him into the city unto them, and give him a place, that he may dwell among them.

<b>5 </b>And if the avenger of blood pursue after him, then they shall not deliver the slayer up into his hand; because he smote his neighbour unwittingly, and hated him not beforetime.

<b>6 </b>And he shall dwell in that city, until he stand before the congregation for judgment, <i>and</i> until the death of the high priest that shall be in those days: then shall the slayer return, and come unto his own city, and unto his own house, unto the city from whence he fled.

<b>7 </b>¶ And they appointed Kedesh in Galilee in mount Naphtali, and Shechem in mount Ephraim, and Kirjath-arba, which <i>is</i> Hebron, in the mountain of Judah.

<b>8 </b>And on the other side Jordan by Jericho eastward, they assigned Bezer in the wilderness upon the plain out of the tribe of Reuben, and Ramoth in Gilead out of the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan out of the tribe of Manasseh.

<b>9 </b>These were the cities appointed for all the children of Israel, and for the stranger that sojourneth among them, that whosoever killeth <i>any</i> person at unawares might flee thither, and not die by the hand of the avenger of blood, until he stood before the congregation.


--------------------

CHAPTER 21

<b>1 </b>Then came near the heads of the fathers of the Levites unto Eleazar the priest, and unto Joshua the son of Nun, and unto the heads of the fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel;

<b>2 </b>And they spake unto them at Shiloh in the land of Canaan, saying, The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded by the hand of Moses to give us cities to dwell in, with the suburbs thereof for our cattle.

<b>3 </b>And the children of Israel gave unto the Levites out of their inheritance, at the commandment of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, these cities and their suburbs.

<b>4 </b>And the lot came out for the families of the Kohathites: and the children of Aaron the priest, <i>which were</i> of the Levites, had by lot out of the tribe of Judah, and out of the tribe of Simeon, and out of the tribe of Benjamin, thirteen cities.

<b>5 </b>And the rest of the children of Kohath <i>had</i> by lot out of the families of the tribe of Ephraim, and out of the tribe of Dan, and out of the half tribe of Manasseh, ten cities.

<b>6 </b>And the children of Gershon <i>had</i> by lot out of the families of the tribe of Issachar, and out of the tribe of Asher, and out of the tribe of Naphtali, and out of the half tribe of Manasseh in Bashan, thirteen cities.

<b>7 </b>The children of Merari by their families <i>had</i> out of the tribe of Reuben, and out of the tribe of Gad, and out of the tribe of Zebulun, twelve cities.

<b>8 </b>And the children of Israel gave by lot unto the Levites these cities with their suburbs, as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded by the hand of Moses.

<b>9 </b>¶ And they gave out of the tribe of the children of Judah, and out of the tribe of the children of Simeon, these cities which are <i>here</i> mentioned by name,

<b>10 </b>Which the children of Aaron, <i>being</i> of the families of the Kohathites, <i>who were</i> of the children of Levi, had: for theirs was the first lot.

<b>11 </b>And they gave them the city of Arba the father of Anak, which <i>city is</i> Hebron, in the hill <i>country</i> of Judah, with the suburbs thereof round about it.

<b>12 </b>But the fields of the city, and the villages thereof, gave they to Caleb the son of Jephunneh for his possession.

<b>13 </b>¶ Thus they gave to the children of Aaron the priest Hebron with her suburbs, <i>to be</i> a city of refuge for the slayer; and Libnah with her suburbs,

<b>14 </b>And Jattir with her suburbs, and Eshtemoa with her suburbs,

<b>15 </b>And Holon with her suburbs, and Debir with her suburbs,

<b>16 </b>And Ain with her suburbs, and Juttah with her suburbs, <i>and</i> Beth-shemesh with her suburbs; nine cities out of those two tribes.

<b>17 </b>And out of the tribe of Benjamin, Gibeon with her suburbs, Geba with her suburbs,

<b>18 </b>Anathoth with her suburbs, and Almon with her suburbs; four cities.

<b>19 </b>All the cities of the children of Aaron, the priests, <i>were</i> thirteen cities with their suburbs.

<b>20 </b>¶ And the families of the children of Kohath, the Levites which remained of the children of Kohath, even they had the cities of their lot out of the tribe of Ephraim.

<b>21 </b>For they gave them Shechem with her suburbs in mount Ephraim, <i>to be</i> a city of refuge for the slayer; and Gezer with her suburbs,

<b>22 </b>And Kibzaim with her suburbs, and Beth-horon with her suburbs; four cities.

<b>23 </b>And out of the tribe of Dan, Eltekeh with her suburbs, Gibbethon with her suburbs,

<b>24 </b>Aijalon with her suburbs, Gath-rimmon with her suburbs; four cities.

<b>25 </b>And out of the half tribe of Manasseh, Tanach with her suburbs, and Gath-rimmon with her suburbs; two cities.

<b>26 </b>All the cities <i>were</i> ten with their suburbs for the families of the children of Kohath that remained.

<b>27 </b>¶ And unto the children of Gershon, of the families of the Levites, out of the <i>other</i> half tribe of Manasseh <i>they gave</i> Golan in Bashan with her suburbs, <i>to be</i> a city of refuge for the slayer; and Beesh-terah with her suburbs; two cities.

<b>28 </b>And out of the tribe of Issachar, Kishon with her suburbs, Dabareh with her suburbs,

<b>29 </b>Jarmuth with her suburbs, En-gannim with her suburbs; four cities.

<b>30 </b>And out of the tribe of Asher, Mishal with her suburbs, Abdon with her suburbs,

<b>31 </b>Helkath with her suburbs, and Rehob with her suburbs; four cities.

<b>32 </b>And out of the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee with her suburbs, <i>to be</i> a city of refuge for the slayer; and Hammoth-dor with her suburbs, and Kartan with her suburbs; three cities.

<b>33 </b>All the cities of the Gershonites according to their families <i>were</i> thirteen cities with their suburbs.

<b>34 </b>¶ And unto the families of the children of Merari, the rest of the Levites, out of the tribe of Zebulun, Jokneam with her suburbs, and Kartah with her suburbs,

<b>35 </b>Dimnah with her suburbs, Nahalal with her suburbs; four cities.

<b>36 </b>And out of the tribe of Reuben, Bezer with her suburbs, and Jahazah with her suburbs,

<b>37 </b>Kedemoth with her suburbs, and Mephaath with her suburbs; four cities.

<b>38 </b>And out of the tribe of Gad, Ramoth in Gilead with her suburbs, <i>to be</i> a city of refuge for the slayer; and Mahanaim with her suburbs,

<b>39 </b>Heshbon with her suburbs, Jazer with her suburbs; four cities in all.

<b>40 </b>So all the cities for the children of Merari by their families, which were remaining of the families of the Levites, were <i>by</i> their lot twelve cities.

<b>41 </b>All the cities of the Levites within the possession of the children of Israel <i>were</i> forty and eight cities with their suburbs.

<b>42 </b>These cities were every one with their suburbs round about them: thus <i>were</i> all these cities.

<b>43 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> gave unto Israel all the land which he sware to give unto their fathers; and they possessed it, and dwelt therein.

<b>44 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> gave them rest round about, according to all that he sware unto their fathers: and there stood not a man of all their enemies before them; the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> delivered all their enemies into their hand.

<b>45 </b>There failed not ought of any good thing which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had spoken unto the house of Israel; all came to pass.


--------------------

CHAPTER 22

<b>1 </b>Then Joshua called the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh,

<b>2 </b>And said unto them, Ye have kept all that Moses the servant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded you, and have obeyed my voice in all that I commanded you:

<b>3 </b>Ye have not left your brethren these many days unto this day, but have kept the charge of the commandment of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God.

<b>4 </b>And now the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God hath given rest unto your brethren, as he promised them: therefore now return ye, and get you unto your tents, <i>and</i> unto the land of your possession, which Moses the servant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> gave you on the other side Jordan.

<b>5 </b>But take diligent heed to do the commandment and the law, which Moses the servant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> charged you, to love the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God, and to walk in all his ways, and to keep his commandments, and to cleave unto him, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul.

<b>6 </b>So Joshua blessed them, and sent them away: and they went unto their tents.

<b>7 </b>¶ Now to the <i>one</i> half of the tribe of Manasseh Moses had given <i>possession</i> in Bashan: but unto the <i>other</i> half thereof gave Joshua among their brethren on this side Jordan westward. And when Joshua sent them away also unto their tents, then he blessed them,

<b>8 </b>And he spake unto them, saying, Return with much riches unto your tents, and with very much cattle, with silver, and with gold, and with brass, and with iron, and with very much raiment: divide the spoil of your enemies with your brethren.

<b>9 </b>¶ And the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh returned, and departed from the children of Israel out of Shiloh, which <i>is</i> in the land of Canaan, to go unto the country of Gilead, to the land of their possession, whereof they were possessed, according to the word of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> by the hand of Moses.

<b>10 </b>¶ And when they came unto the borders of Jordan, that <i>are</i> in the land of Canaan, the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh built there an altar by Jordan, a great altar to see to.

<b>11 </b>¶ And the children of Israel heard say, Behold, the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh have built an altar over against the land of Canaan, in the borders of Jordan, at the passage of the children of Israel.

<b>12 </b>And when the children of Israel heard <i>of it,</i> the whole congregation of the children of Israel gathered themselves together at Shiloh, to go up to war against them.

<b>13 </b>And the children of Israel sent unto the children of Reuben, and to the children of Gad, and to the half tribe of Manasseh, into the land of Gilead, Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest,

<b>14 </b>And with him ten princes, of each chief house a prince throughout all the tribes of Israel; and each one <i>was</i> an head of the house of their fathers among the thousands of Israel.

<b>15 </b>¶ And they came unto the children of Reuben, and to the children of Gad, and to the half tribe of Manasseh, unto the land of Gilead, and they spake with them, saying,

<b>16 </b>Thus saith the whole congregation of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, What trespass <i>is</i> this that ye have committed against the God of Israel, to turn away this day from following the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, in that ye have builded you an altar, that ye might rebel this day against the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>?

<b>17 </b><i>Is</i> the iniquity of Peor too little for us, from which we are not cleansed until this day, although there was a plague in the congregation of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>,

<b>18 </b>But that ye must turn away this day from following the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>? and it will be, <i>seeing</i> ye rebel to day against the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, that to morrow he will be wroth with the whole congregation of Israel.

<b>19 </b>Notwithstanding, if the land of your possession <i>be</i> unclean, <i>then</i> pass ye over unto the land of the possession of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, wherein the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s tabernacle dwelleth, and take possession among us: but rebel not against the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, nor rebel against us, in building you an altar beside the altar of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> our God.

<b>20 </b>Did not Achan the son of Zerah commit a trespass in the accursed thing, and wrath fell on all the congregation of Israel? and that man perished not alone in his iniquity.

<b>21 </b>¶ Then the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh answered, and said unto the heads of the thousands of Israel,

<b>22 </b>The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of gods, the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of gods, he knoweth, and Israel he shall know; if <i>it be</i> in rebellion, or if in transgression against the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, (save us not this day,)

<b>23 </b>That we have built us an altar to turn from following the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, or if to offer thereon burnt offering or meat offering, or if to offer peace offerings thereon, let the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> himself require <i>it;</i>

<b>24 </b>And if we have not <i>rather</i> done it for fear of <i>this</i> thing, saying, In time to come your children might speak unto our children, saying, What have ye to do with the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel?

<b>25 </b>For the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath made Jordan a border between us and you, ye children of Reuben and children of Gad; ye have no part in the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: so shall your children make our children cease from fearing the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>26 </b>Therefore we said, Let us now prepare to build us an altar, not for burnt offering, nor for sacrifice:

<b>27 </b>But <i>that</i> it <i>may be</i> a witness between us, and you, and our generations after us, that we might do the service of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> before him with our burnt offerings, and with our sacrifices, and with our peace offerings; that your children may not say to our children in time to come, Ye have no part in the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>28 </b>Therefore said we, that it shall be, when they should <i>so</i> say to us or to our generations in time to come, that we may say <i>again,</i> Behold the pattern of the altar of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, which our fathers made, not for burnt offerings, nor for sacrifices; but it <i>is</i> a witness between us and you.

<b>29 </b>God forbid that we should rebel against the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and turn this day from following the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, to build an altar for burnt offerings, for meat offerings, or for sacrifices, beside the altar of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> our God that <i>is</i> before his tabernacle.

<b>30 </b>¶ And when Phinehas the priest, and the princes of the congregation and heads of the thousands of Israel which <i>were</i> with him, heard the words that the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the children of Manasseh spake, it pleased them.

<b>31 </b>And Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest said unto the children of Reuben, and to the children of Gad, and to the children of Manasseh, This day we perceive that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>is</i> among us, because ye have not committed this trespass against the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: now ye have delivered the children of Israel out of the hand of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>32 </b>¶ And Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, and the princes, returned from the children of Reuben, and from the children of Gad, out of the land of Gilead, unto the land of Canaan, to the children of Israel, and brought them word again.

<b>33 </b>And the thing pleased the children of Israel; and the children of Israel blessed God, and did not intend to go up against them in battle, to destroy the land wherein the children of Reuben and Gad dwelt.

<b>34 </b>And the children of Reuben and the children of Gad called the altar <i>Ed:</i> for it <i>shall be</i> a witness between us that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>is</i> God.


--------------------

CHAPTER 23

<b>1 </b>And it came to pass a long time after that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had given rest unto Israel from all their enemies round about, that Joshua waxed old <i>and</i> stricken in age.

<b>2 </b>And Joshua called for all Israel, <i>and</i> for their elders, and for their heads, and for their judges, and for their officers, and said unto them, I am old <i>and</i> stricken in age:

<b>3 </b>And ye have seen all that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God hath done unto all these nations because of you; for the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God <i>is</i> he that hath fought for you.

<b>4 </b>Behold, I have divided unto you by lot these nations that remain, to be an inheritance for your tribes, from Jordan, with all the nations that I have cut off, even unto the great sea westward.

<b>5 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God, he shall expel them from before you, and drive them from out of your sight; and ye shall possess their land, as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God hath promised unto you.

<b>6 </b>Be ye therefore very courageous to keep and to do all that is written in the book of the law of Moses, that ye turn not aside therefrom <i>to</i> the right hand or <i>to</i> the left;

<b>7 </b>That ye come not among these nations, these that remain among you; neither make mention of the name of their gods, nor cause to swear <i>by them,</i> neither serve them, nor bow yourselves unto them:

<b>8 </b>But cleave unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God, as ye have done unto this day.

<b>9 </b>For the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath driven out from before you great nations and strong: but <i>as for</i> you, no man hath been able to stand before you unto this day.

<b>10 </b>One man of you shall chase a thousand: for the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God, he <i>it is</i> that fighteth for you, as he hath promised you.

<b>11 </b>Take good heed therefore unto yourselves, that ye love the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God.

<b>12 </b>Else if ye do in any wise go back, and cleave unto the remnant of these nations, <i>even</i> these that remain among you, and shall make marriages with them, and go in unto them, and they to you:

<b>13 </b>Know for a certainty that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God will no more drive out <i>any of</i> these nations from before you; but they shall be snares and traps unto you, and scourges in your sides, and thorns in your eyes, until ye perish from off this good land which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God hath given you.

<b>14 </b>And, behold, this day I <i>am</i> going the way of all the earth: and ye know in all your hearts and in all your souls, that not one thing hath failed of all the good things which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God spake concerning you; all are come to pass unto you, <i>and</i> not one thing hath failed thereof.

<b>15 </b>Therefore it shall come to pass, <i>that</i> as all good things are come upon you, which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God promised you; so shall the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> bring upon you all evil things, until he have destroyed you from off this good land which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God hath given you.

<b>16 </b>When ye have transgressed the covenant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God, which he commanded you, and have gone and served other gods, and bowed yourselves to them; then shall the anger of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> be kindled against you, and ye shall perish quickly from off the good land which he hath given unto you.


--------------------

CHAPTER 24

<b>1 </b>And Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel to Shechem, and called for the elders of Israel, and for their heads, and for their judges, and for their officers; and they presented themselves before God.

<b>2 </b>And Joshua said unto all the people, Thus saith the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel, Your fathers dwelt on the other side of the flood in old time, <i>even</i> Terah, the father of Abraham, and the father of Nachor: and they served other gods.

<b>3 </b>And I took your father Abraham from the other side of the flood, and led him throughout all the land of Canaan, and multiplied his seed, and gave him Isaac.

<b>4 </b>And I gave unto Isaac Jacob and Esau: and I gave unto Esau mount Seir, to possess it; but Jacob and his children went down into Egypt.

<b>5 </b>I sent Moses also and Aaron, and I plagued Egypt, according to that which I did among them: and afterward I brought you out.

<b>6 </b>And I brought your fathers out of Egypt: and ye came unto the sea; and the Egyptians pursued after your fathers with chariots and horsemen unto the Red sea.

<b>7 </b>And when they cried unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, he put darkness between you and the Egyptians, and brought the sea upon them, and covered them; and your eyes have seen what I have done in Egypt: and ye dwelt in the wilderness a long season.

<b>8 </b>And I brought you into the land of the Amorites, which dwelt on the other side Jordan; and they fought with you: and I gave them into your hand, that ye might possess their land; and I destroyed them from before you.

<b>9 </b>Then Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, arose and warred against Israel, and sent and called Balaam the son of Beor to curse you:

<b>10 </b>But I would not hearken unto Balaam; therefore he blessed you still: so I delivered you out of his hand.

<b>11 </b>And ye went over Jordan, and came unto Jericho: and the men of Jericho fought against you, the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Girgashites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites; and I delivered them into your hand.

<b>12 </b>And I sent the hornet before you, which drave them out from before you, <i>even</i> the two kings of the Amorites; <i>but</i> not with thy sword, nor with thy bow.

<b>13 </b>And I have given you a land for which ye did not labour, and cities which ye built not, and ye dwell in them; of the vineyards and oliveyards which ye planted not do ye eat.

<b>14 </b>¶ Now therefore fear the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and serve him in sincerity and in truth: and put away the gods which your fathers served on the other side of the flood, and in Egypt; and serve ye the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>15 </b>And if it seem evil unto you to serve the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, choose you this day whom ye will serve; whether the gods which your fathers served that <i>were</i> on the other side of the flood, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land ye dwell: but as for me and my house, we will serve the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>16 </b>And the people answered and said, God forbid that we should forsake the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, to serve other gods;

<b>17 </b>For the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> our God, he <i>it is</i> that brought us up and our fathers out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage, and which did those great signs in our sight, and preserved us in all the way wherein we went, and among all the people through whom we passed:

<b>18 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> drave out from before us all the people, even the Amorites which dwelt in the land: <i>therefore</i> will we also serve the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; for he <i>is</i> our God.

<b>19 </b>And Joshua said unto the people, Ye cannot serve the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: for he <i>is</i> an holy God; he <i>is</i> a jealous God; he will not forgive your transgressions nor your sins.

<b>20 </b>If ye forsake the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and serve strange gods, then he will turn and do you hurt, and consume you, after that he hath done you good.

<b>21 </b>And the people said unto Joshua, Nay; but we will serve the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>22 </b>And Joshua said unto the people, Ye <i>are</i> witnesses against yourselves that ye have chosen you the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, to serve him. And they said, <i>We are</i> witnesses.

<b>23 </b>Now therefore put away, <i>said he,</i> the strange gods which <i>are</i> among you, and incline your heart unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel.

<b>24 </b>And the people said unto Joshua, The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> our God will we serve, and his voice will we obey.

<b>25 </b>So Joshua made a covenant with the people that day, and set them a statute and an ordinance in Shechem.

<b>26 </b>¶ And Joshua wrote these words in the book of the law of God, and took a great stone, and set it up there under an oak, that <i>was</i> by the sanctuary of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>27 </b>And Joshua said unto all the people, Behold, this stone shall be a witness unto us; for it hath heard all the words of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> which he spake unto us: it shall be therefore a witness unto you, lest ye deny your God.

<b>28 </b>So Joshua let the people depart, every man unto his inheritance.

<b>29 </b>¶ And it came to pass after these things, that Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, died, <i>being</i> an hundred and ten years old.

<b>30 </b>And they buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnath-serah, which <i>is</i> in mount Ephraim, on the north side of the hill of Gaash.

<b>31 </b>And Israel served the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders that overlived Joshua, and which had known all the works of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, that he had done for Israel.

<b>32 </b>¶ And the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel brought up out of Egypt, buried they in Shechem, in a parcel of ground which Jacob bought of the sons of Hamor the father of Shechem for an hundred pieces of silver: and it became the inheritance of the children of Joseph.

<b>33 </b>And Eleazar the son of Aaron died; and they buried him in a hill <i>that pertained to</i> Phinehas his son, which was given him in mount Ephraim.


--------------------

<small>The Book of </small>Judges

CHAPTER 1

<b>1 </b>Now after the death of Joshua it came to pass, that the children of Israel asked the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, saying, Who shall go up for us against the Canaanites first, to fight against them?

<b>2 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said, Judah shall go up: behold, I have delivered the land into his hand.

<b>3 </b>And Judah said unto Simeon his brother, Come up with me into my lot, that we may fight against the Canaanites; and I likewise will go with thee into thy lot. So Simeon went with him.

<b>4 </b>And Judah went up; and the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> delivered the Canaanites and the Perizzites into their hand: and they slew of them in Bezek ten thousand men.

<b>5 </b>And they found Adoni-bezek in Bezek: and they fought against him, and they slew the Canaanites and the Perizzites.

<b>6 </b>But Adoni-bezek fled; and they pursued after him, and caught him, and cut off his thumbs and his great toes.

<b>7 </b>And Adoni-bezek said, Threescore and ten kings, having their thumbs and their great toes cut off, gathered <i>their meat</i> under my table: as I have done, so God hath requited me. And they brought him to Jerusalem, and there he died.

<b>8 </b>Now the children of Judah had fought against Jerusalem, and had taken it, and smitten it with the edge of the sword, and set the city on fire.

<b>9 </b>¶ And afterward the children of Judah went down to fight against the Canaanites, that dwelt in the mountain, and in the south, and in the valley.

<b>10 </b>And Judah went against the Canaanites that dwelt in Hebron: (now the name of Hebron before <i>was</i> Kirjath-arba:) and they slew Sheshai, and Ahiman, and Talmai.

<b>11 </b>And from thence he went against the inhabitants of Debir: and the name of Debir before <i>was</i> Kirjath-sepher:

<b>12 </b>And Caleb said, He that smiteth Kirjath-sepher, and taketh it, to him will I give Achsah my daughter to wife.

<b>13 </b>And Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb’s younger brother, took it: and he gave him Achsah his daughter to wife.

<b>14 </b>And it came to pass, when she came <i>to him,</i> that she moved him to ask of her father a field: and she lighted from off <i>her</i> ass; and Caleb said unto her, What wilt thou?

<b>15 </b>And she said unto him, Give me a blessing: for thou hast given me a south land; give me also springs of water. And Caleb gave her the upper springs and the nether springs.

<b>16 </b>¶ And the children of the Kenite, Moses’ father in law, went up out of the city of palm trees with the children of Judah into the wilderness of Judah, which <i>lieth</i> in the south of Arad; and they went and dwelt among the people.

<b>17 </b>And Judah went with Simeon his brother, and they slew the Canaanites that inhabited Zephath, and utterly destroyed it. And the name of the city was called Hormah.

<b>18 </b>Also Judah took Gaza with the coast thereof, and Askelon with the coast thereof, and Ekron with the coast thereof.

<b>19 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> was with Judah; and he drave out <i>the inhabitants of</i> the mountain; but could not drive out the inhabitants of the valley, because they had chariots of iron.

<b>20 </b>And they gave Hebron unto Caleb, as Moses said: and he expelled thence the three sons of Anak.

<b>21 </b>And the children of Benjamin did not drive out the Jebusites that inhabited Jerusalem; but the Jebusites dwell with the children of Benjamin in Jerusalem unto this day.

<b>22 </b>¶ And the house of Joseph, they also went up against Beth-el: and the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>was</i> with them.

<b>23 </b>And the house of Joseph sent to descry Beth-el. (Now the name of the city before <i>was</i> Luz.)

<b>24 </b>And the spies saw a man come forth out of the city, and they said unto him, Shew us, we pray thee, the entrance into the city, and we will shew thee mercy.

<b>25 </b>And when he shewed them the entrance into the city, they smote the city with the edge of the sword; but they let go the man and all his family.

<b>26 </b>And the man went into the land of the Hittites, and built a city, and called the name thereof Luz: which <i>is</i> the name thereof unto this day.

<b>27 </b>¶ Neither did Manasseh drive out <i>the inhabitants of</i> Beth-shean and her towns, nor Taanach and her towns, nor the inhabitants of Dor and her towns, nor the inhabitants of Ibleam and her towns, nor the inhabitants of Megiddo and her towns: but the Canaanites would dwell in that land.

<b>28 </b>And it came to pass, when Israel was strong, that they put the Canaanites to tribute, and did not utterly drive them out.

<b>29 </b>¶ Neither did Ephraim drive out the Canaanites that dwelt in Gezer; but the Canaanites dwelt in Gezer among them.

<b>30 </b>¶ Neither did Zebulun drive out the inhabitants of Kitron, nor the inhabitants of Nahalol; but the Canaanites dwelt among them, and became tributaries.

<b>31 </b>¶ Neither did Asher drive out the inhabitants of Accho, nor the inhabitants of Zidon, nor of Ahlab, nor of Achzib, nor of Helbah, nor of Aphik, nor of Rehob:

<b>32 </b>But the Asherites dwelt among the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land: for they did not drive them out.

<b>33 </b>¶ Neither did Naphtali drive out the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh, nor the inhabitants of Beth-anath; but he dwelt among the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land: nevertheless the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh and of Beth-anath became tributaries unto them.

<b>34 </b>And the Amorites forced the children of Dan into the mountain: for they would not suffer them to come down to the valley:

<b>35 </b>But the Amorites would dwell in mount Heres in Aijalon, and in Shaalbim: yet the hand of the house of Joseph prevailed, so that they became tributaries.

<b>36 </b>And the coast of the Amorites <i>was</i> from the going up to Akrabbim, from the rock, and upward.


--------------------

CHAPTER 2

<b>1 </b>And an angel of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> came up from Gilgal to Bochim, and said, I made you to go up out of Egypt, and have brought you unto the land which I sware unto your fathers; and I said, I will never break my covenant with you.

<b>2 </b>And ye shall make no league with the inhabitants of this land; ye shall throw down their altars: but ye have not obeyed my voice: why have ye done this?

<b>3 </b>Wherefore I also said, I will not drive them out from before you; but they shall be <i>as thorns</i> in your sides, and their gods shall be a snare unto you.

<b>4 </b>And it came to pass, when the angel of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake these words unto all the children of Israel, that the people lifted up their voice, and wept.

<b>5 </b>And they called the name of that place Bochim: and they sacrificed there unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>6 </b>¶ And when Joshua had let the people go, the children of Israel went every man unto his inheritance to possess the land.

<b>7 </b>And the people served the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders that outlived Joshua, who had seen all the great works of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, that he did for Israel.

<b>8 </b>And Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, died, <i>being</i> an hundred and ten years old.

<b>9 </b>And they buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnath-heres, in the mount of Ephraim, on the north side of the hill Gaash.

<b>10 </b>And also all that generation were gathered unto their fathers: and there arose another generation after them, which knew not the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, nor yet the works which he had done for Israel.

<b>11 </b>¶ And the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and served Baalim:

<b>12 </b>And they forsook the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of their fathers, which brought them out of the land of Egypt, and followed other gods, of the gods of the people that <i>were</i> round about them, and bowed themselves unto them, and provoked the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> to anger.

<b>13 </b>And they forsook the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and served Baal and Ashtaroth.

<b>14 </b>¶ And the anger of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> was hot against Israel, and he delivered them into the hands of spoilers that spoiled them, and he sold them into the hands of their enemies round about, so that they could not any longer stand before their enemies.

<b>15 </b>Whithersoever they went out, the hand of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> was against them for evil, as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had said, and as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had sworn unto them: and they were greatly distressed.

<b>16 </b>¶ Nevertheless the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> raised up judges, which delivered them out of the hand of those that spoiled them.

<b>17 </b>And yet they would not hearken unto their judges, but they went a whoring after other gods, and bowed themselves unto them: they turned quickly out of the way which their fathers walked in, obeying the commandments of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; <i>but</i> they did not so.

<b>18 </b>And when the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> raised them up judges, then the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> was with the judge, and delivered them out of the hand of their enemies all the days of the judge: for it repented the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> because of their groanings by reason of them that oppressed them and vexed them.

<b>19 </b>And it came to pass, when the judge was dead, <i>that</i> they returned, and corrupted <i>themselves</i> more than their fathers, in following other gods to serve them, and to bow down unto them; they ceased not from their own doings, nor from their stubborn way.

<b>20 </b>¶ And the anger of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> was hot against Israel; and he said, Because that this people hath transgressed my covenant which I commanded their fathers, and have not hearkened unto my voice;

<b>21 </b>I also will not henceforth drive out any from before them of the nations which Joshua left when he died:

<b>22 </b>That through them I may prove Israel, whether they will keep the way of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> to walk therein, as their fathers did keep <i>it,</i> or not.

<b>23 </b>Therefore the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> left those nations, without driving them out hastily; neither delivered he them into the hand of Joshua.


--------------------

CHAPTER 3

<b>1 </b>Now these <i>are</i> the nations which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> left, to prove Israel by them, <i>even</i> as many <i>of Israel</i> as had not known all the wars of Canaan;

<b>2 </b>Only that the generations of the children of Israel might know, to teach them war, at the least such as before knew nothing thereof;

<b>3 </b><i>Namely,</i> five lords of the Philistines, and all the Canaanites, and the Sidonians, and the Hivites that dwelt in mount Lebanon, from mount Baal-hermon unto the entering in of Hamath.

<b>4 </b>And they were to prove Israel by them, to know whether they would hearken unto the commandments of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, which he commanded their fathers by the hand of Moses.

<b>5 </b>¶ And the children of Israel dwelt among the Canaanites, Hittites, and Amorites, and Perizzites, and Hivites, and Jebusites:

<b>6 </b>And they took their daughters to be their wives, and gave their daughters to their sons, and served their gods.

<b>7 </b>And the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and forgat the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> their God, and served Baalim and the groves.

<b>8 </b>¶ Therefore the anger of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> was hot against Israel, and he sold them into the hand of Chushan-rishathaim king of Mesopotamia: and the children of Israel served Chushan-rishathaim eight years.

<b>9 </b>And when the children of Israel cried unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> raised up a deliverer to the children of Israel, who delivered them, <i>even</i> Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb’s younger brother.

<b>10 </b>And the Spirit of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> came upon him, and he judged Israel, and went out to war: and the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> delivered Chushan-rishathaim king of Mesopotamia into his hand; and his hand prevailed against Chushan-rishathaim.

<b>11 </b>And the land had rest forty years. And Othniel the son of Kenaz died.

<b>12 </b>¶ And the children of Israel did evil again in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: and the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> strengthened Eglon the king of Moab against Israel, because they had done evil in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>13 </b>And he gathered unto him the children of Ammon and Amalek, and went and smote Israel, and possessed the city of palm trees.

<b>14 </b>So the children of Israel served Eglon the king of Moab eighteen years.

<b>15 </b>But when the children of Israel cried unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> raised them up a deliverer, Ehud the son of Gera, a Benjamite, a man lefthanded: and by him the children of Israel sent a present unto Eglon the king of Moab.

<b>16 </b>But Ehud made him a dagger which had two edges, of a cubit length; and he did gird it under his raiment upon his right thigh.

<b>17 </b>And he brought the present unto Eglon king of Moab: and Eglon <i>was</i> a very fat man.

<b>18 </b>And when he had made an end to offer the present, he sent away the people that bare the present.

<b>19 </b>But he himself turned again from the quarries that <i>were</i> by Gilgal, and said, I have a secret errand unto thee, O king: who said, Keep silence. And all that stood by him went out from him.

<b>20 </b>And Ehud came unto him; and he was sitting in a summer parlour, which he had for himself alone. And Ehud said, I have a message from God unto thee. And he arose out of <i>his</i> seat.

<b>21 </b>And Ehud put forth his left hand, and took the dagger from his right thigh, and thrust it into his belly:

<b>22 </b>And the haft also went in after the blade; and the fat closed upon the blade, so that he could not draw the dagger out of his belly; and the dirt came out.

<b>23 </b>Then Ehud went forth through the porch, and shut the doors of the parlour upon him, and locked them.

<b>24 </b>When he was gone out, his servants came; and when they saw that, behold, the doors of the parlour <i>were</i> locked, they said, Surely he covereth his feet in his summer chamber.

<b>25 </b>And they tarried till they were ashamed: and, behold, he opened not the doors of the parlour; therefore they took a key, and opened <i>them:</i> and, behold, their lord <i>was</i> fallen down dead on the earth.

<b>26 </b>And Ehud escaped while they tarried, and passed beyond the quarries, and escaped unto Seirath.

<b>27 </b>And it came to pass, when he was come, that he blew a trumpet in the mountain of Ephraim, and the children of Israel went down with him from the mount, and he before them.

<b>28 </b>And he said unto them, Follow after me: for the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath delivered your enemies the Moabites into your hand. And they went down after him, and took the fords of Jordan toward Moab, and suffered not a man to pass over.

<b>29 </b>And they slew of Moab at that time about ten thousand men, all lusty, and all men of valour; and there escaped not a man.

<b>30 </b>So Moab was subdued that day under the hand of Israel. And the land had rest fourscore years.

<b>31 </b>¶ And after him was Shamgar the son of Anath, which slew of the Philistines six hundred men with an ox goad: and he also delivered Israel.


--------------------

CHAPTER 4

<b>1 </b>And the children of Israel again did evil in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, when Ehud was dead.

<b>2 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> sold them into the hand of Jabin king of Canaan, that reigned in Hazor; the captain of whose host <i>was</i> Sisera, which dwelt in Harosheth of the Gentiles.

<b>3 </b>And the children of Israel cried unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: for he had nine hundred chariots of iron; and twenty years he mightily oppressed the children of Israel.

<b>4 </b>¶ And Deborah, a prophetess, the wife of Lapidoth, she judged Israel at that time.

<b>5 </b>And she dwelt under the palm tree of Deborah between Ramah and Beth-el in mount Ephraim: and the children of Israel came up to her for judgment.

<b>6 </b>And she sent and called Barak the son of Abinoam out of Kedesh-naphtali, and said unto him, Hath not the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel commanded, <i>saying,</i> Go and draw toward mount Tabor, and take with thee ten thousand men of the children of Naphtali and of the children of Zebulun?

<b>7 </b>And I will draw unto thee to the river Kishon Sisera, the captain of Jabin’s army, with his chariots and his multitude; and I will deliver him into thine hand.

<b>8 </b>And Barak said unto her, If thou wilt go with me, then I will go: but if thou wilt not go with me, <i>then</i> I will not go.

<b>9 </b>And she said, I will surely go with thee: notwithstanding the journey that thou takest shall not be for thine honour; for the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall sell Sisera into the hand of a woman. And Deborah arose, and went with Barak to Kedesh.

<b>10 </b>¶ And Barak called Zebulun and Naphtali to Kedesh; and he went up with ten thousand men at his feet: and Deborah went up with him.

<b>11 </b>Now Heber the Kenite, <i>which was</i> of the children of Hobab the father in law of Moses, had severed himself from the Kenites, and pitched his tent unto the plain of Zaanaim, which <i>is</i> by Kedesh.

<b>12 </b>And they shewed Sisera that Barak the son of Abinoam was gone up to mount Tabor.

<b>13 </b>And Sisera gathered together all his chariots, <i>even</i> nine hundred chariots of iron, and all the people that <i>were</i> with him, from Harosheth of the Gentiles unto the river of Kishon.

<b>14 </b>And Deborah said unto Barak, Up; for this <i>is</i> the day in which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath delivered Sisera into thine hand: is not the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> gone out before thee? So Barak went down from mount Tabor, and ten thousand men after him.

<b>15 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> discomfited Sisera, and all <i>his</i> chariots, and all <i>his</i> host, with the edge of the sword before Barak; so that Sisera lighted down off <i>his</i> chariot, and fled away on his feet.

<b>16 </b>But Barak pursued after the chariots, and after the host, unto Harosheth of the Gentiles: and all the host of Sisera fell upon the edge of the sword; <i>and</i> there was not a man left.

<b>17 </b>Howbeit Sisera fled away on his feet to the tent of Jael the wife of Heber the Kenite: for <i>there was</i> peace between Jabin the king of Hazor and the house of Heber the Kenite.

<b>18 </b>¶ And Jael went out to meet Sisera, and said unto him, Turn in, my lord, turn in to me; fear not. And when he had turned in unto her into the tent, she covered him with a mantle.

<b>19 </b>And he said unto her, Give me, I pray thee, a little water to drink; for I am thirsty. And she opened a bottle of milk, and gave him drink, and covered him.

<b>20 </b>Again he said unto her, Stand in the door of the tent, and it shall be, when any man doth come and inquire of thee, and say, Is there any man here? that thou shalt say, No.

<b>21 </b>Then Jael Heber’s wife took a nail of the tent, and took an hammer in her hand, and went softly unto him, and smote the nail into his temples, and fastened it into the ground: for he was fast asleep and weary. So he died.

<b>22 </b>And, behold, as Barak pursued Sisera, Jael came out to meet him, and said unto him, Come, and I will shew thee the man whom thou seekest. And when he came into her <i>tent,</i> behold, Sisera lay dead, and the nail <i>was</i> in his temples.

<b>23 </b>So God subdued on that day Jabin the king of Canaan before the children of Israel.

<b>24 </b>And the hand of the children of Israel prospered, and prevailed against Jabin the king of Canaan, until they had destroyed Jabin king of Canaan.


--------------------

CHAPTER 5

<b>1 </b>Then sang Deborah and Barak the son of Abinoam on that day, saying,

<b>2 </b>Praise ye the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> for the avenging of Israel, when the people willingly offered themselves.

<b>3 </b>Hear, O ye kings; give ear, O ye princes; I, <i>even</i> I, will sing unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; I will sing <i>praise</i> to the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel.

<b>4 </b><span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, when thou wentest out of Seir, when thou marchedst out of the field of Edom, the earth trembled, and the heavens dropped, the clouds also dropped water.

<b>5 </b>The mountains melted from before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, <i>even</i> that Sinai from before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel.

<b>6 </b>In the days of Shamgar the son of Anath, in the days of Jael, the highways were unoccupied, and the travellers walked through byways.

<b>7 </b><i>The inhabitants of</i> the villages ceased, they ceased in Israel, until that I Deborah arose, that I arose a mother in Israel.

<b>8 </b>They chose new gods; then <i>was</i> war in the gates: was there a shield or spear seen among forty thousand in Israel?

<b>9 </b>My heart <i>is</i> toward the governors of Israel, that offered themselves willingly among the people. Bless ye the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>10 </b>Speak, ye that ride on white asses, ye that sit in judgment, and walk by the way.

<b>11 </b><i>They that are delivered</i> from the noise of archers in the places of drawing water, there shall they rehearse the righteous acts of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, <i>even</i> the righteous acts <i>toward the inhabitants</i> of his villages in Israel: then shall the people of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> go down to the gates.

<b>12 </b>Awake, awake, Deborah: awake, awake, utter a song: arise, Barak, and lead thy captivity captive, thou son of Abinoam.

<b>13 </b>Then he made him that remaineth have dominion over the nobles among the people: the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> made me have dominion over the mighty.

<b>14 </b>Out of Ephraim <i>was there</i> a root of them against Amalek; after thee, Benjamin, among thy people; out of Machir came down governors, and out of Zebulun they that handle the pen of the writer.

<b>15 </b>And the princes of Issachar <i>were</i> with Deborah; even Issachar, and also Barak: he was sent on foot into the valley. For the divisions of Reuben <i>there were</i> great thoughts of heart.

<b>16 </b>Why abodest thou among the sheepfolds, to hear the bleatings of the flocks? For the divisions of Reuben <i>there were</i> great searchings of heart.

<b>17 </b>Gilead abode beyond Jordan: and why did Dan remain in ships? Asher continued on the sea shore, and abode in his breaches.

<b>18 </b>Zebulun and Naphtali <i>were</i> a people <i>that</i> jeoparded their lives unto the death in the high places of the field.

<b>19 </b>The kings came <i>and</i> fought, then fought the kings of Canaan in Taanach by the waters of Megiddo; they took no gain of money.

<b>20 </b>They fought from heaven; the stars in their courses fought against Sisera.

<b>21 </b>The river of Kishon swept them away, that ancient river, the river Kishon. O my soul, thou hast trodden down strength.

<b>22 </b>Then were the horsehoofs broken by the means of the pransings, the pransings of their mighty ones.
