<b>13 </b>Where <i>is</i> the king of Hamath, and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, of Hena, and Ivah?

<b>14 </b>¶ And Hezekiah received the letter of the hand of the messengers, and read it: and Hezekiah went up into the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and spread it before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>15 </b>And Hezekiah prayed before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and said, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel, which dwellest <i>between</i> the cherubims, thou art the God, <i>even</i> thou alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth; thou hast made heaven and earth.

<b>16 </b><span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, bow down thine ear, and hear: open, <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, thine eyes, and see: and hear the words of Sennacherib, which hath sent him to reproach the living God.

<b>17 </b>Of a truth, <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, the kings of Assyria have destroyed the nations and their lands,

<b>18 </b>And have cast their gods into the fire: for they <i>were</i> no gods, but the work of men’s hands, wood and stone: therefore they have destroyed them.

<b>19 </b>Now therefore, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> our God, I beseech thee, save thou us out of his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that thou <i>art</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God, <i>even</i> thou only.

<b>20 </b>¶ Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah, saying, Thus saith the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel, <i>That</i> which thou hast prayed to me against Sennacherib king of Assyria I have heard.

<b>21 </b>This <i>is</i> the word that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath spoken concerning him; The virgin the daughter of Zion hath despised thee, <i>and</i> laughed thee to scorn; the daughter of Jerusalem hath shaken her head at thee.

<b>22 </b>Whom hast thou reproached and blasphemed? and against whom hast thou exalted <i>thy</i> voice, and lifted up thine eyes on high? <i>even</i> against the Holy <i>One</i> of Israel.

<b>23 </b>By thy messengers thou hast reproached the Lord, and hast said, With the multitude of my chariots I am come up to the height of the mountains, to the sides of Lebanon, and will cut down the tall cedar trees thereof, <i>and</i> the choice fir trees thereof: and I will enter into the lodgings of his borders, <i>and into</i> the forest of his Carmel.

<b>24 </b>I have digged and drunk strange waters, and with the sole of my feet have I dried up all the rivers of besieged places.

<b>25 </b>Hast thou not heard long ago <i>how</i> I have done it, <i>and</i> of ancient times that I have formed it? now have I brought it to pass, that thou shouldest be to lay waste fenced cities <i>into</i> ruinous heaps.

<b>26 </b>Therefore their inhabitants were of small power, they were dismayed and confounded; they were <i>as</i> the grass of the field, and <i>as</i> the green herb, <i>as</i> the grass on the housetops, and <i>as corn</i> blasted before it be grown up.

<b>27 </b>But I know thy abode, and thy going out, and thy coming in, and thy rage against me.

<b>28 </b>Because thy rage against me and thy tumult is come up into mine ears, therefore I will put my hook in thy nose, and my bridle in thy lips, and I will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest.

<b>29 </b>And this <i>shall be</i> a sign unto thee, Ye shall eat this year such things as grow of themselves, and in the second year that which springeth of the same; and in the third year sow ye, and reap, and plant vineyards, and eat the fruits thereof.

<b>30 </b>And the remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah shall yet again take root downward, and bear fruit upward.

<b>31 </b>For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant, and they that escape out of mount Zion: the zeal of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>of hosts</i> shall do this.

<b>32 </b>Therefore thus saith the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> concerning the king of Assyria, He shall not come into this city, nor shoot an arrow there, nor come before it with shield, nor cast a bank against it.

<b>33 </b>By the way that he came, by the same shall he return, and shall not come into this city, saith the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>34 </b>For I will defend this city, to save it, for mine own sake, and for my servant David’s sake.

<b>35 </b>¶ And it came to pass that night, that the angel of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> went out, and smote in the camp of the Assyrians an hundred fourscore and five thousand: and when they arose early in the morning, behold, they <i>were</i> all dead corpses.

<b>36 </b>So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed, and went and returned, and dwelt at Nineveh.

<b>37 </b>And it came to pass, as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons smote him with the sword: and they escaped into the land of Armenia. And Esarhaddon his son reigned in his stead.


--------------------

CHAPTER 20

<b>1 </b>In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And the prophet Isaiah the son of Amoz came to him, and said unto him, Thus saith the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, Set thine house in order; for thou shalt die, and not live.

<b>2 </b>Then he turned his face to the wall, and prayed unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, saying,

<b>3 </b>I beseech thee, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, remember now how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done <i>that which is</i> good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept sore.

<b>4 </b>And it came to pass, afore Isaiah was gone out into the middle court, that the word of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> came to him, saying,

<b>5 </b>Turn again, and tell Hezekiah the captain of my people, Thus saith the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, the God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears: behold, I will heal thee: on the third day thou shalt go up unto the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>6 </b>And I will add unto thy days fifteen years; and I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria; and I will defend this city for mine own sake, and for my servant David’s sake.

<b>7 </b>And Isaiah said, Take a lump of figs. And they took and laid <i>it</i> on the boil, and he recovered.

<b>8 </b>¶ And Hezekiah said unto Isaiah, What <i>shall be</i> the sign that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> will heal me, and that I shall go up into the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> the third day?

<b>9 </b>And Isaiah said, This sign shalt thou have of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, that the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> will do the thing that he hath spoken: shall the shadow go forward ten degrees, or go back ten degrees?

<b>10 </b>And Hezekiah answered, It is a light thing for the shadow to go down ten degrees: nay, but let the shadow return backward ten degrees.

<b>11 </b>And Isaiah the prophet cried unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: and he brought the shadow ten degrees backward, by which it had gone down in the dial of Ahaz.

<b>12 </b>¶ At that time Berodach-baladan, the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present unto Hezekiah: for he had heard that Hezekiah had been sick.

<b>13 </b>And Hezekiah hearkened unto them, and shewed them all the house of his precious things, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the precious ointment, and <i>all</i> the house of his armour, and all that was found in his treasures: there was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah shewed them not.

<b>14 </b>¶ Then came Isaiah the prophet unto king Hezekiah, and said unto him, What said these men? and from whence came they unto thee? And Hezekiah said, They are come from a far country, <i>even</i> from Babylon.

<b>15 </b>And he said, What have they seen in thine house? And Hezekiah answered, All <i>the things</i> that <i>are</i> in mine house have they seen: there is nothing among my treasures that I have not shewed them.

<b>16 </b>And Isaiah said unto Hezekiah, Hear the word of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>17 </b>Behold, the days come, that all that <i>is</i> in thine house, and that which thy fathers have laid up in store unto this day, shall be carried into Babylon: nothing shall be left, saith the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>18 </b>And of thy sons that shall issue from thee, which thou shalt beget, shall they take away; and they shall be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.

<b>19 </b>Then said Hezekiah unto Isaiah, Good <i>is</i> the word of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> which thou hast spoken. And he said, <i>Is it</i> not <i>good,</i> if peace and truth be in my days?

<b>20 </b>¶ And the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and all his might, and how he made a pool, and a conduit, and brought water into the city, <i>are</i> they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

<b>21 </b>And Hezekiah slept with his fathers: and Manasseh his son reigned in his stead.


--------------------

CHAPTER 21

<b>1 </b>Manasseh <i>was</i> twelve years old when he began to reign, and reigned fifty and five years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name <i>was</i> Hephzi-bah.

<b>2 </b>And he did <i>that which was</i> evil in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, after the abominations of the heathen, whom the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> cast out before the children of Israel.

<b>3 </b>For he built up again the high places which Hezekiah his father had destroyed; and he reared up altars for Baal, and made a grove, as did Ahab king of Israel; and worshipped all the host of heaven, and served them.

<b>4 </b>And he built altars in the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, of which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said, In Jerusalem will I put my name.

<b>5 </b>And he built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>6 </b>And he made his son pass through the fire, and observed times, and used enchantments, and dealt with familiar spirits and wizards: he wrought much wickedness in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, to provoke <i>him</i> to anger.

<b>7 </b>And he set a graven image of the grove that he had made in the house, of which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said to David, and to Solomon his son, In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all tribes of Israel, will I put my name for ever:

<b>8 </b>Neither will I make the feet of Israel move any more out of the land which I gave their fathers; only if they will observe to do according to all that I have commanded them, and according to all the law that my servant Moses commanded them.

<b>9 </b>But they hearkened not: and Manasseh seduced them to do more evil than did the nations whom the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> destroyed before the children of Israel.

<b>10 </b>¶ And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> spake by his servants the prophets, saying,

<b>11 </b>Because Manasseh king of Judah hath done these abominations, <i>and</i> hath done wickedly above all that the Amorites did, which <i>were</i> before him, and hath made Judah also to sin with his idols:

<b>12 </b>Therefore thus saith the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel, Behold, I <i>am</i> bringing <i>such</i> evil upon Jerusalem and Judah, that whosoever heareth of it, both his ears shall tingle.

<b>13 </b>And I will stretch over Jerusalem the line of Samaria, and the plummet of the house of Ahab: and I will wipe Jerusalem as <i>a man</i> wipeth a dish, wiping <i>it,</i> and turning <i>it</i> upside down.

<b>14 </b>And I will forsake the remnant of mine inheritance, and deliver them into the hand of their enemies; and they shall become a prey and a spoil to all their enemies;

<b>15 </b>Because they have done <i>that which was</i> evil in my sight, and have provoked me to anger, since the day their fathers came forth out of Egypt, even unto this day.

<b>16 </b>Moreover Manasseh shed innocent blood very much, till he had filled Jerusalem from one end to another; beside his sin wherewith he made Judah to sin, in doing <i>that which was</i> evil in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>17 </b>¶ Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and all that he did, and his sin that he sinned, <i>are</i> they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

<b>18 </b>And Manasseh slept with his fathers, and was buried in the garden of his own house, in the garden of Uzza: and Amon his son reigned in his stead.

<b>19 </b>¶ Amon <i>was</i> twenty and two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned two years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name <i>was</i> Meshullemeth, the daughter of Haruz of Jotbah.

<b>20 </b>And he did <i>that which was</i> evil in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, as his father Manasseh did.

<b>21 </b>And he walked in all the way that his father walked in, and served the idols that his father served, and worshipped them:

<b>22 </b>And he forsook the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of his fathers, and walked not in the way of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>23 </b>¶ And the servants of Amon conspired against him, and slew the king in his own house.

<b>24 </b>And the people of the land slew all them that had conspired against king Amon; and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his stead.

<b>25 </b>Now the rest of the acts of Amon which he did, <i>are</i> they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

<b>26 </b>And he was buried in his sepulchre in the garden of Uzza: and Josiah his son reigned in his stead.


--------------------

CHAPTER 22

<b>1 </b>Josiah <i>was</i> eight years old when he began to reign, and he reigned thirty and one years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name <i>was</i> Jedidah, the daughter of Adaiah of Boscath.

<b>2 </b>And he did <i>that which was</i> right in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and walked in all the way of David his father, and turned not aside to the right hand or to the left.

<b>3 </b>¶ And it came to pass in the eighteenth year of king Josiah, <i>that</i> the king sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah, the son of Meshullam, the scribe, to the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, saying,

<b>4 </b>Go up to Hilkiah the high priest, that he may sum the silver which is brought into the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, which the keepers of the door have gathered of the people:

<b>5 </b>And let them deliver it into the hand of the doers of the work, that have the oversight of the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: and let them give it to the doers of the work which <i>is</i> in the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, to repair the breaches of the house,

<b>6 </b>Unto carpenters, and builders, and masons, and to buy timber and hewn stone to repair the house.

<b>7 </b>Howbeit there was no reckoning made with them of the money that was delivered into their hand, because they dealt faithfully.

<b>8 </b>¶ And Hilkiah the high priest said unto Shaphan the scribe, I have found the book of the law in the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>. And Hilkiah gave the book to Shaphan, and he read it.

<b>9 </b>And Shaphan the scribe came to the king, and brought the king word again, and said, Thy servants have gathered the money that was found in the house, and have delivered it into the hand of them that do the work, that have the oversight of the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>10 </b>And Shaphan the scribe shewed the king, saying, Hilkiah the priest hath delivered me a book. And Shaphan read it before the king.

<b>11 </b>And it came to pass, when the king had heard the words of the book of the law, that he rent his clothes.

<b>12 </b>And the king commanded Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam the son of Shaphan, and Achbor the son of Michaiah, and Shaphan the scribe, and Asahiah a servant of the king’s, saying,

<b>13 </b>Go ye, inquire of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> for me, and for the people, and for all Judah, concerning the words of this book that is found: for great <i>is</i> the wrath of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> that is kindled against us, because our fathers have not hearkened unto the words of this book, to do according unto all that which is written concerning us.

<b>14 </b>So Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam, and Achbor, and Shaphan, and Asahiah, went unto Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvah, the son of Harhas, keeper of the wardrobe; (now she dwelt in Jerusalem in the college;) and they communed with her.

<b>15 </b>¶ And she said unto them, Thus saith the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel, Tell the man that sent you to me,

<b>16 </b>Thus saith the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, Behold, I will bring evil upon this place, and upon the inhabitants thereof, <i>even</i> all the words of the book which the king of Judah hath read:

<b>17 </b>Because they have forsaken me, and have burned incense unto other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all the works of their hands; therefore my wrath shall be kindled against this place, and shall not be quenched.

<b>18 </b>But to the king of Judah which sent you to inquire of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, thus shall ye say to him, Thus saith the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel, <i>As touching</i> the words which thou hast heard;

<b>19 </b>Because thine heart was tender, and thou hast humbled thyself before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, when thou heardest what I spake against this place, and against the inhabitants thereof, that they should become a desolation and a curse, and hast rent thy clothes, and wept before me; I also have heard <i>thee,</i> saith the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>20 </b>Behold therefore, I will gather thee unto thy fathers, and thou shalt be gathered into thy grave in peace; and thine eyes shall not see all the evil which I will bring upon this place. And they brought the king word again.


--------------------

CHAPTER 23

<b>1 </b>And the king sent, and they gathered unto him all the elders of Judah and of Jerusalem.

<b>2 </b>And the king went up into the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and all the men of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem with him, and the priests, and the prophets, and all the people, both small and great: and he read in their ears all the words of the book of the covenant which was found in the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>3 </b>¶ And the king stood by a pillar, and made a covenant before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, to walk after the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and to keep his commandments and his testimonies and his statutes with all <i>their</i> heart and all <i>their</i> soul, to perform the words of this covenant that were written in this book. And all the people stood to the covenant.

<b>4 </b>And the king commanded Hilkiah the high priest, and the priests of the second order, and the keepers of the door, to bring forth out of the temple of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> all the vessels that were made for Baal, and for the grove, and for all the host of heaven: and he burned them without Jerusalem in the fields of Kidron, and carried the ashes of them unto Beth-el.

<b>5 </b>And he put down the idolatrous priests, whom the kings of Judah had ordained to burn incense in the high places in the cities of Judah, and in the places round about Jerusalem; them also that burned incense unto Baal, to the sun, and to the moon, and to the planets, and to all the host of heaven.

<b>6 </b>And he brought out the grove from the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, without Jerusalem, unto the brook Kidron, and burned it at the brook Kidron, and stamped <i>it</i> small to powder, and cast the powder thereof upon the graves of the children of the people.

<b>7 </b>And he brake down the houses of the sodomites, that <i>were</i> by the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, where the women wove hangings for the grove.

<b>8 </b>And he brought all the priests out of the cities of Judah, and defiled the high places where the priests had burned incense, from Geba to Beer-sheba, and brake down the high places of the gates that <i>were</i> in the entering in of the gate of Joshua the governor of the city, which <i>were</i> on a man’s left hand at the gate of the city.

<b>9 </b>Nevertheless the priests of the high places came not up to the altar of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in Jerusalem, but they did eat of the unleavened bread among their brethren.

<b>10 </b>And he defiled Topheth, which <i>is</i> in the valley of the children of Hinnom, that no man might make his son or his daughter to pass through the fire to Molech.

<b>11 </b>And he took away the horses that the kings of Judah had given to the sun, at the entering in of the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, by the chamber of Nathan-melech the chamberlain, which <i>was</i> in the suburbs, and burned the chariots of the sun with fire.

<b>12 </b>And the altars that <i>were</i> on the top of the upper chamber of Ahaz, which the kings of Judah had made, and the altars which Manasseh had made in the two courts of the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, did the king beat down, and brake <i>them</i> down from thence, and cast the dust of them into the brook Kidron.

<b>13 </b>And the high places that <i>were</i> before Jerusalem, which <i>were</i> on the right hand of the mount of corruption, which Solomon the king of Israel had builded for Ashtoreth the abomination of the Zidonians, and for Chemosh the abomination of the Moabites, and for Milcom the abomination of the children of Ammon, did the king defile.

<b>14 </b>And he brake in pieces the images, and cut down the groves, and filled their places with the bones of men.

<b>15 </b>¶ Moreover the altar that <i>was</i> at Beth-el, <i>and</i> the high place which Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin, had made, both that altar and the high place he brake down, and burned the high place, <i>and</i> stamped <i>it</i> small to powder, and burned the grove.

<b>16 </b>And as Josiah turned himself, he spied the sepulchres that <i>were</i> there in the mount, and sent, and took the bones out of the sepulchres, and burned <i>them</i> upon the altar, and polluted it, according to the word of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> which the man of God proclaimed, who proclaimed these words.

<b>17 </b>Then he said, What title <i>is</i> that that I see? And the men of the city told him, <i>It is</i> the sepulchre of the man of God, which came from Judah, and proclaimed these things that thou hast done against the altar of Beth-el.

<b>18 </b>And he said, Let him alone; let no man move his bones. So they let his bones alone, with the bones of the prophet that came out of Samaria.

<b>19 </b>And all the houses also of the high places that <i>were</i> in the cities of Samaria, which the kings of Israel had made to provoke <i>the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span></i> to anger, Josiah took away, and did to them according to all the acts that he had done in Beth-el.

<b>20 </b>And he slew all the priests of the high places that <i>were</i> there upon the altars, and burned men’s bones upon them, and returned to Jerusalem.

<b>21 </b>¶ And the king commanded all the people, saying, Keep the passover unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> your God, as <i>it is</i> written in the book of this covenant.

<b>22 </b>Surely there was not holden such a passover from the days of the judges that judged Israel, nor in all the days of the kings of Israel, nor of the kings of Judah;

<b>23 </b>But in the eighteenth year of king Josiah, <i>wherein</i> this passover was holden to the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in Jerusalem.

<b>24 </b>¶ Moreover the <i>workers with</i> familiar spirits, and the wizards, and the images, and the idols, and all the abominations that were spied in the land of Judah and in Jerusalem, did Josiah put away, that he might perform the words of the law which were written in the book that Hilkiah the priest found in the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>25 </b>And like unto him was there no king before him, that turned to the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> with all his heart, and with all his soul, and with all his might, according to all the law of Moses; neither after him arose there <i>any</i> like him.

<b>26 </b>¶ Notwithstanding the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> turned not from the fierceness of his great wrath, wherewith his anger was kindled against Judah, because of all the provocations that Manasseh had provoked him withal.

<b>27 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said, I will remove Judah also out of my sight, as I have removed Israel, and will cast off this city Jerusalem which I have chosen, and the house of which I said, My name shall be there.

<b>28 </b>Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and all that he did, <i>are</i> they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

<b>29 </b>¶ In his days Pharaoh-nechoh king of Egypt went up against the king of Assyria to the river Euphrates: and king Josiah went against him; and he slew him at Megiddo, when he had seen him.

<b>30 </b>And his servants carried him in a chariot dead from Megiddo, and brought him to Jerusalem, and buried him in his own sepulchre. And the people of the land took Jehoahaz the son of Josiah, and anointed him, and made him king in his father’s stead.

<b>31 </b>¶ Jehoahaz <i>was</i> twenty and three years old when he began to reign; and he reigned three months in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name <i>was</i> Hamutal, the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

<b>32 </b>And he did <i>that which was</i> evil in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, according to all that his fathers had done.

<b>33 </b>And Pharaoh-nechoh put him in bands at Riblah in the land of Hamath, that he might not reign in Jerusalem; and put the land to a tribute of an hundred talents of silver, and a talent of gold.

<b>34 </b>And Pharaoh-nechoh made Eliakim the son of Josiah king in the room of Josiah his father, and turned his name to Jehoiakim, and took Jehoahaz away: and he came to Egypt, and died there.

<b>35 </b>And Jehoiakim gave the silver and the gold to Pharaoh; but he taxed the land to give the money according to the commandment of Pharaoh: he exacted the silver and the gold of the people of the land, of every one according to his taxation, to give <i>it</i> unto Pharaoh-nechoh.

<b>36 </b>¶ Jehoiakim <i>was</i> twenty and five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name <i>was</i> Zebudah, the daughter of Pedaiah of Rumah.

<b>37 </b>And he did <i>that which was</i> evil in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, according to all that his fathers had done.


--------------------

CHAPTER 24

<b>1 </b>In his days Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up, and Jehoiakim became his servant three years: then he turned and rebelled against him.

<b>2 </b>And the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> sent against him bands of the Chaldees, and bands of the Syrians, and bands of the Moabites, and bands of the children of Ammon, and sent them against Judah to destroy it, according to the word of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, which he spake by his servants the prophets.

<b>3 </b>Surely at the commandment of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> came <i>this</i> upon Judah, to remove <i>them</i> out of his sight, for the sins of Manasseh, according to all that he did;

<b>4 </b>And also for the innocent blood that he shed: for he filled Jerusalem with innocent blood; which the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> would not pardon.

<b>5 </b>¶ Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim, and all that he did, <i>are</i> they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

<b>6 </b>So Jehoiakim slept with his fathers: and Jehoiachin his son reigned in his stead.

<b>7 </b>And the king of Egypt came not again any more out of his land: for the king of Babylon had taken from the river of Egypt unto the river Euphrates all that pertained to the king of Egypt.

<b>8 </b>¶ Jehoiachin <i>was</i> eighteen years old when he began to reign, and he reigned in Jerusalem three months. And his mother’s name <i>was</i> Nehushta, the daughter of Elnathan of Jerusalem.

<b>9 </b>And he did <i>that which was</i> evil in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, according to all that his father had done.

<b>10 </b>¶ At that time the servants of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up against Jerusalem, and the city was besieged.

<b>11 </b>And Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came against the city, and his servants did besiege it.

<b>12 </b>And Jehoiachin the king of Judah went out to the king of Babylon, he, and his mother, and his servants, and his princes, and his officers: and the king of Babylon took him in the eighth year of his reign.

<b>13 </b>And he carried out thence all the treasures of the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and the treasures of the king’s house, and cut in pieces all the vessels of gold which Solomon king of Israel had made in the temple of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, as the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> had said.

<b>14 </b>And he carried away all Jerusalem, and all the princes, and all the mighty men of valour, <i>even</i> ten thousand captives, and all the craftsmen and smiths: none remained, save the poorest sort of the people of the land.

<b>15 </b>And he carried away Jehoiachin to Babylon, and the king’s mother, and the king’s wives, and his officers, and the mighty of the land, <i>those</i> carried he into captivity from Jerusalem to Babylon.

<b>16 </b>And all the men of might, <i>even</i> seven thousand, and craftsmen and smiths a thousand, all <i>that were</i> strong <i>and</i> apt for war, even them the king of Babylon brought captive to Babylon.

<b>17 </b>¶ And the king of Babylon made Mattaniah his father’s brother king in his stead, and changed his name to Zedekiah.

<b>18 </b>Zedekiah <i>was</i> twenty and one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name <i>was</i> Hamutal, the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

<b>19 </b>And he did <i>that which was</i> evil in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.

<b>20 </b>For through the anger of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> it came to pass in Jerusalem and Judah, until he had cast them out from his presence, that Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.


--------------------

CHAPTER 25

<b>1 </b>And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth <i>day</i> of the month, <i>that</i> Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came, he, and all his host, against Jerusalem, and pitched against it; and they built forts against it round about.

<b>2 </b>And the city was besieged unto the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.

<b>3 </b>And on the ninth <i>day</i> of the <i>fourth</i> month the famine prevailed in the city, and there was no bread for the people of the land.

<b>4 </b>¶ And the city was broken up, and all the men of war <i>fled</i> by night by the way of the gate between two walls, which <i>is</i> by the king’s garden: (now the Chaldees <i>were</i> against the city round about:) and <i>the king</i> went the way toward the plain.

<b>5 </b>And the army of the Chaldees pursued after the king, and overtook him in the plains of Jericho: and all his army were scattered from him.

<b>6 </b>So they took the king, and brought him up to the king of Babylon to Riblah; and they gave judgment upon him.

<b>7 </b>And they slew the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes, and put out the eyes of Zedekiah, and bound him with fetters of brass, and carried him to Babylon.

<b>8 </b>¶ And in the fifth month, on the seventh <i>day</i> of the month, which <i>is</i> the nineteenth year of king Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, came Nebuzar-adan, captain of the guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, unto Jerusalem:

<b>9 </b>And he burnt the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and the king’s house, and all the houses of Jerusalem, and every great <i>man’s</i> house burnt he with fire.

<b>10 </b>And all the army of the Chaldees, that <i>were with</i> the captain of the guard, brake down the walls of Jerusalem round about.

<b>11 </b>Now the rest of the people <i>that were</i> left in the city, and the fugitives that fell away to the king of Babylon, with the remnant of the multitude, did Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard carry away.

<b>12 </b>But the captain of the guard left of the poor of the land <i>to be</i> vinedressers and husbandmen.

<b>13 </b>And the pillars of brass that <i>were</i> in the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and the bases, and the brasen sea that <i>was</i> in the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, did the Chaldees break in pieces, and carried the brass of them to Babylon.

<b>14 </b>And the pots, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the spoons, and all the vessels of brass wherewith they ministered, took they away.

<b>15 </b>And the firepans, and the bowls, <i>and</i> such things as <i>were</i> of gold, <i>in</i> gold, and of silver, <i>in</i> silver, the captain of the guard took away.

<b>16 </b>The two pillars, one sea, and the bases which Solomon had made for the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; the brass of all these vessels was without weight.

<b>17 </b>The height of the one pillar <i>was</i> eighteen cubits, and the chapiter upon it <i>was</i> brass: and the height of the chapiter three cubits; and the wreathen work, and pomegranates upon the chapiter round about, all of brass: and like unto these had the second pillar with wreathen work.

<b>18 </b>¶ And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the door:

<b>19 </b>And out of the city he took an officer that was set over the men of war, and five men of them that were in the king’s presence, which were found in the city, and the principal scribe of the host, which mustered the people of the land, and threescore men of the people of the land <i>that were</i> found in the city:

<b>20 </b>And Nebuzar-adan captain of the guard took these, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah:

<b>21 </b>And the king of Babylon smote them, and slew them at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away out of their land.

<b>22 </b>¶ And <i>as for</i> the people that remained in the land of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had left, even over them he made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, ruler.

<b>23 </b>And when all the captains of the armies, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah governor, there came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, even Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan the son of Careah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah the son of a Maachathite, they and their men.

<b>24 </b>And Gedaliah sware to them, and to their men, and said unto them, Fear not to be the servants of the Chaldees: dwell in the land, and serve the king of Babylon; and it shall be well with you.

<b>25 </b>But it came to pass in the seventh month, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the seed royal, came, and ten men with him, and smote Gedaliah, that he died, and the Jews and the Chaldees that were with him at Mizpah.

<b>26 </b>And all the people, both small and great, and the captains of the armies, arose, and came to Egypt: for they were afraid of the Chaldees.

<b>27 </b>¶ And it came to pass in the seven and thirtieth year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the seven and twentieth <i>day</i> of the month, <i>that</i> Evil-merodach king of Babylon in the year that he began to reign did lift up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah out of prison;

<b>28 </b>And he spake kindly to him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings that <i>were</i> with him in Babylon;

<b>29 </b>And changed his prison garments: and he did eat bread continually before him all the days of his life.

<b>30 </b>And his allowance <i>was</i> a continual allowance given him of the king, a daily rate for every day, all the days of his life.


--------------------

<small>The First Book of the </small>Chronicles

CHAPTER 1

<b>1 </b>Adam, Sheth, Enosh,

<b>2 </b>Kenan, Mahalaleel, Jered,

<b>3 </b>Henoch, Methuselah, Lamech,

<b>4 </b>Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

<b>5 </b>¶ The sons of Japheth; Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.

<b>6 </b>And the sons of Gomer; Ashchenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.

<b>7 </b>And the sons of Javan; Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

<b>8 </b>¶ The sons of Ham; Cush, and Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

<b>9 </b>And the sons of Cush; Seba, and Havilah, and Sabta, and Raamah, and Sabtecha. And the sons of Raamah; Sheba, and Dedan.

<b>10 </b>And Cush begat Nimrod: he began to be mighty upon the earth.

<b>11 </b>And Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,

<b>12 </b>And Pathrusim, and Casluhim, (of whom came the Philistines,) and Caphthorim.

<b>13 </b>And Canaan begat Zidon his firstborn, and Heth,

<b>14 </b>The Jebusite also, and the Amorite, and the Girgashite,

<b>15 </b>And the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,

<b>16 </b>And the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.

<b>17 </b>¶ The sons of Shem; Elam, and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram, and Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Meshech.

<b>18 </b>And Arphaxad begat Shelah, and Shelah begat Eber.

<b>19 </b>And unto Eber were born two sons: the name of the one <i>was</i> Peleg; because in his days the earth was divided: and his brother’s name <i>was</i> Joktan.

<b>20 </b>And Joktan begat Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,

<b>21 </b>Hadoram also, and Uzal, and Diklah,

<b>22 </b>And Ebal, and Abimael, and Sheba,

<b>23 </b>And Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab. All these <i>were</i> the sons of Joktan.

<b>24 </b>¶ Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,

<b>25 </b>Eber, Peleg, Reu,

<b>26 </b>Serug, Nahor, Terah,

<b>27 </b>Abram; the same <i>is</i> Abraham.

<b>28 </b>The sons of Abraham; Isaac, and Ishmael.

<b>29 </b>¶ These <i>are</i> their generations: The firstborn of Ishmael, Nebaioth; then Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,

<b>30 </b>Mishma, and Dumah, Massa, Hadad, and Tema,

<b>31 </b>Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.

<b>32 </b>¶ Now the sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: she bare Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah. And the sons of Jokshan; Sheba, and Dedan.

<b>33 </b>And the sons of Midian; Ephah, and Epher, and Henoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these <i>are</i> the sons of Keturah.

<b>34 </b>And Abraham begat Isaac. The sons of Isaac; Esau and Israel.

<b>35 </b>¶ The sons of Esau; Eliphaz, Reuel, and Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah.

<b>36 </b>The sons of Eliphaz; Teman, and Omar, Zephi, and Gatam, Kenaz, and Timna, and Amalek.

<b>37 </b>The sons of Reuel; Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.

<b>38 </b>And the sons of Seir; Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah, and Dishon, and Ezer, and Dishan.

<b>39 </b>And the sons of Lotan; Hori, and Homam: and Timna <i>was</i> Lotan’s sister.

<b>40 </b>The sons of Shobal; Alian, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. And the sons of Zibeon; Aiah, and Anah.

<b>41 </b>The sons of Anah; Dishon. And the sons of Dishon; Amram, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.

<b>42 </b>The sons of Ezer; Bilhan, and Zavan, <i>and</i> Jakan. The sons of Dishan; Uz, and Aran.

<b>43 </b>¶ Now these <i>are</i> the kings that reigned in the land of Edom before <i>any</i> king reigned over the children of Israel; Bela the son of Beor: and the name of his city <i>was</i> Dinhabah.

<b>44 </b>And when Bela was dead, Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his stead.

<b>45 </b>And when Jobab was dead, Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his stead.

<b>46 </b>And when Husham was dead, Hadad the son of Bedad, which smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead: and the name of his city <i>was</i> Avith.

<b>47 </b>And when Hadad was dead, Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.

<b>48 </b>And when Samlah was dead, Shaul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his stead.

<b>49 </b>And when Shaul was dead, Baal-hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.

<b>50 </b>And when Baal-hanan was dead, Hadad reigned in his stead: and the name of his city <i>was</i> Pai; and his wife’s name <i>was</i> Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.

<b>51 </b>¶ Hadad died also. And the dukes of Edom were; duke Timnah, duke Aliah, duke Jetheth,

<b>52 </b>Duke Aholibamah, duke Elah, duke Pinon,

<b>53 </b>Duke Kenaz, duke Teman, duke Mibzar,

<b>54 </b>Duke Magdiel, duke Iram. These <i>are</i> the dukes of Edom.


--------------------

CHAPTER 2

<b>1 </b>These <i>are</i> the sons of Israel; Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun,

<b>2 </b>Dan, Joseph, and Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

<b>3 </b>¶ The sons of Judah; Er, and Onan, and Shelah: <i>which</i> three were born unto him of the daughter of Shua the Canaanitess. And Er, the firstborn of Judah, was evil in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; and he slew him.

<b>4 </b>And Tamar his daughter in law bare him Pharez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah <i>were</i> five.

<b>5 </b>The sons of Pharez; Hezron, and Hamul.

<b>6 </b>And the sons of Zerah; Zimri, and Ethan, and Heman, and Calcol, and Dara: five of them in all.

<b>7 </b>And the sons of Carmi; Achar, the troubler of Israel, who transgressed in the thing accursed.

<b>8 </b>And the sons of Ethan; Azariah.

<b>9 </b>The sons also of Hezron, that were born unto him; Jerahmeel, and Ram, and Chelubai.

<b>10 </b>And Ram begat Amminadab; and Amminadab begat Nahshon, prince of the children of Judah;

<b>11 </b>And Nahshon begat Salma, and Salma begat Boaz,

<b>12 </b>And Boaz begat Obed, and Obed begat Jesse,

<b>13 </b>¶ And Jesse begat his firstborn Eliab, and Abinadab the second, and Shimma the third,

<b>14 </b>Nethaneel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,

<b>15 </b>Ozem the sixth, David the seventh:

<b>16 </b>Whose sisters <i>were</i> Zeruiah, and Abigail. And the sons of Zeruiah; Abishai, and Joab, and Asahel, three.

<b>17 </b>And Abigail bare Amasa: and the father of Amasa <i>was</i> Jether the Ishmeelite.

<b>18 </b>¶ And Caleb the son of Hezron begat <i>children</i> of Azubah <i>his</i> wife, and of Jerioth: her sons <i>are</i> these; Jesher, and Shobab, and Ardon.

<b>19 </b>And when Azubah was dead, Caleb took unto him Ephrath, which bare him Hur.

<b>20 </b>And Hur begat Uri, and Uri begat Bezaleel.

<b>21 </b>¶ And afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he married when he <i>was</i> threescore years old; and she bare him Segub.

<b>22 </b>And Segub begat Jair, who had three and twenty cities in the land of Gilead.

<b>23 </b>And he took Geshur, and Aram, with the towns of Jair, from them, with Kenath, and the towns thereof, <i>even</i> threescore cities. All these <i>belonged to</i> the sons of Machir the father of Gilead.

<b>24 </b>And after that Hezron was dead in Caleb-ephratah, then Abiah Hezron’s wife bare him Ashur the father of Tekoa.

<b>25 </b>¶ And the sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron were, Ram the firstborn, and Bunah, and Oren, and Ozem, <i>and</i> Ahijah.

<b>26 </b>Jerahmeel had also another wife, whose name <i>was</i> Atarah; she <i>was</i> the mother of Onam.

<b>27 </b>And the sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel were, Maaz, and Jamin, and Eker.

<b>28 </b>And the sons of Onam were, Shammai, and Jada. And the sons of Shammai; Nadab, and Abishur.

<b>29 </b>And the name of the wife of Abishur <i>was</i> Abihail, and she bare him Ahban, and Molid.

<b>30 </b>And the sons of Nadab; Seled, and Appaim: but Seled died without children.

<b>31 </b>And the sons of Appaim; Ishi. And the sons of Ishi; Sheshan. And the children of Sheshan; Ahlai.

<b>32 </b>And the sons of Jada the brother of Shammai; Jether, and Jonathan: and Jether died without children.

<b>33 </b>And the sons of Jonathan; Peleth, and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.

<b>34 </b>¶ Now Sheshan had no sons, but daughters. And Sheshan had a servant, an Egyptian, whose name <i>was</i> Jarha.

<b>35 </b>And Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant to wife; and she bare him Attai.

<b>36 </b>And Attai begat Nathan, and Nathan begat Zabad,

<b>37 </b>And Zabad begat Ephlal, and Ephlal begat Obed,

<b>38 </b>And Obed begat Jehu, and Jehu begat Azariah,

<b>39 </b>And Azariah begat Helez, and Helez begat Eleasah,

<b>40 </b>And Eleasah begat Sisamai, and Sisamai begat Shallum,

<b>41 </b>And Shallum begat Jekamiah, and Jekamiah begat Elishama.

<b>42 </b>¶ Now the sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel <i>were,</i> Mesha his firstborn, which <i>was</i> the father of Ziph; and the sons of Mareshah the father of Hebron.

<b>43 </b>And the sons of Hebron; Korah, and Tappuah, and Rekem, and Shema.

<b>44 </b>And Shema begat Raham, the father of Jorkoam: and Rekem begat Shammai.

<b>45 </b>And the son of Shammai <i>was</i> Maon: and Maon <i>was</i> the father of Beth-zur.

<b>46 </b>And Ephah, Caleb’s concubine, bare Haran, and Moza, and Gazez: and Haran begat Gazez.

<b>47 </b>And the sons of Jahdai; Regem, and Jotham, and Geshan, and Pelet, and Ephah, and Shaaph.

<b>48 </b>Maachah, Caleb’s concubine, bare Sheber, and Tirhanah.

<b>49 </b>She bare also Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbenah, and the father of Gibea: and the daughter of Caleb <i>was</i> Achsah.

<b>50 </b>¶ These were the sons of Caleb the son of Hur, the firstborn of Ephratah; Shobal the father of Kirjath-jearim,

<b>51 </b>Salma the father of Beth-lehem, Hareph the father of Beth-gader.

<b>52 </b>And Shobal the father of Kirjath-jearim had sons; Haroeh, <i>and</i> half of the Manahethites.

<b>53 </b>And the families of Kirjath-jearim; the Ithrites, and the Puhites, and the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; of them came the Zareathites, and the Eshtaulites.

<b>54 </b>The sons of Salma; Beth-lehem, and the Netophathites, Ataroth, the house of Joab, and half of the Manahethites, the Zorites.

<b>55 </b>And the families of the scribes which dwelt at Jabez; the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, <i>and</i> Suchathites. These <i>are</i> the Kenites that came of Hemath, the father of the house of Rechab.


--------------------

CHAPTER 3

<b>1 </b>Now these were the sons of David, which were born unto him in Hebron; the firstborn Amnon, of Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second Daniel, of Abigail the Carmelitess:

<b>2 </b>The third, Absalom the son of Maachah the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur: the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith:

<b>3 </b>The fifth, Shephatiah of Abital: the sixth, Ithream by Eglah his wife.

<b>4 </b><i>These</i> six were born unto him in Hebron; and there he reigned seven years and six months: and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty and three years.

<b>5 </b>And these were born unto him in Jerusalem; Shimea, and Shobab, and Nathan, and Solomon, four, of Bath-shua the daughter of Ammiel:

<b>6 </b>Ibhar also, and Elishama, and Eliphelet,

<b>7 </b>And Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,

<b>8 </b>And Elishama, and Eliada, and Eliphelet, nine.

<b>9 </b><i>These were</i> all the sons of David, beside the sons of the concubines, and Tamar their sister.

<b>10 </b>¶ And Solomon’s son <i>was</i> Rehoboam, Abia his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,

<b>11 </b>Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,

<b>12 </b>Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,

<b>13 </b>Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,

<b>14 </b>Amon his son, Josiah his son.

<b>15 </b>And the sons of Josiah <i>were,</i> the firstborn Johanan, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, the fourth Shallum.

<b>16 </b>And the sons of Jehoiakim: Jeconiah his son, Zedekiah his son.

<b>17 </b>¶ And the sons of Jeconiah; Assir, Salathiel his son,

<b>18 </b>Malchiram also, and Pedaiah, and Shenazar, Jecamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.

<b>19 </b>And the sons of Pedaiah <i>were,</i> Zerubbabel, and Shimei: and the sons of Zerubbabel; Meshullam, and Hananiah, and Shelomith their sister:

<b>20 </b>And Hashubah, and Ohel, and Berechiah, and Hasadiah, Jushab-hesed, five.

<b>21 </b>And the sons of Hananiah; Pelatiah, and Jesaiah: the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, the sons of Shechaniah.

<b>22 </b>And the sons of Shechaniah; Shemaiah: and the sons of Shemaiah; Hattush, and Igeal, and Bariah, and Neariah, and Shaphat, six.

<b>23 </b>And the sons of Neariah; Elioenai, and Hezekiah, and Azrikam, three.

<b>24 </b>And the sons of Elioenai <i>were,</i> Hodaiah, and Eliashib, and Pelaiah, and Akkub, and Johanan, and Dalaiah, and Anani, seven.


--------------------

CHAPTER 4

<b>1 </b>The sons of Judah; Pharez, Hezron, and Carmi, and Hur, and Shobal.

<b>2 </b>And Reaiah the son of Shobal begat Jahath; and Jahath begat Ahumai, and Lahad. These <i>are</i> the families of the Zorathites.

<b>3 </b>And these <i>were of</i> the father of Etam; Jezreel, and Ishma, and Idbash: and the name of their sister <i>was</i> Hazelelponi:

<b>4 </b>And Penuel the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These <i>are</i> the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephratah, the father of Beth-lehem.

<b>5 </b>¶ And Ashur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.

<b>6 </b>And Naarah bare him Ahuzam, and Hepher, and Temeni, and Haahashtari. These <i>were</i> the sons of Naarah.

<b>7 </b>And the sons of Helah <i>were,</i> Zereth, and Jezoar, and Ethnan.

<b>8 </b>And Coz begat Anub, and Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.

<b>9 </b>¶ And Jabez was more honourable than his brethren: and his mother called his name Jabez, saying, Because I bare him with sorrow.

<b>10 </b>And Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, Oh that thou wouldest bless me indeed, and enlarge my coast, and that thine hand might be with me, and that thou wouldest keep <i>me</i> from evil, that it may not grieve me! And God granted him that which he requested.

<b>11 </b>¶ And Chelub the brother of Shuah begat Mehir, which <i>was</i> the father of Eshton.

<b>12 </b>And Eshton begat Beth-rapha, and Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Ir-nahash. These <i>are</i> the men of Rechah.

<b>13 </b>And the sons of Kenaz; Othniel, and Seraiah: and the sons of Othniel; Hathath.

<b>14 </b>And Meonothai begat Ophrah: and Seraiah begat Joab, the father of the valley of Charashim; for they were craftsmen.

<b>15 </b>And the sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh; Iru, Elah, and Naam: and the sons of Elah, even Kenaz.

<b>16 </b>And the sons of Jehaleleel; Ziph, and Ziphah, Tiria, and Asareel.

<b>17 </b>And the sons of Ezra <i>were,</i> Jether, and Mered, and Epher, and Jalon: and she bare Miriam, and Shammai, and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.

<b>18 </b>And his wife Jehudijah bare Jered the father of Gedor, and Heber the father of Socho, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah. And these <i>are</i> the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh, which Mered took.

<b>19 </b>And the sons of <i>his</i> wife Hodiah the sister of Naham, the father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maachathite.

<b>20 </b>And the sons of Shimon <i>were,</i> Amnon, and Rinnah, Ben-hanan, and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi <i>were,</i> Zoheth, and Ben-zoheth.

<b>21 </b>¶ The sons of Shelah the son of Judah <i>were,</i> Er the father of Lecah, and Laadah the father of Mareshah, and the families of the house of them that wrought fine linen, of the house of Ashbea,

<b>22 </b>And Jokim, and the men of Chozeba, and Joash, and Saraph, who had the dominion in Moab, and Jashubi-lehem. And <i>these are</i> ancient things.

<b>23 </b>These <i>were</i> the potters, and those that dwelt among plants and hedges: there they dwelt with the king for his work.

<b>24 </b>¶ The sons of Simeon <i>were,</i> Nemuel, and Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, <i>and</i> Shaul:

<b>25 </b>Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, Mishma his son.

<b>26 </b>And the sons of Mishma; Hamuel his son, Zacchur his son, Shimei his son.

<b>27 </b>And Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brethren had not many children, neither did all their family multiply, like to the children of Judah.

<b>28 </b>And they dwelt at Beer-sheba, and Moladah, and Hazar-shual,

<b>29 </b>And at Bilhah, and at Ezem, and at Tolad,

<b>30 </b>And at Bethuel, and at Hormah, and at Ziklag,

<b>31 </b>And at Beth-marcaboth, and Hazar-susim, and at Beth-birei, and at Shaaraim. These <i>were</i> their cities unto the reign of David.

<b>32 </b>And their villages <i>were,</i> Etam, and Ain, Rimmon, and Tochen, and Ashan, five cities:

<b>33 </b>And all their villages that <i>were</i> round about the same cities, unto Baal. These <i>were</i> their habitations, and their genealogy.

<b>34 </b>And Meshobab, and Jamlech, and Joshah the son of Amaziah,

<b>35 </b>And Joel, and Jehu the son of Josibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,

<b>36 </b>And Elioenai, and Jaakobah, and Jeshohaiah, and Asaiah, and Adiel, and Jesimiel, and Benaiah,

<b>37 </b>And Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah;

<b>38 </b>These mentioned by <i>their</i> names <i>were</i> princes in their families: and the house of their fathers increased greatly.

<b>39 </b>¶ And they went to the entrance of Gedor, <i>even</i> unto the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.

<b>40 </b>And they found fat pasture and good, and the land <i>was</i> wide, and quiet, and peaceable; for <i>they</i> of Ham had dwelt there of old.

<b>41 </b>And these written by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and smote their tents, and the habitations that were found there, and destroyed them utterly unto this day, and dwelt in their rooms: because <i>there was</i> pasture there for their flocks.

<b>42 </b>And <i>some</i> of them, <i>even</i> of the sons of Simeon, five hundred men, went to mount Seir, having for their captains Pelatiah, and Neariah, and Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.

<b>43 </b>And they smote the rest of the Amalekites that were escaped, and dwelt there unto this day.


--------------------

CHAPTER 5

<b>1 </b>Now the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel, (for he <i>was</i> the firstborn; but, forasmuch as he defiled his father’s bed, his birthright was given unto the sons of Joseph the son of Israel: and the genealogy is not to be reckoned after the birthright.

<b>2 </b>For Judah prevailed above his brethren, and of him <i>came</i> the chief ruler; but the birthright <i>was</i> Joseph’s:)

<b>3 </b>The sons, <i>I say,</i> of Reuben the firstborn of Israel <i>were,</i> Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

<b>4 </b>The sons of Joel; Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,

<b>5 </b>Micah his son, Reaia his son, Baal his son,

<b>6 </b>Beerah his son, whom Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria carried away <i>captive:</i> he <i>was</i> prince of the Reubenites.

<b>7 </b>And his brethren by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was reckoned, <i>were</i> the chief, Jeiel, and Zechariah,

<b>8 </b>And Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who dwelt in Aroer, even unto Nebo and Baal-meon:

<b>9 </b>And eastward he inhabited unto the entering in of the wilderness from the river Euphrates: because their cattle were multiplied in the land of Gilead.

<b>10 </b>And in the days of Saul they made war with the Hagarites, who fell by their hand: and they dwelt in their tents throughout all the east <i>land</i> of Gilead.

<b>11 </b>¶ And the children of Gad dwelt over against them, in the land of Bashan unto Salchah:

<b>12 </b>Joel the chief, and Shapham the next, and Jaanai, and Shaphat in Bashan.

<b>13 </b>And their brethren of the house of their fathers <i>were,</i> Michael, and Meshullam, and Sheba, and Jorai, and Jachan, and Zia, and Heber, seven.

<b>14 </b>These <i>are</i> the children of Abihail the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz;

<b>15 </b>Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, chief of the house of their fathers.

<b>16 </b>And they dwelt in Gilead in Bashan, and in her towns, and in all the suburbs of Sharon, upon their borders.

<b>17 </b>All these were reckoned by genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.

<b>18 </b>¶ The sons of Reuben, and the Gadites, and half the tribe of Manasseh, of valiant men, men able to bear buckler and sword, and to shoot with bow, and skilful in war, <i>were</i> four and forty thousand seven hundred and threescore, that went out to the war.

<b>19 </b>And they made war with the Hagarites, with Jetur, and Nephish, and Nodab.

<b>20 </b>And they were helped against them, and the Hagarites were delivered into their hand, and all that <i>were</i> with them: for they cried to God in the battle, and he was entreated of them; because they put their trust in him.

<b>21 </b>And they took away their cattle; of their camels fifty thousand, and of sheep two hundred and fifty thousand, and of asses two thousand, and of men an hundred thousand.

<b>22 </b>For there fell down many slain, because the war <i>was</i> of God. And they dwelt in their steads until the captivity.

<b>23 </b>¶ And the children of the half tribe of Manasseh dwelt in the land: they increased from Bashan unto Baal-hermon and Senir, and unto mount Hermon.

<b>24 </b>And these <i>were</i> the heads of the house of their fathers, even Epher, and Ishi, and Eliel, and Azriel, and Jeremiah, and Hodaviah, and Jahdiel, mighty men of valour, famous men, <i>and</i> heads of the house of their fathers.

<b>25 </b>¶ And they transgressed against the God of their fathers, and went a whoring after the gods of the people of the land, whom God destroyed before them.

<b>26 </b>And the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria, and the spirit of Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria, and he carried them away, even the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh, and brought them unto Halah, and Habor, and Hara, and to the river Gozan, unto this day.


--------------------

CHAPTER 6

<b>1 </b>The sons of Levi; Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

<b>2 </b>And the sons of Kohath; Amram, Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.

<b>3 </b>And the children of Amram; Aaron, and Moses, and Miriam. The sons also of Aaron; Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

<b>4 </b>¶ Eleazar begat Phinehas, Phinehas begat Abishua,

<b>5 </b>And Abishua begat Bukki, and Bukki begat Uzzi,

<b>6 </b>And Uzzi begat Zerahiah, and Zerahiah begat Meraioth,

<b>7 </b>Meraioth begat Amariah, and Amariah begat Ahitub,

<b>8 </b>And Ahitub begat Zadok, and Zadok begat Ahimaaz,

<b>9 </b>And Ahimaaz begat Azariah, and Azariah begat Johanan,

<b>10 </b>And Johanan begat Azariah, (he <i>it is</i> that executed the priest’s office in the temple that Solomon built in Jerusalem:)

<b>11 </b>And Azariah begat Amariah, and Amariah begat Ahitub,

<b>12 </b>And Ahitub begat Zadok, and Zadok begat Shallum,

<b>13 </b>And Shallum begat Hilkiah, and Hilkiah begat Azariah,

<b>14 </b>And Azariah begat Seraiah, and Seraiah begat Jehozadak,

<b>15 </b>And Jehozadak went <i>into captivity,</i> when the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> carried away Judah and Jerusalem by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.

<b>16 </b>¶ The sons of Levi; Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.

<b>17 </b>And these <i>be</i> the names of the sons of Gershom; Libni, and Shimei.

<b>18 </b>And the sons of Kohath <i>were,</i> Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.

<b>19 </b>The sons of Merari; Mahli, and Mushi. And these <i>are</i> the families of the Levites according to their fathers.

<b>20 </b>Of Gershom; Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,

<b>21 </b>Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, Jeaterai his son.

<b>22 </b>The sons of Kohath; Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,

<b>23 </b>Elkanah his son, and Ebiasaph his son, and Assir his son,

<b>24 </b>Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.

<b>25 </b>And the sons of Elkanah; Amasai, and Ahimoth.

<b>26 </b><i>As for</i> Elkanah: the sons of Elkanah; Zophai his son, and Nahath his son,

<b>27 </b>Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, Elkanah his son.

<b>28 </b>And the sons of Samuel; the firstborn Vashni, and Abiah.

<b>29 </b>The sons of Merari; Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzza his son,

<b>30 </b>Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, Asaiah his son.

<b>31 </b>And these <i>are they</i> whom David set over the service of song in the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, after that the ark had rest.

<b>32 </b>And they ministered before the dwelling place of the tabernacle of the congregation with singing, until Solomon had built the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in Jerusalem: and <i>then</i> they waited on their office according to their order.

<b>33 </b>And these <i>are</i> they that waited with their children. Of the sons of the Kohathites: Heman a singer, the son of Joel, the son of Shemuel,

<b>34 </b>The son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,

<b>35 </b>The son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,

<b>36 </b>The son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,

<b>37 </b>The son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,

<b>38 </b>The son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.

<b>39 </b>And his brother Asaph, who stood on his right hand, <i>even</i> Asaph the son of Berachiah, the son of Shimea,

<b>40 </b>The son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malchiah,

<b>41 </b>The son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,

<b>42 </b>The son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,

<b>43 </b>The son of Jahath, the son of Gershom, the son of Levi.

<b>44 </b>And their brethren the sons of Merari <i>stood</i> on the left hand: Ethan the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,

<b>45 </b>The son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,

<b>46 </b>The son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shamer,

<b>47 </b>The son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.

<b>48 </b>Their brethren also the Levites <i>were</i> appointed unto all manner of service of the tabernacle of the house of God.

<b>49 </b>¶ But Aaron and his sons offered upon the altar of the burnt offering, and on the altar of incense, <i>and were appointed</i> for all the work of the <i>place</i> most holy, and to make an atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.

<b>50 </b>And these <i>are</i> the sons of Aaron; Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,

<b>51 </b>Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,

<b>52 </b>Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,

<b>53 </b>Zadok his son, Ahimaaz his son.

<b>54 </b>¶ Now these <i>are</i> their dwelling places throughout their castles in their coasts, of the sons of Aaron, of the families of the Kohathites: for theirs was the lot.

<b>55 </b>And they gave them Hebron in the land of Judah, and the suburbs thereof round about it.

<b>56 </b>But the fields of the city, and the villages thereof, they gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh.

<b>57 </b>And to the sons of Aaron they gave the cities of Judah, <i>namely,</i> Hebron, <i>the city</i> of refuge, and Libnah with her suburbs, and Jattir, and Eshtemoa, with their suburbs,

<b>58 </b>And Hilen with her suburbs, Debir with her suburbs,

<b>59 </b>And Ashan with her suburbs, and Beth-shemesh with her suburbs:

<b>60 </b>And out of the tribe of Benjamin; Geba with her suburbs, and Alemeth with her suburbs, and Anathoth with her suburbs. All their cities throughout their families <i>were</i> thirteen cities.

<b>61 </b>And unto the sons of Kohath, <i>which were</i> left of the family of that tribe, <i>were cities given</i> out of the half tribe, <i>namely, out of</i> the half <i>tribe</i> of Manasseh, by lot, ten cities.

<b>62 </b>And to the sons of Gershom throughout their families out of the tribe of Issachar, and out of the tribe of Asher, and out of the tribe of Naphtali, and out of the tribe of Manasseh in Bashan, thirteen cities.

<b>63 </b>Unto the sons of Merari <i>were given</i> by lot, throughout their families, out of the tribe of Reuben, and out of the tribe of Gad, and out of the tribe of Zebulun, twelve cities.

<b>64 </b>And the children of Israel gave to the Levites <i>these</i> cities with their suburbs.

<b>65 </b>And they gave by lot out of the tribe of the children of Judah, and out of the tribe of the children of Simeon, and out of the tribe of the children of Benjamin, these cities, which are called by <i>their</i> names.

<b>66 </b>And <i>the residue</i> of the families of the sons of Kohath had cities of their coasts out of the tribe of Ephraim.

<b>67 </b>And they gave unto them, <i>of</i> the cities of refuge, Shechem in mount Ephraim with her suburbs; <i>they gave</i> also Gezer with her suburbs,

<b>68 </b>And Jokmeam with her suburbs, and Beth-horon with her suburbs,

<b>69 </b>And Aijalon with her suburbs, and Gath-rimmon with her suburbs:

<b>70 </b>And out of the half tribe of Manasseh; Aner with her suburbs, and Bileam with her suburbs, for the family of the remnant of the sons of Kohath.

<b>71 </b>Unto the sons of Gershom <i>were given</i> out of the family of the half tribe of Manasseh, Golan in Bashan with her suburbs, and Ashtaroth with her suburbs:

<b>72 </b>And out of the tribe of Issachar; Kedesh with her suburbs, Daberath with her suburbs,

<b>73 </b>And Ramoth with her suburbs, and Anem with her suburbs:

<b>74 </b>And out of the tribe of Asher; Mashal with her suburbs, and Abdon with her suburbs,

<b>75 </b>And Hukok with her suburbs, and Rehob with her suburbs:

<b>76 </b>And out of the tribe of Naphtali; Kedesh in Galilee with her suburbs, and Hammon with her suburbs, and Kirjathaim with her suburbs.

<b>77 </b>Unto the rest of the children of Merari <i>were given</i> out of the tribe of Zebulun, Rimmon with her suburbs, Tabor with her suburbs:

<b>78 </b>And on the other side Jordan by Jericho, on the east side of Jordan, <i>were given them</i> out of the tribe of Reuben, Bezer in the wilderness with her suburbs, and Jahzah with her suburbs,

<b>79 </b>Kedemoth also with her suburbs, and Mephaath with her suburbs:

<b>80 </b>And out of the tribe of Gad; Ramoth in Gilead with her suburbs, and Mahanaim with her suburbs,

<b>81 </b>And Heshbon with her suburbs, and Jazer with her suburbs.


--------------------

CHAPTER 7

<b>1 </b>Now the sons of Issachar <i>were,</i> Tola, and Puah, Jashub, and Shimron, four.

<b>2 </b>And the sons of Tola; Uzzi, and Rephaiah, and Jeriel, and Jahmai, and Jibsam, and Shemuel, heads of their father’s house, <i>to wit,</i> of Tola: <i>they were</i> valiant men of might in their generations; whose number <i>was</i> in the days of David two and twenty thousand and six hundred.

<b>3 </b>And the sons of Uzzi; Izrahiah: and the sons of Izrahiah; Michael, and Obadiah, and Joel, Ishiah, five: all of them chief men.

<b>4 </b>And with them, by their generations, after the house of their fathers, <i>were</i> bands of soldiers for war, six and thirty thousand <i>men:</i> for they had many wives and sons.

<b>5 </b>And their brethren among all the families of Issachar <i>were</i> valiant men of might, reckoned in all by their genealogies fourscore and seven thousand.

<b>6 </b>¶ <i>The sons</i> of Benjamin; Bela, and Becher, and Jediael, three.

<b>7 </b>And the sons of Bela; Ezbon, and Uzzi, and Uzziel, and Jerimoth, and Iri, five; heads of the house of <i>their</i> fathers, mighty men of valour; and were reckoned by their genealogies twenty and two thousand and thirty and four.

<b>8 </b>And the sons of Becher; Zemira, and Joash, and Eliezer, and Elioenai, and Omri, and Jerimoth, and Abiah, and Anathoth, and Alameth. All these <i>are</i> the sons of Becher.

<b>9 </b>And the number of them, after their genealogy by their generations, heads of the house of their fathers, mighty men of valour, <i>was</i> twenty thousand and two hundred.

<b>10 </b>The sons also of Jediael; Bilhan: and the sons of Bilhan; Jeush, and Benjamin, and Ehud, and Chenaanah, and Zethan, and Tharshish, and Ahishahar.

<b>11 </b>All these the sons of Jediael, by the heads of their fathers, mighty men of valour, <i>were</i> seventeen thousand and two hundred <i>soldiers,</i> fit to go out for war <i>and</i> battle.

<b>12 </b>Shuppim also, and Huppim, the children of Ir, <i>and</i> Hushim, the sons of Aher.

<b>13 </b>¶ The sons of Naphtali; Jahziel, and Guni, and Jezer, and Shallum, the sons of Bilhah.

<b>14 </b>¶ The sons of Manasseh; Ashriel, whom she bare: (<i>but</i> his concubine the Aramitess bare Machir the father of Gilead:

<b>15 </b>And Machir took to wife <i>the sister</i> of Huppim and Shuppim, whose sister’s name <i>was</i> Maachah;) and the name of the second <i>was</i> Zelophehad: and Zelophehad had daughters.

<b>16 </b>And Maachah the wife of Machir bare a son, and she called his name Peresh; and the name of his brother <i>was</i> Sheresh; and his sons <i>were</i> Ulam and Rakem.

<b>17 </b>And the sons of Ulam; Bedan. These <i>were</i> the sons of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.

<b>18 </b>And his sister Hammoleketh bare Ishod, and Abiezer, and Mahalah.

<b>19 </b>And the sons of Shemida were, Ahian, and Shechem, and Likhi, and Aniam.

<b>20 </b>¶ And the sons of Ephraim; Shuthelah, and Bered his son, and Tahath his son, and Eladah his son, and Tahath his son,

<b>21 </b>¶ And Zabad his son, and Shuthelah his son, and Ezer, and Elead, whom the men of Gath <i>that were</i> born in <i>that</i> land slew, because they came down to take away their cattle.

<b>22 </b>And Ephraim their father mourned many days, and his brethren came to comfort him.

<b>23 </b>¶ And when he went in to his wife, she conceived, and bare a son, and he called his name Beriah, because it went evil with his house.

<b>24 </b>(And his daughter <i>was</i> Sherah, who built Beth-horon the nether, and the upper, and Uzzen-sherah.)

<b>25 </b>And Rephah <i>was</i> his son, also Resheph, and Telah his son, and Tahan his son,

<b>26 </b>Laadan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,

<b>27 </b>Non his son, Jehoshua his son.

<b>28 </b>¶ And their possessions and habitations <i>were,</i> Beth-el and the towns thereof, and eastward Naaran, and westward Gezer, with the towns thereof; Shechem also and the towns thereof, unto Gaza and the towns thereof:

<b>29 </b>And by the borders of the children of Manasseh, Beth-shean and her towns, Taanach and her towns, Megiddo and her towns, Dor and her towns. In these dwelt the children of Joseph the son of Israel.

<b>30 </b>¶ The sons of Asher; Imnah, and Isuah, and Ishuai, and Beriah, and Serah their sister.

<b>31 </b>And the sons of Beriah; Heber, and Malchiel, who <i>is</i> the father of Birzavith.

<b>32 </b>And Heber begat Japhlet, and Shomer, and Hotham, and Shua their sister.

<b>33 </b>And the sons of Japhlet; Pasach, and Bimhal, and Ashvath. These <i>are</i> the children of Japhlet.

<b>34 </b>And the sons of Shamer; Ahi, and Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.

<b>35 </b>And the sons of his brother Helem; Zophah, and Imna, and Shelesh, and Amal.

<b>36 </b>The sons of Zophah; Suah, and Harnepher, and Shual, and Beri, and Imrah,

<b>37 </b>Bezer, and Hod, and Shamma, and Shilshah, and Ithran, and Beera.

<b>38 </b>And the sons of Jether; Jephunneh, and Pispah, and Ara.

<b>39 </b>And the sons of Ulla; Arah, and Haniel, and Rezia.

<b>40 </b>All these <i>were</i> the children of Asher, heads of <i>their</i> father’s house, choice <i>and</i> mighty men of valour, chief of the princes. And the number throughout the genealogy of them that were apt to the war <i>and</i> to battle <i>was</i> twenty and six thousand men.


--------------------

CHAPTER 8

<b>1 </b>Now Benjamin begat Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, and Aharah the third,

<b>2 </b>Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.

<b>3 </b>And the sons of Bela were, Addar, and Gera, and Abihud,

<b>4 </b>And Abishua, and Naaman, and Ahoah,

<b>5 </b>And Gera, and Shephuphan, and Huram.

<b>6 </b>And these <i>are</i> the sons of Ehud: these are the heads of the fathers of the inhabitants of Geba, and they removed them to Manahath:

<b>7 </b>And Naaman, and Ahiah, and Gera, he removed them, and begat Uzza, and Ahihud.

<b>8 </b>And Shaharaim begat <i>children</i> in the country of Moab, after he had sent them away; Hushim and Baara <i>were</i> his wives.

<b>9 </b>And he begat of Hodesh his wife, Jobab, and Zibia, and Mesha, and Malcham,

<b>10 </b>And Jeuz, and Shachia, and Mirma. These <i>were</i> his sons, heads of the fathers.

<b>11 </b>And of Hushim he begat Abitub, and Elpaal.

<b>12 </b>The sons of Elpaal; Eber, and Misham, and Shamed, who built Ono, and Lod, with the towns thereof:

<b>13 </b>Beriah also, and Shema, who <i>were</i> heads of the fathers of the inhabitants of Aijalon, who drove away the inhabitants of Gath:

<b>14 </b>And Ahio, Shashak, and Jeremoth,

<b>15 </b>And Zebadiah, and Arad, and Ader,

<b>16 </b>And Michael, and Ispah, and Joha, the sons of Beriah;

<b>17 </b>And Zebadiah, and Meshullam, and Hezeki, and Heber,

<b>18 </b>Ishmerai also, and Jezliah, and Jobab, the sons of Elpaal;

<b>19 </b>And Jakim, and Zichri, and Zabdi,

<b>20 </b>And Elienai, and Zilthai, and Eliel,

<b>21 </b>And Adaiah, and Beraiah, and Shimrath, the sons of Shimhi;

<b>22 </b>And Ishpan, and Heber, and Eliel,

<b>23 </b>And Abdon, and Zichri, and Hanan,

<b>24 </b>And Hananiah, and Elam, and Antothijah,

<b>25 </b>And Iphedeiah, and Penuel, the sons of Shashak;

<b>26 </b>And Shamsherai, and Shehariah, and Athaliah,

<b>27 </b>And Jaresiah, and Eliah, and Zichri, the sons of Jeroham.

<b>28 </b>These <i>were</i> heads of the fathers, by their generations, chief <i>men.</i> These dwelt in Jerusalem.

<b>29 </b>And at Gibeon dwelt the father of Gibeon; whose wife’s name <i>was</i> Maachah:

<b>30 </b>And his firstborn son Abdon, and Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Nadab,

<b>31 </b>And Gedor, and Ahio, and Zacher.

<b>32 </b>And Mikloth begat Shimeah. And these also dwelt with their brethren in Jerusalem, over against them.

<b>33 </b>¶ And Ner begat Kish, and Kish begat Saul, and Saul begat Jonathan, and Malchi-shua, and Abinadab, and Esh-baal.

<b>34 </b>And the son of Jonathan <i>was</i> Merib-baal; and Merib-baal begat Micah.

<b>35 </b>And the sons of Micah <i>were,</i> Pithon, and Melech, and Tarea, and Ahaz.

<b>36 </b>And Ahaz begat Jehoadah; and Jehoadah begat Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri begat Moza,

<b>37 </b>And Moza begat Binea: Rapha <i>was</i> his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son:

<b>38 </b>And Azel had six sons, whose names <i>are</i> these, Azrikam, Bocheru, and Ishmael, and Sheariah, and Obadiah, and Hanan. All these <i>were</i> the sons of Azel.

<b>39 </b>And the sons of Eshek his brother <i>were,</i> Ulam his firstborn, Jehush the second, and Eliphelet the third.

<b>40 </b>And the sons of Ulam were mighty men of valour, archers, and had many sons, and sons’ sons, an hundred and fifty. All these <i>are</i> of the sons of Benjamin.


--------------------

CHAPTER 9

<b>1 </b>So all Israel were reckoned by genealogies; and, behold, they <i>were</i> written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah, <i>who</i> were carried away to Babylon for their transgression.

<b>2 </b>¶ Now the first inhabitants that <i>dwelt</i> in their possessions in their cities <i>were,</i> the Israelites, the priests, Levites, and the Nethinims.

<b>3 </b>And in Jerusalem dwelt of the children of Judah, and of the children of Benjamin, and of the children of Ephraim, and Manasseh;

<b>4 </b>Uthai the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, of the children of Pharez the son of Judah.

<b>5 </b>And of the Shilonites; Asaiah the firstborn, and his sons.

<b>6 </b>And of the sons of Zerah; Jeuel, and their brethren, six hundred and ninety.

<b>7 </b>And of the sons of Benjamin; Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hasenuah,

<b>8 </b>And Ibneiah the son of Jeroham, and Elah the son of Uzzi, the son of Michri, and Meshullam the son of Shephathiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah;

<b>9 </b>And their brethren, according to their generations, nine hundred and fifty and six. All these men <i>were</i> chief of the fathers in the house of their fathers.

<b>10 </b>¶ And of the priests; Jedaiah, and Jehoiarib, and Jachin,

<b>11 </b>And Azariah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the ruler of the house of God;

<b>12 </b>And Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashur, the son of Malchijah, and Maasiai the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;

<b>13 </b>And their brethren, heads of the house of their fathers, a thousand and seven hundred and threescore; very able men for the work of the service of the house of God.

<b>14 </b>And of the Levites; Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari;

<b>15 </b>And Bakbakkar, Heresh, and Galal, and Mattaniah the son of Micah, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph;

<b>16 </b>And Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun, and Berechiah the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, that dwelt in the villages of the Netophathites.

<b>17 </b>And the porters <i>were,</i> Shallum, and Akkub, and Talmon, and Ahiman, and their brethren: Shallum <i>was</i> the chief;

<b>18 </b>Who hitherto <i>waited</i> in the king’s gate eastward: they <i>were</i> porters in the companies of the children of Levi.

<b>19 </b>And Shallum the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his brethren, of the house of his father, the Korahites, <i>were</i> over the work of the service, keepers of the gates of the tabernacle: and their fathers, <i>being</i> over the host of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, <i>were</i> keepers of the entry.

<b>20 </b>And Phinehas the son of Eleazar was the ruler over them in time past, <i>and</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>was</i> with him.

<b>21 </b><i>And</i> Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah <i>was</i> porter of the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
