<b>22 </b>The sun ariseth, they gather themselves together, and lay them down in their dens.

<b>23 </b>Man goeth forth unto his work and to his labour until the evening.

<b>24 </b>O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, how manifold are thy works! in wisdom hast thou made them all: the earth is full of thy riches.

<b>25 </b><i>So is</i> this great and wide sea, wherein <i>are</i> things creeping innumerable, both small and great beasts.

<b>26 </b>There go the ships: <i>there is</i> that leviathan, <i>whom</i> thou hast made to play therein.

<b>27 </b>These wait all upon thee; that thou mayest give <i>them</i> their meat in due season.

<b>28 </b><i>That</i> thou givest them they gather: thou openest thine hand, they are filled with good.

<b>29 </b>Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled: thou takest away their breath, they die, and return to their dust.

<b>30 </b>Thou sendest forth thy spirit, they are created: and thou renewest the face of the earth.

<b>31 </b>The glory of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall endure for ever: the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall rejoice in his works.

<b>32 </b>He looketh on the earth, and it trembleth: he toucheth the hills, and they smoke.

<b>33 </b>I will sing unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> as long as I live: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.

<b>34 </b>My meditation of him shall be sweet: I will be glad in the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>35 </b>Let the sinners be consumed out of the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless thou the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, O my soul. Praise ye the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.


--------------------

PSALM 105

<b>1 </b>O give thanks unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; call upon his name: make known his deeds among the people.

<b>2 </b>Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him: talk ye of all his wondrous works.

<b>3 </b>Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>4 </b>Seek the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and his strength: seek his face evermore.

<b>5 </b>Remember his marvellous works that he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;

<b>6 </b>O ye seed of Abraham his servant, ye children of Jacob his chosen.

<b>7 </b>He <i>is</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> our God: his judgments <i>are</i> in all the earth.

<b>8 </b>He hath remembered his covenant for ever, the word <i>which</i> he commanded to a thousand generations.

<b>9 </b>Which <i>covenant</i> he made with Abraham, and his oath unto Isaac;

<b>10 </b>And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a law, <i>and</i> to Israel <i>for</i> an everlasting covenant:

<b>11 </b>Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance:

<b>12 </b>When they were <i>but</i> a few men in number; yea, very few, and strangers in it.

<b>13 </b>When they went from one nation to another, from <i>one</i> kingdom to another people;

<b>14 </b>He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes;

<b>15 </b><i>Saying,</i> Touch not mine anointed, and do my prophets no harm.

<b>16 </b>Moreover he called for a famine upon the land: he brake the whole staff of bread.

<b>17 </b>He sent a man before them, <i>even</i> Joseph, <i>who</i> was sold for a servant:

<b>18 </b>Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron:

<b>19 </b>Until the time that his word came: the word of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> tried him.

<b>20 </b>The king sent and loosed him; <i>even</i> the ruler of the people, and let him go free.

<b>21 </b>He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his substance:

<b>22 </b>To bind his princes at his pleasure; and teach his senators wisdom.

<b>23 </b>Israel also came into Egypt; and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

<b>24 </b>And he increased his people greatly; and made them stronger than their enemies.

<b>25 </b>He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtilly with his servants.

<b>26 </b>He sent Moses his servant; <i>and</i> Aaron whom he had chosen.

<b>27 </b>They shewed his signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham.

<b>28 </b>He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against his word.

<b>29 </b>He turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish.

<b>30 </b>Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, in the chambers of their kings.

<b>31 </b>He spake, and there came divers sorts of flies, <i>and</i> lice in all their coasts.

<b>32 </b>He gave them hail for rain, <i>and</i> flaming fire in their land.

<b>33 </b>He smote their vines also and their fig trees; and brake the trees of their coasts.

<b>34 </b>He spake, and the locusts came, and caterpillers, and that without number,

<b>35 </b>And did eat up all the herbs in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.

<b>36 </b>He smote also all the firstborn in their land, the chief of all their strength.

<b>37 </b>He brought them forth also with silver and gold: and <i>there was</i> not one feeble <i>person</i> among their tribes.

<b>38 </b>Egypt was glad when they departed: for the fear of them fell upon them.

<b>39 </b>He spread a cloud for a covering; and fire to give light in the night.

<b>40 </b><i>The people</i> asked, and he brought quails, and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

<b>41 </b>He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; they ran in the dry places <i>like</i> a river.

<b>42 </b>For he remembered his holy promise, <i>and</i> Abraham his servant.

<b>43 </b>And he brought forth his people with joy, <i>and</i> his chosen with gladness:

<b>44 </b>And gave them the lands of the heathen: and they inherited the labour of the people;

<b>45 </b>That they might observe his statutes, and keep his laws. Praise ye the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.


--------------------

PSALM 106

<b>1 </b>Praise ye the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>. O give thanks unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; for <i>he is</i> good: for his mercy <i>endureth</i> for ever.

<b>2 </b>Who can utter the mighty acts of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>? <i>who</i> can shew forth all his praise?

<b>3 </b>Blessed <i>are</i> they that keep judgment, <i>and</i> he that doeth righteousness at all times.

<b>4 </b>Remember me, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, with the favour <i>that thou bearest unto</i> thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;

<b>5 </b>That I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.

<b>6 </b>We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.

<b>7 </b>Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked <i>him</i> at the sea, <i>even</i> at the Red sea.

<b>8 </b>Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.

<b>9 </b>He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.

<b>10 </b>And he saved them from the hand of him that hated <i>them,</i> and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

<b>11 </b>And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.

<b>12 </b>Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.

<b>13 </b>They soon forgat his works; they waited not for his counsel:

<b>14 </b>But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.

<b>15 </b>And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.

<b>16 </b>They envied Moses also in the camp, <i>and</i> Aaron the saint of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>17 </b>The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.

<b>18 </b>And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.

<b>19 </b>They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.

<b>20 </b>Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.

<b>21 </b>They forgat God their saviour, which had done great things in Egypt;

<b>22 </b>Wondrous works in the land of Ham, <i>and</i> terrible things by the Red sea.

<b>23 </b>Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy <i>them.</i>

<b>24 </b>Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:

<b>25 </b>But murmured in their tents, <i>and</i> hearkened not unto the voice of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>26 </b>Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:

<b>27 </b>To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.

<b>28 </b>They joined themselves also unto Baal-peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

<b>29 </b>Thus they provoked <i>him</i> to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.

<b>30 </b>Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment: and <i>so</i> the plague was stayed.

<b>31 </b>And that was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations for evermore.

<b>32 </b>They angered <i>him</i> also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:

<b>33 </b>Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.

<b>34 </b>They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> commanded them:

<b>35 </b>But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.

<b>36 </b>And they served their idols: which were a snare unto them.

<b>37 </b>Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,

<b>38 </b>And shed innocent blood, <i>even</i> the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan: and the land was polluted with blood.

<b>39 </b>Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.

<b>40 </b>Therefore was the wrath of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.

<b>41 </b>And he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.

<b>42 </b>Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.

<b>43 </b>Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked <i>him</i> with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.

<b>44 </b>Nevertheless he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:

<b>45 </b>And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

<b>46 </b>He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.

<b>47 </b>Save us, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, <i>and</i> to triumph in thy praise.

<b>48 </b>Blessed <i>be</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.


--------------------

PSALM 107

<b>1 </b>O give thanks unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, for <i>he is</i> good: for his mercy <i>endureth</i> for ever.

<b>2 </b>Let the redeemed of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> say <i>so,</i> whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy;

<b>3 </b>And gathered them out of the lands, from the east, and from the west, from the north, and from the south.

<b>4 </b>They wandered in the wilderness in a solitary way; they found no city to dwell in.

<b>5 </b>Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.

<b>6 </b>Then they cried unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in their trouble, <i>and</i> he delivered them out of their distresses.

<b>7 </b>And he led them forth by the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.

<b>8 </b>Oh that <i>men</i> would praise the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>for</i> his goodness, and <i>for</i> his wonderful works to the children of men!

<b>9 </b>For he satisfieth the longing soul, and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.

<b>10 </b>Such as sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, <i>being</i> bound in affliction and iron;

<b>11 </b>Because they rebelled against the words of God, and contemned the counsel of the most High:

<b>12 </b>Therefore he brought down their heart with labour; they fell down, and <i>there was</i> none to help.

<b>13 </b>Then they cried unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in their trouble, <i>and</i> he saved them out of their distresses.

<b>14 </b>He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and brake their bands in sunder.

<b>15 </b>Oh that <i>men</i> would praise the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>for</i> his goodness, and <i>for</i> his wonderful works to the children of men!

<b>16 </b>For he hath broken the gates of brass, and cut the bars of iron in sunder.

<b>17 </b>Fools because of their transgression, and because of their iniquities, are afflicted.

<b>18 </b>Their soul abhorreth all manner of meat; and they draw near unto the gates of death.

<b>19 </b>Then they cry unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in their trouble, <i>and</i> he saveth them out of their distresses.

<b>20 </b>He sent his word, and healed them, and delivered <i>them</i> from their destructions.

<b>21 </b>Oh that <i>men</i> would praise the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>for</i> his goodness, and <i>for</i> his wonderful works to the children of men!

<b>22 </b>And let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare his works with rejoicing.

<b>23 </b>They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters;

<b>24 </b>These see the works of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and his wonders in the deep.

<b>25 </b>For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof.

<b>26 </b>They mount up to the heaven, they go down again to the depths: their soul is melted because of trouble.

<b>27 </b>They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and are at their wits’ end.

<b>28 </b>Then they cry unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in their trouble, and he bringeth them out of their distresses.

<b>29 </b>He maketh the storm a calm, so that the waves thereof are still.

<b>30 </b>Then are they glad because they be quiet; so he bringeth them unto their desired haven.

<b>31 </b>Oh that <i>men</i> would praise the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>for</i> his goodness, and <i>for</i> his wonderful works to the children of men!

<b>32 </b>Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the elders.

<b>33 </b>He turneth rivers into a wilderness, and the watersprings into dry ground;

<b>34 </b>A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

<b>35 </b>He turneth the wilderness into a standing water, and dry ground into watersprings.

<b>36 </b>And there he maketh the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city for habitation;

<b>37 </b>And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.

<b>38 </b>He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly; and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.

<b>39 </b>Again, they are minished and brought low through oppression, affliction, and sorrow.

<b>40 </b>He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, <i>where there is</i> no way.

<b>41 </b>Yet setteth he the poor on high from affliction, and maketh <i>him</i> families like a flock.

<b>42 </b>The righteous shall see <i>it,</i> and rejoice: and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.

<b>43 </b>Whoso <i>is</i> wise, and will observe these <i>things,</i> even they shall understand the lovingkindness of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.


--------------------

PSALM 108

A Song <i>or</i> Psalm of David.

<b>1 </b>O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.

<b>2 </b>Awake, psaltery and harp: I <i>myself</i> will awake early.

<b>3 </b>I will praise thee, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, among the people: and I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.

<b>4 </b>For thy mercy <i>is</i> great above the heavens: and thy truth <i>reacheth</i> unto the clouds.

<b>5 </b>Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: and thy glory above all the earth;

<b>6 </b>That thy beloved may be delivered: save <i>with</i> thy right hand, and answer me.

<b>7 </b>God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

<b>8 </b>Gilead <i>is</i> mine; Manasseh <i>is</i> mine; Ephraim also <i>is</i> the strength of mine head; Judah <i>is</i> my lawgiver;

<b>9 </b>Moab <i>is</i> my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe; over Philistia will I triumph.

<b>10 </b>Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?

<b>11 </b><i>Wilt</i> not <i>thou,</i> O God, <i>who</i> hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our hosts?

<b>12 </b>Give us help from trouble: for vain <i>is</i> the help of man.

<b>13 </b>Through God we shall do valiantly: for he <i>it is that</i> shall tread down our enemies.


--------------------

PSALM 109

To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

<b>1 </b>Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;

<b>2 </b>For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.

<b>3 </b>They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.

<b>4 </b>For my love they are my adversaries: but I <i>give myself unto</i> prayer.

<b>5 </b>And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

<b>6 </b>Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.

<b>7 </b>When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.

<b>8 </b>Let his days be few; <i>and</i> let another take his office.

<b>9 </b>Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

<b>10 </b>Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek <i>their bread</i> also out of their desolate places.

<b>11 </b>Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.

<b>12 </b>Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.

<b>13 </b>Let his posterity be cut off; <i>and</i> in the generation following let their name be blotted out.

<b>14 </b>Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

<b>15 </b>Let them be before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.

<b>16 </b>Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.

<b>17 </b>As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.

<b>18 </b>As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.

<b>19 </b>Let it be unto him as the garment <i>which</i> covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.

<b>20 </b><i>Let</i> this <i>be</i> the reward of mine adversaries from the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and of them that speak evil against my soul.

<b>21 </b>But do thou for me, O <span class="small-caps">God</span> the Lord, for thy name’s sake: because thy mercy <i>is</i> good, deliver thou me.

<b>22 </b>For I <i>am</i> poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

<b>23 </b>I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.

<b>24 </b>My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.

<b>25 </b>I became also a reproach unto them: <i>when</i> they looked upon me they shaked their heads.

<b>26 </b>Help me, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> my God: O save me according to thy mercy:

<b>27 </b>That they may know that this <i>is</i> thy hand; <i>that</i> thou, <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, hast done it.

<b>28 </b>Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.

<b>29 </b>Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.

<b>30 </b>I will greatly praise the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.

<b>31 </b>For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save <i>him</i> from those that condemn his soul.


--------------------

PSALM 110

A Psalm of David.

<b>1 </b>The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> said unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.

<b>2 </b>The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall send the rod of thy strength out of Zion: rule thou in the midst of thine enemies.

<b>3 </b>Thy people <i>shall be</i> willing in the day of thy power, in the beauties of holiness from the womb of the morning: thou hast the dew of thy youth.

<b>4 </b>The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou <i>art</i> a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

<b>5 </b>The Lord at thy right hand shall strike through kings in the day of his wrath.

<b>6 </b>He shall judge among the heathen, he shall fill <i>the places</i> with the dead bodies; he shall wound the heads over many countries.

<b>7 </b>He shall drink of the brook in the way: therefore shall he lift up the head.


--------------------

PSALM 111

<b>1 </b>Praise ye the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>. I will praise the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> with <i>my</i> whole heart, in the assembly of the upright, and <i>in</i> the congregation.

<b>2 </b>The works of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>are</i> great, sought out of all them that have pleasure therein.

<b>3 </b>His work <i>is</i> honourable and glorious: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

<b>4 </b>He hath made his wonderful works to be remembered: the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>is</i> gracious and full of compassion.

<b>5 </b>He hath given meat unto them that fear him: he will ever be mindful of his covenant.

<b>6 </b>He hath shewed his people the power of his works, that he may give them the heritage of the heathen.

<b>7 </b>The works of his hands <i>are</i> verity and judgment; all his commandments <i>are</i> sure.

<b>8 </b>They stand fast for ever and ever, <i>and are</i> done in truth and uprightness.

<b>9 </b>He sent redemption unto his people: he hath commanded his covenant for ever: holy and reverend <i>is</i> his name.

<b>10 </b>The fear of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>is</i> the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do <i>his commandments:</i> his praise endureth for ever.


--------------------

PSALM 112

<b>1 </b>Praise ye the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>. Blessed <i>is</i> the man <i>that</i> feareth the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, <i>that</i> delighteth greatly in his commandments.

<b>2 </b>His seed shall be mighty upon earth: the generation of the upright shall be blessed.

<b>3 </b>Wealth and riches <i>shall be</i> in his house: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

<b>4 </b>Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness: <i>he is</i> gracious, and full of compassion, and righteous.

<b>5 </b>A good man sheweth favour, and lendeth: he will guide his affairs with discretion.

<b>6 </b>Surely he shall not be moved for ever: the righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance.

<b>7 </b>He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>8 </b>His heart <i>is</i> established, he shall not be afraid, until he see <i>his desire</i> upon his enemies.

<b>9 </b>He hath dispersed, he hath given to the poor; his righteousness endureth for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honour.

<b>10 </b>The wicked shall see <i>it,</i> and be grieved; he shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away: the desire of the wicked shall perish.


--------------------

PSALM 113

<b>1 </b>Praise ye the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>. Praise, O ye servants of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, praise the name of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>2 </b>Blessed be the name of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> from this time forth and for evermore.

<b>3 </b>From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s name <i>is</i> to be praised.

<b>4 </b>The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>is</i> high above all nations, <i>and</i> his glory above the heavens.

<b>5 </b>Who <i>is</i> like unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> our God, who dwelleth on high,

<b>6 </b>Who humbleth <i>himself</i> to behold <i>the things that are</i> in heaven, and in the earth!

<b>7 </b>He raiseth up the poor out of the dust, <i>and</i> lifteth the needy out of the dunghill;

<b>8 </b>That he may set <i>him</i> with princes, <i>even</i> with the princes of his people.

<b>9 </b>He maketh the barren woman to keep house, <i>and to be</i> a joyful mother of children. Praise ye the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.


--------------------

PSALM 114

<b>1 </b>When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language;

<b>2 </b>Judah was his sanctuary, <i>and</i> Israel his dominion.

<b>3 </b>The sea saw <i>it,</i> and fled: Jordan was driven back.

<b>4 </b>The mountains skipped like rams, <i>and</i> the little hills like lambs.

<b>5 </b>What <i>ailed</i> thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest? thou Jordan, <i>that</i> thou wast driven back?

<b>6 </b>Ye mountains, <i>that</i> ye skipped like rams; <i>and</i> ye little hills, like lambs?

<b>7 </b>Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob;

<b>8 </b>Which turned the rock <i>into</i> a standing water, the flint into a fountain of waters.


--------------------

PSALM 115

<b>1 </b>Not unto us, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, not unto us, but unto thy name give glory, for thy mercy, <i>and</i> for thy truth’s sake.

<b>2 </b>Wherefore should the heathen say, Where <i>is</i> now their God?

<b>3 </b>But our God <i>is</i> in the heavens: he hath done whatsoever he hath pleased.

<b>4 </b>Their idols <i>are</i> silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.

<b>5 </b>They have mouths, but they speak not: eyes have they, but they see not:

<b>6 </b>They have ears, but they hear not: noses have they, but they smell not:

<b>7 </b>They have hands, but they handle not: feet have they, but they walk not: neither speak they through their throat.

<b>8 </b>They that make them are like unto them; <i>so is</i> every one that trusteth in them.

<b>9 </b>O Israel, trust thou in the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: he <i>is</i> their help and their shield.

<b>10 </b>O house of Aaron, trust in the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: he <i>is</i> their help and their shield.

<b>11 </b>Ye that fear the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, trust in the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: he <i>is</i> their help and their shield.

<b>12 </b>The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath been mindful of us: he will bless <i>us;</i> he will bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron.

<b>13 </b>He will bless them that fear the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, <i>both</i> small and great.

<b>14 </b>The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> shall increase you more and more, you and your children.

<b>15 </b>Ye <i>are</i> blessed of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> which made heaven and earth.

<b>16 </b>The heaven, <i>even</i> the heavens, <i>are</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s: but the earth hath he given to the children of men.

<b>17 </b>The dead praise not the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, neither any that go down into silence.

<b>18 </b>But we will bless the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> from this time forth and for evermore. Praise the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.


--------------------

PSALM 116

<b>1 </b>I love the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, because he hath heard my voice <i>and</i> my supplications.

<b>2 </b>Because he hath inclined his ear unto me, therefore will I call upon <i>him</i> as long as I live.

<b>3 </b>The sorrows of death compassed me, and the pains of hell gat hold upon me: I found trouble and sorrow.

<b>4 </b>Then called I upon the name of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.

<b>5 </b>Gracious <i>is</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and righteous; yea, our God <i>is</i> merciful.

<b>6 </b>The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> preserveth the simple: I was brought low, and he helped me.

<b>7 </b>Return unto thy rest, O my soul; for the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath dealt bountifully with thee.

<b>8 </b>For thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, <i>and</i> my feet from falling.

<b>9 </b>I will walk before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in the land of the living.

<b>10 </b>I believed, therefore have I spoken: I was greatly afflicted:

<b>11 </b>I said in my haste, All men <i>are</i> liars.

<b>12 </b>What shall I render unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>for</i> all his benefits toward me?

<b>13 </b>I will take the cup of salvation, and call upon the name of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>14 </b>I will pay my vows unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> now in the presence of all his people.

<b>15 </b>Precious in the sight of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>is</i> the death of his saints.

<b>16 </b>O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, truly I <i>am</i> thy servant; I <i>am</i> thy servant, <i>and</i> the son of thine handmaid: thou hast loosed my bonds.

<b>17 </b>I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving, and will call upon the name of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>18 </b>I will pay my vows unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> now in the presence of all his people,

<b>19 </b>In the courts of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s house, in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise ye the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.


--------------------

PSALM 117

<b>1 </b>O praise the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, all ye nations: praise him, all ye people.

<b>2 </b>For his merciful kindness is great toward us: and the truth of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>endureth</i> for ever. Praise ye the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

PSALM 118

<b>1 </b>O give thanks unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; for <i>he is</i> good: because his mercy <i>endureth</i> for ever.

<b>2 </b>Let Israel now say, that his mercy <i>endureth</i> for ever.

<b>3 </b>Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy <i>endureth</i> for ever.

<b>4 </b>Let them now that fear the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> say, that his mercy <i>endureth</i> for ever.

<b>5 </b>I called upon the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> in distress: the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> answered me, <i>and set me</i> in a large place.

<b>6 </b>The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>is</i> on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?

<b>7 </b>The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> taketh my part with them that help me: therefore shall I see <i>my desire</i> upon them that hate me.

<b>8 </b><i>It is</i> better to trust in the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> than to put confidence in man.

<b>9 </b><i>It is</i> better to trust in the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> than to put confidence in princes.

<b>10 </b>All nations compassed me about: but in the name of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> will I destroy them.

<b>11 </b>They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about: but in the name of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> I will destroy them.

<b>12 </b>They compassed me about like bees; they are quenched as the fire of thorns: for in the name of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> I will destroy them.

<b>13 </b>Thou hast thrust sore at me that I might fall: but the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> helped me.

<b>14 </b>The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> <i>is</i> my strength and song, and is become my salvation.

<b>15 </b>The voice of rejoicing and salvation <i>is</i> in the tabernacles of the righteous: the right hand of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> doeth valiantly.

<b>16 </b>The right hand of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> is exalted: the right hand of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> doeth valiantly.

<b>17 </b>I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>18 </b>The <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath chastened me sore: but he hath not given me over unto death.

<b>19 </b>Open to me the gates of righteousness: I will go into them, <i>and</i> I will praise the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>:

<b>20 </b>This gate of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, into which the righteous shall enter.

<b>21 </b>I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation.

<b>22 </b>The stone <i>which</i> the builders refused is become the head <i>stone</i> of the corner.

<b>23 </b>This is the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>’s doing; it <i>is</i> marvellous in our eyes.

<b>24 </b>This <i>is</i> the day <i>which</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span> hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.

<b>25 </b>Save now, I beseech thee, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, I beseech thee, send now prosperity.

<b>26 </b>Blessed <i>be</i> he that cometh in the name of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: we have blessed you out of the house of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>27 </b>God <i>is</i> the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, which hath shewed us light: bind the sacrifice with cords, <i>even</i> unto the horns of the altar.

<b>28 </b>Thou <i>art</i> my God, and I will praise thee: <i>thou art</i> my God, I will exalt thee.

<b>29 </b>O give thanks unto the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; for <i>he is</i> good: for his mercy <i>endureth</i> for ever.


--------------------

PSALM 119

א Aleph

<b>1 </b>Blessed <i>are</i> the undefiled in the way, who walk in the law of the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.

<b>2 </b>Blessed <i>are</i> they that keep his testimonies, <i>and that</i> seek him with the whole heart.

<b>3 </b>They also do no iniquity: they walk in his ways.

<b>4 </b>Thou hast commanded <i>us</i> to keep thy precepts diligently.

<b>5 </b>O that my ways were directed to keep thy statutes!

<b>6 </b>Then shall I not be ashamed, when I have respect unto all thy commandments.

<b>7 </b>I will praise thee with uprightness of heart, when I shall have learned thy righteous judgments.

<b>8 </b>I will keep thy statutes: O forsake me not utterly.

ב Beth

<b>9 </b>Wherewithal shall a young man cleanse his way? by taking heed <i>thereto</i> according to thy word.

<b>10 </b>With my whole heart have I sought thee: O let me not wander from thy commandments.

<b>11 </b>Thy word have I hid in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.

<b>12 </b>Blessed <i>art</i> thou, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: teach me thy statutes.

<b>13 </b>With my lips have I declared all the judgments of thy mouth.

<b>14 </b>I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies, as <i>much as</i> in all riches.

<b>15 </b>I will meditate in thy precepts, and have respect unto thy ways.

<b>16 </b>I will delight myself in thy statutes: I will not forget thy word.

ג Gimel

<b>17 </b>Deal bountifully with thy servant, <i>that</i> I may live, and keep thy word.

<b>18 </b>Open thou mine eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of thy law.

<b>19 </b>I <i>am</i> a stranger in the earth: hide not thy commandments from me.

<b>20 </b>My soul breaketh for the longing <i>that it hath</i> unto thy judgments at all times.

<b>21 </b>Thou hast rebuked the proud <i>that are</i> cursed, which do err from thy commandments.

<b>22 </b>Remove from me reproach and contempt; for I have kept thy testimonies.

<b>23 </b>Princes also did sit <i>and</i> speak against me: <i>but</i> thy servant did meditate in thy statutes.

<b>24 </b>Thy testimonies also <i>are</i> my delight <i>and</i> my counsellors.

ד Daleth

<b>25 </b>My soul cleaveth unto the dust: quicken thou me according to thy word.

<b>26 </b>I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.

<b>27 </b>Make me to understand the way of thy precepts: so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.

<b>28 </b>My soul melteth for heaviness: strengthen thou me according unto thy word.

<b>29 </b>Remove from me the way of lying: and grant me thy law graciously.

<b>30 </b>I have chosen the way of truth: thy judgments have I laid <i>before me.</i>

<b>31 </b>I have stuck unto thy testimonies: O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, put me not to shame.

<b>32 </b>I will run the way of thy commandments, when thou shalt enlarge my heart.

ה He

<b>33 </b>Teach me, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, the way of thy statutes; and I shall keep it <i>unto</i> the end.

<b>34 </b>Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law; yea, I shall observe it with <i>my</i> whole heart.

<b>35 </b>Make me to go in the path of thy commandments; for therein do I delight.

<b>36 </b>Incline my heart unto thy testimonies, and not to covetousness.

<b>37 </b>Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity; <i>and</i> quicken thou me in thy way.

<b>38 </b>Stablish thy word unto thy servant, who <i>is devoted</i> to thy fear.

<b>39 </b>Turn away my reproach which I fear: for thy judgments <i>are</i> good.

<b>40 </b>Behold, I have longed after thy precepts: quicken me in thy righteousness.

ו Vau

<b>41 </b>Let thy mercies come also unto me, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, <i>even</i> thy salvation, according to thy word.

<b>42 </b>So shall I have wherewith to answer him that reproacheth me: for I trust in thy word.

<b>43 </b>And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth; for I have hoped in thy judgments.

<b>44 </b>So shall I keep thy law continually for ever and ever.

<b>45 </b>And I will walk at liberty: for I seek thy precepts.

<b>46 </b>I will speak of thy testimonies also before kings, and will not be ashamed.

<b>47 </b>And I will delight myself in thy commandments, which I have loved.

<b>48 </b>My hands also will I lift up unto thy commandments, which I have loved; and I will meditate in thy statutes.

ז Zain

<b>49 </b>Remember the word unto thy servant, upon which thou hast caused me to hope.

<b>50 </b>This <i>is</i> my comfort in my affliction: for thy word hath quickened me.

<b>51 </b>The proud have had me greatly in derision: <i>yet</i> have I not declined from thy law.

<b>52 </b>I remembered thy judgments of old, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; and have comforted myself.

<b>53 </b>Horror hath taken hold upon me because of the wicked that forsake thy law.

<b>54 </b>Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.

<b>55 </b>I have remembered thy name, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, in the night, and have kept thy law.

<b>56 </b>This I had, because I kept thy precepts.

ח Cheth

<b>57 </b><i>Thou art</i> my portion, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: I have said that I would keep thy words.

<b>58 </b>I entreated thy favour with <i>my</i> whole heart: be merciful unto me according to thy word.

<b>59 </b>I thought on my ways, and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.

<b>60 </b>I made haste, and delayed not to keep thy commandments.

<b>61 </b>The bands of the wicked have robbed me: <i>but</i> I have not forgotten thy law.

<b>62 </b>At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee because of thy righteous judgments.

<b>63 </b>I <i>am</i> a companion of all <i>them</i> that fear thee, and of them that keep thy precepts.

<b>64 </b>The earth, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, is full of thy mercy: teach me thy statutes.

ט Teth

<b>65 </b>Thou hast dealt well with thy servant, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, according unto thy word.

<b>66 </b>Teach me good judgment and knowledge: for I have believed thy commandments.

<b>67 </b>Before I was afflicted I went astray: but now have I kept thy word.

<b>68 </b>Thou <i>art</i> good, and doest good; teach me thy statutes.

<b>69 </b>The proud have forged a lie against me: <i>but</i> I will keep thy precepts with <i>my</i> whole heart.

<b>70 </b>Their heart is as fat as grease; <i>but</i> I delight in thy law.

<b>71 </b><i>It is</i> good for me that I have been afflicted; that I might learn thy statutes.

<b>72 </b>The law of thy mouth <i>is</i> better unto me than thousands of gold and silver.

י Jod

<b>73 </b>Thy hands have made me and fashioned me: give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments.

<b>74 </b>They that fear thee will be glad when they see me; because I have hoped in thy word.

<b>75 </b>I know, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, that thy judgments <i>are</i> right, and <i>that</i> thou in faithfulness hast afflicted me.

<b>76 </b>Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.

<b>77 </b>Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live: for thy law <i>is</i> my delight.

<b>78 </b>Let the proud be ashamed; for they dealt perversely with me without a cause: <i>but</i> I will meditate in thy precepts.

<b>79 </b>Let those that fear thee turn unto me, and those that have known thy testimonies.

<b>80 </b>Let my heart be sound in thy statutes; that I be not ashamed.

כ Caph

<b>81 </b>My soul fainteth for thy salvation: <i>but</i> I hope in thy word.

<b>82 </b>Mine eyes fail for thy word, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?

<b>83 </b>For I am become like a bottle in the smoke; <i>yet</i> do I not forget thy statutes.

<b>84 </b>How many <i>are</i> the days of thy servant? when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?

<b>85 </b>The proud have digged pits for me, which <i>are</i> not after thy law.

<b>86 </b>All thy commandments <i>are</i> faithful: they persecute me wrongfully; help thou me.

<b>87 </b>They had almost consumed me upon earth; but I forsook not thy precepts.

<b>88 </b>Quicken me after thy lovingkindness; so shall I keep the testimony of thy mouth.

ל Lamed

<b>89 </b>For ever, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, thy word is settled in heaven.

<b>90 </b>Thy faithfulness <i>is</i> unto all generations: thou hast established the earth, and it abideth.

<b>91 </b>They continue this day according to thine ordinances: for all <i>are</i> thy servants.

<b>92 </b>Unless thy law <i>had been</i> my delights, I should then have perished in mine affliction.

<b>93 </b>I will never forget thy precepts: for with them thou hast quickened me.

<b>94 </b>I <i>am</i> thine, save me; for I have sought thy precepts.

<b>95 </b>The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: <i>but</i> I will consider thy testimonies.

<b>96 </b>I have seen an end of all perfection: <i>but</i> thy commandment <i>is</i> exceeding broad.

מ Mem

<b>97 </b>O how love I thy law! it <i>is</i> my meditation all the day.

<b>98 </b>Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than mine enemies: for they <i>are</i> ever with me.

<b>99 </b>I have more understanding than all my teachers: for thy testimonies <i>are</i> my meditation.

<b>100 </b>I understand more than the ancients, because I keep thy precepts.

<b>101 </b>I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.

<b>102 </b>I have not departed from thy judgments: for thou hast taught me.

<b>103 </b>How sweet are thy words unto my taste! <i>yea, sweeter</i> than honey to my mouth!

<b>104 </b>Through thy precepts I get understanding: therefore I hate every false way.

נ Nun

<b>105 </b>Thy word <i>is</i> a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.

<b>106 </b>I have sworn, and I will perform <i>it,</i> that I will keep thy righteous judgments.

<b>107 </b>I am afflicted very much: quicken me, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, according unto thy word.

<b>108 </b>Accept, I beseech thee, the freewill offerings of my mouth, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and teach me thy judgments.

<b>109 </b>My soul <i>is</i> continually in my hand: yet do I not forget thy law.

<b>110 </b>The wicked have laid a snare for me: yet I erred not from thy precepts.

<b>111 </b>Thy testimonies have I taken as an heritage for ever: for they <i>are</i> the rejoicing of my heart.

<b>112 </b>I have inclined mine heart to perform thy statutes alway, <i>even unto</i> the end.

ס Samech

<b>113 </b>I hate <i>vain</i> thoughts: but thy law do I love.

<b>114 </b>Thou <i>art</i> my hiding place and my shield: I hope in thy word.

<b>115 </b>Depart from me, ye evildoers: for I will keep the commandments of my God.

<b>116 </b>Uphold me according unto thy word, that I may live: and let me not be ashamed of my hope.

<b>117 </b>Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe: and I will have respect unto thy statutes continually.

<b>118 </b>Thou hast trodden down all them that err from thy statutes: for their deceit <i>is</i> falsehood.

<b>119 </b>Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth <i>like</i> dross: therefore I love thy testimonies.

<b>120 </b>My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.

ע Ain

<b>121 </b>I have done judgment and justice: leave me not to mine oppressors.

<b>122 </b>Be surety for thy servant for good: let not the proud oppress me.

<b>123 </b>Mine eyes fail for thy salvation, and for the word of thy righteousness.

<b>124 </b>Deal with thy servant according unto thy mercy, and teach me thy statutes.

<b>125 </b>I <i>am</i> thy servant; give me understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.

<b>126 </b><i>It is</i> time for <i>thee,</i> <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, to work: <i>for</i> they have made void thy law.

<b>127 </b>Therefore I love thy commandments above gold; yea, above fine gold.

<b>128 </b>Therefore I esteem all <i>thy</i> precepts <i>concerning</i> all <i>things to be</i> right; <i>and</i> I hate every false way.

פ Pe

<b>129 </b>Thy testimonies <i>are</i> wonderful: therefore doth my soul keep them.

<b>130 </b>The entrance of thy words giveth light; it giveth understanding unto the simple.

<b>131 </b>I opened my mouth, and panted: for I longed for thy commandments.

<b>132 </b>Look thou upon me, and be merciful unto me, as thou usest to do unto those that love thy name.

<b>133 </b>Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.

<b>134 </b>Deliver me from the oppression of man: so will I keep thy precepts.

<b>135 </b>Make thy face to shine upon thy servant; and teach me thy statutes.

<b>136 </b>Rivers of waters run down mine eyes, because they keep not thy law.

צ Tzaddi

<b>137 </b>Righteous <i>art</i> thou, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, and upright <i>are</i> thy judgments.

<b>138 </b>Thy testimonies <i>that</i> thou hast commanded <i>are</i> righteous and very faithful.

<b>139 </b>My zeal hath consumed me, because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.

<b>140 </b>Thy word <i>is</i> very pure: therefore thy servant loveth it.

<b>141 </b>I <i>am</i> small and despised: <i>yet</i> do not I forget thy precepts.

<b>142 </b>Thy righteousness <i>is</i> an everlasting righteousness, and thy law <i>is</i> the truth.

<b>143 </b>Trouble and anguish have taken hold on me: <i>yet</i> thy commandments <i>are</i> my delights.

<b>144 </b>The righteousness of thy testimonies <i>is</i> everlasting: give me understanding, and I shall live.

ק Koph

<b>145 </b>I cried with <i>my</i> whole heart; hear me, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: I will keep thy statutes.

<b>146 </b>I cried unto thee; save me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.

<b>147 </b>I prevented the dawning of the morning, and cried: I hoped in thy word.

<b>148 </b>Mine eyes prevent the <i>night</i> watches, that I might meditate in thy word.

<b>149 </b>Hear my voice according unto thy lovingkindness: O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, quicken me according to thy judgment.

<b>150 </b>They draw nigh that follow after mischief: they are far from thy law.

<b>151 </b>Thou <i>art</i> near, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; and all thy commandments <i>are</i> truth.

<b>152 </b>Concerning thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.

ר Resh

<b>153 </b>Consider mine affliction, and deliver me: for I do not forget thy law.

<b>154 </b>Plead my cause, and deliver me: quicken me according to thy word.

<b>155 </b>Salvation <i>is</i> far from the wicked: for they seek not thy statutes.

<b>156 </b>Great <i>are</i> thy tender mercies, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: quicken me according to thy judgments.

<b>157 </b>Many <i>are</i> my persecutors and mine enemies; <i>yet</i> do I not decline from thy testimonies.

<b>158 </b>I beheld the transgressors, and was grieved; because they kept not thy word.

<b>159 </b>Consider how I love thy precepts: quicken me, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, according to thy lovingkindness.

<b>160 </b>Thy word <i>is</i> true <i>from</i> the beginning: and every one of thy righteous judgments <i>endureth</i> for ever.

ש Schin

<b>161 </b>Princes have persecuted me without a cause: but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.

<b>162 </b>I rejoice at thy word, as one that findeth great spoil.

<b>163 </b>I hate and abhor lying: <i>but</i> thy law do I love.

<b>164 </b>Seven times a day do I praise thee because of thy righteous judgments.

<b>165 </b>Great peace have they which love thy law: and nothing shall offend them.

<b>166 </b><span class="small-caps">Lord</span>, I have hoped for thy salvation, and done thy commandments.

<b>167 </b>My soul hath kept thy testimonies; and I love them exceedingly.

<b>168 </b>I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies: for all my ways <i>are</i> before thee.

ת Tau

<b>169 </b>Let my cry come near before thee, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>: give me understanding according to thy word.

<b>170 </b>Let my supplication come before thee: deliver me according to thy word.

<b>171 </b>My lips shall utter praise, when thou hast taught me thy statutes.

<b>172 </b>My tongue shall speak of thy word: for all thy commandments <i>are</i> righteousness.

<b>173 </b>Let thine hand help me; for I have chosen thy precepts.

<b>174 </b>I have longed for thy salvation, O <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>; and thy law <i>is</i> my delight.

<b>175 </b>Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee; and let thy judgments help me.

<b>176 </b>I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thy servant; for I do not forget thy commandments.
